Product: AMD Ryzen 5 5600G 6-Core 12-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor with Radeon Graphics
Reviews: ['When replacing the cooler, the cooler was like super glued to the mobo. I had to yank it off using a scissor and almost broke the mobo. Amazingly the gigabyte mobo survived.', "Had no complain for budget entry gaming, can play most today's gaming and low to mid setting, doing productivity work seems great", 'Had no issues after install. Runs smoothly on the games I play without discrete graphics. Upgraded to Wraith Prism for better cooling over the Stealth.', 'I bought the 5600G to use while my CPU was being RMAed.  I ended up deciding to keep this instead and sell the RMAed CPU.  With a -0.2V offset and speed capped at 4 GHz, the CPU sips around 55W on full load and the heat output barely taxed my AIO.  The power efficiency was way better than expected.IF caps at 2000 MHz and the CPU worked with DDR-4000 without any problem.', 'Best', "I wanna list the Cons first:Cons:- If you're ordering from Singaoore, prepare to wait around 3 weeks for it to arrive- Packaging was slightly damaged (Dented), but the item itself was perfectly sealed and fine- Wasn't able to run Genshin Impact at 60fps awwwPros:- Everything is as expected, fully functional- Able to run non-competitive shooter games even at my overkill monitor (1440p 165hz)- Smooth experience in Windows 10 overall, it's just like having a below average GPU for the prize of just a great CPUEven though I'm kinda salty that the Ryzen 6000 series APUs with RDNA 2 graphics are gonna come out just half a year later, this 5600G will do me well for now. Overall, thanks AMD for giving me the stop-gap solution I needed, amazing processor.", 'Just build a HTPC with the Ryzen 5600g. Great APU for small form factor build. Got this CPU below retail price. I would recommend this APU if you are planning to run a PC without a graphics card. Shipping took only 6 days to arrive from USA to Singapore. That is pretty fast shipping.', 'If you want CPU with built-in graphics this this best solution, for me just use for normal gaming no request high quality resolution. My case is NZXT H1, use this save more space with ITX built, but if u prefer good graphics resolution u can swith to 5600X + graphics card will better, main different for G & X are the L3 cache 16MB vs 32MB', "good overclock of the FCLK and Dram that helps to close the gap between 5600x but the lower L3 and lack of pcie4 makes it a harder sell than 5600x. with 2100 flck and 4200 dram, it benchmark close to 5600xThe vega7 gpu do not have AV1 hardware makes it looks worse. That's why AMD should have shave $30 off their MSRP.", 'Smooth and fast boot-up from Window 11 and fast graphic display on the monitor. Good performance and quality for value compared to its competitor. I always enjoy AMD though I have had Intel before. This is really a good CPU as most put it!']

Product: AMD Ryzen‚Ñ¢ 7 5800X3D 8-core, 16-Thread Desktop Processor with AMD 3D V-Cache‚Ñ¢ Technology
Reviews: ['greatly increased FPS for games over 3600. Able to run 3600MT/s RAM no problem. recommend to set Curve Optimiser to -15 or below to reduce power and temp usage.', 'Bought for an upgrade. This is the last great CPU for the AM4 socket and it did work with my motherboard after a quick BIOS update.The box is mostly air from the factory. There is no cooler inside. Else, no too much complain except it runs a little bit more hot than my previous Rizen.', 'I upgraded from a 5600 to a 5800x3d and later bought an aftermarket CPU cooler to run lower temps during summer and for higher gaming performance.This upgrade was massive for me for gaming as that is my main focus and hobby on my desktop. With the AMD 5000x series drivers for my bios already installed this was plug-and-play for me.Gaming performance hit my target 144hz on my 1440p monitor in most games with reduced settings as framerate is my go-to in fast-paced games like FPS. I do occasionally reduce framerate in single-player games or games that are isometric to reduce gpu/cpu load and get more consistent frame-times when upping graphic settings. I would recommend this in most cases for the majority of gamers but this is still my preference.Performance is SMOOTH and I do mean buttery smooth for me. The change in the 1% lows was immediately felt by me, but take this with a grain of salt especially if you are less experienced with high framerates/stutters and not a major PC enthusiast. Most people will game at 1080p on lower refresh rates, but please try to take this CPU to at least 1440p 90-120hz for optimal experience.COOLER - I kept my wraith cooler from my older 5600 to start while I researched what cooler I wanted to go with but I did game on this cooler for over a month. The wraith cooler was more than sufficient in most scenarios but due to the summer heat, and more demanding games my CPU temps were going above 80C and causing my room to get hotter and some CPU throttling requiring more tampering with settings and research into curve optimization. Much of my room heat comes from my PC due to it being closed, but it is an older house, a lightly insulated wooden home, with 5 windows, along with a mini-fridge and a bathroom that seems to absorb heat from somewhere. This temp was not ideal for me due to my room often being above 80F and during the heatwaves and AC work done up to 88 or higher in my room.COOLER Pt 2 - To reduce my room heat and reduce CPU thermal throttling I purchased an aftermarket CPU cooler with 6 heat pipes. This dramatically reduced my CPU thermal throttling reducing my average temps by 10-20F which also reduced temps on my GPU. The cooler I bought was around 40-50 bucks so if you are interested that is more than enough to cool this CPU for its lifetime.Curve Optimizer(WARNING!!  this may void your warrant) - When using a curve optimizer with this CPU you will see a sizeable increase in performance and thermal temps. You can use a no-update manual optimizer like PBO2 Tuner or research into making it always optimized with bios settings.  Idle temps get the most benefit from this and second is when performing at medium-high load in my experience. Idle temps were 5-10F reduced and medium-high load temps were in a similar range and sometimes far better due to increased CPU performance as well.This CPU is an incredible value for anyone that is enthusiastic about gaming performance. Be aware that there is a newer generation of x3D cpus but the current dollar-to-dollar value for 7000x3d cpus is not close enough to consider for anyone that does not want a maxed-out expensive system.On sale, the 5800x3d CPU is an absolute NO-BRAINER for gaming, but please be aware you need to buy a cooler, and you may need a bios update PRIOR to installing your CPU if you do not already have an AMD 5000 series CPU.  If the 7000x3d series goes on sale and you are building an entirely new system, you should be aware of RAM costs and Motherboard costs as well as this can be a dramatic price differential for cheaper system builds if you are not careful.', "AMD Ryzen 7 5800X3DIch h√§tte es nicht gedacht, aber auch 2023 noch spielt nicht nur die GPU bei der Spiele-Performance eine Rolle.Vorher war bei mir ein Ryzen 5 3600 verbaut.Grafikkarte: RTX 4070 TiRAM: G.Skill 32 GB 3200er DDR4-RAMAufl√∂sung: 1440p, UWQHD (3.440 x 1.440)Nachdem die neue Grafikkarte verbaut war, sollte nun auch eine neue CPU her.Im Desktopbetrieb habe ich gef√ºhlt nur einen geringen Geschwindigkeitsschub (vorher: pfeilschnell, jetzt: pfeilschnell+).Im Gaming-Betrieb kommt es auf das Spiel an... da gibt es Titel, die kaum oder nur etwas schneller laufen, etwa +10%, andere wieder, wo ich √ºber +50% mehr FPS bekomme:Z.B. 120 FPS z.B. bei Horizon Zero Dawn bei 1440p und alles auf max. sind schon ne Hausnummer, wenn man vorher mit dem Ryzen 5 3600 bei 75 FPS war. Hammer!Was mich dabei erstaunte: Die neue CPU f√ºhrt auch auch dann zu mehr FPS, wenn vorher wie nachher beim Gaming gar keine 100% CPU-Auslastung vorlag, wenn man also eher an eine Grafikkartenlimitierung denken w√ºrde.Von der Leistungsaufnahme her ist der Ryzen 7 5800X3D im Desktopbetrieb eher noch sparsamer als die alte CPU vorher, da l√§uft sie so etwa bei 35 W, das passt.Im Gaming-Betrieb unter Last zieht der 8-Kerner dann nat√ºrlich etwas mehr, etwa 100 W, damit etwa 30W mehr als die alte CPU, was aber den Kohl dann auch nicht mehr fett macht, wenn nebendran eine RTX 4070 Ti Strom zieht.Die CPU ist nicht ganz billig, aber ich bin's zufrieden und bereue den Kauf nicht.Auf der AM4-Plattform gibt es f√ºr den Gaming-Bereich nichts schnelleres (und wird es h√∂chstwahrscheinlich auch nicht mehr geben).Ich denke allerdings, dass sich sowas (die Grafikkarte auch) nur dann lohnt, wenn man sein System mit h√∂herer Aufl√∂sung als Full HD betreiben m√∂chte und wenn man schon ein AM4-Mainboard hat, das man noch eine Weile behalten m√∂chte.Wichtig bei der CPU:Eine performate CPU-K√ºhlung verbauen, sonst regelt die CPU ab, wenn sie zu hei√ü wird!Bei mir ist ein Thermalright Peerless Assassin 120 SE verbaut, was prima harmoniert.In dieser K√ºhler-Leistungsklasse sollte man schon arbeiten. Oder eine WaK√º verbauen.", "Attention, avant toute chose, n'oubliez pas de mettre a jour votre BIOS avant d'installer le 5800X3D.Je vais essay√© d'√™tre le plus franc possible, alors oui le 5800X3D est le meilleur processeur GAMING sur la plateforme AM4 !J'ai bien dis GAMING, car en rendu 3D etc, il sera un peu moins performant qu'un 5800X normal par exemple. Si vous comptez jouer la plupart du temps, sans passer par une upgrade AM5 ou refaire une configuration neuve, je vous le conseil, ca donne un sacr√© coup de perf par rapport √† tout les autres processeur AM4.En 2023, si vous partez sur une configuration neuve, je ne vous le conseil pas, il est destin√© √† ceux qui veulent rester sur AM4 pendant encore un moment.Il a des points positifs et n√©gatifs.- Positifs => Gain de perfs en 1080P ET 1440P, oui m√™me en 1440P, il donne plus de perf en g√©n√©ral. Son 1%LOW est plus haut que mon ancien 3700X OC et de loin, par ex. Je joue en 1440P avec un 5800X3D et une 7900XT, autant vous dire que c'est un monstre de puissance (il reste, tr√®s proche d'un 12900KS en gaming !)Le plus flagrant, pour ma part, est sur Escape From tarkov, j'avais l'impression d'avoir un autre PC !=> Il fait le taf en rendu vid√©o, 3D ect, mais il y a bien plus perf pour ce domaine la, mais ca reste un petit 8 coeurs / 16 threads=> Upgrade ultra facile, suffit juste de mettre son BIOS √† jour et il a une faible consommationPoints n√©gatifs => Ca chauffe ... Il chauffe vraiment in game, il faut un bon AIO/Ventirad. J'√©tais oblig√© de changer mon H100I 240MM (qui est un des meilleurs sur les ryzen 5000) parce que je fr√¥lai, sur certains jeux gourmand en processeur, les 85 parfois presque 90 degr√©s ! (coucou BF2042).=> Il n'est pas destin√© √† √™tre OverClocker !=>Son prix.Sinon, si vous avez un bon boitier avec un bon refroidissement, il n'y plus trop de probl√®me de chauffe.Pour conclure, il donne plus de perfs, le 3D cache fonctionne vraiment, ca sera plus ou moins important selon les jeux. Il ne consomme pas trop, ca reste le best en AM4, MAIS ca chauffe. Il est destin√© aux personnes sur AM4. Pour les nouvelles configurations, c'est non.", 'Ich m√∂chte gerne meine √§u√üerst positive Erfahrung mit dem AMD Ryzen 7 5800X3D auf Amazon teilen und betonen, wie sehr dieser Prozessor meinen alten Intel i7-9700K √ºbertrifft. Als langj√§hriger Nutzer von Intel-Prozessoren war ich anfangs skeptisch, aber der Ryzen 7 5800X3D hat meine Erwartungen √ºbertroffen.Die Leistung des AMD Ryzen 7 5800X3D ist beeindruckend. Mit seinen 8 Kernen und 16 Threads bietet er eine deutlich h√∂here Verarbeitungsgeschwindigkeit im Vergleich zu meinem alten Intel i7-9700K. Die Multitasking-F√§higkeiten des Ryzen 7 5800X3D sind ausgezeichnet und erm√∂glichen mir eine reibungslose Durchf√ºhrung mehrerer anspruchsvoller Aufgaben gleichzeitig.Die Taktfrequenz des Ryzen 7 5800X3D ist sp√ºrbar h√∂her und f√ºhrt zu einer merklichen Steigerung der Leistung. Egal ob beim Gaming, beim Rendern von Videos oder bei anderen rechenintensiven Anwendungen - dieser Prozessor liefert eine beeindruckende Performance und sorgt f√ºr ein fl√ºssiges Nutzererlebnis.Die verbesserte Zen 3-Architektur des Ryzen 7 5800X3D erm√∂glicht eine effizientere Verarbeitung und eine verbesserte Single-Core-Leistung. Dadurch werden Ladezeiten verk√ºrzt und das System reagiert schneller. Ich war beeindruckt von der Geschwindigkeit und dem reibungslosen Ablauf meiner t√§glichen Aufgaben mit diesem Prozessor.Ein weiterer Pluspunkt des Ryzen 7 5800X3D ist seine Energieeffizienz. Im Vergleich zu meinem alten Intel i7-9700K hat der Ryzen 7 5800X3D eine niedrigere TDP (Thermal Design Power) und verbraucht weniger Strom. Dies f√ºhrt zu einer kosteneffizienten Nutzung und einer reduzierten Umweltauswirkung.Die Kompatibilit√§t des Ryzen 7 5800X3D ist ebenfalls bemerkenswert. Er ist mit dem AM4-Sockel kompatibel und kann mit einer Vielzahl von Mainboards verwendet werden. Dies erm√∂glicht eine einfache Anpassung des Systems nach individuellen Bed√ºrfnissen.Alles in allem kann ich den AMD Ryzen 7 5800X3D auf Amazon w√§rmstens empfehlen. Mit seiner beeindruckenden Leistung, seiner Energieeffizienz und seiner verbesserten Architektur √ºbertrifft er meinen alten Intel i7-9700K deutlich. Wenn Sie auf der Suche nach einem leistungsstarken und vielseitigen Prozessor sind, der alle Anforderungen moderner Anwendungen und Spiele erf√ºllt, dann ist der AMD Ryzen 7 5800X3D die richtige Wahl. Investieren Sie in diesen Prozessor und profitieren Sie von einer deutlichen Leistungssteigerung!', "I upgraded from a 2600 to this 5800X3D and it's truly amazing how much of a CPU bottleneck I didn't even realize I had. This makes my platform more stable and extends its life out by at least a couple years, hopefully longer. Overall performance is noticeably better, but in games it's day and night. I play in 1440p widescreen resolution, and the 2600 was struggling a bit. I didn't even realize it was my CPU (thought maybe I had an underperforming GPU) for a while. My frames were acceptable, but only just. Now with the same RX6750XT I was already using, I'm getting smooth framerates across every game I play. I was worried it would run too hot, but using the same cheap aftermarket air cooler I was using on the 2600, temperatures have not been an issue at all.If you can catch this CPU on sale especially, it's basically endgame for the AM4 platform.", "Star Citizen was stuttering with my 5600x, so I upgraded to the 5800x3D, which helped smooth frames out. You'll want the 5800x3D if your favorite games (especially the simulation ones) are CPU-bound. I've also seen performance improvements with Satisfactory, Factorio, Minecraft, MS Flight Simulator, and Elite Dangerous.Many online tech circles recommend this one due to the 96MB L3 cache, which is the most offered in the entire AM4 lineup. There's also a few more cores and threads than the 5600x, which is beneficial for multitasking. If you wanted to, this could potentially be run with a top-tier GPU like the RTX 4090, although right now I am content with my 6700XT.There's no heatsink/fan assembly included with the 5800x3D. I bought the $50 AIO cooler on Amazon and that works well enough. I wouldn't use the 5600x's stock heatsink on the 5800x3D, due to the higher TDP. It would have resulted in the fan running louder more often, and that's annoying.In terms of price-to-performance, this is probably the best sim-gaming CPU you can get on the AM4 slot. As an upgrade from the 5600x, the performance gains are noticeable in the right games.", 'El rendimiento de este procesador es simplemente impresionante. He estado usando este chip en uno de mis sistemas y ha superado todas mis expectativas. La velocidad de procesamiento y la capacidad de respuesta son sobresalientes, lo que me permite realizar m√∫ltiples tareas y ejecutar aplicaciones exigentes sin problemas.La eficiencia energ√©tica tambi√©n es destacable. A pesar de su potencia, el consumo de energ√≠a se mantiene bajo, lo que es beneficioso para el medio ambiente y para aquellos que desean reducir su huella de carbono.Otra caracter√≠stica que realmente me ha impresionado es la arquitectura 3D. Esta tecnolog√≠a ha mejorado significativamente la calidad visual y la precisi√≥n en los gr√°ficos, brindando una experiencia visual m√°s inmersiva y realista.El dise√±o sin ventilador tambi√©n es un acierto. Gracias a esto, el procesador funciona de manera silenciosa y eficiente, sin generar ruido innecesario ni calor excesivo.En general, este procesador es una opci√≥n excepcional para aquellos que buscan un rendimiento de primera categor√≠a en su sistema. La combinaci√≥n de potencia, eficiencia energ√©tica y tecnolog√≠a 3D lo convierten en una opci√≥n imprescindible para los entusiastas de la inform√°tica y los amantes de la tecnolog√≠a.', "I heard this was good for VR or other unity titles with the huge L3 but also knew a upgrade from a 3600XT would net solid jump in performanceI was wrong... it was a massive jump, I didn't know how badly I was bottlenecking my 3080ti but seash, I have seen a drastic change in every game, beat saber scores increased across the board, I can actually see stuff smooth now, vrc like full 2x fps, and I went from being one weird person fortnite group with 3080ti but barely can run the game on medium, to running ultra full stable 144fpsSo yeah, mega hyped had upgraded, if anyone's running a older lower skew wondering if a cpu upgrade will do much, wellPs. This chip is a real tuff pup to keep cool, I thought I could just ease away with a e32 heat sink, NOPE, this was throttling back, like Frick, I went strait upto a liquid freezer ii 360 , decked out fans, and just barely got it under controllBe serious about the cooling on this one for sure"]

Product: AMD Ryzen 7 5700G with Wraith Stealth Cooler 3.8 GHz 8 Cores / 16 Threads 72MB 65W [Domestic Authorized Dealer] 100-10000263BOX
Reviews: ["I bought this for its top value/performance relative to other cpu's available. For its class it plays flight simulator extremely smoothly, never mind there are higher benchmarks out there. Besides it is very efficient and fast for my home movie making. Your experience may vary. I paired it to a Asus X570 plus wifi motherboard , and 16Gb Corsair ddr4 3200 ram and this combination is made in heaven. At 65W TDP this cpu runs about 37degrees to 40degrees celsius at normal usage.I wanted the Ryzen 5600G at first but as it is limited to pcie 3.0 i decided to get this Ryzen 5700X as it supports pcie 4.0.These cpu's are the last of the AM4 sockets  since new Ryzens have moved to AM5 sockets.Who cares? One cpu generation behind saves big money!Conclusion: i am very satisfied with this buy. Delivery was a mere 3 days and overall its unbeatable value for the performance i get. All goods came intact in good working order ( touch wood, as one or two people i read got lemons).Highly recommended (imo).", 'The high number of core and threads is more than enough to play AAA games and easy rendering works. Use it as is or paired it later with dedicated GPU down the road, hence provides good flexibility. The 65W tdp is also good for mini itx config. I put this in Deskmeet X300 and no need to worry about high temps.', "With the crazy price of GFX card and my ancient GTX650Ti Boost card is dying, I bought this to replace both CPU and GFX. Cinebench R20 shown 55xx points, faster than 3700X's 50xx, obviously not noticeable in real world but temperature is ~5‚ÑÉ lower when I'm doing video transcoding. less heat output and lower noise from fans. I was expecting the VEGA iGPU to perform similarly as my 9 years old GFX card but sadly, it doesn't. For video decoding, It does able to hardware decode VP9 and HEVC(H.265) up to 8K, which the old nvidia couldn't. Then again, the 8c/16t 5700G is power enough to decode even the AV1 at 8K by itself. Maybe the VEGA can play popular game at lower resolution, I don't know. But even age old Age of Empire III DE have a hard time doing 30fps@1600p, I didn't bother trying others. I would say if you expect to replace the dedicated GFX card, don't bother. Other than that, this is still the best 8c/16t cpu with iGPU on the market.", 'Has been using for weeks, all stable, good value for money.', 'CPU works perfectly fine in my B450 board.Good ? 8 cores/16 threads at 65w with iGPU, with the only weak points like pcie 3.0 and 16mb L3 cache.Bad ? Disappointed Amazon CSO declined my request to match the price drop days after I placed the order.', "Sono rimasto sbalordito dalle prestazioni offerte dal processore AMD Ryzen 7 5700G. Ecco perch√© sono entusiasta di condividere la mia esperienza con questo gioiello di tecnologia:Potenza Bruta:Il Ryzen 7 5700G si √® dimostrato un vero campione in termini di prestazioni. Con 8 core e 16 thread, offre un'accelerazione incredibile per qualsiasi tipo di compito, che si tratti di gaming, editing multimediale o multitasking intenso. Le applicazioni pesanti vengono gestite senza alcun problema, garantendo una fluidit√† senza compromessi.Grafica Integrata Impressionante:La GPU Vega integrata √® una sorpresa molto gradita. Anche senza una scheda grafica discreta, ho potuto godere di un'esperienza di gioco straordinaria. Giochi meno esigenti possono essere eseguiti a dettagli elevati senza alcun problema. Questo lo rende una scelta perfetta per costruzioni di sistemi compatti o per coloro che desiderano risparmiare sul costo di una GPU dedicata.Efficienza Energetica:Sono rimasto sorpreso dalla gestione dell'energia di questo processore. Nonostante le prestazioni eccezionali, l'efficienza energetica √® notevole. Il Ryzen 7 5700G √® stato progettato per offrire potenza senza dover compromettere il consumo energetico.Facilit√† di Overclocking:Per gli appassionati, l'overclocking √® un piacere con questo processore. Le prestazioni possono essere spinte ulteriormente, permettendo un controllo totale sulla potenza di elaborazione.Compatibilit√† e Aggiornamenti:La compatibilit√† con le schede madri AM4 √® un punto a favore. Inoltre, la possibilit√† di aggiornare il BIOS per supportare le ultime tecnologie garantisce che il Ryzen 7 5700G sia una scelta futura-proof.In conclusione, il processore AMD Ryzen 7 5700G ha superato le mie aspettative in termini di prestazioni, efficienza energetica e versatilit√†. Se stai cercando un processore che offra prestazioni di alto livello e una grafica integrata degna di nota, questo √® sicuramente la scelta giusta. Lo consiglio vivamente a tutti gli appassionati di gaming e creativi che cercano il massimo dalle loro macchine.", 'Questo 5700G √® sostanzialmente equivalente ad un Ryzen 5700X con qualche limitazione da un lato e con qualche miglioria dall\'altro.La limitazione √® data dal fatto che non supporta lo standard pci-e 4.0 ma solamente 3.0 (per quanto mi riguarda non √® un problema). Il lato migliore √® dato dal fatto che ha una GPU integrata (Radeon Vega) in grado di offrire un adeguato framerate anche ad alte risoluzioni con livelli di dettaglio medio. In pi√π la presenza di una architettura 8 core /16 thread ne consente un suo utilizzo anche per supportare carichi di lavoro pesanti.Stiamo parlando quindi di un processore di fascia medio-alta pensato per configurazioni office con heavy workload, media center o gaming di fascia bassa (se usato con la GPU integrata, medio-alta se usato per supportare una GPU dedicata)Io personalmente ho acquistato questa APU per realizzare una postazione di lavoro tipo "workstation" dove sfrutto la potenza del processore per far girare qualche machina virtuale per la generazione/gestione di servizi home (quindi con un po\' di disco e tanta RAM). La configurazione √® la seguente:- Asrock B450 Steel Legend (Bios Aggiornato)- 4x16GB Corsair LPX 3600 CL18- 2 x Crucial P2 1TB NVME,- Thermalright SI-100- Case SilverStone Grandia GD09- Corsair TX650W Modulare- 3 x 120 Arctic P12- 2 x 80 Arctic P8- 1 Fan Controller Lamptron FC5Per l\'utilizzo che ne faccio che dire ... ottimo ottimo ottimo!!!', "I upgraded from a 2700X which was really good, However I hated not having onboard graphics to troubleshoot. While the On-Board graphics is powerful enough to do light gaming and basic office work It's only a Radeon Graphics APU, Meaning anything released in the last 15 years is probably outside of it's capabilities  with exception to some online games (Runescape, League of Legends, ect). That's not really why you would want to buy this for a gaming computer, You could have a processor with more raw power and more L2/L3 Cache that would definitely do better, but... having onboard graphics is sort of like a spare tire. When a GPU inevitably breaks it's nice to be able to hop along and still use your computer until you get a replacement. It's for this reason I bought this processor, my GPU may break & I may or may not be able to buy another graphics card based on current prices (Things have gotten crazy on the GPU market.... most people can't afford mid-range GPU's anymore) I love my computer but I'm not that wealthy, having onboard graphics as a spare tire is infinitely more valuable than 5% increase in performance, Don't let that fool you though this APU is a powerhouse of AM4 Architecture and compared to my 2700x It's really fast, with higher turbo frequencies and a much lower TDP, It can still be overclocked (granted voiding your warranty in the process) for when you want to squeeze even more juice out of it. Overall it's a great CPU and I highly recommend it for anyone who can't upgrade to AM5 yet (All AM5's have built in graphics)", 'Ich habe den AMD Ryzen 7 5700G mit integrierter AMD Radeon Grafik gekauft und bin absolut begeistert von seiner Leistung. Dieser Prozessor verf√ºgt √ºber 8 Kerne und 16 Threads, was eine herausragende Rechenleistung erm√∂glicht. Egal, ob Sie intensive Aufgaben ausf√ºhren, wie Videobearbeitung, 3D-Modellierung oder nat√ºrlich Gaming - der Ryzen 7 5700G steht Ihnen zur Seite.Was mich besonders beeindruckt hat, ist die nahtlose Zusammenarbeit mit einer NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080 Super in Full HD Gaming. Der Prozessor liefert eine solide Leistung und erm√∂glicht ein reibungsloses Spielerlebnis mit hohen Frameraten und einer beeindruckenden Grafikqualit√§t. Sie werden in der Lage sein, die neuesten Spiele in voller Pracht zu genie√üen, ohne Kompromisse eingehen zu m√ºssen.Die integrierte AMD Radeon Grafik ist eine gro√üartige Erg√§nzung, die zus√§tzliche Leistung bietet, insbesondere f√ºr Benutzer, die nicht sofort eine dedizierte Grafikkarte kaufen m√∂chten. Sie k√∂nnen Spiele spielen, Videos streamen und sogar leichte Bildbearbeitung durchf√ºhren, ohne eine separate GPU anschlie√üen zu m√ºssen. Die Grafikleistung ist bemerkenswert und √ºbertrifft viele integrierte L√∂sungen anderer CPUs.Die K√ºhlleistung des Ryzen 7 5700G ist ebenfalls beeindruckend. Mit einem angemessenen K√ºhler bleibt die Temperatur auch unter hoher Belastung stabil, was die Langlebigkeit des Prozessors gew√§hrleistet. Es ist jedoch zu beachten, dass ein leistungsstarker Luft- oder Wasserk√ºhler empfehlenswert ist, um die Temperatur noch weiter zu senken und das volle Potenzial des Prozessors auszusch√∂pfen.Dar√ºber hinaus ist der Ryzen 7 5700G auch energieeffizient. Dank der 7-nm-Fertigungstechnologie von AMD wird der Stromverbrauch auf einem niedrigen Niveau gehalten, ohne die Leistungsf√§higkeit zu beeintr√§chtigen. Das ist besonders wichtig f√ºr umweltbewusste Benutzer, die ihren CO2-Fu√üabdruck reduzieren m√∂chten.Alles in allem kann ich den AMD Ryzen 7 5700G mit AMD Radeon Grafik w√§rmstens empfehlen. Mit seinen 8 Kernen, 16 Threads und der beeindruckenden Zusammenarbeit mit einer NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080 Super bietet er eine hervorragende Leistung f√ºr Full HD Gaming und andere anspruchsvolle Aufgaben. Wenn Sie auf der Suche nach einem Top-CPU sind, ist der Ryzen 7 5700G definitiv eine herausragende Wahl.', "Un APU (CPU + iGPU), convaincant de part sa consommation mod√©r√©e (grand max 90W au total CPU + iGPU), et une chauffe ma√Ætris√©e (jusqu'√† 65W de TDP max), malgr√© une puissance clairement pr√©sente (autant pour la partie graphique (le plus puissant des iGPU) que CPU).La rapidit√© d‚Äôex√©cution des calculs n'est pas dingue (l√©g√®rement inf√©rieure √† un 5600X, √† cause du manque de cache...), il en r√©sulte donc des performances gaming correctes, sans plus, mais sa puissance totale (8 c≈ìurs 16 threads tout de m√™me) est cons√©quente, et permettra une utilisation des logiciels gourmands sans aucun soucis, et un multit√¢che pouss√©.La partie graphique permet du gaming l√©ger (1080p low autour de 40fps en moyenne), et d'afficher de la 4k 60fps sur maximum 3 √©crans (m√™me si les cartes m√®res n'ont que 2 ports vid√©os max...).Cet iGPU est bien sup√©rieur en terme de perfs √† tout ceux de Intel (m√™me le dernier UHD 770) d'environ 30%, et amplement suffisant pour toutes les t√¢ches bureautiques.Attention, l'iGPU ne disposant pas de m√©moire vid√©o d√©di√© mais partag√©e, je vous recommande fortement d'opter pour de la RAM de qualit√© (minimum 2x8 Go en DDR4 3200 MHz), pour que la puissance de calcul graphique ne soit pas brid√©e. PS : pensez √† activer l'XMP.En revanche pour les petites config gaming (autour de 500 euros) sans carte graphique d√©di√©e, j'aurai plut√¥t tendance √† vous recommander le 5600G, dont les perfs graphiques et en jeu sont quasi similaires, seule la puissance brute varie (d'environ 30%), et de 60 euros en moyenne moins cher.Pour les grosses config (> √† 1000 euros), partez plut√¥t sur un 5600X ou un 5700X (et pour des config gaming entre 600 et 1000 euros, le 5600 tout court est top !!!).Pour le refroidissement, le Wraith Sleath int√©gr√©e √† cet version boxed est limite... on atteint les 85 degr√©s lors des grosses charges. Un ventirad dot√© de minimum 4 caloducs est donc recommand√© pour m√©nager la dur√©e de vie de cet APU.C√¥t√© carte m√®re, une B450 est recommand√©e, attention, il faudra mettre √† jours le BIOS.Une B550 est √©galement compatible avec M√†J du BIOS, mais celle-ci sont plus couteuses, et n'apportent rien de plus, cet APU se limitant √† du PCIe 3.0, contre 4.0 pour les 5000 et 5000x (√† prendre en compte si on veut faire du gaming).- Parenth√®se overclocking -L'overclocking de cet APU est top. Il est facile, apporte beaucoup, et tr√®s stable ! Par contre √ßa chauffe et consomme plus du coup (Pass√© √† 120w de conso pour +10% de perfs). Mais surtout le must, c'est l'overclocking de l'iGPU ! Je l'ai pass√© √† 2400MHz, et j'ai gagn√© 15% de fps !De plus, l'iMC dans cet APU est excellent, la RAM tourne bien m√™me overclock√©e, m√™me sur 4 rank, et m√™me sur une CM Daisy-Chain !R√©sum√© :Les plus :  - puissance brute  - efficacit√© √©nerg√©tique  - rapport perfs/prix (pour 230 euros environ)  - la partie graphique convaincante  - l'overclocking fantastique !Les moins :  - le ventirad  - le manque de cache (=> pas ouf pour du gaming)  - la concurrence avec le 5600G, et les 5000X*  - l'absence de PCIe 4.0 (que du 3.0)Recommand√© pour :De la bureautique pouss√©e.D√©conseill√© pour :Du gaming.Voili voilou fin du pav√© ;)"]

Product: Intel¬Æ Core‚Ñ¢ i5-11400F Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.4 GHz LGA1200 (Intel¬Æ 500 Series & Select 400 Series Chipset) 65W
Reviews: ['Wanted to upgrade my old 6-year old build. Salvaged most parts and put in this Core i5-11400F processor, reasonably priced at <$200.Everything works/booted fine, no issues  - you will need your own graphics card (salvaged mine) for better resolution and a fan cooler (again salvaged); intel coolers are not the best.  All in all a good processor for office work (not for gaming - get an Core i7 for that).', 'Noticed that the price of 11400(F) has dropped quite significantly since the launch of Alder Lake. For the price of quality B560M motherboard and the CPU, it is a value choice.', 'Sehr guter cpu f√ºr nen arbeits pc aber auch sein sehr guter gaming cpu keine frage', 'Super recomendable para ensamblar tu pc gama media', 'I bought this based on performance to price for my second PC. I was going to use a 10000 series CPU but discovered that using the 11400 utiilizes the features on my motherboard better. This one works very well with my motherboard.', "the cpu is great for gaming, I use it only for that but the stock coolers is really bad, when first installed got temps about 90-95 celsius while gaming and had to check online for help, it turned out to be a bios setting (dont remember the exact name of the option, but I understand most gaming high end motherboards come with it eneabled) that makes it always go boosted clocks and therefore hot temps, disabled it and got temps down to 70-75 while gaming wich is still hot for my likes but I guess it's acceptable for the stock cooler.soon getting it a liquid cooler, but mostly for aesthetics, a decent air cooler will do the job", 'Funciona muy bien y su desempe√±o espectacular en gamming al igual que profesiona,ensamble con una RTX 3060 y funciona sin problemas,este procesador saca todo el jugo a esta gr√°fica sin ning√∫n cuello de botella hasta la 3060TI pero ya para gama 70 para arriba ya es recomendable una generaci√≥n m√°s actual o uno de esta pero serie K para levantarlo sin problemasEn pocas palabras buen procesador e incluso me lleg√≥ con unos aud√≠fonos razer de diadema de regalo üéÅ amarrados con este mismo ,much√≠simas gracias al vendedor , excelente compra üòÉ‚ú®', "For the price, this is a great CPU. Be aware that this chip does not have built in graphics, so you'll need one.This worked perfect for my budget build I did with my son for his first gaming PC. You can't overclock it, but it does max out at 4.4 GHz and the 6 cores makes it work faster than I expected. Paired with a decent GPU and this chip is more than enough for a decent system.", 'Aunque tengo que comprar otro disipador vale la pena total', 'Lleg√≥ al d√≠a siguiente y funciona como es esperado a un buen precio. Es la versi√≥n F, as√≠ que no soporta gr√°fico integrado (es normal), se requiere una tarjeta externa para entregar video.']

Product: AMD Ryzen 7 5700X 8-Core, 16-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor, Ceramic Gray
Reviews: ["This is a great processor which only runs at 23% during Steam's Insurgency game! So much so that it is bottlenecking my old 1070GTX by quite a mile until I upgrade my GPU! However this processor runs 6 degree celcius hotter than Ryzen 6 cores processors because of the extra 2 cores. Overall, this processor is highly recommended to be able to handle intensive tasks and heavy gaming!", 'Comes well packed with packed air unlike certain other online retailers like L**** and S****Product is genuine as far as I can tell and is working well with Ryzen Master and AMD Adrenalin. Definitely a good last upgrade from my 3600 and AM4 board', 'Works like a charm with my Mortax Max.', 'Running like a charm, no overheating anymore', 'Lo Positivo:üí® Potencia y Velocidad Impresionantes: El AMD Ryzen 7 5700X ofrece un rendimiento excepcional con su reloj base de 3,4 GHz y una potencia m√°xima de reloj de 4,6 GHz. Los 8 n√∫cleos y 32 MB de cach√© L3 brindan una experiencia de procesamiento r√°pida y fluida.üî• Rendimiento para Tareas Pesadas: Este procesador es ideal para tareas pesadas y multitarea intensiva, como edici√≥n de video, dise√±o gr√°fico y juegos exigentes. No se queda atr√°s incluso ante las cargas de trabajo m√°s desafiantes.‚ö° Tecnolog√≠a AMD Ryzen: La arquitectura avanzada de AMD Ryzen proporciona un rendimiento optimizado y una eficiencia energ√©tica mejorada. Es ideal para aquellos que buscan un procesador de alto nivel en t√©rminos de potencia y eficacia.üå°Ô∏è Sin Enfriador Incluido: Aunque puede ser visto como un punto negativo por algunos, la falta de enfriador incluido permite a los usuarios elegir un sistema de enfriamiento que se ajuste a sus necesidades espec√≠ficas, especialmente para aquellos que desean un enfriamiento personalizado.Lo Negativo:‚ùå Enfriador No Incluido: Para algunos usuarios, la ausencia de un enfriador puede ser una desventaja, ya que tendr√≠an que invertir en un enfriador por separado para asegurar un funcionamiento √≥ptimo.üå°Ô∏è Temperaturas Elevadas: Algunos usuarios pueden experimentar temperaturas m√°s altas durante el uso intenso, especialmente sin un enfriador adecuado.üõí Conclusi√≥n:Adquir√≠ el procesador AMD Ryzen 7 5700X y estoy muy satisfecho con su rendimiento. Aunque tuve que comprar un enfriador adicional, la potencia y velocidad que ofrece valen la inversi√≥n.Es ideal para mis necesidades de dise√±o gr√°fico y juegos exigentes.', 'The AMD Ryzen 7 5700X processor is a perfect replacement for my 2017 vintage Ryzen 7 1700 model workhorse (which I would be quite content to keep using except for lack of some obscure feature that Microsoft deems necessary for u[grading from Windows 10 to 11).It has the same 8 cores with 16 threads. (see screenshot of my old processor shown with the nifty "All CPU Meter" gadget, the new CPU looks almost the same but with shorter core bars indicating far greater throughput).It is officially supported for Windows 11, and provides a distinctly zippier performance. It also offers the same cool and running (65 Watt TDP). Running Prime95 as a stress tester it barely reaches 65-70 degrees Celsius, which is way below AMD\'s specification of 95 Celsius maximum allowable.INSTALLATION TIP - If your system will not boot after you install the CPU, try rebooting with just a single RAM card, which seems to trigger the processor recognition procedure in the BIOS  You can then reboot with all the original RAM cards installed.', 'Actualice desde un ryzen 5 2400g que ten√≠a desde hace 5 a√±os y el rendimiento mejor√≥ para juegos sin duda, sin embargo las temperaturas son altas, mientras que en uso normal va de 47-60 grados, en juegos se mantiene arriba de 60-70 incluso llega a los 80 por lo que recomiendo optar por una mejor disipaci√≥n distinta a la stock.A√∫n falta ver su rendimiento en otros programas pero de momento me ha solucionado mi problema de los tirones, ya que ten√≠a un cuello de botella con mi rtx 2060. Si est√°s corto de dinero el R5 5600x estar√≠a mejor, pero si puedes optar preferir este procesador que te vendra bien para futuras actualizaciones de tu PC.', 'Ich habe den 5700x als Ersatz f√ºr meinen 2700X gekauft und bin sehr zufrieden. Der geringere Stromverbrauch (immerhin 40 Watt weniger) bei deutlich besserer Leistung, ist ein echter Mehrwert f√ºr mich, da der Rechner bei mir 24/7 l√§uft.Auch ist der 5700X sehr k√ºhl im Betrieb und daher stehen die L√ºfter im Idle fast still - das war beim 2700x ganz anders. Im Stresstest komme ich bei 100% Auslastung auf gerade mal 52¬∞ Celsius (NZXT Kraken 360 Wasserk√ºhlung). Da der Stresstest nat√ºrlich nicht mit meiner t√§glichen Nutzung zu vergleichen ist und ich selten √ºber 20% Last komme, ist das System tats√§chlich unh√∂rbar leise bei rund 35¬∞ Celsius.Ich wollte eigentlich den 5800x kaufen, allerdings ist der mit 105 Watt im Stromverbrauch auf dem gleichen Niveau wie mein alter 2700x und was die Temperatur angeht ebenso. Auf die geringe Mehrleistung verzichte ich daher gerne und wenn ich sie br√§uchte, dann w√§re der 5700x auch sehr einfach zu √ºbertakten, was aber f√ºr mich nicht in Frage kommt.Den 5800x hingegen m√ºsste ich im Eco-Modus laufen lassen, damit er k√ºhl und sparsam bleibt (dann w√§re allerdings die Mehrleistung auch verpufft). Preislich tut sich bei beiden Prozessoren nicht viel, daher ist es nachher wirklich nur eine "Glaubensfrage".Ich bin mit dem Kauf sehr zufrieden.', 'I`ve created this review for people, like myself, considering updating an older Ryzen CPU for this end phase of the Ryzen 4 chipset.I pondered doing this for quite some time, read reviews researched etc, but I did have some doubts, even at a great price (¬£163) its still a lot of cash for something that may not make a huge difference.Well, no worries on that front at all, as you can see from the pictured CPUBenchmark results, the upgrade in performance is significant.The whole machine feels a lot snappier than before, more so than I expected. Software I run (Ableton + Games) are all more responsive, most games I`m getting noticeable increase in framerates.Fitting this was a easy, I also bought a Wraith Prism CPU cooler, as I was unsure if my stock 3600 cooler would do the job, plus its got lights on it!! As it goes, temps are actually better than the older 3600 so I think the older stock cooler would have done the job.For anyone with an older Ryzen looking to extend the life of their kit, I would recommend this CPU. I avoided the 5800x as the performance to price increase is not so good, additionally, it consumes more power and thus generates more heat.Super chuffed with this, reckon I`ve got another 4-5 years on this build now, probably longer!', "The AMD Ryzen‚Ñ¢ 7 5700X desktop processor may belong to the last generation, but it still packs quite a punch and delivers an impressive performance that doesn't disappoint.Unleashing Power with 8 Cores and 16 Threads:With its 8-core, 16-thread configuration, the Ryzen‚Ñ¢ 7 5700X is a true multitasking powerhouse. It effortlessly handles demanding tasks, making it ideal for gamers and content creators alike.Seamless Gaming Experience:When it comes to gaming, this processor is a force to be reckoned with. It delivers smooth and lag-free gameplay, and the 8 cores ensure that modern games run like a dream, even with demanding graphics.Editing Videos Like a Pro:For content creators and video editors, the Ryzen‚Ñ¢ 7 5700X is a reliable companion. Its multithreaded performance shines during video editing tasks, reducing rendering times and enhancing overall productivity.Unlocked for Overclocking:Enthusiasts will appreciate the unlocked nature of this processor, allowing for easy overclocking to squeeze out even more performance when needed.Compatible with AM4 Socket:The Ryzen‚Ñ¢ 7 5700X fits the AM4 socket, making it compatible with a wide range of motherboards. This ensures future upgradability and versatility in building your dream system.Reliable Cooling Solutions:The processor comes with a capable stock cooler that does a commendable job at keeping temperatures in check during regular use.Great Value for Performance:Though it's from the last generation, the Ryzen‚Ñ¢ 7 5700X continues to offer excellent value for its performance. It competes admirably with newer counterparts in its price range.Future-Proof for Everyday Tasks:For everyday computing tasks, this processor is future-proof. It's more than capable of handling web browsing, office work, and other day-to-day activities with ease.Final Verdict:In conclusion, the AMD Ryzen‚Ñ¢ 7 5700X 8-Core, 16-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor is a testament to AMD's commitment to delivering powerful and efficient processors. While it may belong to the last generation, its performance is nothing short of impressive. Gamers, content creators, and everyday users will find a lot to love in this processor, thanks to its multitasking capabilities and smooth gaming experience. If you're looking for a cost-effective option that can handle both gaming and productivity tasks without breaking the bank, the Ryzen‚Ñ¢ 7 5700X is undoubtedly worth considering. It's a reliable performer that stands the test of time and continues to shine in various computing scenarios."]

Product: Intel Core i5-12600K Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked¬† LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Reviews: ["12600K is faster comparing to my 3900X(same on 3200Mhz, 8GB x4), more snappy when switching charts. Intel graphics driver doesn't support multi monitors well in Windows 10, seems to be okay in Windows 11. it cannot remember monitor relative postion when resume from sleep. no other issues found.", 'Good quality product.  I received messages about the location of my goods, so I always knew where it was and how long it would take to arrive.  The packaging is good, performance is good.', 'En general es un buen producto pero su manejo de temperaturas no me gusta, por un lado puedes tener un n√∫cleo a 50¬∞c mientras otro est√° a 34¬∞c y otro a 29¬∞c y tener saltos "raros" desde igual 29 a 45¬∞c; y eso descontrola un poco el manejo del ventidador del disipador; esto es usando una motherboard nueva gigabyte B760m ds3h AX y refrigeraci√≥n l√≠quida Corsair Hydro H60, vengo de usar un AMD FX 8350 (que se calentaba mucho y por eso me acostumbre a la refrigeraci√≥n l√≠quida y con ese FX siempre ten√≠a temperaturas en repodo de unos 25¬∞c sin saltos raros y con el mismo H60 y TDP de 125W), cabe destacar que sabiendo del problema de pandeo que tiene esta serie (LGA 1700) he instalado desde el principio una placa de presion termalright para que ese problema no ocurra; hasta ahora todo funciona bien nunca ha pasado de los 60¬∞c pero esos saltos de temperatura en diferentes partes del procesador siguen sin gustarme.', "Got it for ¬£174 from Amazon US, which is about ¬£65 cheaper than buying one in the UK. Even if you compare it with a 13400, which has a similar performance running at base clock, it is still so much cheaper (¬£46).If I remember correctly, the cpu does not come with a warranty, which is probably fine as CPUs are known to be very durable. So make sure you test it when you receivie it so you know if it's faulty.", 'Cumple con todo lo que promete, entiendo es una buena inversi√≥n, pues el mismo lo puedo usar tanto para gaming como para trabajo, excelente desempe√±o. Para una persona normal ita como yo esta s√∫per, pues tambi√©n he usado el 12700 y son muy parecidos en cuanto a rendimiento, a pesar de que el 12700 tiene m√°s n√∫cleos y que su consumo es menor, he sentido m√°s estabilidad en el 12600k. Nota no hago OC. Siempre uso eso en stock.Lo tengo acompa√±ado de rtx3080 y 64gb de RAM a 3600mhz y tengo otro que ya llevo desde que sali√≥ esta generaci√≥n con 32gb de ram a 4400mhz y son una pasada para mi. Uno con Refrigeracion nzxt z53 y el otro con noctua nhd15s y se manejan s√∫per las temperaturas en ambos casos.', 'He utilizado el procesador ya de alg√∫n tiempo y no he tenido problemas con el, simplemente perfecto', "Bought this as an upgrade for my old processor and I can honestly say I have not been disappointed. This thing is powerful and doesn't take up much energy. Haven't had any issues with it. If you've been eyeballing this one and are looking for a budget processor I'd say quit hesitating and get it.", 'I needed a PC that could edit video and raw picture files without crashing. This i5 10 core is amazing. I also added a GeForce 3060 ti and let my teen boys have a crack at it with gaming and they approve. I could have got a better CPU, but the price of this one was way worth it. Great buy!', 'Llego en perfectas condiciones y no me ha dado problemas en lo absoluto. Aun no pruebo el overclock pero no lo veo necesario, lo compr√© para que en unos a√±os cuando se este quedando corto el procesador hacerle overclock y sacarle un par de a√±os de uso m√°s', 'Super recomendado comprado este a√±o 2023, una excelente inversi√≥n. Super r√°pido.']

Product: AMD RYZEN THREADRIPPER 3960X 24-Core 48-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor, Black, Medium
Reviews: ['As a 3D artist I gotta say I really like this CPU! It is really fast at rendering and got a Cinebench score of 14254! I did enable the Precision Boost Overdrive in the BIOS.Things you should know is,make sure you properly cool this CPU, I bought the new Aorus Liquid Cooler 360 and it couldn‚Äôt cool down my temperatures at full CPU load of 95c, and resulted in lower Cinebench scores of around 13400-13700.However, I switched to a Noctua air cooler ‚ÄúNH-U14S TR4-SP3‚Äù, and replaced the fan it came with, with a 120mm fan ‚ÄúNF-A12x25‚Äù for better RPM. Overall, idle temps and full load were much better! 36c-39c idle, 84c-85c full load and much quieter than the Aorus Liquid cooler 360.Finally, I am happy with this CPU and it serves me well.Quick Note: just make sure you know what you are doing if you decide to enable Precision Boost Overdrive. Read and look up information and tutorials. and don‚Äôt mess with anything if you don‚Äôt know much.Update on a 5 star review:Unfortunately, I have to knock down 2 stars because as a 3D artist, Maya user, whenever I try to unfold some pieces of my UV\'s, I get a "// Error: Unfold3D process error." , which some users have experienced with Ryzen CPU\'s if you look in the Maya forums the same mesh works with Intel rigs and functions properly. Personally, I never had a problem unfolding UV\'s with my Intel rig until in Maya 2019-2020, only when I bought my new 3960X, which is a nightmare with UV unfolding because you have to cut the UV\'s in places that are very undesirable in order to unfold your UV\'s and then I have to reattach them manually in the right places.I know Intel\'s prices for the Intel - Core i9-10980XE 18-core may be high, but if you want to avoid software issues, I would definitely go Intel because recently as 02/24/2020 AMD has had many driver issues with their GPU\'s and the Ryzen Master App is super buggy, sometimes it loads and sometimes it doesn\'t and I get an "error hence aborting". Literally, I have to click on the Ryzen Master App sometimes up to 5 times in order to bypass the error to load up the app. AMD\'s hardware is impressive, but without proper functioning software it will still be behind Intel.Final thoughts:I would not recommend buying this CPU if you are a Maya user, AMD\'s software is too buggy and unreliable and this is the first and last time I will buy AMD. Sorry AMD, I gave you a chance and you failed me big time, I trusted you and these type of issues are not acceptable. Maya is an industry standard, and AMD should\'ve invested more time into these types of issues because you cannot render your mesh without UV unwrapping and texturing it first, so fast renders don\'t mean a thing if my Ryzen CPU has issues UV unfolding my UV\'s. UV unfolding was such a headache because it made a simple thing into a nightmare.', "I was debating between this and the 36 core model, and I'm glad I went with this one. My other components are 128gb of ram, Two 1tb NVMe 4.0 drives, 2080it...I use a LOT of the Adobe Suite, and for video editing, the Adobe CC suite isn't quite coded to fully utilize a build like this. Right now I've done a lot of editing and rendering and here is my experience:-Adobe After Effects: can not utilize these many cores. I'm sure the next release will, but right now if I render a video or even during editing, I'm at most 38percent processor utilization. According to what I can find on Adobe's site, it maxes out at 16 cores.- Adobe Rush - Utilizes all cores, but even with multiple layers on a 4k 60 min video file, 72% processor utilization-Adobe Premiere -  Same as Rush, but on a few renders I've been able to get up to high 80s on utilization.I don't regret the build, but at the moment, Adobe needs to do a lot of work on their software to start to utilize these processors.That being said... I can render something, and continue using my computer as if nothing is going on in the background, and that is incredible.My plan is to use this smaller core build, and then as Adobe steps up their game, and windows steps up their processor utilization game, then I'll upgrade to the larger core and not need to replace any other components.-", 'If you want a CPU that supports 256GB of RAM as QUAD channel (not dual) and has PCIE lanes in abundance, then this is a CPU for you.This is one of the very last CPUs that is affordable with these specifications.I do finite element analysis FEA. I do benefit significantly from more memory channels and a 256GB ECC RAM size, PCIE lanes etc. The 5950x and the 12900k go only up to 128gb and ECC support is not easy.It is still a bargain compared to the 5965WX Threadripper Pro which is listed for thousands more.It is still faster than the 12900k in memory intensive applications such as FEA. 7zip benchmark is attached.', 'The retail packaging is rather elaborate and seems rather more for jewellery (which it shares the price with). However the chip is delivered well protected. It is supplied with a torque wrench to ensure that the bolts locking down the holder on the mainboard are not overtightened. The chip is not supplied with a cooler, so you must find one yourself and ensure that you have the right thermal paste.For gaming it is great but possibly not the best value for money now. Where it excels are apps with lots of threads so graphics/video processing as well as AI/ML.For best performance, you need the right motherboard, I went for the Aorus TRX40 Master and the bios supported this processor out of the box', 'I Got this last week. I own a threadripper 3970x But. that is more costly then this one so I decided to buy this for my second threaddripper build. I used the same Asus mother board. I used the same be quiet air cooled cpu cooler. I went with the same  500gb Aorus nvme 2 ssd.  I used a corsair rm850x psu and 8 sticks of hyperx 16gb ram for a total of 128gb ram.  I mine with this machine Xmr/monero this machine cost me a lot less then my 3970x build.Which is same motherboard ,same cooler, same nvme ssd.  I am happy with this after 10-14 days of running it is nice.this machine does 21-22k hash ratethe more expensive machine does 27-28k hash rate.this build. was 35% cheaper. and I get 25% less hash not 35% less so this has more value.', 'Die alte Kr√ºcke wollte die Videobearbeitung nicht mehr so recht schaffen. Darum musste ein neuer PC her.Braucht man das in dieser St√§rke?Ganz einfach: wer gelegentlich mal ein Video schneidet sicher nicht, aber bei mir l√§uft das fast t√§glich √ºber den PC. Darum her mit was Vern√ºnftigem.Der CPU ist der g√ºnstigste der 3ten Generation. Mit dem Oreis zwar kein Schn√§ppchen, aber man hat schon mehr Geld f√ºr Unn√∂tigeres ausgegeben.Mit der Motherboard eigenen Software mal die √úbertaktung getestet und im Stresstest 4,175 Gigahertz erreicjt bei knapp 81¬∞C. Alles im gr√ºnen Bereich.PC Programme f√ºr Foto- und Videobearbeitung installiert, knapp 1 Minute je Programm.Video gerendert und exportiert, zusammen knapp 3 Minuten. Vorher waren es 30-60 Minuten und eine extrem hei√üe CPU. Jetzt grad mal 55¬∞C.Also ein voller Gewinn.', 'Does everything it needs to do fast and efficiently. I lowered the PPT from 280Watts to 180Watts in Bios (can be done in ryzen master as well) and lost only 10% multicore performance and lost 0 single core performance for 40% less energy and heat output. Using this currently with a Noctua NH U9 TR4/SP3 cooler which only supports up to 180Watts of power. Under prime95 for a few hours all core load small FFT the temps stabilize around 80-87 Celcius. Absolute beast and quiet.', 'Upgraded from a 2700x to this with an Asus sTRX 40-E Gaming. the quad channel memory is INSANELY fast. I load games like Resident Evil 3 in about 5 seconds paired with a Radeon VII with water cooling for both.I run NPlus Miner for crypto mining on this and it runs at 50c at full load with a 360x 60mm thick rad.Worth every penny!', "Great for video editing in DaVinci Resolve or Premiere Pro. I've noticed a good performance boost when using it to create motion graphics inside the Fusion tab of Resolve, much faster than the Intel i9 9920x I was using. It also renders out projects very fast which is great in case I need to go back and render something out again. My first AMD processor and I couldn't be happier.The only thing to look out for is the heat this thing generates, using a Noctua NH-U14S, but it's not the recommended fan cooler for this CPU. The only coolers on the recommended list for this CPU are liquid coolers to my knowledge (as of 2/22/2020). Excellent CPU, worth the $$$ and switch to AMD.", 'Very happy with this purchase, has been working reliably for serval months.(not used for gaming - rather on a software developer machine)']

Product: Intel Core i5-13600KF Desktop Processor 14 cores (6 P-cores + 8 E-cores) 24M Cache, up to 5.1 GHz
Reviews: ['Happy to build my PC with the latest 13th gen i5 processors.', "Excellent  CPU, great gaming performance, and  the midrange  King of Productivity. Typical of Intel, it just works flawlessly with everything, 14 cores & 20 threads deal easily with heavy work loads.  Fast, 5.5-5.7 Ghz overclock, no problem! Efficient gaming chip, uses a little over half the power as a 9th Gen 9600k (that's  with a 5.5GHz overclock) and UK summertime in game temps rarely exceed mid 50¬∞C's. (cooled with 280mm AIO) Flexible,  use with DDR4 or DDR5, so there's  a wide range of mobo's  to choose from. Impressive CPU.", 'this i5-kf replaces my 11th gen i7-kf. sure, one reads that and first thought is, he\'s downgrading. well, hang on, grasshopper!! this pup puts the 11th gen i7 to shame even when it was slightly overclocked. very weird cause it\'s has a slower speed but when it\'s time to rock & roll, it flies.boot time, and app loading is measurably quicker. when stress/load tested using the intel tool, it gets very hot. with this processor, temps above 89c did not cause throttling, so intel must be ok with this. temps are considerably lower when not testing. i was ready to buy an aio cooler but am holding off for now. the huge noctua d15 attached may suffice. i don\'t want to mess around with water pumps, so until intel figures out how to bring the heat, with less heat, i can park here for the foreseeable.lemme go out on a limb and say that for most folks, this much hp may be overkill. lastly, this was not a "vine" purchase but a damn good one at $285!', 'Got one for each kid.  Very thankful I bought them over the ryzen 7600 and 7700.  Card is a beast for gaming and smokes the Ryzens in multi tasking eqsoly.and even gaming, especially when overclocked.  Does great on an AK620 zerodark.  Nabbed money for loke 230 or 250 on sale. Worth every penny.', "While I've been trying to build a PC as a blender workstation I wanted a good enough processor that won't bottleneck under ¬£300 as spent most of my budget on GPU. But it is way better than I expected. I am not rendering anything with the CPU and it handles complex geometry without hiccups. Unless you're doing complex simulations, I think it's a decent option as you can use the extra cash on GPU.", "I bought this proceesor based on the recommendation that it's the go-to mid/upper mid-range for this generation. I didn't do any in-depth comparisons for cost to speed, etc. as I felt it unnecessary. I'm coming from a 2014 Intel i7, so pretty much anything is going to be an upgrade. Everything is working great. Air cooled with a deepcool AK620, the temps under prime95 load can reach 100c, which seems extremely hot, but it seems like that's just the way the cookie crumbles with my setup. Reapplied thermal paste and made some space in my tower for better airflow and it more or less remained the same. Idle temps are around 35c.Everything is running very snappily, particularly loading models in Stable Diffusion now takes only seconds when it used to take minutes with my 4790k. Hoping this CPU will last me just as long.", "I won't go into much technical detail here since there's people a lot smarter than myself who can get into the nitty gritty. Generally speaking though - this CPU absolutely smokes, especially for the price. Don't let the 'i5' name fool you. The i5-13600K (and KF) is a top-class processor that for most users, will offer more than enough performance for intensive tasks while having probably the most reasonable power consumption and cooling requirements of the top-three 13th generation Intel processors.I came from an i7-5960X - still a solid processor in this day and age but unfortunately my motherboard wasn't exactly kind to me attempting to take it above 3.8 GHz. Despite it bottlenecking against my 2080 Ti, it still ran cool under a 360mm CLC, topping out at no more than 51 degrees C gaming (GPU load) and 60 degrees under full CPU loads. But since the current market for new components is pretty good, I opted to go all in on a 13th gen build rather than find a better X99 motherboard.Odds are, you're probably going to be cross shopping the i5-13600K with the i7-13700K and the i9-13900K. Unless your workflow necessitates the additional core count or you're chasing records, the performance difference between those CPUs and the 13600K did not seem worth the hundreds of dollars of additional cost and the massive increase in peak power consumption. Power also equals heat, and that was another motivating factor for going with the 13600K, having been accustomed to a relatively cool and quiet build for some time. That said; with the additional cores and much higher boost frequency, I was expecting higher peak power draw and temps despite a lower TDP on paper.And they were definitely higher, under the same 360mm CLC. After running benchmarks with Cinebench and 3DMark, I was hitting peak temps in the mid-to-high 70s under full CPU loads. Gaming loads however were definitely more manageable though, sitting in the 40s and seldom breaking 50 degrees, which was actually a small but appreciable improvement over the 5960X. I'd advise at minimum a high quality air cooler or a 240mm CLC for this processor.The out of the box performance is something else though. I managed to hit 23345 on a multi-core Cinebench test and a 16459 combined score on 3DMark Time Spy. Again, this is stock clocks paired with an overclocked 2080 Ti and 32GB of DDR5 at 5600 MHz. At 3440 x 1440 and 144Hz, games run like butter. I could dabble in overclocking it since I have the headroom but honestly, I don't see the point. It's fantastic as is.All in all, I feel like the 13600K is kind of the no-brainer option for most people looking to put together a high-end system on a budget. You're getting most of the performance of it's more expensive stablemates for a much lower price and less obnoxiously high power and cooling requirements. The KF is also a little cheaper if you don't need integrated graphics. Just buy it. You'll love it.", "For the price, it's just as good as most i9 and i7 processors and comes in a bit cheaper too. I use my PC for gaming/multitasking and it hasn't given me any issues so far.", 'Temp is fine on an air cooled pc.  It plays stafield just fine and price wise it was well worth it for the speed of this little bugga', 'Great processor for the price.']

Product: AMD Ryzen 9 5900X 12-core, 24-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor
Reviews: ['Good performance at a good price. No problems running Cyberpunk 2077', "Bought this for a new desktop I was building.Paired it with a NZXT X73 cooler (I'm using a Lian Li Lancool III RGB case) and I'm getting high 30s degrees when idle and high 60s - low 70s degrees when under load.Blazing fast and performs really well.  Even running Cyberpunk 2077 I get about 25% - 30% load max on 4K with a 3080Ti on Ultra, which leaves a ton of legroom for other apps running concurrent.I got it for SG$499 (including import fees), which is a real bargain.", 'Great CPU to get for productivity. Bought it for my custom build. Runs at about 75 degrees at peak loads with a fan cooler. Great buy!', 'Sold and shipped from Amazon USA.Well packaged with minimal damage to packaging during transport.Box contains only the CPU without any accessories or cooler, as expected.Direct drop in replacement of my 1st gen ryzen 1700 on my Asus x370 prime pro board.Updated bios to latest version prior to CPU swap. Works flawlessly.', "Great for both video work and gaming. Snagged this for 580SGD, an excellent price for the performance offered by this chip. I was debating between the 5700X, 5800X3D, and this, but when i saw this go for such a low price, I just went for it and I certainly didn't regret it!", "Upgraded from 5600X. This 12 core Ryzen is going to last a very long time, even Intel's i9-10900K only has 10 cores. I'd never maxed out my 5600X with any games or applications, and have never gone above 50% utilization with this 5900X.Only con is that the box is ridiculously empty since there is no cooler included. AMD could have made the packaging 20x smaller", 'I ordered 5950X initially, but waiting one week and didn‚Äôt ship, so I cancelled the Order and ordered 5900x, so far this cpu gave great performance to my daily work at video editing. Rendering takes a few minutes compared with my 2019 Mac Mini takes 6 hours to finish.', 'Great CPU. But it is hot. I plan to use this for my own personal desktop + lab. I paired it with Scythe Fuma 2 cooler. Many testings are yet to be done. So far, I am happy with it.', 'Authentic AMD Ryzen 9 5900X. Fast CPU, fast delivery.', "Best buy at promotional discount, the final upgrade for AM4. I'll be using this for a long time ahead.Amazon finally shipping this in a proper cardboard box and not in a flimsy manila envelope."]

Product: Intel Core i9-13900K (Latest Gen) Gaming Desktop Processor 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores) with Integrated Graphics - Unlocked
Reviews: ["The Intel Core i9-13900K Gaming Desktop Processor has completely redefined my gaming and computing experience, offering a level of performance that's truly in a league of its own. With an impressive 24 cores, this processor delivers raw power that translates into seamless gaming, multitasking, and content creation.To start, the processing prowess of the Intel Core i9-13900K is jaw-dropping. The 24 cores and 48 threads make it a true powerhouse, capable of handling the most demanding tasks with ease. Whether it's immersive gaming, 3D rendering, video editing, or complex simulations, this processor doesn't break a sweat.The gaming performance is a standout feature. With its high clock speeds and multithreading capabilities, the i9-13900K ensures buttery-smooth gameplay even in the most graphically intensive titles. The ability to run background applications without compromising gaming performance is a game-changer for streamers and content creators.Multitasking reaches new heights with this processor. The 24 cores enable effortless switching between applications, ensuring a seamless workflow even with resource-hungry software. Whether I'm editing videos, running virtual machines, or working on complex projects, the processor's performance remains consistently impressive.The Intel Core i9-13900K's compatibility with the latest technologies is worth noting. Support for PCIe 5.0 and DDR5 memory allows for lightning-fast data transfer speeds and optimal memory performance, further enhancing the overall computing experience.Thermal management is another area where this processor shines. The advanced cooling solutions and efficient power consumption ensure that the processor maintains optimal temperatures under heavy loads, contributing to its long-term reliability.In conclusion, the Intel Core i9-13900K Gaming Desktop Processor has exceeded my expectations in terms of performance, gaming prowess, multitasking capabilities, technology integration, and thermal management. Its 24 cores offer a level of processing power that's perfect for gamers, content creators, and professionals seeking exceptional performance across the board. If you're looking to elevate your gaming and computing experience to unprecedented heights, the Intel Core i9-13900K is undoubtedly a worthy investment. It has earned my highest praise and has become the centerpiece of my high-performance desktop setup.", 'When it comes to going over the top for a PC upgrade, this CPU is the undisputed heavyweight champion. I, too, dabble in video editing, 3D modeling, and an array of demanding tasks, and let me tell you, this powerhouse just devours them with sheer gusto. Paired with a Kraken water cooler, it operates like a well-oiled machine, showing absolutely no signs of throttling, even under the most intense workloads. And as for those so-called "CPU-intensive" games, well, they might as well be child\'s play for this beast. If you\'re seeking the best of the best, look no further ‚Äì this CPU is the crown jewel in the kingdom of processors, and it\'s here to make your computing dreams come true. It\'s not just top-tier; it\'s top of the world, and it laughs in the face of anything you throw its way. A true marvel of technology that\'s worth every penny!', "The Intel Core i9-13900K is undeniably a top-tier processor that showcases unparalleled performance and technological excellence. However, it's essential to acknowledge that this exceptional power comes with a premium price tag. While the Intel Core i9-13900K may be considered expensive, the performance it delivers makes it a compelling option for those who demand the absolute best from their computing experience.Let's address the elephant in the room first: the cost. The i9-13900K is indeed one of the higher-priced processors on the market. This means it may not be the most budget-friendly choice for all users, especially for those whose computing needs aren't as resource-intensive. However, for professionals, enthusiasts, and gamers who rely on cutting-edge performance to tackle demanding workloads and push their creativity to the limits, the i9-13900K's price begins to justify itself.With its impressive 16 cores and 32 threads, this processor shines in multitasking scenarios and content creation tasks. Video rendering, 3D modeling, and heavy computation become swift and seamless experiences, reducing project turnaround times and boosting overall productivity.Gaming enthusiasts will be delighted with the i9-13900K's prowess in delivering breathtaking gaming performance. Its native support for DDR5 memory and PCIe 5.0 ensures faster data access and transfer, leading to quicker load times and smoother gameplay, which enhances the gaming experience to a whole new level.The processor's unlocked multiplier empowers overclockers to maximize its potential further, catering to those who love to tweak and fine-tune their systems for optimal performance. With Intel's Turbo Boost Technology 4.0, you'll experience intelligent performance adjustments, optimizing efficiency when required and delivering maximum power when needed.Furthermore, Intel's 10nm SuperFin process technology contributes to the i9-13900K's energy efficiency, ensuring that it provides a balance between power and consumption, which is especially vital for environmentally-conscious users.In conclusion, the Intel Core i9-13900K may have a higher price point, but it delivers a level of performance that leaves competing processors trailing in its wake. While not everyone might find it within their budget, for those seeking the absolute pinnacle of computing capabilities, the i9-13900K is an investment worth considering. If performance and cutting-edge technology are your top priorities, this processor will undoubtedly elevate your computing experience to new heights, making it a worthy 5-star choice despite its cost.", 'This processor is a beast especially paired with gtx 4090 graphics card. I can edit videos and play games both at 4K settings together no problem and it doesn‚Äôt generate that much heat either. I previously had a 2080ti paired with 6900k and was very happy with it until everyone was transitioning to 4K so sadly I had to retire my old build. Just a heads up to anyone who plans to pair 13900k with 4090, don‚Äôt be a smartass and try to put it in small case, you will regret it later. I personally recommend big case with high airflow like fractal design torrent mid size atx but if you don‚Äôt want to spend too much money on graphics card and happy with getting something like 4060 then you can get the nano version of fractal torrent. Good luck gamers and editors. Just remember if gaming is the only thing you do then no point spending this much just go a step down on processor. AMD processors are better if gaming is the only thing you do.', 'Todo llego bien. Me gusto mucho el cuidado de empaquetado del producto. Muy bien.', 'Well, what can I tell you, it is simply the best processor of 2023, you have to have an idea of \u200b\u200bwhat you are going to use it for, it is a big beast that is not worth it for small fights.', 'Extremely fast processor. Moved from a 12900kf. Much faster RAM clocks without the issues the 12900kf was giving me.I have been using the processor for a while now with no issues and great thermals on a watercooled system. The processor stability has been rock solid even with a bios updated 12th gen motherboard.', 'Thanks üôè', 'Super', 'Would recommend it for your battle station. I could not be happier.']

Product: AMD Ryzen‚Ñ¢ 3 4100 4-Core, 8-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor with Wraith Stealth Cooler
