Se voc√™ tiver mem√≥ria e um boa placa de v√≠deo.', "I have this installed in an ASUS PRIME PLUS-D4 with an M.2 970 EVO Pro 1TB, ZOTAC 2080, 32GB VulcanC DDR4, AZZA Spectra 280 case with 7 fans.  Running 1080P maxed out CyberPunk 2077 @ 57-60fps WHILE streaming was more than I thought this 'lil dude could handle. Third day stock cooler couldn't keep up so I threw in a Deepcool cooler in there! Never goes above 70C now.... Love this build :)", 'Paired with 8 gb ram, H610M-E D4 Intel Lga 1700 Mic-ATX Motherboard, Western Digital WD Green SN350 NVMe 240GB, Upto 2400MB/s, and working fine. Go for it.', 'Do grania w 1080p idealny, bardzo niski pob√≥r mocy, niskie temperatury, wydajno≈õciowo w grach nie odstaje od Ryzena 5600. Je≈õli chodzi o wielozadaniowo≈õƒá (multicore) wypada gorzej ale to mi nie przeszkadza.', 'buon prodotto consegna veloce', 'I‚Äôve paired it with a RX 7600. Works pretty well with it. I‚Äôve not experienced any issues so far.You may push to get a i5-12400F for higher cores if your budget allows it. Otherwise, this is a great starting point for a budget PC build.', 'Probably the best 100 dollar cpu out there.']

Product: AMD Ryzen‚Ñ¢ 9 7900X 12-Core, 24-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor
Reviews: ["Had to buy from Amazon since the local 7000 series MSRP still haven't come down yet. Coming back from where it belong. Absolute worth for the price even after the shipping and import duty fee. Although it's still an overpriced CPU and AM5 ecosystem overall to be honest. Besides the brace period about a week after placing the order, the shipping itself was really quick for something that shipped from the other side of the earth, received in less than a week. The parcel box quite damaged but the processor box is mostly fine.Make sure the rest of the PC hardware configuration is right to make use of it. Lots of people overlooked their specifications and ended up with issues. Paired mine with MSI MPG X670E Carbon Wifi. Using this as my personal workstation and minor gaming. Anything beyond the 7700X is already overkill for gaming tbh. Hopefully it can last for at least 4-5 years.", 'Been waiting to build my new rig for quite some time and this was the missing piece.New build:Corsair Icue 7000X Full Tower RGBRyzen 9 7900X CPU32GB DDR5 5600 Corsair Dominator RAM1 TB Crucial M.2 Gen 4XFX Merc 319 Radeon 6950XT 16GB Graphics CardCorsair 1000w PSUGigabyte X670 Elite AX AM5 MotherboardCorsair iCUE H150i Elite LCD XT Liquid CPU Cooler (360 AIO mounted to top as Exhaust6 Corsair ML140\'s Fans (10 total fans including those with the case/aio with 6 as intake and 4 for exhaust).Lian Li Strimer V2 RGB Cables for the GPU and Motherboard (they look very nice and controllable via the L Connect 3 software)As I needed additional powered USB headers I also added a Corsair Internal 4-Port USB 2.0 Hub - 4X 9-Pin USB 2.0 Ports for the Commander Core XT and Lian Li Controllers to function.Thermal Grizzly Kryonaut Thermal Paste (removed the stock paste with AIO using TG cleaner wipes as well for better contact).ThermalRight AMD5 CPU Shield - This allows the AIO or Waterblock (if doing a custom loop) to make WAY better contact with the CPU HS. It can be a little nerve wracking as your removing the cpu mount and installing this one but its worth it. As the AM5 CPU has no pins (the mobo now has the pins), its imperative you are gentle on the placement. Best way I found to install this shield was to place the CPU into the socket, then remove the cpu holder so this way you can\'t damage the cpu or pins as they are socketed. Installing the shield from that point is easy, just don\'t overtighten it. Theres a bunch of youtube videos on this process. Definitely recommend reviewing them before attempting this step.I upgraded from my old Ryzen 5 2600X system with a GTX 960 SSC 4GB card and a 512gb M.2 Gen 2 drive.Needless to say this was quite the upgrade from my old system.Cinebench scores on my 2600X even with a mild overclock was only around 7200.After getting everything configured/setup and Windows 11 Pro installed with all updates and enabling EXPO1 (RAM OC) and enabling SAM in the BIOS I started my benchmarking.Cinebench score with just EXPO1 enabled baseline was 28745. What a jump!CPU temp on the multi-core threading with the 360 AIO only went as high as 82c (AMD rates these to run at 95c as normal operating temp so it was well below even that).Haven\'t done any OC\'ing other than enabling EXPO1 yet since I really don\'t need to as the CPU and GPU run everything maxed out.Tested on a few games on max/ultra settings and below are what I got FPS wise:The Division 2 (All settings maxed and on DX12) - Avg 125fps on 3440 x 1440 165hz resolutionAliens: Fireteam Elite - Avg 160fps on 3440 x 1440 165hz resolutionBorderlands 2 (older game I know but love to play it with max settings) - Avg 476fps on 3440 x 1440 165hz resolutionForza Horizon 5 - Ultra Settings (max) including Ray Tracing - Avg 155fps on 3440 x 1440 165hz resolutionAliens: Colonial Marines (older game) - Avg 190FPS on 3440 x 1440 165hz resolutionWarframe - Avg 155fps on 3440 x 1440 165hz resolutionPairing this CPU and GPU together worked great and the CPU itself is a beast. It does get hot when it turbo\'s up into the 5ghz range which is why you need a really good cooler (either AIO or custom loop) to keep the temps in check.If you do that, this CPU will be everything you need and then some.One thing I always tell people is to take your time, plan out your PC parts you want for what you want the system to do (video editing, gaming, streaming, etc). Don\'t be afraid to look around for good deals. I scored the AIO Cooler off Newegg for a much cheaper price than Amazon had it and it works beautifully and the LCD screen is just a nice "geek" factor to put JPG\'s or GIF\'s there.Once you have everything, take your time when building it. You may run into an issue here or there which is normal. First boot on AM5 systems is sometimes slow (Memory has to train) and you may see it cycle on/off for up to 1 minute. Mine did this and on the 4th power cycle it posted and I could get into the BIOS and everything showed up correctly.Good luck enthusiasts and hope this review helped with anyone looking at this CPU for their system!Its worth it!', "I realize that a pc picture for a processor is pointless and just showing off, but isn't everyone who gets this showing off a little lol. Anyway, the title says it all, a beast. I've been intel all my life, though to be fair I havent had many computers, but still, i was like amd who? lol. Even when amd surpassed intel with the x3d for gaming anyway I was like well whatever intel's still the goat so they can have their short victory, which is unheard of for me because if there are 2 brands that are equal or even one thats close but not quite as good, ill always go with the red one(obsessive fav color), but then am5 came out, and to be clear, i wasn't one of those fanboys who was like omg becky! amd is going to destroy intel and there's going to be nothing they can do about it. No! quite the opposite. I knew. I knew what revolutionary technology the hybrid core design was and how great raptor lake was going to be, I knew it might even surpass amd's new best unlike everyone else. Didn't matter though. Because i wanted to try changing it up and switching to team red for a variety of reasons. 1. like i said cuz its red. 2. because as great as raptor is, i dont wanna be in the cycle i was in before where if i wanna upgrade a single pc part like the processor, ill have to basically build a new pc, which is what i had to do and what youll always have to do with intel usually, but amd will have upgradability on this for years new platform and all on top of the fact that amd has always been better about keeping compatible socket types for a longer time, while obviously thats not true for raptor, and even if raptor was a new platform lets not play like am5 still wouldnt be supported way longer, because it will, hell am5 will probably be supported to the end of intels next platform lol, 3. ive never once cared about power efficiency and heat, like so what, ok it draws alotta power, BUT, as long as the performance is there(lookin at you 12900/13900) and it will not throttle and be stable, awesome, do whatever you want, why limit performance for braggin rights efficiency(i know some people will cringe reading that), but anyway, while idc about it, it is a big win all the same for amd 4. 12 cores and 24 threads of pure American Muscle (jk but you get the point lol), 5. amd has become the stability platform thanks to intels new incredible but still NEW architecture 6. you get every bonus I just said and are getting like the 3rd best consumer processor in the world right now, who cares if the 13900 is technically #1 by a few percent 7. if you want both gaming performance and workstation performance, which is the main reason i upgraded, this is the way to go, best of both worlds if 16 core 32 thread or 13900k is just a bit unnecessary for you but you still want that best of both worlds, and for that reason idc what any reviews say online about it being slightly overpriced, because for all of the reasons i listed above, i disagree 8. well this is more of a counter, but, are the motherboards pretty expensive, yes, is ddr5 expensive? yes but if your building a new pc it really doesn't matter does it because your already spending a bunch of money and you might as well pay a bit more for that amd upgradability over intel, and for those who aren't building a totally new one, assuming you don't wanna pay a bunch of money, if you do your research you can still get a good motherboard and ddr5 for pretty cheap OH AND AT THE TIME OF WRITING THIS I've been talking about the normal price, but currently the 7900 is at an INSANE DISCOUNT, LIKE CRAZY, final note: that second picture i showed was me letting hw monitor run for 30 minutes, the point is that, it does go way above 5.6 even if only in semi frequent spikes, just thought it was cool, i know practically it doesnt matter", 'Nach ca. mehr als 5 Jahren endlich der Umstieg und Erneuerung meines Computers vom Intel i7-3770 nun auf AMD Ryzen 9 7900x. War das beste was ich tun konnte. Schnelle Lieferung. Nichts kaputt oder so.Eingebaut und l√§uft. So soll es sein.', 'Ne bronche pas. Par contre pr√©voir un excellent AIO ou watercooling custom car il chauffe le coco.', "Un monstre, utilisation hybride aujourd'hui, (d√©veloppement etc), mais √©ventuellement j'ajouterais plus tard pour un R9 7900X3D sur un autre PC gaming.Par contre j'attends des nouvelles de mon Starfield Ultimate Edition, mais nada, aucune mention !", 'Mine runs at 90C + under load with water cooling, not overclocked. Had it off and on again, several times. Everything is making contact that should be. I even put 3 120mm fans on the radiator that scream 5200rpm. Is what it is. Games run like butter. 3d printer slicing happens fast. Just the heat thing. Be prepared to not cheap the cooling.', "I originally paired this 7900X with an RTX 4080, and 64gb DDR5 6000Mhz CL36. It was a gaming powerhouse. Sure, there are some other options out there but this 12 core 24 thread 7900X is a beast. Yes it's one of the hotter running CPU's on the market but it's easier to cool than a 13700k. I had a 280mm Arctic AIO cooling my 7900X and the temps are great. Temps are typically in the low 60‚Å∞s which is very good.", 'CPU is insane and I love it.Built my PC with this and bought this CPU to future proof it, this CPU is insane and is a bit overkill atleast it is at the moment. When playing heavy games the cpu does idle at 90 degrees which is normal. When using for normal use it‚Äôll sit at 40 degrees. I myself use a liquid cooler AIO in order to manage the temps.For the price it is 110% worth it, was either this or intel i9 13900k but the price definitely beats it here.If you are building a pc and using this CPU just remember to buy an AM5 compatible motherboard. AM4 AIO coolers still work with this, just make sure to use the mounting bracket.', 'Es muy r√°pido, depender√° del sistema operativo que gestione correctamente su potencial. Por lo dem√°s es un procesador increible.El env√≠o fue desagradable, tard√≥ un largo mes en llegar. El vendedor no era directamente por AMAZON sino otro proveedor y no me dej√≥ un buen sabor de rapidez.']

Product: Intel Core i5-13400F Desktop Processor 10 cores (6 P-cores + 4 E-cores) 20MB Cache, up to 4.6 GHz
Reviews: ['Perfect for me!', 'Êú¨Ë£ΩÂìÅ„ÅØÂûãÁï™F‰ªò„Åç„Å™„ÅÆ„Åß„Ç∞„É©„Éï„Ç£„ÉÉ„ÇØÊ©üËÉΩ„Åå„Å§„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„ÄÇ„Åì„Çå„Å´„Çà„ÇäÁô∫ÁÜ±„Çí„Åã„Å™„ÇäÊäë„Åà„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Ç±„Éº„Çπ„ÅÆÈ¢®ÈÄö„Åó„ÅåËâØ„Åë„Çå„Å∞‰ªòÂ±û„ÅÆ„É™„ÉÜ„Éº„É´„ÇØ„Éº„É©„Éº(„Å†„Åï„ÅÑ)„ÅßÂçÅÂàÜÂÜ∑„Åà„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇËÉΩÂäõ„ÅØÈÖç‰ø°„Çí„Åó„Å™„Åå„Çâ„Éè„Ç§„Ç®„É≥„Éâ„ÅÆ„Ç≤„Éº„É†„Çí„ÇÑ„Çã„Å®„Ç≥„Ç¢Êï∞„ÅÆÈÉΩÂêà„Åß100%Ë°å„Åè„Åì„Å®„ÇÇ„ÅÇ„Çã„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜÊÑü„Åò„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ100%„ÇíÊ∞ó„Å´„Åó„Å™„ÅÑ‰∫∫„Åß‰ªñ„Å´Èáë„ÇíÂõû„Åó„Åü„ÅÑ‰∫∫„Å™„ÇâË≤∑„ÅÑ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇÊ∞ó„Å´„Å™„Çã„Å™„Çâ„ÇÇ„Å£„Å®„Ç≥„Ç¢Êï∞„ÇíÂ¢ó„ÇÑ„Åó„ÅüÊñπ„Åå„Çà„ÅÑ„Åã„Å®ÊÄù„ÅÜ„ÄÇ', 'For the price this is an amazing mid to high range cpu. I‚Äôve had this for a few weeks now and it works great.', 'Great performance on a budget. Great core for a 1080p/2K gaming machine. Easy to install and no issues with operation.', 'Excelente para juegos, buenas temperaturas pero el disipador stock es un poco ruidoso...', 'This really handles gaming well, look up bottle neck calculator online‚Ä¶. Match it with some GPUs you may be quite surprised of what it is capable of. Works great with my rtx3080. Yea I like it. :)', 'Super great price, runs super cold. Worth it', 'Running smoothly,I have used it with 1080ti ,playing high configuration requirements PC games for several months.and it works great.  It‚Äôs not expensive, very worth.', 'perfect for 2K gaming. Never used the integrated graphics on a CPU before and you save some with this F model. No issues so far.', 'El producto mas concretamente el procesador llego bien ojo solo el procesador, pero cuando abri la caja del procesador (para armar mi PC), el ventilador que venia con el estaba roto, pero por suerte no me preocupe, pues tenia una refigeracion liquida que ya habia comprado y no me detuve a pedir garantia, pues solo me interesaba el procesador.']

Product: Intel Core i7-12700K Desktop Processor 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked¬† LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Reviews: ["I upgraded from the i7 6700k to the i3 13100 and saw a great performance increase. I was eager to test ddr5. However,  I also wanted to experiment with 6+ core processors. Fortunately I found this i7 12700k when the price dropped to 275. I wasn't sure if it would be a big increase from the i3 and the i7 6700k. But the i7 12700k is a ferocious beast that has crushed all tasks I've given it and brought immesnse life back to my RTX 2060 super and it stays cools & fluent.Z790 auros elite axI7 12700k overclocked pcores 5.2 ghz ecores 4.0 ghz 50-65¬∞C during multi intensive tasks and games for long periods of timeRTX 2060 super 8bg ddr6Corsair vengeance 6000mhz ddr5Cyberpunk 60-65 fps 1080 ultra+psycho with medium ray tracing with a low of 59Starfield 30- 40 1080p fps high settings the devs need to optimize thoughHorizon zero Dawn 80-85 fps 1080 ultraShreds through video editing and music editing all at onceAmazing at multitaskingPowerfulFastCan be placed in ddr4 mobos and ddr5 mobos", 'I upgraded to this CPU after some HEAVY research, asking Reddit (Both Intel and AMD subreddits), weighing in money VS performance gained. I have used AMD since I was a teen and started building computers. The conclusion is this: It is an amazing CPU, runs faster and cooler than my Ryzen 7 1700. The price AND performance VS AMD (Also including a board) was better than if I had went with a Ryzen 7 5800X.Some background information: I wanted to upgrade after receiving an Amazon gift card (I have never ordered computer parts from Amazon though). I upgraded from a Ryzen 7 1700, with an ASUS x370-f board. I really wanted to upgrade, and was sad also that Windows 11 did not support my CPU! I will give it to Microsoft for this, as it made A LOT of people upgrade their entire computers, all for basically the same OS as of now with newer looks, and not much done under the hood (EXCEPT for 12th gen Intel, so good news there too). Sadly, my old board STILL doesn\'t support the Ryzen 7 5000 series, and only the 3000 series (They are working on a BIOS apparently for the 5000 series, because of people who were in my shoes). I first almost ordered the Ryzen 7 3800XT, for $400! After a couple hours of research, asking, and thinking about it... I cancelled that order (Thankfully) and thought "Well, if I am going to spend this much on upgrading my CPU, I might as well go all in/spend a little more for something better, as this may be my last big upgrade in this regard for awhile." I was then going to get the Ryzen 7 5800X with an Asus board. There lied a problem of price, I could not find a board AND get that CPU still within my budget (At-least not a board that wasn\'t worse than the one I had in ways). I mentioned I had posted on the AMD subreddit, and even they suggested I go Intel (Intel is just killing it as of now, hands down, although I am sure AMD will retaliate). I ended up getting the MSI Z690-A DDR4 (I wish I had the money for DDR5 RAM, I would have went with the DDR5 version as it was basically the same price). I had A LOT of second thoughts on this board though, as it just didn\'t seem "Premium" as the one I had (I am going to do a whole review on it after this. I\'ll save my Pros & Cons for there.) This CPU also auto-clocks itself up or down depending on the load (Saw it clock down to 1GHz, although not for long, for example if not much processing power is warranted, which makes sense and I wish everything did). So if idling, it will clock down and save power/heat/and therefore longevity is increased. I absolutely love this CPU coming from AMD. Anyways...If you have a Corsair H100I RGB Platinum or similar cooler already: The included 1200 screws work just fine with the 1700 socket and this CPU, even though you are supposed to get the 1700 kit/screws for this CPU (Which I did, but they are taking FOREVER to ship, so I googled, and someone said using the 1200 screws will work just fine). I get better temps. than my Ryzen 7 1700. I can even overclock EVEN MORE but have no need, and no point.TL:DRUpgraded from: Ryzen 7 1700, Asus Rog Strix x370-f gaming.Upgraded to: i7-12700K, MSI Z690-A DDR4.Parts kept: 4x8GB 32GB DDR4 CL16 3000MHz RAM (With XMP, D.O.C.P), RTX 2070. The RAM works great with this CPU as well, although it TECHNICALLY (Latency wise, runs at 2T on Intel instead of 1T on AMD) runs slower than when on AMD (AMD\'s infinity fabric) but obviously whatever Intel is doing makes up for that, and therefore my RAM either runs faster/the same)Pros: It is an amazing CPU for price VS performance. The i5-12600K is good as well (I almost just went with it), and you would be fine going with it for gaming (As even it still has more cores technically than the Ryzen 7 5800X, it also beats the 5800X even though THIS CPU is supposed to be its comparison rival brother.) This CPU has cool temps on my Corsair H100I RGB Platinum cooler, and the P&E core structure are REALLY cool and fun to watch when doing tasks/gaming. It shipped fast!Cons: Literally none with the CPU itself. Just with shipping - It shipped really fast! Was here in 2-3 days after purchasing on here. The biggest complaint I have is Amazon\'s shipping (SO BE AWARE OF THIS) I have never ordered computer parts from Amazon, and have always used New-egg. They just left the CPU in my mail-box, and if it weren\'t for me looking at my camera\'s, and looking out for this part, it would have sat in the mail-box all day. My mail-box sadly is not very weather proof as well, and if it had been raining... It wouldn\'t have been good. Although it did come in a big box around it. The CPU also was jarred loose and flopping around in the box (Not held into the front window).I hope this review helps people!', '√â muito r√°pido, mas esquenta bastante, chega a usar 220W em teste de estresse. Antes de comprar, procure saber nos f√≥runs sobre essa quest√£o, n√£o importa qual cooler e pasta t√©rmica use, ele vai esquentar muito. A √∫nica solu√ß√£o √© fazer um ligeiro undervolt, ou diminuir o loadline calibration na BIOS. Me fez lembrar o i7-7700K que sofria do mesmo problema.', 'Rien √† redire et il ne chauffe pas (28C au repos) m√™me sans water cooling', 'Bought this for a new personal PC. My last was an i7 4790K build that got totaled out (crushed) during shipping. After building a new one on a z790i platform, the performance gain was stunning, completely night and day! I cannot say enough about this CPU, and would totally recommend this product!!', 'Good.......', 'Paired it with an ASUS MOBO and a Lian Li 360mm AIO.Runs cool, no performance issues, and no bottlenecks for the gaming i use it for.', 'super', "This item has been with me for a very short time.So I recently decided to upgrade my gaming rig, and after extensive research, I made the bold choice to order the Intel Core i7-12700K Gaming Desktop Processor with Integrated Graphics and 12 Cores. Let me tell you, this processor is the absolute best! With its 12 cores, it brings a whole new level of performance to my gaming experience. Whether I'm playing graphically demanding AAA titles or indulging in intense multitasking, this processor effortlessly handles it all. And what's even better is that it comes with integrated graphics, meaning I didn't have to shell out extra cash for a separate graphics card, yet. The integrated Graphics offer the flexibility of running dual displays smoothly without any hiccups. Plus, with Intel's reputation for reliable and high-quality products, I know I can trust the i7-12700K to last me for years to come.I hope you find this review helpful.", 'Tutto Ok']

Product: Intel Core i5-12600KF Desktop Processor 10 (6P+4E) Cores up to 4.9 GHz Unlocked¬† LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Reviews: ['Have one in my build for over a week and it works great, does not overheat with most FPS games i play and is powerful enough.', 'Took a little longer (14 days) to ship out but delivery was fast. Great Upgrade from Intel 9600K PC User.', "When my motherboard died, I decided to build myself a new PC and update my son's Ryzen 2600 build with something with more zip. I bought this processor (on a smoking coupon deal), a Z690 board for it, and a Z590 for the i7 11700KF from my old build to form the base of the two builds.I kind of agonized over which I would choose for myself - the 11th Gen i7 paired with the Z590 or this 12th Gen i5 with the Z690. I chose the latter, mostly because those parts came first and I was the one with the dead PC.Turns out that it didn't much matter. The i5 12600KF is every bit the equal of the i7 11700KF. Considering that I paid under $160 for this processor, I couldn't be happier with my purchase.", 'Excelente procesador a buen precio', 'Tutto perfetto', 'I was using an i7-5820k and the 12600kf blows it out of the water and it‚Äôs less than I paid for the 5820k back in the day. 10/10 recommend', 'Super Leistung', 'received within ten days after ordering, which is normal for my country (in asia). Product was packed nicely as usual and is performing well as intended. Really satisfied especially with the coupon Amazon offered, thank you.', "Amazing CPU handles everything I throw at it with ease and I'm able to run everything smoothly.I would like to add that for some weird reason windows wasn't using all cores and I suspected that I received the wrong one. In order to utilize all cores and use them to their max potential you need to make sure they are first of all enabled in the bios and only after that in windows you need to go to msconfig.msc > boot > advanced options > and uncheck the box with number of processors. This is very important otherwise windows will pretend that you don't have a 10 core CPU and give you false info under system info. and make sure to reboot for this to take effect. and when you do that windows will show that you have 10 cores CPU but still doesn't mean they are all in use. Download a software called QuickCPU and then change the power plan to high performance and at the bottom set everything to 100% and click apply. Once that is done congrats windows will use all the cores to their limit.", "Buy with confidence. Amazing product. Just note however, on your choice of motherboards, get a Z if you plan on doing some overclocking, and an H if you don't. Do not bother with the other two cheap bords."]

Product: Intel Core i9-13900KF (Latest Gen) Gaming Desktop Processor 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores) - Unlocked
Reviews: ["i upgraded from 5900xt. I got the msi board z690 -a for 159, and this the 13900kf. I ‚Äòve been wanting a cpu with an IGPU for years, but couldn‚Äôt justify the price increase on the gpu version. I actually use a dgpu but it really is convenient, and they can be used to accelerate some work. Again, before you judge i'm using this for work, productivity. NOT gaming. I would spend 200 for a gaming cpu.my use case is productivity. i‚Äôm a developer, and this is the sole reason i upgraded. I was fighting windows freezing and slowing down during a lot of my workflows. I use wsl intellj, docker, react apps java etc, often at the same time. It‚Äôs pretty noticeable the improvement. It really helped.  Like that i could use ddr4 for now since the boards are about 150 it was acceptable.Heat: The cpu gets a bad reputation due to heat and wattage. I put this in the bucket frankly that amd got as well. I mean it‚Äôs fine they are using as much power as needed to maximize perf. I limited the cpu to 250w, and it runs on a d15 cooler than my 5900, Full load can get up to high 80c, but working is 30‚Äôs. you lose very little perf by running it more in the zone. I don't know about other boards but that msi one sure makes it easy and the price if right.About the cpu: it has a ton of cores, I didn't need to buy ddr5--  i need quite a lot of ram and it still costs too much for the benefit it provides in my workload. The memory controller on 13gen is far better than ryzen 5000 series. I couldn't before get my ddr4 stable at 4000 on the 5900x and it did it on the intel one immediately. Indeed i was even able to tighten up the timings just a touch. So modern processors (and i'd assume the amd ones as well) have made welcome improvements to memory support. Id' say if you don't need as much ram say 32gb, and you don't have ddr4 already to tide you over i'd consider getting ddr5 though.  I mean nothing is cheaper than what you have and 4k speed is fine. If i had nothing or maybe some old ram i'd go w/ ddr5.Price: For 570 it‚Äôs decent deal here. It is more than i love spending, but for what you get it is a lot better than what amd is offering at the time i write this which was 700.I do wish intel supported board reuse down the line, but that even can. be overblown (to an extent, and only an extent) though it's a selling feature to me frankly reuse!! I had to really think about that. I don't understand why intel is so stubborn on this subject.  with my amd cpu i went from 2700x to 5900x and the board went from a 470 to 570 because i waned more io and better pcie but i also gave that board to my kid and upgraded it one time. With intel especially I mean i just buy cheap boards anyway and upgrade more because there are a ton of features that get added half the time. I usually try to spend about 150 on a board, though it. is getting harder but it would be more my preference. I 'm not really onboard with the 600 motherboards. Is there a  300 one in-between i guess so but that's equally unappealing to me esp w/ out the upgrade.Tips/A rant if you will: trust me on this that msi board for 159 is so amazing. It really works great. don‚Äôt worry about the vrm. that‚Äôs also very overblown too. you can go calculate the amperage this will not come close. ALso msi is a great brand and the bios is easy to navigate. If you want fancy audio buy a dac that you can reuse and plug into usb and keep reusing it. Just think about what you really need in there. The msi board has a nice selection of pcie slots and well placed nvme. I use multiple gpu one nvidia gpu quatro for encoding (its a small one) and and amd one 6900 i bought for 570 for gaming. I just really love the layout connectivity and features of the board. They cut all the stuff i don't need and pared with the cpu it's all together about 700 for a cpu and board, pretty much as good as you can get.", "Concerning Intel Core i9-13900KF,I have this CPU with board ASUS ROG Strix Z790-E Gaming WiFi 6E LGA 1700 for gaming usage.  Once I discovered that I had to slow the memory down from the 6600MHz XMP rating to 6200MHz, the board/cpu combo has worked very reliably  (multiple passes of OCCT Gold stress test).  Just checking the XMP II box,  the 6200MHz box and the (so called) AI overclocking box in the bios gives a score of 40K on Cinebench R23 so it's plenty fast -- the loss of 400MHz memory bandwidth isn't a big deal.  I tried various other adjustments but the latter turned out to be sufficiently fast and very reliable.  My current chip has a Silicon Predictor(SP) of 99 (roll of the dice).  I suspect that higher SP levels while possible are rare.I am using a ARCTIC Liquid Freezer II 360  AIO which works OK but the CPU can run hot.  The mother board cooling prediction for said AIO is 155 but that is not really enough for this chip to run all out.  It is easy to get this CPU up to 100C using OCT Power Stress test.  While the CPU might run at 100C for a long time, it will not do it any good and it will not run reliably -- I needed to check the 90C max box in the bios to get it to pass the OCCT power stress test.  I have a RTX 4090 and in the OCCT power test the net system power gets up to 1100W.  Normal gaming so far never gets to such power levels but still worth considering.FWIW, I have had a CPU apparently fail from running the OCCT Power Stress test.  If you want to run this CPU all out with reasonable temps, you really need significant cooling.  I doubt any AIO will work for this.  I suggest an open loop system with something like a Watercool MO-RA3 420 PRO radiator.All said, If you are building a gaming system, you would be just as well served with a ASUS ROG Strix Z690-E and a i9-12900KF CPU.  It will be easier to cool and will save you some money for a better graphics card which will make *much* more difference in most games than the CPU.", 'Es un procesador muy poderoso y se calienta por lo tanto vas a necesitar una buena refrigeraci√≥n liquida as√≠ que no ahorres en la refrigeraci√≥n de este procesador.', "The Intel Core i9-13900KF is an absolute beast! From the moment I upgraded to this 13th generation CPU, everything has been running very smoothly. My DaVinci Resolve playback on 4K is now smooth with zero choppiness or freezing, a remarkable improvement compared to my old setup. I'm blown away by its speed and performance, making it a game-changer for my work and entertainment. Highly recommend this powerhouse CPU for anyone seeking top-notch performance! üíªüî•", "I have found the KF models overclock a bit better. This is a beast of a CPU and puts AMD fan boys to shame. This one is able to do 6.0 GHZ all core at 1.40 volts with DDR5 running at 8000 mt's CL32.  Currently the best CPU you can buy at time of writing this.  Pair it with a 4090 and you have the fastest 4K gaming PC out.", 'Best investment I ever made when it comes to a gaming/streaming pc. I‚Äôm a pretty hardcore gamer and this cpu is the most amazing thing I‚Äôve ever had when it comes to a high end build. I paired it with a rtx 4080 and needless to say this cpu doesn‚Äôt disappoint. Now, this review isn‚Äôt about pricing because we all know this cpu is expensive and honestly if you‚Äôre only gaming then maybe a 13600k would suffice. However, if you are streaming, photo editing, video editing etc‚Ä¶. Then this is the right cpu for you. I‚Äôm able to snap together YouTube videos in seconds NOT minutes or anywhere near it. I‚Äôm able to stream and game at the same time with less than a 10 fps loss while gaming and streaming on the highest quality settings. My wife loves it for photo editing bc everything is just perfect. Only downside is that it does run hot but you can get a good 240-360mm aio that will tame this cpu with ease. All the issues I use to have on the 10th gen platform are completely irradiated now that I own this cpu. I did go with the ddr5 and honestly for me it runs better than ddr4. Tech reviewers say otherwise but from personal experience ddr5 is the future NOW. Performance issues I use to have with ddr4 and weaker cpus are just gone now. I can do so much and this cpu doesn‚Äôt break a sweat. For instance, ddr4 for whatever reason sometimes wouldn‚Äôt work with xmp although it was advertised. I like to tinker so it wasn‚Äôt an issue BUT sometimes it‚Äôs just nice to do a single click and let it dial itself in and that‚Äôs what ddr5 has done for me. I‚Äôve used several different sticks with this cpu and from all of them I went with Corsair vengeance. Honestly, this is the most bada$$ cpu I‚Äôve ever owned or seen in a personal system of mine. If you have the money I couldn‚Äôt recommend it enough. Everybody has different needs and in my case I needed this cpu. It hasn‚Äôt disappointed. As for amd, if you want the bugs and issues go ahead and grab one of those cpus and tell me how that goes. This cpu can do everything and more. Hope this review helps anybody who is on the edge about getting this or something else.', "Remember F and K means no cpu based graphics. So as long as you are installing a gpu, you're fine. Even if your motherboard has video outputs, you cant use them.This only becomes a problem if you have to troubleshoot and it COULD be the gpu.", 'Even 14900 is close at hand, 13900 is still powerful to  handle any task. The temperature is higher than it‚Äôs competitor 7950x3d but still can be controlled by any 360mm water cooler', 'Seems to run pretty cool using the Corsair H115i water cooler and overclocked to 5800 on the EVGA Z790 Dark Kingpin with G.Skill Trident 8000 memory. Only had it installed and overclocked for about a week now but I have not seen it reach 50c yet. I play a lot of COD MW2.', 'Insane processor, I put this thing on an H770 plus motherboard. Blazing fast cpu, 24c,32t this thing eats everything i throw. Fortnite 1.2k fps at 1080p, minecraft 1.3kfps at 1080p just all around winner; future proof i expect to get a good 8-10 years or so out of this cpu']

Product: AMD Ryzen‚Ñ¢ 5 4500 6-Core, 12-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor with Wraith Stealth Cooler
Reviews: ['You get what you pay for on a budget CPU but better than a 4 core CPU for it price.USD$83 for a 6 core/ 12 threads CPU base Clock at 3.6GHz!It lost it performance if you compare others 6 core CPU due to it limited "L3 Cache 8MB"!It\'s not a bad CPU for it current price get this CPU instead of saving a few bucks on a 4 core CPU why not a 6 core CPU with decent 65w TPD :)If you wanted to buy a budget 4 core CPU I recommend this CPU for it value!If you want a CPU with 6 core and wanted good performance and not on budget get something else!Thank you!', "Ce processeur, assez d√©nigr√© par la plupart des testeurs, est  excellent de performance et de stabilit√© en rapport √† son prix actuel.La plupart des benchmark utilis√©, en terme de performance, √©quivaut au ryzen 7  1700, et d√©passant dans certains cas le ryzen 7 2700Ces performances sont globalement proches de l'excellent ryzen 5 3600En lui faisant passer le test de stabilit√©, il ne bronche pas.J'ai √©t√© surprise par sa puissance, sa nervosit√© pr√™t √† r√©pondre  rapidement √† la plupart des t√¢ches sur lightroom, photoshop, premi√®re proConcernant les jeux (r√©sident evil village, tomb raider 2020, last of us, ne l'ayant utilis√© qu'en full hd, l√† encore, il ne bronche pas et d√©passe rarement une temp√©rature de 58¬∞cTout ceci, avec les param√®tres par d√©faut du bios, c'est √† dire avec le turbo boost activ√©.Turbo boost qui me pose actuellement un probl√®me :Le processeur joue au yoyo passant de basse fr√©quence √† 4200 htz sans cesse.  Ce qui implique le mouvement constant des ventilateurs, ce qui peut √™tre aga√ßant.Lorsque le processeur est tr√®s sollicit√© (√† 4200 htz par d√©faut chez moi) , les temp√©ratures grimpent et n√©cessite une bonne ventilation du bo√Ætier. A prendre en compte si on veut utiliser tout le potentielde ce processeur.Le fonctionnement du processeur d√©pend aussi de tous ses composants et organisation du bo√Ætier.En attendant de compl√©ter mon √©quipement, et pour ne pas faire chauffer le processeur, il y a une solution : d√©sactiver le turbo boost dans le bios.Cela le ram√®ne √† une temp√©rature de 48¬∞C max. quelques soient les activit√©s (traitement d'images ou jeux) , cela le rend moins nerveux mais reste efficace.Bref, pour ce prix, c'est un excellent processeur. Attention toutefois √† v√©rifier la compatibilit√©", 'Als passionierter Gamer und kreativer Content-Ersteller ist der AMD Ryzen 5 4500 Prozessor einfach ein wahrer Allesk√∂nner!Die Leistung des Ryzen 5 4500 ist schlichtweg atemberaubend. Mit seinen 6 Kernen und 12 Threads sorgt er f√ºr eine unglaublich fl√ºssige und reaktionsschnelle Performance, egal ob ich anspruchsvolle Spiele oder komplexe Multimedia-Aufgaben erledige. Die Geschwindigkeit, mit der der Prozessor arbeitet, hat meine Erwartungen weit √ºbertroffen und l√§sst keine W√ºnsche offen.Die Energieeffizienz des Ryzen 5 4500 ist ebenfalls bemerkenswert. Trotz seiner starken Leistung verbraucht er vergleichsweise wenig Strom, was sich positiv auf meinen Energieverbrauch und meine Stromrechnung auswirkt. Das ist nicht nur umweltfreundlich, sondern auch ein wichtiger Faktor f√ºr mich als t√§glicher Nutzer meines PCs.Die Einrichtung des Prozessors war ein Kinderspiel, und die Kompatibilit√§t mit meinem bestehenden System war perfekt. Ich musste keine Komponenten aufr√ºsten oder andere √Ñnderungen vornehmen - es war ein problemloser Plug-and-Play-Prozess, der meinen Zeitaufwand minimierte.Zusammenfassend kann ich nur sagen, dass der AMD Ryzen 5 4500 Prozessor meine Erwartungen in jeder Hinsicht √ºbertroffen hat. Seine Performance, Energieeffizienz, Kompatibilit√§t und Preisgestaltung machen ihn zu einem absoluten Spitzenreiter in der Welt der Prozessoren. Egal, ob Sie ein Gamer, Content-Ersteller oder einfach nur ein PC-Enthusiast sind - der Ryzen 5 4500 wird Sie nicht entt√§uschen!', 'Dopo un primo sconforto perch√© la mia scheda non lo vedeva, una volta aggiornato il BIOS tutto okQuindi super contento, avrei gradito qualche grammo di pasta termica in dotazione, ma mica posso chiedere la lunaüòÇ', "Rapport Performance/Prix juste imbattable pour ce Ryzen 5 4500 !Le ventirad fournis suffit √† refroidir le processeur m√™me pour une utilisation gaming.Id√©al sur une config pro ou gaming petit budget avec une GTX1660 ou m√™me une RTX 3060 !Notez qu'il faut absolument une carte graphique pour afficher une image car le processeur ne poss√®de pas de chipset graphique int√©gr√©.", 'Processore dal basso costo ma dalle ottime prestazioni, non sar√† un top di gamma dei processori, ma fa tutto adeguatamente dal navigare su internet a anche giocare a giochi tripla A recenti, se cercate qualcosa per montaggio video forse vi serve qualcosa come pi√π core e frequenza pi√π elevata.', 'Ce produit est trop bien pour son prix je vous conseille !', 'comprato per fare un upgrade al mio fisso, ovviamente spedizione puntuale e pacco in ottimo stato.', 'Estoy seguro que cuando lo agregu√© a la cesta de compra no pon√≠a por ning√∫n lado que se trataba de un producto usado, me lleg√≥ sin la caja (que me hac√≠a mucha ilusi√≥n tenerla). Solo lleg√≥ el disipador de calor en su caja negra y, pegado con celo a esa caja, el procesador (dentro de su blister pero sin sellar). De momento funciona muy bien (tanto el ventilador como el procesador), es lo que esperaba, pero deber√≠an ser m√°s especificos y destacar bien cuando de trata de productos usados.', 'Love the CPU, threw out the stock fan cooler. Went and got an Arctic Freezer 7x, way better. The CPU does great for Converting Video and audio and light gaming. The stock cooler becomes a turbo jet loud when it sucks 100% on all 6 cores when Converting and shot the temps to 175 Degrees F. Went right back down after converting was done. Paired this with a B450 board and 32gb of 3600 ddr4 ram.']

Product: AMD Ryzen 9 3900X Unlocked Desktop Processor
Reviews: ["Switched from intel to AMD and i think its a wise choice for me as my budget is tight.Tho AMD still losing abit or on par with intel processor and its a big thing for pricing wise!The only thing i'm worried is the prism cooler seems like leaking lubrication oil but im changing to full watercooling so should not bother me much.", 'Great product from AMD. The processor works right out of the box and offers great all round performance without breaking the bank. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a high performance computer. The only con I can think of is while the bundled cooler is great, it may struggle to cool this 12 core chip, depending on the ambience temp in your location.', "Amazing processor for the price that you can get it at now. If you're not a hardcore gamer that needs that extra 1 fps boost from an Intel cpu, this is way more worth it.", 'Very satisfy with the Ryzen 3900x performance, it is going into my Asus tuf x570 wifi MB', "Best processor I've ever owned my whole life.", 'works perfectly', 'It took a long while before the order was dispatched. To my horror it came without the CPU, just the Cooler fan in the box. The box was not sealed at all. How could this happen?', 'The seal is broken and the processor is missing. Only the cooler is in the box, I asked for a refund. I am very disappointed with Amazon, never buy from Amazon again!', 'Indicar que cuando recib√≠ el paquete venia aplastado y roto (Se ve√≠a el contenido del paquete), en el interior de la caja venia sin papel burbuja, s√≥lo con un trozo de papel acartonado, es un procesador, no es un bal√≥n de futbol, es delicado, y por suerte la caja del propio procesador protegi√≥ bien el contenido. De mano antes de pedir la mercanc√≠a me puse en contacto con el vendedor para indicarle que no quer√≠a un producto usado, reacondicionado o manipulado, de hecho, antes de abrir la caja hice un video realiz√°ndolo para curarme en salud, por suerte vino todo bien precintado y en perfecto estado. (Le√≠ las rese√±as de los usuarios y proced√≠ as√≠)Por una parte, tenemos el procesador Ryzen 3900X con 12 n√∫cleos y 24 Hilos con frecuencia base de 3,8GHz y hasta 4,6GHz con socket AM4 y un TPD de 105w (Ojo que el consumo es bastante inferior, solo llega a ese extremo en renderizado y puntualmente)Lo tengo instalado en una placa base MSI PRESTIGE X570 CREATION con 32GB de RAM DDR4 a 3600MHz (G. Skill Trident Z adecuada para estos Ryzen) con refrigeraci√≥n l√≠quida NZXT Kraken X42 y su temperatura es de 34-38¬∞C en procesos normales, jugando no pasa de los 50¬∞C y renderizando no pasa de los 65¬∞C (Temperatura ambiente 21¬∞C)En relaci√≥n con el disipador de serie (Probado pero reemplazado por refrigeraci√≥n l√≠quida que es m√°s eficiente), es muy chulo, las luces RGB muy llamativas, buenas velocidades de ventilador para no meter mucho ruido (No es muy ruidoso a bajas temperaturas a altas es algo molesto)En la parte inferior del disipador de serie en vez de ser plano totalmente tiene 3 ranuras, en principio es para una mejor refrigeraci√≥n pero que con la pasta t√©rmica no hacen el contacto adecuado que deber√≠a y es f√°cil echar m√°s pasta t√©rmica de la adecuada y terminar con la pasta en sitios que no deber√≠aExisten termal-pad que te evita estos posibles problemas, pero por alg√∫n motivo en mi caso con la refrigeraci√≥n l√≠quida la temperatura es m√°s alta que con la pasta t√©rmica y eso de que es reutilizable en mi caso no ha sido as√≠, ya que queda inservible (Hablo de 0,5 mm)*Un factor determinante a la hora de comprar este procesador y no un i9 9900k o i9 10900k han sido las vulnerabilidades que siguen afectando a Intel y que, aunque alguna este parcheada por software o por hardware no me convenc√≠a su compraRecomiendo este procesador porque es una pasada lo optimizado que va sobre todo para edici√≥n de video y para los m√°s gamers para jugar, adem√°s su precio es muy bueno ahoraEso si es muy importante tener un hardware equiparable a nuestro procesador, (Una buena fuente de alimentaci√≥n es primordial)* El consumo energ√©tico es bajo (Mi PC con todo suele consumir sobre 130-250W), dependiendo la carga de trabajo.** Mucho cuidado al poner pasta t√©rmica, si pones de m√°s l√≠mpialo en el z√≥calo, no vaya a ser que lo retires y parte de esa pasta pase a los pines.*** Ahora Ryzen saca la serie 5000, el equiparable al 3900X ser√≠a el 5900X, que si leemos las caracter√≠sticas y mejoras no lo veo una gran mejora, he tenido la opci√≥n de comprarlo, ya que socket y mi placa lo admite, pero por 200MHz no compensa. Adem√°s, pasa lo mismo con el 3900XT son 100MHz m√°s. El 3900X me parece la mejor opci√≥n de compra adem√°s las BIOS ya est√° pulidas.**** Se supone que este procesador su frecuencia base es de 3,8GHz y llega hasta 4,6GHz, yo usando el modo autom√°tico de MSI trabaja todos los n√∫cleos a 4,2GHz, todo esto a una temperatura de 36¬∞C (Sin carga de trabajo), ahora en renderizaci√≥n de video llega a 4,3GHz pero nunca ha superado esos 4,3GHz (A ver si con las nuevas BIOS mejora esto)', "It is fast, runs cool, and has 12 cores and 24 threads. What's not to like?"]

Product: AMD Ryzen‚Ñ¢ 7 7700X 8-Core, 16-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor
Reviews: ["I decided to upgrade from AM4 and my 5800X to this beast of a cpu, the 7700X. On the one hand, I now have a brand, spanking new AM5 platform and cpu. On the other hand, it was a very expensive upgrade due to the stupidly high early adopter tax. I also had to buy two new modules of M.2 (pcie) SSD's because AM5 does not support sata based M.2. A very expensive investment indeed.Back to the 7700X. I am very happy. It is definitely faster than my 5800X and notably more snappy in various programs such as video editing and gaming. I can believe AMD's claims that it is 13% faster than the 5800X.I do not understand why some people (I will come back to this) are complaining about it being too hot, etc. Yes, it does run hot (but so does 12 and 13 gen intel), but the 7700X is nowhere as hot as intel.When I had PBO and auto-OC activated for my 5800X, the Noctua industrial fans on my air cooler were running at full pelt and sounded like a jet engine. The 5800X also ran hot, at up to 70c. In the end, I deactivated PBO and auto-OC to get far better thermals and acoustics (but at a cost of somewhat decreased performance).The 7700X did run hot under load with PBO and auto-OC turned on, as I saw temperatures go up to 57c on tasks. With gaming, it would go up to 65c (depending on the game). At idle, my 7700X would sit at circa 45c.After a bit of tinkering in BIOS and disabling PBO and auto-OC, my 7700X is currently sitting at a very comfortable and constant 35c. This is with a single tower air cooler and two fans (same cooling solution as with my 5800X).Also, during activated PBO and auto-OC, my fans were only intermittently running like jet engines and then would calm down (7700X). With these two features deactivated, my Arctic Freezer Esport34 duo air cooler is now running almost silently.To summarise, my 7700X is definitely running cooler and faster than my previous 5800X under different BIOS scenarios and work loads.Note - For the very first time, AMD has included a built in (integrated) graphics chip for 7 series Ryzen (including my 7700X). I have not yet tested the iGPU, but I will in due course, when the time is right. I will then update my review.Moving on, particularly to one individual who posted a review on 07/10/22 and was whining about the cost of the 7700X and heat output. Yes the release MSRP for the 7700X is over-priced at between ¬£430 and ¬£440 in UK, whilst it is selling for $400 in USA (when the 5800X was released, the UK msrp was ¬£400).IMHO, the 7700X should not be more than ¬£380. Sadly, the current high price is mostly due to the atrocious state of the british economy, with some good old fashioned price gouging thrown in for good measure.I also remember when Zen1 was released in March 2017, the 1800X (which I purchased) was retailing for ¬£500, the 1700X at ¬£400 and 1700 non-X at ¬£340.This individual was also whining about the supposedly bad physical design for Ryzen 7K series cpu as the metal lid is sitting c.4mm higher on the actual chip. He claimed the thermal paste kept dripping down the sides of the metal plate and it was so bad that Noctua were forced to release an AM5 cpu guard (NATPG1).From my own experience, I have had no such issues whatsoever. So this dribbling TP problem comes down to user error and especially competency (more specifically, lack thereof). Mind you, I have been building pc's since March 2007, so I have a lot of experience.Hurdygurdy then concluded that Ryzen-7 and X670 is very difficult to justify at such absurdly hiked up msrp. He even stated that entry level X670 was grossly over priced at ¬£500 and concluded he would be migrating back to intel, bearing in mind the imminent release of Raptor Lake.Please ignore his review as he is clearly an intel fanboy. First of all, who shells out >¬£1K for an AM5 platform and then decides he does not like it, due to high msrp and heat issues?. If you did not like the price of AM5 and 7700X, then why did you supposedly buy it in the first place?.Secondly, entry level AM5 mobos do not cost ¬£500. In fact, my top dog Gigabyte Aorus Master X670E cost ¬£500. The entry level X670-P mobo msrp starts at ¬£268. The entry level X670E mobo msrp start at ¬£300.Let me put things in perspective by now comparing the 7700X (8c/16t) to intel Raptor Lake. The 13700K Raptor Lake (8 Performance cores/16t with 8 economy cores/8t) costs ¬£500 and the last generation 12700K Alder Lake (8c/16t) costs ¬£416. This is in stark contrast to the new architecture 7700X which cost ¬£430. So if you want the 13700K, that is an extra ¬£70 you have to shell out. But is it worth the extra expenditure?. I will come to that later on.As mentioned, my AM5 mobo cost ¬£500 and if I look at exactly the same brand/model mobo but for intel platform (Gigabyte Aorus Master, Z790, LGA 1700), then it is costing ¬£620. For around the ¬£500 price point, I am seeing the mid range Z790-F for ¬£480. So the same tier intel mobo is ¬£120 more expensive. Again, is it worth the extra expenditure?.IMHO, it most definitely is not as the Gigabyte AM5 and Z790 variants have very similar features.The only price advantage that the Z790 has over AM5 is that it is compatible with DDR4 and DDR5, whereas AM5 is compatible only with DDR5. TBH, I purchased from Amazon, a Crucial 16GB DDR5 module for ¬£64. So not bad at all.In terms of benchmark comparisons, according to WCCFTECH, RGT, etc the 7700X is virtually on par with the last gen 5900X (12c/24t). That is a very good performance upgrade.According to Hardware Times, the 7700X narrowly beats the i7-13700K in gaming, but the 7700X is slightly slower in (synthetic) content creation.According to benchmarks by Hardware unboxed, the 13700K is only 3% to 7% faster than the 7700X in gaming (dependent on different games) and about 4% to 10% faster in productivity (depending on different productivity tasks).Ultimately, it comes down to buyer preference. I see no benefit is shelling out c. ¬£200 more for an intel platform.On hindsight, I should have upgraded my 5800X to a 5900X (¬£330 new in June 2022). This would have been the cheapest and most convenient upgrade option. I could then sit tight and wait for the MSRP of AM5 and Ryzen-7 to drop down to a more palatable level (Q1-23), bearing in mind Zen4 global sales have been very poor due to the high prices of Zen4, AM5 mobos and having to migrate to expensive DDR5 RAM. As a result, AMD has made the decision to cut back Zen4 production in order to keep msrp artificially high (instead of maintaining Zen4 production and reducing msrp to sensible levels, which would encourage consumer purchasing). AMD is now adopting the same policies as intel and nvidia.", 'Sin duda es un procesador muy potente, pero que con un Noctua NH-D15 ( que es lo mejorcito del mercado en refrigeraci√≥n por aire ) se ponga a mas de 90 grados a la m√≠nima que le metes un poco de ca√±a, me parece una burrada, por mucho que AMD diga que estos procesadores de la serie 7000 est√°n preparados para eso...Por muy preparados que est√©n, esas temperaturas van a afectar, si o si, a su vida √∫til y a la de los dem√°s componentes que est√°n dentro de tu equipo...Y los que sep√°is un poco del tema me dir√©is que puedo poner el procesador en modo "Eco" utilizando el software AMD Ryzen Master ( o modificarlo a trav√©s de la BIOS ) y as√≠ ser√° mas dif√≠cil que llegue a esas temperaturas.... Pues s√≠, as√≠ es, aunque a cambio su rendimiento se ver√° ligeramente afectado... Y, al menos a mi, no me parece muy normal comprar un procesador y limitar su rendimiento, por poco que sea, para que funcione a unas temperaturas m√≠nimamente aceptables... ( tampoco mucho mas aceptables ).Otra cosa que no me termina de convencer es la forma de funcionar de estos Ryzen y que ya era similar en los anteriores. Concretamente los continuos "spikes" o "picos" de frecuencia a la que funcionan los n√∫cleos del procesador y por consiguiente tambi√©n picos de temperatura y acelerones de los ventiladores del refrigerador, que por muy silenciosos que sean, llega a apreciarse y es bastante molesto en un entorno silencioso.Por √∫ltimo, el consumo del que tanto se habla √∫ltimamente... Pues bien, si hipot√©ticamente tuvieses tu procesador trabajando al 100%, tu Ryzen consumir√≠a menos que un Intel de caracter√≠sticas similares...PERO, cu√°nto tiempo tienes el procesador trabajando al 100% y cu√°nto tiempo en lo que se llama "idle" o m√≠nimamente activo? Pues para el uso t√≠pico de un usuario medio, el procesador va a estar en "idle" much√≠simo mas tiempo que trabajando a tope, y en ese estado, el Intel va a consumir mucho menos... No lo digo yo ( que tambi√©n, porque lo he comprobado ) sino todos los test que se han hecho al respecto y que decid√≠ investigar al ver el alto consumo de este 7700X en reposo o "idle".No me enrollo mas. Aun estoy en duda si quedarme con √©l o devolverlo y cambiarlo por un Intel como por ejemplo el i5-13500, que siendo mas barato, gracias a su mayor cantidad de n√∫cleos, en productividad est√° mas o menos a la altura de este Ryzen 7700X.', "Meant to buy a 7600x for a friend but didn't realize i had gotten this one, but it works perfect and can handle what you throw at it. Only issue i've ran into (when i say i, i mean the friend i gave it to who has then told me the issues he ran into) was that when you're on linux and don't currently have a gpu installed, the APU sort of just doesn't desire to operate as it should and you wind up with a solid white desktop environment with nothing else. But if you only use a TTY then you're good to go! But for most i would recommend getting a gpu alongside it if you're on linux until amd decides to offer better support for the APU inside of it. From my experience tho, the APU works just fine on windows, and perfect on linux if not using the APU.", "I recently upgraded my PC with the AMD Ryzen 7 7700X processor and paired it with an RTX 4060 GPU and an Asus B650 motherboard. The performance has been outstanding.The AMD Ryzen 7 7700X, with its 8 cores and 16 threads, has significantly boosted my PC's processing power. It handles multitasking, gaming, and content creation with ease. Plus, being unlocked, it's a dream for overclocking enthusiasts.Whether I'm gaming at high settings or working on resource-intensive tasks, this processor delivers exceptional performance and efficiency. It's a fantastic choice for anyone looking to elevate their computing experience.", "While part of me almost bought the 7800X3D since at the time I bought this the X3D was only 85 bucks Extra. I'm Happy with what I got this does everything I need it to do and Its been an Excellent chip.Don't Forget to buy a CPU cooler with this as the 7700X Doesn't come with a Boxed Cooler. Paired mine with a Noctua NH-U12A Chromax Black + Noctua 7mm Offset Brackets & Noctua AM5 Thermal Paste Guard (fills in the gaps with a plastic cover to prevent thermal paste from seeping between the IHS gaps on AM5 Processors.)", 'El mejor procesador que he tenido hasta la fecha, como un cohete, la verdad que en cuanto a calidad/precio podr√≠amos estar ante el mejor del mercado, recomiendo encarecidamente que si est√°s mirando si comprar un modelo inferior o este apostar por este pues ser√° una mejor inversi√≥n a largo plazo.', "Preso questo 7700X per mandare in pensione il 3800X e il salto di prestazioni √® qualcosa di incredibile. Per tutti quelli che, come me inizialmente, sono un po' spaventati dalle temperature notoriamente elevate di questa serie 7000; non temete, i processori di questa specifica generazione sono progettati apposta per operare a temperature discretamente pi√π alte di quello che ci si aspetterebbe, √® tutto nella norma e confermato da AMD. Una volta viste le prestazioni che sono in grado di tirare fuori ho capito il perch√© delle temperature, davvero impressionante! Questa serie √® micidiale! Un consiglio che posso darvi tuttavia qualora voleste ottimizzare il rapporto prestazioni/temperature (+ RPM di sistema) √® quello di o effettuare un leggerissimo undervolt o semplicemente abbassare la temperatura massima da 95 gradi a 85 gradi dal bios. Non si perde praticamente nulla in performance ma si ottimizzano di MOLTO sia le temperature che (di conseguenza) il profilo sonoro del sistema nel caso abbiate una fan curve un po' aggressiva, come la mia.", 'Hey! Ich habe mir die beiden Prozessoren, den 7700X und den 7700, genauer angesehen, und ich m√∂chte dir mitteilen, dass ich mich letztendlich f√ºr den 7700 entschieden habe. Warum? Nun, es gibt einen deutlichen Unterschied beim K√ºhlen dieser beiden CPUs.Der 7700X hat eine TDP von 105, was bedeutet, dass er mehr W√§rme erzeugt und schwieriger zu k√ºhlen ist, insbesondere in kleineren Geh√§usen wie ITX oder M-ATX. Bei solchen Geh√§usen ist die W√§rmeableitung oft eine Herausforderung, und ein Prozessor mit h√∂herer TDP kann zu h√∂heren Temperaturen f√ºhren, die die Leistung beeintr√§chtigen oder sogar zu thermischen Problemen f√ºhren k√∂nnen.Aus diesem Grund habe ich mich f√ºr den 7700 entschieden, der eine niedrigere TDP von nur 65 hat. Mit dieser geringeren TDP produziert er weniger W√§rme und ist einfacher zu k√ºhlen. Dies ist besonders wichtig, wenn du ein kompaktes Geh√§use verwendest, da die begrenzte Gr√∂√üe den Luftstrom und die K√ºhlung beeintr√§chtigen kann.Dank der niedrigeren TDP des 7700 kannst du eine bessere Kontrolle √ºber die Temperaturen in deinem System haben und somit eine stabilere Leistung gew√§hrleisten. Du kannst einen K√ºhler w√§hlen, der besser zu deinen Bed√ºrfnissen passt und die optimale K√ºhlung f√ºr deine CPU bietet.Insgesamt bin ich mit meiner Wahl des AMD 7700 zufrieden, da ich dadurch in meinem ITX- oder M-ATX-System eine bessere K√ºhlung erreichen kann. Die niedrigere TDP macht einen deutlichen Unterschied und sorgt daf√ºr, dass mein Prozessor auch unter Last k√ºhl bleibt.Ich hoffe, diese Bewertung hilft dir bei deiner Entscheidung, und wenn du weitere Fragen hast, stehe ich gerne zur Verf√ºgung!', 'Utilizando em uma Asus Tuf Gaming B650M Wifi. Ficou show.', 'Ottimo processore, mi sta dando belle soddisfazioni. Rispetto ai processori di alcuni fa i Ryzen 7000 scaldano un p√≤, ma vale anche gli Itel. Con i primi bios i 7000 scaldavano parecchio, ad eccezione forse del 7600x che rimane un p√≤ pi√π fresco. Con gli ultimi bios per√≤ la situazione √® migliorata e adesso sono molto pi√π gestibili.N.B. dal 7700x in su servir√† un dissipatore di una certa qualit√†, preferibilmente a liquido. Io ho un B√® Quiet Pure Loop 2 FX 280mm e mi sto trovando bene. Sotto un 280mm non andrei.']

Product: AMD Ryzen‚Ñ¢ 9 7950X 16-Core, 32-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor
Reviews: ["What I like to do is run CPU intensive things in the background while also playing games. Often times I can go in Ryzen Master and drop the clock and voltage down and things still run at a satisfying degree. I've used this playing at 1080p-2160p. Top to bottom no issues. Like 2 months later the 7950x3D was on sale for what I bought this for but it is what it is. AM4 lasted a long time. Someday I'll be buying some x3D 16 core from the last AM5 gen CPUs.It's great when you have software that lets you choose to encode/simulate on the CPU and set how many cores to use. Give 8c/16th  and play games without issue. I've kept up with bios updates so I haven't had issues with the overvolting EXPO stuff that was in the news. I use a Thermaltake Peerless Assassin to cool it  and that's been adequate even when playing at stock voltages where it hits those 95 celcius temps. You can undervolt this thing, drop the clocks a bit and the performance difference is negligible.If you're a software developer, you'll enjoy the amount of cores for running VMs, docker containers, compiling software, etc. I like photography so enjoy playing with RAW photos in Darktable and mild things in Krita. Going from a 4770k to this was a pretty massive change.I feel like people buying CPUs seperate probably know what to expect. I was able to run a 4770k for 8 years. I don't want to run this for 8 years but I wouldn't be surprised if the performance in games at 2160p is so minor that I just keep going on with this and occasionally upgrading the graphics card", 'As a software developer, I spend a great deal of time compiling thousands of lines of C++ code so need a CPU that has exceptional multi-core performance.  I bought the Ryzen 9 7950X for a new AM5 build to replace an ageing 10th generation i7 and I was delighted with the performance.My previous system took almost 5 minutes to do a full build of my project but this CPU has cut the build time to under 30 seconds. I highly recommend this CPU if you have a requirement for heavy multi-core processing.', '(geschrieben am 08.09.2023)Absoluter hammer das Teil,  sehr stabil und macht bis jetzt  keine anzeichen von fehlern in denn Berechnungen / Gameing .Das einzige was  vielleicht abschrecken k√∂nnte ist die hohe belastungs Temperatur,eine reine  luft k√ºhlung k√∂nnte zu wenig sein (h√§ngt von der Geh√§usel√ºftung  ab).Wenn m√∂glich  w√ºrde ich sagen besorgt man sich am besten noch eine Wasserk√ºhlung (AIO reicht schon).', 'Mostly been on Intel chips for the last 40+ years. But I like to give the other guy a go if they have a competitive product.', 'Build:  AMD Ryzen 9 7950X  MSI MPG X67E Carbon  G.Skill Trident Z5 NEO RGB F5-6000J3040G32GX2-TZ5NR  (AMD Expo 2 x 32GB DDR5 6000 CL30-40-40-96)  Crucial T700 1TB Gen5 NVMe M.2 (CT1000T700SSD3)The DDR5 runs solid at 6000MHZ.The gen 5 Crucial T700 gets 11700MB/sec.FAST!!!The only caution is that this CPU is tuned to run up to 95 degrees C to get all this performance.Be sure to have a good cooler.', "I can run every core at 5500mhz, for hours, with just a little overclocking, core tuning, and a good 360mm AIO. This is just an amazing amount of computational power for a home computer.  The best part, I have it tuned such that I can do this while it runs at 65c (vs 95c).  This is an enthusiast CPU, and you will want to watch a lot of videos on how to tune and optimize it, and if you don't have excellent cooling, you will never get the performance you paid dearly for.  This thing rocks, and handles any task I throw at it with zero hesitation.  AM5 is also relatively future-proof for a while.  :)", 'amazing performance, bought it for my 3d workstation and it makes everything I throw at it a breeze!', 'El producto lleg√≥ a tiempo y perfectamente sellado. Es excelente para computadoras gamer de gama media, no es necesario el overclock pero enfriamiento l√≠quido es recomendado a√∫n sin esta modalidad.', 'Gute Leistung schlecht zum OC', 'The best processor ever']

Product was exactly as advertised, works great!', '', 'Processeur 6C/12T qui reste encore tr√®s performant en 2023 , ne chauffe pas beaucoup et une consommation √©lectrique maitris√© , 9W en idle,  entre 30 et 50W en gaming selon les jeux,  et au maximum 88W pendant un stress test tr√®s exigeant.', "Make sure to read the details! Product: Intel Core i5-9600KF Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.6 GHz Turbo Unlocked Without Processor Graphics LGA1151 300 Series 95W
Reviews: ['The product is legitimate and the item was received smoothly. Only issue I had was the box arrived pretty dented. While the processor itself was working and does not looked damaged, I wished the product would be delivered in a nicer condition.', 'I have receive the product is very good quality thanks.', 'good job keep up', 'This is the top-end Coffee Lake i5, I believe. Works great for my purposes, although I have not tried overclocking it. With my (suspectedly sub-standard) cooling, I can get sustained all-core turbo boost of 4.3 GHz, which is below the advertised maximum but I have it in a very cramped mini-ITX case.', 'very epic if u have a 1660 super', 'Great offer', 'Good good good', 'Received box like this, ugly, when trying to check barcode this sticker they put makes it impossible to see S-spec number', "Nel corso di questi tre anni, l'i5-9600K ha vissuto momenti di intensa attivit√† e giornate di relativa tranquillit√†. Dal fotoritocco al rendering, passando per sessioni di gaming ad alta definizione, non c'√® stato un solo momento in cui abbia sentito il bisogno di un processore pi√π potente. Il vero test, per√≤, √® arrivato quando ho iniziato a lavorare da casa, dovendo gestire diverse applicazioni contemporaneamente. Nonostante il carico di lavoro, l'i5-9600K ha dimostrato di essere all'altezza della situazione, permettendomi di svolgere le mie attivit√† senza alcun rallentamento.Punti di Forza:Il principale punto di forza di questo processore √® senza dubbio la sua performance. L'i5-9600K √® infatti un vero e proprio campione di velocit√† e multitasking, capace di gestire anche i carichi di lavoro pi√π pesanti senza alcun problema. Inoltre, nonostante le elevate prestazioni, il calore generato rimane sempre nei limiti della norma, un dettaglio non da poco se consideriamo che un'eccessiva temperatura pu√≤ ridurre la vita del processore e danneggiare altri componenti del PC.Punti di Debolezza:Nonostante l'i5-9600K sia un ottimo processore, non √® esente da difetti. Il primo √® legato al costo: se da un lato la qualit√† e le prestazioni sono indubbie, dall'altro il prezzo potrebbe risultare proibitivo per chi sta assemblando un PC con un budget limitato. Un altro aspetto da considerare √® l'assenza di un dissipatore nella confezione, elemento che dovr√† quindi essere acquistato separatamente. Infine, per sfruttare al meglio le capacit√† di overclocking dell'i5-9600K, sar√† necessario disporre di una scheda madre e di un sistema di raffreddamento adeguati.Conclusioni:Nonostante alcune piccole pecche, l'i5-9600K √® un processore che consiglierei senza esitazioni. Che siate gamer, professionisti o semplici appassionati di informatica, con questo prodotto avrete a disposizione un componente capace di fare la differenza. A tre anni dal mio acquisto, posso affermare di essere pienamente soddisfatto della mia scelta e di non aver mai avuto motivi per pentirmi.", 'Produto chegou.']
