Product: Intel Core i7-12700KF Desktop Processor 12 (8P+4E) Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked¬† LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Reviews: ['I felt that Amazon should provide the Intel CPU fan as well as a package deal. The CPU is already so pricey and throwing in a standard CPU fan would not hurt Amazon bottom line.', 'los amo con toda mi alma, creo que se les acabo en stock cuando lo pedi, porque me llego un 13700k, pero en la etiqueta de envio decia 12700fkLOS AMO', 'I like Intel processors. Been building primarily Intel based computers since my first 386SX 16 back in about 1991. I just never have issues with Intel builds like I have with other vendors. This i7 is no different. It‚Äôs fast and stable with a moderately priced air cooler. No issues. Rock solid. I think this 12th gen is currently the best bang for the buck as of late summer 2023.', "I'm upgrading from an old AMD FX 8320 chip and that was an 8 core 8 thread 3.5ghz cpu. i could overclock it to 4ghz no problem but it was DDR3 1600mhz ram. This thing crush's that chip like there is no tomorrow. I have this chip paired with Corsair Vengeance DDR5 5200 RAM, a Asus TUF Z690,1X Fire Cuda 530 Gen 4 NVMe SSD, Alseye M120D cooler and a case with 7 fans, crushed 4tb data file transfers across old drives in about 12 hours, never got hotter then 62C in any of my bench tests and maintains an average temp of 35C while general use. startup is 0-15C until you heat it up first time then it doesn't seem to drop below 32 until a shut down for a while. I had it off all day on second day, turned it on and logged in, got distracted on my cell phone for 1 hour then looked at temp, and it was 12C. checked 3 different sources all read same. then i ran a game for 15 mins and it got to 43C. i stopped the game and left it for an hour to see what it did with nothing really running. it immediately dropped to 36 when i shut game off within under 5 seconds.After 20 mins of it pegged at 36 i maxed out the fans then took the hour to drop to 32 to see if it made a difference. 0 change.  anyway Skoocum chip and it isn't even the best you can get right now. plus gen 14 is right around corner ;)", 'Consegu√≠ este procesador a un precio incre√≠ble, no dud√© en comprarlo, es r√°pido y los n√∫cleos e hilos extras que lleva me resultan muy √∫tiles.', "I bought this CPU with internal graphics primarily to have backup if my primary installed GPU should fail. Also for the speed and quality of the CPU itself, it satisfies. But the internal graphics not so much. I used it's graphics for the time I was shopping and waiting for my ordered GPU and was not impressed. I would never want to depend on it permanently. My TV monitor continually had issues with detecting it's source and would drop connection on occasion, forcing me to have to continually reset HDMI cable in it's port. A real irritation and pain. Is this a problem with the MBs HDMI port or the CPU. I don't know, but either way it ain't good. Nor did I care much for the overall look of the graphics it provided. Just not quality.I have been using a big screen TV for a monitor my for many years and never had this issue, so I don't think it's the TV. Still the cost of an I7 K vs an I7 KF is negligible so why not go for the one with graphics in case I ever need it. For a short while.", 'Great product.', 'It performs great and with the help of the e-cores, I can browse my website with lower power consumption.', 'I accidentally bought the i7 (this one) vs the i9. Used it in a different setup and worked exactly as expected. No issues with bent pins or a bad processor. If anything changes I‚Äôll be sure to update.', 'It‚Äôs a good CPU, but I had the wrong motherboard which meant I also had to get new RAM. I managed to upgrade my PC with about a 500 dollar budget.']

Product: Intel Core i9-12900K Desktop Processor 16 (8P+8E) Cores up to 5.2 GHz Unlocked LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Reviews: ['Se siente mucho la diferencia en el cambio de AMD a Inter, es mucho m√°s estable y m√°s fluido, sus drivers est√°n bien optimizados y corre espectacular, no se calienta, incluso al 100% de uso se mantiene en los 70 grados', 'Are usually go for the best products and it was a mistake for my first PC build I chose this chip and I didn‚Äôt know it runs that hot I built my PC I had enough fans but I had a 240 mm radiator I want a Micro Center and had to get a 360 mm cooler from the pool. The temps were at 89 to 92¬∞C after the deep cool AIO under stress, test and bench testing the temp stay under 60¬∞C , other than that I game hard on it and stream and the CPU usage never goes past 30%. It‚Äôs pretty overkill but that‚Äôs how I like my PC.', 'This thing was so patient with me as I turned it on without a cooler several times because my pump was failing. Sure it shut off when it hit ~102 Celsius but there was no long term damage and now it serves me well with a working pump. We love to see it.', "Bought this CPU on sale, and it runs fast and stays cool. Mine is running at 5.2 ghz with temps in the 40's on AIO on an ASRock Z790m ITX. I am super impressed at this combination of speed and reasonable temps. Have not gamed yet, but I expect killer performance!!", 'This CPU is top quality, it is easy to install and works great for gaming, it stays cool and I have had no problems with it.', 'L√§uft super und keine Beanstandungen!', "Bought for a friend's computer I was building. I got it in the Prime sale and it's fantasticly fast", "I purchase this CPU 1 year ago and it cost me 74,000 JPY back then.the price didn't drop much since that time and the performance is satisfying so far.the new generation spec is higher so if you want to buy this CPU don't. instead, you can buy i7 Gen13 as it will have the same spec plus a better cache than the 12 Gen.it might be better to buy the K version in case you have issues with your GPU to troubleshoot.", 'I was going to go for the 13900k but I took this one for half of the price and have to tell u love it thank you', 'Purchased this for my new rig as opposed to an i7 based on price point at time of purchase (this was actually cheaper than the i7).Paired with RTX 4060TI 8GB.NO regrets.This can handle anything I throw at it, without issue (gaming wise) and never goes above 50/55C (not overclocked and cooled with 240MM AIO from Corsair) Idles around 32/33CVery responsive with plenty of clearance if I ever want to OC this guy.Heat was a concern after reading reviews and only having a 240MM radiator (sitting over a 4060Ti), but no issues - heat or performance) at all.Great time to buy with new gen just arriving recently.']

Product: Intel Core i7-10700K Desktop Processor 8 Cores up to 5.1 GHz Unlocked¬† LGA1200 (Intel 400 Series Chipset) 125W (BX8070110700K)
Reviews: ['Perfect for my 3070 build!', 'Super!!', 'Die CPU l√§uft und l√§uft und l√§uft. Der Einbau ist wie immer bei CPUs sehr einfach.', '(a) Considering its current price and given that its gaming performance (without power limits) is overall identical to the 11700k (without power limits too) and just 3-4% slower overall than the 5800x I would say this cpu is the best choice for gaming. After overclocking it actually beats or matches the 5800x overall even when compared against a PBOed 5800x. By "overall" I mean when comparing these cpus in a large range of games (30+ games) and not just 4-5, (something that some biased reviews do)(b) Productivity is very good too although in heavy multithreaded applications (e.g. tile-based rendering) it does lose by 10-20% to both the 11700k and the 5800x. That said it reduces the deficit to only 3-15% in an overclocked vs overclocked battle, thanks to its higher overclocking potential.(c) It runs pretty cool - I am using a Noctua NH-D15 and is also very silent. Even on stock auto motherboard settings (and with power limits removed) I don\'t get temps above 68-69C even when running Cinebench R23 in a loop and sustaining indefinitely the stock all-core 4.7GHz. Temps reduce further when you manually tune the voltage to a lower value (a practice known as undervolting) or when you apply a better thermal paste or a case with better airflow. You can also undervolt and still overclock. Or overclock more without increasing the voltage above its stock value.(d) I paired it with a fairly high-end Asus Z490 (Strix-E) board instead of a Z590 one.  There is no reason buying a Z590 board for 10th gen cpus as for the same price you typically don\'t get "enthusiast" features (such as postcode, third PCIe x16 slot, PCIe bifurcation, etc). Moreover most of the "goodies" of the Z590 boards (e.g. PCIe4, additional M.2 slot, DMI3x8) are only enabled when using an 11th gen cpu. So buying a Z590 for 10th gen is a bit of a waste.(e) Currently the price of the 11700K +Z590 is around 200 euros higher than that of the 10700K+Z490 combo. If the difference drops to 60-80 euros then I would advise to go for the former instead. But as of now the 10700K+Z490 combo is the wiser choice.', 'Don‚Äôt let the 125w TDP fool ya because this chip runs WAY cooler than previous gens. Tested temps using OCCT stress test for about 3 hours, alongside my Noctua NH-D15 cooler. The highest I‚Äôve seen the temp spike up to was 71c. Note that OCCT is a heavy synthetic test that pushes the CPU to the limit. Regular gaming temps will never reach that high. I‚Äôve had the chip for almost two months now and accumulated quite a bit of gaming hours during that time. The games I played included a mix of intensive AAA titles like CoD Warzone and AC: Odyssey to light eSport ones such as Rocket League and Rainbow Six Siege. Highest temps are always in the 50s to mid 60s range. That is a huge difference compared to my old i5 6600k that spiked to over 80c at times! My brother who bought a 9900k last year was also amazed by how much cooler 10th gen runs and even said that he wished he waited a bit longer before upgrading. Note that both the 9900k and 6600k have lower TDPs than the 10700k yet still run warmer. The reason as to why 10th gen runs cooler is because intel made modifications to the IHS of the cpu and upgraded their Thermal Interface Material. Other then the improvement in the temperature department, I‚Äôve also noticed a big difference in gaming performance. Despite having a 2080 super, my PC used to struggle to reach and stay at a consistent 100+fps at 1080p. CPU intensive games like AC Odyssey often dropped to like 50fps. This is a clear indication that there was bottleneck on the CPU side. With this new 10700k, My PC now has no problems reaching and maintaining that sweet consistent 144+ FPS on light competitive eSport titles and 100+FPS on demanding CPU intensive AAA titles. Also, note that I am running the CPU at stock settings right out the box and have not messed with overclocking yet. Nonetheless, I am very satisfied with this CPU and I highly recommend it.', "While a good idea anyway, with many processors now utilizing stock overclocks, you can benefit a performance boost by choosing a better CPU cooler. I went the cheap route, actually, I thought it was middle of the road since the Thermaltake Contac Silent 12 is rated for 150w. I thought I could get away with a $30 cooler since I am not planning on overclocking. That cooler could not even keep up with stock CPU settings. In benchmarks the CPU hit 80-Celsius in seconds and gradually up to 90 where I had it set to throttle. In more practical testing, under basic workloads the temps are more reasonable but the Contac Silent 12 has to ramp up to %100 fan speed frequently to keep that way and it is not quiet at that speed. I know somebody is going to say that's because the default settings on the motherboard are overclocking the CPU beyond Intel's recommended settings. Well, that was one of the first things I checked and that's not the case here. Despite what somebody on YouTube said or didn't say, not all motherboards do that. It is a great processor and complements my workload nicely (no games here). The new cooler is a Reeven Justice, $45 right now. I has the same size 120mm fan however it has six heat pipes instead of four and the tower is about %50 thicker and fins stacked closer together. Temps, while still pretty hot, have come down 8-10 degrees on Cinebench R-20. It still gets up to 80-82 Celsius but instead of hitting 80 right away as it did before, it takes until the render is almost complete and seems to level off there. I feel better about the temps now that It's not riding on the ceiling, especially since all core full load is not a typical workload for me. The fan is much quieter during typical use. I would recommend that cooler for those who are looking for a good compatible cooler.", '‰∏≠Âè§ÂìÅ„ÅåÂá∫ÂìÅ„Åï„Çå„Çã„ÅÆ„ÅØ„ÄÅÈÅã„Å†„ÅåÂÆâ„ÅèË≤∑„Åà„Çã„ÅÆ„ÅåÂ¨â„Åó„ÅÑ„ÄÇ‰ªä„ÅÆÊâÄÂÆâÂÆö„Åó„Å¶‰Ωø„Åà„Å¶„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ', "Yeah I know, Ryzens are cheaper, and out perform the Intel chips in everything... except clocks. As a gamer, I want the highest single core speed possible, 16 threads instead of 32? Whatever, I don't need that many for my uses, lol.I don't upgrade often, and until now I was still running my trusty 4790k, which still can hold it's own pretty well, but now with the 10700k, the 1080 isn't bottlenecked by my CPU any more, and it's VERY noticeable in certain games I normally saw slight issues.Should you upgrade 9th gen, or even 8th gen to 10th gen? Honestly, probably not. But if you're say, a few of more generations behind now, it's a worthy upgrade. Yes it's an upgraded 9900k, but that's still really good for ~$400!(pic included just because I find it hilarious how absurdly big the Noctua D15 cooler is)1 MONTH UPDATE:So yeah it's just shy of a month using it and it's been a beast. I haven't messed with clocks at all since the built in boosts do the job fine, especially paired with the D15 keeping it nice and cool. Haven't gone above 60c in full load yet.8 MONTH UPDATE:Still going strong! Was able to snag a 3080 from MicroCenter in September, so my build is now complete, and the 3080/10700k combo is beasting through anything I put in front of it.PC Build:CPU: i7-10700kCPUC: Noctua NH-D15 ChromaxMOBO: MSI Z490-A PRORAM: 32GB (4x8GB) HyperX Fury DDR4 3200GPU: EVGA RTX 3080 XC3 UltraPSU: Seasonic Focus Plus Gold 750wDRIVES: 250GB Samsung 970 EVO Plus M.2, 1TB Seagate SSHD, 2TB Samsung 860 Evo SSD, 4TB WD Black HDD", "Works great, the original one I got from Amazon died on me within 2 weeks it was essentially dead on arrival. This rarely happens but from time to time this can happen.I contacted Intel and asked for a replacement and they agreed as it was under warranty obviously. While I had to pay like $10 to ship it to them which I originally thought was sorta cheap since other companies like MSI cover the shipping costs I can see why Intel doesn't.While I only paid $10 for shipping I assumed it would be ground shipping from Canada to the middle of the USA and figured I'd be without a CPU for up to 2-weeks.Turns out Intel ships via Air and my package was on a Plane and arrived at the facility within 8 hours and I had a new CPU in my computer within 72 hours.I would highly recommend this product even after my issues because Intel was as fast as possible with replacing mine.After using this product for a few months it's worked great and performs perfectly and I've had no issues since getting the original replaced.", 'I waited too long to switch back to the FPS king. This chip is amazing. I missed you Intel.The PC world is weird. Always chasing $50 savings. Too many games have CPU bottlenecks. I debated hard between just buying a 3700x to replace my 2700x versus the hard MB/CPU upgrade to Intel. But AMD had left me frustrated. My 2700x was never maxed out and I couldn‚Äôt tell what was bottleknecking me. The 3700x didn‚Äôt promise much higher clock speeds so I wasn‚Äôt sure if an upgrade would help. I play Rust on 1440p and my GPU and CPU would sit at 60% utilization or less with frames only around 70fps. First test with the 10700k stock and I‚Äôm at 135fps, max graphic settings. My GPU is now pumping out 99% utilization and the game feels amazing.This chip runs cool on stock. Idk where all the bad thermal predictions came from, but it didn‚Äôt happen. Haven‚Äôt even OC‚Äôd it yet and honestly I may not need to until I upgrade off of my 2080super. But that‚Äôs not happening any time soon. I‚Äôm hitting 144fps on 1440p max settings now in every FPS game and that was the goal.Thank you Intel, you nailed this one. The 9th gen had some cost/heat issues and that made me give AMD a try and I‚Äôm glad to be back!For anyone choosing a card. The 10700k is the sweet spot for gaming and streaming. If you only game, I think the 10600k is a cheaper but same performance. I don‚Äôt see any need for the 10900k.']

Product: Intel Core i5-10600K Desktop Processor 6 Cores up to 4.8 GHz Unlocked¬† LGA1200 (Intel 400 Series Chipset) 125W
Reviews: ['Prompt delivery and function well', 'calidad', 'nothing to dislike, just does what it is supposed to.', 'A good upgrade for a 10400f, slight speed upgrade and unlocked for overclocking.Used in a 10th gen system with an Arc770.', 'Ottimo processore ,prestazioni al top .ottimo acquisto.', "I bought this to upgrade my sons gaming PC and I have to say this thing is a little workhorse with the overclock feature. I wanted a better CPU without having to upgrade the MOBO and get faster, better performance without bottlenecking. This does the job.I have it paired with an MSI 460G Mobo and a Nvidia RTX 2060 super and the performance is much better. CPU is running at 60-70 C maxed out (which is well within spec), so I am going to add a liquid cooled fan to bring that down, but even at the 60-70 there's no lag.If you're looking to make an upgrade to your 10th gen system without having to get a new Mobo, this is a great option", 'So, I know AMD has become the dominate force in CPU\'s but when I couldn\'t get ahold of a Ryzen 5 5600X and I heard AMD was having a lot of chips failing I decided to go with the i5-10600K "Especially when the price dropped from $260 to $230" This chip though it has a 125w TDP runs very cool with my 240mm Fractal S24 Prisma AIO (Idle Temps inside a Corsair 4000D case are around 81-82 Degrees "F" Inside a room that stays around 72-73F)CPU has some serious Overclocking Room. Gamer Nexus showed this CPU beating out a i9 in Gaming with proper RAM and CPU Overclocking, and the results are repeatable because I\'ve tested this myself and found this CPU to be a little monster for Gaming performance. We all know the i5-9600K was the best Gaming CPU for the longest time and the i5-10600K is basically just a i5-9600K 2.0 that\'s been revised and improved.At the $230 price tag I would highly suggest this CPU to anyone who wants to stick with Intel and running on the LGA1200 socket. (Please keep in mind that my results are on a water cooled AIO setup so please don\'t expect the same results)PC Setup:Case: Corsair 4000D Air FlowMOB: ASUS Rog Z490 E (DO NOT SUGGEST THIS BOARD OR COMPANY!!)CPU: i5-10600KRAM: Corsair Vengeance Pro RGB 3200Mhz (16gb Kit)AIO: Fractal Prisma S24 AIO 240mmGPU: EVGA FTW2 1070TiPSU: Seasonic GX750 Gold 750wSSD: Samsung EVO 840 (1TB) WD Blue (500gb)This has been a very strong setup for the money so far, so feel free to copy of it what you want.I just wouldn\'t use the ASUS Z490E "It arrived broken and ASUS refused to help me at all, so I ended up having to solder and Super Glue on a $300 board to fix the damage from the factory"', "I replaced an 8 yr old i7 with his Gen 11 i5, it blew the i7 performance out of the water. No compairison between the two. I had all the settings to max on Black Desert Online which I couldn't do with the old i7.", 'For personal video editing, professional photo editing and gaming as hard as it could be done. Never had an issue and never has let me down. No laggin, freezing, or shut downs of any type. Cant get anything better than that.', 'No issues, fast.']

Blazing fast doing work and internet duties.Good value.', 'Top', "I really like to overclock my cpu's as once you find stability you could realize a 10% improvement.  this one went smooth at about 7 %  and has been stable for better than a year with zero hiccups", 'Works as expected']

Product: Intel Core i3-10100 Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.3 GHz¬† LGA1200 (Intel 400 Series Chipset) 65W, Model Number: BX8070110100
Reviews: ['able to take the workload that was given!! working very well with no issues at all!üòùüòù', 'Been using intel i3 cpu as I just need a simple computer to surf net, and play some simple games. The internal graphics is enough to power my needs.', 'No display on 8 out of 10 tries. Even with display, it did not get past BIOS stage. Eventually solved only with installing an entry-level graphics card. Problem is either this CPU or the mobo: MSI MAG B460M MORTAR WIFI Gaming Motherboard (mATX, 10th Gen Intel Core, LGA 1200 Socket, DDR4, CFX, Dual M.2 Slots, USB 3.2 Gen 1, 2.5G LAN, DP/HDMI.', '„Éè„Éº„Éâ„Éá„Ç£„Çπ„ÇØ„Åã„ÇâSSD„Å´‰∫§Êèõ„Åó„Å¶„ÄÅ„Åù„Åì„Åã„Çâ„ÅÆË£èÊäÄ„ÅØ„Éì„Éá„Ç™„Éª„Ç´„Éº„Éâ„ÇíÂ∑Æ„Åó„Å¶‰Ωø„Å£„Åü„ÇâÊøÄÈÄü„Å´„Å™„Å£„Åü„ÄÇ', 'DISCLAIMER: This review covers 3 main items (CPU, MOBO, RAM). Links to the other parts are included (all available at Amazon for good prices). You\'ll read this review on each of the other parts as well.WHY DID I BUY IT? I recently built and absolute beast of a computer and kept my older one as a backup. Unfortunately, it decided to take a dive this past week with the motherboard failing catastropically. Given that it was 10 years old, I decided to replace the "brains" with something a little more modern, but not overkill. Because I had spent a LOT of money on a computer recently, I was trying to keep the repair under about $400 and here\'s what I did...The BRAINS...Intel i3-10100 Processor ($100): www.amazon.com/gp/product/B086MMRW87MSI Mag B460 Motherboard ($110): www.amazon.com/gp/product/B08GXVP1DMTeamGroup 16GB DDR4 ($60): www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07WNQVBZ6*** These are the main parts that MUST be compatible.. and they are ***I was worried about my hard drive, so I went ahead and splurged on a TeamGroup 1TB SSD ($75 -- www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07PX2KKHM) bringing my total to just under $400. I could have kept my old Seagate 500gb 5400 RPM drive but I had a little extra to spend and that greatly sped up boot and wait times.For what it\'s worth, I also kept my existing Antec Power Supply (550W) that was replaced about a year ago, my case, and my now very old graphics card (R9 380 - 4gb). I already had a good monitor, mouse, and keyboard so those carried over as well.So how did it go together? Pretty seamlessly with just 2 little hiccups.HICCUP #1RAM: I did not realize the motherboard I purchased has a standard RAM speed of 2666. It can get up to a max of 2933. So the RAM I purchased (3200 speed, CL 16) is overkill and I could have saved another $20 or so. But, I didn\'t... and it\'s my first build with TeamGroup RAM and I\'m happy with it.HICCUP #2LAN/AUDIO: Once I got everything installed, the LAN would not connect to my network (wired, ethernet connection). A little troubleshooting found out YOU MUST TO UPGRADE THE LAN DRIVER for it to work. This means having another computer with internet and a flash drive. Likewise, I went ahead and updated the Audio driver and the sound was much crisper. So... take a moment and download all of the drivers in advance from the MSI website.FIRST POWER ON: The computer started up, then turned off immediately. It then restarted on it\'s own and said the motherboard had detected changes so I needed to configure the BIOS. Entering BIOS found that everything was recognized. So I changed the first boot device to USB flash drive and plugged in my Windows 10 install flash drive and restarted.Bottom Line: The Intel i3-10100 is a great little chip (not overclockable). The MSI 460 Torpedo is a decent motherboard (just update the LAN and Audio drivers) that boots quickly. In fact, it boots so quickly, I don\'t even see the POST screen. From cold to Windows is easily under 30 seconds.The RAM is stable at 2666 and fast enough that I probably won\'t even push the 2933 setting. The SSD is very fast (functionally almost as fast as the M2 drive I have in my beast at a savings of $20-25). Even with the aging R9 graphics card, I\'m easily hitting 60 FPS on modern titles at 1080 in medium to high settings. Sometime next year when graphics card prices drop to a reasonable level, I\'ll update that and have a second gaming rig ready.Overall, I\'m very happy with this setup.', 'Paired this with a Crucial BX500 1TB SSD, CORSAIR VENGEANCELPX 64GB RAM and the ASUS Prime H510M-E mother board.The Movavi video editor now loads a file ready for editing in less than 4 seconds (my previous setup with 32Gb RAM used to take 90 seconds).', 'Built a computer for the relative as a very early Christmas gift or a reverse birthday gift (my birthday, but I give you gifts), who honestly would probably be doing very little with it to justify a 4 core/8 thread current generation processor if it\'s web browsing, video conferencing, YouTube for music and the general emailing stuff. I put an RX 580 in it as well as 2x8GB 2666 DDR4 RAM and 2 500GB HDDs.I would definitely say the thing itself is quite the "sleeper"! It\'s gonna run your games at console and above performance with a simpler GPU at lower settings, and it\'ll destroy on a much more advanced GPU. It\'s a good email/web/very light gaming/YouTube browser alone thanks to this particular CPU\'s integrated GPU, turning it into an APU (Accelerated Processing Unit). It\'s not a workstation processor due to its four core and eight thread composition. It can take in eight tasks and work on them, but it can only digest four at a time.If you\'re looking for a desktop PC and know how to or someone who does know how to build it, This is all you need and more.If you\'re into gaming on a console but want to try it on a computer and have a sub $1000 budget, get this and do some research before building, spend a few weeks on PC building knowledge. I recommend if buying this a B460 Motherboard, 2x8GB RAM sticks, a new HDD/SSD/M.2 PCIe SSD of at least 1TB/500GB/500GB, HDD is slow but cheap, lasts a good few years without fail and large in storage, SSD is fast and usually lasts long with less storage space (do not buy DRAM-less SSDs, lack of SSD RAM will damage the drive much faster), M.2 PCIe SSD is very fast but most expensive, no SATA cables needed but does disable one SATA port on most motherboards due to it sharing the same data lane.If you want a workstation, try either Intel\'s Core i7 or i9 Series, or AMD\'s Ryzen 7 or Ryzen 9 Series processors.', "Pagato 125 euro. Una bomba! Entry level quad core, nuovo chispet lga 1200. Intel, con questa gamma, ha fatto un bel salto avanti e nel mercato entry level si √® piazzata decisamente davanti ai cari vecchi ryzen. Ho costruito una build per uso domestico/piccolo ufficio con poche centinaia di euro, ed il risultato √® stato pi√π che ottimo!Ricordo che per chi √® alla ricerca di una build decente (NON votata al gaming) questa √® un'ottima scelta, considerando anche la grafica integrata che fa risparmiare sulla scheda video. E per chi volesse proprio concedersi un p√≤ di momento ludico, qui fortnite e titoli simili non faticano.L'unica pecca (ma il periodo √® quello che √®) √® che si trovano poche schede madri lga 1200 ad un prezzo consono.", 'Stock cooler cools it fine', 'excellent']

Product: AMD Ryzen 5 3400G 4-core, 8-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor with Radeon RX Graphics
Reviews: ['It has a powerful iGPU better than intels ad could easily play AAA title at low settings. With a good nvme ssd and ram, the bootup speed and daily web surfing is a breeze.', 'meet my expectation & I can play dota 2 with ultra setting 40-50 fps.', 'Good processor. Comes with cooler and integrated graphics with energy of just 60w max.', 'Kaput after a few months. Still trying to claim warranty after 1 year. Wrote to AMD, but they advised to contact seller.', 'Delivery is fast and items tested OK.', 'everything meet expectiation', 'Review of - AMD Ryzen 5 3400G 4-core, 8-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor with Radeon RX Graphics-I am very satisfied with this AMD "value" APU, especially since its impossible to obtain graphics cards at MSRP right now.-I was very fortunately able to obtain this 3400G processor recently from amazon at MSRP pricing (sold by amazon, shipped by amazon). I suppose I was very lucky because all the stock in these sold out in about 30 minutes after I got an email notification. Then the site went back to absurd scalper pricing from 3rd parties (avoid those, boycott them).-I am using the 3400G for a "home theater" computer. At the MSRP price, paired with an Asus B450-F Gaming II mainboard that amazon also had at a great sale price, this CPU is working out well. Keep in mind however, that some BIOS CPU tuning is required. As a side note, I am using the Vetroo V5 air cooler. The Vetroo V5 has been holding idle tempts at 30C or so (CPU tuned to constant 4,000mhz clock speed), and rarely hitting 50C when pumping 2160p60 video from the web for smooth streaming playback. I\'m not using this computer for gaming or video editing (such as with the Davinci Resolve editor). I am also using 32GBs of 3200mhz ADATA brand DRAM, with DOCP enabled. The AMD Ryzen 3400G\'s Vega 11 Graphics component reserves 2GB of RAM for dedicated graphics processing. With the CPU tuned to run at a constant 4,000mhz, the KODI home theater software application pumps steady, smooth, frame rate video.-My CPU/BIOS optimization experience: I discovered that, out the box, the Asus bios setup the AMD 3400G to constantly throttle its clock speed down to the 1700mhz range. As the 3400G kept throttling down, smooth HD video playback was impossible. However, once I used the Asus BIOS auto "tweaker" feature, and set the CPU to hold at a constant 4,000mhz CPU clock speed, I have been experiencing snappy "home theater" software performance. I also discovered that it is very necessary to update the Windows OS to the latest network/ethernet device driver and to add some obscure advanced network device driver settings configuration (see various youtube videos about these obscure ethernet driver tuning settings) in order to obtain smooth 1080p60, 1440p60, etc., internet video streaming performance.-Note also that, when connecting to a HDTV via HDMI, that 2160p60 is NOT possible unless the both the HDTV supports HDMI 2.1 for 2160p at 60hz refresh, as well as the MOBO in use. Based on my experience so far, 2160p (so called 4K), isn\'t that noticeably better beyond well smoothed, crisp, 1080p60 HDTV output anyway.-After the Asus MOBO BIOS tuning, and Windows OS network device driver updating noted above, I have been extremely happy that a $149.00 MSRP AMD CPU has more than enough processing power to provide an excellent home theater computer experience with the KODI home theater software application running my movie and music library (KODI takes a LOT of time to setup though).-The AMD Ryzen Vega 11 APU graphics included with the AMD Ryzen 3400G have been quite adequate for my "home theater" needs. I also recently purchased an AMD Ryzen 3200G, also available from amazon at MSRP from time to time. The graphics in the AMD Ryzen 3200G, which has more limited resolutions and refresh rates, are NOT at all as good as the 3400G graphics. The additional price for the AMD Ryzen 3400G over the 3200G is well worth it. However, for building office/business computers to run MSFT office and such, the $99 AMD Ryzen 3200G appears to provide more than enough processing power.-SYSTEM SETUP WITH THE AMD Ryzen 3400G- AMD Ryzen AMD 3400G- Asus ROG Strix B450-F Gaming II- Vetroo V5 CPU Air Cooler (Arctic brand NO rgb fans installed on it)- Montech Century 850W PSU- Fractal Design Meshify 2 Compact case (using the stock fans tuned with DC mode in BIOS)- (2) PNY XLR8 CS3030 500GB M.2 PCIe NVMe Gen3 x4 SSD) - system drive- - second matching drive for daily auto cloning backup with Macrium Reflect software- (2) Toshiba N300 8TB NAS HD for home theater media storage (RAID 1 / mirroring)- - 8TB total usable mirrored storage-----------------If you can get an AMD Ryzen AMD 3400G directly from amazon at MSRP, it is can excellent value CPU. Given the performance of the AMD 3000G line APUs, if and when the AMD 5000G APUs become available later this year, it seems like they are likely to provide an equally excellent value chip proposition. In years to come the anticipated AMD 6000G APUs, with even more upgraded RDNA2 graphics onboard, will hopefully provide ever more tantalizing value for money.', 'Cumple', 'One of the best investments I could make, as of today (9/14/2023) it continues to perform very well for me after 3 years of continuous use for games, streaming and photo editing.', "I used this chipset as part of a low power file server build. I was looking for an APU (CPU and GPU combination) that can play games in a pinch but has very low power consumption. It‚Äôs by far the most energy efficient APU available at the time, but it has a few caveats. It‚Äôs technically a 2000-series chip and there aren't many motherboards that are compatible with it out of the box - most require flashing the motherboard (yay oh fun). x570 boards are compatible out of the box with the 3400G but almost all of those are ATX so this won't work with smaller sized builds. With those caveats out of the way:  the 3400G ‚Äúgames‚Äù almost as well as its more expensive, more energy hungry siblings (3600G and 3700G), so it's a great compromise between power efficiency and low end gaming performance."]

Product: Intel BX80684I99900K Core i9-9900K Desktop Processor 8 Cores up to 5.0 GHz
Reviews: ['Works as intended, slightly pricey especially with the multiple high end options available nowadays but fantastic performance.', 'really fast, good performance', "At first I ordered the 9700k and Asus Z390 Prime-A motherboard.You may ask Why ASUS board why not Gigabyte etc? I used to use Asus all my life (beginning from core 2 duo processors or even Pentium 4).So, the system was ready to go and it was fast, quiet desktop with Fractal Design R4 case and Noctua D15 cooler( with two fans).No more fans than stock ones in my FD case (one for intake and other for outtake at the back).I OCed the system to 48Ghz at 1.26 Adaptive voltage or so (I don't remember exact number of voltage but 100% it was lower than 1.3v).And I created my computer and I looked at it and it was nice :)But then I started to view benchmarks, assessments in syntetic tests and noticed that 9700k is faster than 8700k in most cases. It faster than 7820x in most scenarios but....But 9900k is much more faster in rendering, photo editing and streaming tasks. In two words, in those cases where multithreading takes place and all real cores + virtual cores are used at their 100%.And ... I made a decision to purchase 9900k.It's a costly investment but I thought I would sell my current X99 5820k computer + sell 9700k processor.It's as good as done.My 9900k was in my hands and....And only then I discovered from various reviews about bad VRMs out there for medium line ASUS Z390 boards.I was frustrated.How come?Why ASUS did so?Should I buy new motherboard now?My Z390 Prime-A is a medium line MB (in one line with Strix and maybe a little worse than Z390 Maximus Hero).I started to research and came to conclusion (having tons of sources in the net, including video reviews + comments to them, articles, reviews from community etc etc) that my ASUS Z390 Prime-A will be suffice for 9900k with moderate OC. To which extent - this is the question.Will I surrender or try?Am I a risky person?No I am not.But... how hard I wanted to try... I could not control myself and I did it.So... ASUS z390 Prime-A + 9900k + 32Gb 4x8 Corsair Vengence + Noctua D15 + PSU Corsair 650X + two more 140mm fans for my case (one for upper outtake and one additional for front intake)Thermal paste I applied to the processor is Arctic MX2Also, I must specifically note for people who will use the config. I used discreet graphics card (XFX RX 580), I did not use internal graphics. Maybe usage of internal graphics may cost you more in temperatures and wattage.When I first started my computer I entered BIOS andI STRONGLY RECOMMEND YOU TO IT: TURN MCE OFF IN BIOS.This is the most important thing you can do.Why?Main reason to do so is the MCE puts very high default voltage to the processor.Then increase power limits:Long Duration Package Limit is 190WPackage power time window is 2secShort duration power limit is 220W.Current CPU capability is 170%CPU SVID support EnabledVRM Spread Spectrum DisabledSVID Behaviour Typical ScenarioIA AC and IA DC  load lines to 0.01CPU Load Line Level 5 (not sure this parameter works at all due to set previous ones to 0.01)VT-D enabled (ignore if you don't use virtual machines like VmWare or Virtualbox)VMX enabled (ignore if you don't use virtual machines like VmWare or Virtualbox)Now, I played a lot with core multipliers and voltages and came to these results:Core mutlipliers for 2 first cores: 50Core mutlipliers for another 6 cores: 49Cache multiplier 43AVX offset: 3 (I strongly recommend to put this offset)Voltage: Adaptive (I know, many reviewers and commenters do not like adaptive voltage. I like it.)Adaptive Additional Turbo voltage 1.25Adaptive Offset : +0.015For memory I set XMP I profile (3200Ghz 16-18-18-36 2T)For your system these voltages may not be appropriate, all depends on your die's quality.Also I played a lot with offset for the Adaptive voltage (see below why).Now the system is ready to go.My ambient temperature in room is 22 CTests I used:1/ Prime95 Small FFT non-AVX version.30 minutes with 4900 on all cores.CPU package temp (hottest core as usual): 75 CTotal power to processor according to hwInfo utility: 177W (max)2/ Prime 95 Small FFT AVX version30 minutes with 4600 on all coresCPU package temp (hottest core as usual): 76 CTotal power to processor according to hwInfo utility: 179W (max, though I notices some peaks to 181W rarely)Where I played the most was the Prime95 with AVX enabled.The issue was that some cores stopped intermittenly (one or two cores) during full load (in 5 minutes or even in 15 minutes).The community recommend to increase VCore a bit in that case.In the continuous process of playing with all this I came the above voltages.I suppose I could put 50 to all cores and 3 AVX offset and get 80 C temperatures but I did not do it as I don't like so high temps.Of course, with regular apps and even other stress testing apps like Cinebench, Realbench, Aida or Asus Exteme Tuning Utility you do not get those temps at all.I double you can actually load the processor that hard (16 threads with 100% load) with any regular app. Let alone for so continuous time...Also I tuned my fan curves so they spin at 90% when CPU temp goes upper than 65 C.So at high load even so super silent case like Fractal Design R4 is loud like a rocket.This all makes me conclude that all those talks about loose VRMs on these boards are no more than just talks.Of course I don't know for how long the processor + MB will last in my scenarios but it works nice so far (3 weeks) with regular loads: compilation, photo editing, virtual machines etc.From this point I can compare my old computer (Asus X99-E + 5820k overclocked to 4200Ghz) to this new one.Forgot to mention, by the way, I use NVME Samsung 960 EVO 500Gb drive in my system.On older one I used Samsung 860 EVO 500Gb.Everything runs faster, and works blaze faster on newer PC.The system with 5820k even OCed at 4200 was somewhat meditative at moments (maybe old Win7 OS with bunch of trash slowed it down or what).I will make additions to the review when I will have something to add.", 'Pues el pedido tuvo problemas en la aduana en Espa√±a, donde me quer√≠an cobrar 125‚Ç¨ de sobrecostes. habl√© con amaz√≥n y el vendedor la verdad que se hizo responsable de todo. Tard√≥ una semana mas en llegar, pero el problema fue por la aduana. dar todos los datos al vendedor sino quer√©is problemas. El procesador se nota una barbaridad, los test de rendimiento son muy buenos los resultados y el pc ha mejorado bastante. estoy muy contento con el cambio. Ten√≠a un I5 5900K no era para nada malo pero este lo mejora bastante.', "The Intel i9-9900K is an absolute powerhouse of a processor that has exceeded all my expectations. From the moment I installed it in my system, it has consistently delivered unparalleled performance in every task I throw at it.The 8-core, 16-thread architecture of the i9-9900K ensures seamless multitasking, effortlessly handling resource-intensive applications, gaming, and content creation with ease. It's a beast of a processor that never breaks a sweat, even under heavy workloads.Gaming on the i9-9900K is an absolute joy. It provides smooth frame rates, eliminates stuttering, and drastically reduces loading times, creating an immersive gaming experience like no other. This CPU truly lets you unleash the full potential of your high-end graphics card.", "Un 9900K √† 5ghz pour tirer les derni√®res cartouches de ma plateforme 1151 . L'oc dynamique d'intel par d√©faut fait tr√®s bien le caf√© , avec de la ram √† 3200 14/34/1t . Ca chauffe un peu sur du lourd .", "I bought two of these CPU's for system builds. They worked flawlessly in 3 different systems. Clocking them at 5Ghz is easy. But you will need a good cooling fan or a water-cooled system if you want them to last.", 'Changed from an i5 9700k and runs everything beautifully', 'A worthy upgrade. Glad I could get my hands on this before it went out of stock again :)', "if your looking at buying this now in 2023,, don't as there are cheaper faster processors now. It is a great processor, but cost too much now with whats available."]

Product: Intel Core i7-10700 Desktop Processor 8 Cores up to 4.8 GHz LGA 1200 (Intel 400 Series Chipset) 65W, BX8070110700
Reviews: ['Works like a charm after upgrading my Acer PC', 'Just installed my i7-10700 in a Gigabyte Z490 Aorus Elite and paired with 32GB Corsair Vengeance LPX (2666) with zero issues. Great performance bump over my previous i7-6700, running at similar temps as well. Idles around 28-32C and HeavyLoad stress test bumps it up to 66-68C using a BeQuiet Pure Rock Slim, Arctic Cooling MX-4, and the motherboard\'s "silent" fan curve for the CPU.If you\'re a stock cooler user that still cares about aesthetics, good news! The stock cooler with the i7-10700 is blacked out, has a sleeved fan cable, and has a copper slug.At the moment, the other reviews imply that they got a tampered product. That may very well be since I can\'t actually hold their product and verify for myself, but I\'ll offer an alternative view on this-- The sticker on my box looked exactly like these others\' pictures, and I\'m 100% sure it was not physically tampered with upon close inspection.  In fact, this sticker does NOT even appear to be the multi-layer type of tamper-evident stickers. When I tried to peel the sticker in various ways, all it ever did was tear the underlying paper/cardboard along with it. It seems like this was merely a case of the "factory sealed" lettering not being uniformly printed onto the sticker, or possibly even rubbed off of the exterior, and nothing more. (A gentle fingernail scrape wiped away the letters easily for me)', "Many reviews mention they received a tampered with box. The Made in Vietnam version of this cpu arrives in a box that has it's tamper seal printed backwards -- meaning the paint that is supposed to come off when you rip open the seal is printed on the outside of the seal, so the paint wears out from rubbing against other boxes in shipment and against shipping material, which makes it appear that the box was opened. It however was not and the cpu is brand new. I purchase multiple Intel chips and I noticed this right away after reading the reviews and receiving my cpu with a rubbed out seal too -- if you use your nail you can see that the paint will come right off -- however if you open the seal it will not stay on the box since it is printed on the outside of the seal. Hence, the CPUs are not tampered with, just an issue with how they created those seals. As to the misalignment of the cpu in the box -- this is something that almost always happens in Intel cpus and is not something to be wary of. The CPU i received performs top notch on a z490 motherboard, with 4889 R20 score.", "I decided to base my new DAW on this processor and I'm glad I did.  Using Cubase 10.5 I am only seeing about 25% of the processor being used at any given time.  I don't intend to use this computer for anything else but it is imperative that it be quiet.I used the Intel supplied cooler for a couple of days but in benchmarking the processor got up to 100C (212F!).  That's crazy hot.  That was WITH thermal throttling.I replaced the wimpy cooler with a 150W TDP one.  Telling BIOS that you installed a tower cooler (automatically) raises the TDP to 125W.  No more throttling and never gets above 60C.  (Pretty amazing for a $25 cooler I think.). The fan is inaudible from a foot away.Rendering my projects now takes mere seconds rather than minutes.  I like that.  But my basic reason for building a new computer was reliability.  I was using a 10 year old HP desktop.", 'I think this processor is the unsung hero of the entire 10th gen product launch.  It has a slightly lower TDP, so it is not a furnace in the case like some of the other 10th gen processors (I\'m using a dual tower air cooler without issues).  With a little bios adjustment and a Z series motherboard, you can adjust the BCLK slightly higher and extend the turbo boosting to get 97% of a regular unlocked "K" CPU at a significantly lower price.  I use it with DDR4 3600 memory, and I\'d be hard pressed to notice a difference between my old 9900k and this CPU in regular usage.If you want to spend an extra $100-200 for that last 3-5% of performance that you\'d get out of an unlocked 10700k or 10900k, so be it, but this is a good alternative for the budget conscious Intel fan looking for higher end performance.', "J'ai achet√© ce processeur pour remplacer mon i5 6600k et je suis franchement pas de√ßue mon utilisation en jeux a pass√© de 100% a 25% je joue en 1440p 144hz. Les point positif sont: perfomance dans le gaming assez incroyable. Je ne comprend pas pk ce cpu est pas mis en valeur. La cadence de base est √† 2.9ghz et en turbo a 4.8ghz si vous voulez pas overclock c'est un super produit et vous n'√™tes pas obliger d'avoir une z490 comme carte m√®re donc le rapport qualit√© prix est tr√®s bon. Seul default est le cpu cooler d'intel quand je game il peut facilement monter a 80 degr√©s m√™me 90 et j'ai beaucoup de fan dans mon pc. Alors un cpu cooler est recommand√© a mon avis. Sinon j'ai eu quelque probl√®me et le vendeur Aero malls ma tr√®s bien dirig√© au final c'etait une autre pi√®ce qui posait probl√®me.Si vous voulez pas overclock je vois pas l'utilit√© d'avoir le 10700k.Aucun probl√®me avec mon processeur je suis tr√®s content de mon achat.", 'Powerful processer for less', "It's been around 3-4 years since my purchase of i7-6700kand because I recently got a 4k cintiq causing lots of lag when workingwith photoshop, I thought I needed a cpu upgrade.I am so glad I decided to get this cause the price was $309.99 + taxwhich is less than the 10700k version but it still reaches 4.58 Ghz on myAsus Prime B460-plus mobo without me tweaking manually.My photoshop has never felt this light before.If you are someone who needs to work with large psd fileswith lots of layers, this is a great choice without breaking your bank accountprobably the best shopping I've done this year so far", 'Gut verpackt. Den L√ºfter kann man sich sparen. Jeder baut heutzutage einen besseren ein. Gut falls man noch keinen hat.', 'Well it works great because I did not have a choice. The mini board required an Intel Chip and this is the best fit. However, if it was a choice I would have selected the Ryzen 7 3700X for the same size mother board with the choice of a Ryzen chip. This does not mean the Intel i7 was a bad choice there are worse choices out there.']

Product: Intel Core i7 (12th Gen) i7-12700 Dodeca-core (12 Core) 2.10 GHz Processor - Retail Pack
Reviews: ['Llego muy bien, resguardado, adem√°s hasta ahora funciona bien, llego r√°pido y todo perfecto', 'Perfetto', 'Tout', "I'm using the stock Intel cooler that came with my 12700 and the highest I hit in games is about 79c, most of the time is stays in the low 70s. Idle temps stay in the 30s. That's with the cpu wattage unlocked and raising the pl1 and pl2 settings a bit in the bios and a single intake and single exhaust fan in a mid size case. I learned a long time ago that ambient room temp and fan curves are very important. You want to exhaust as much hot air as you can out of the case as fast as possible. You can mount a skyscraper to your CPU and have 12 case fans, if your room temp is high and you don't set proper fan curves, you'll still run hot. I don't care about cinebench or other benchmarks, most games people play and apps people use on a daily basis will never stress the CPU anywhere near what a benchmark will. If you do a lot of heavy video editing and conversion work and raise your wattage limits way up then yes go for a higher end cooling solution .Edit: I've since installed an Intel RH1 cooler (the one that comes with the i9) on this chip and it dropped my temps by an average of about 8c. I know I can buy a third party cooler but I don't want a huge cpu cooler in my case and I don't want to play with brackets that may not fit 100% correctly. You can find new RH1 coolers on ebay for pretty cheap.", "quite fast I think based on CPUZ score, but it looks like the stock fan is not enough it can get 85+c on cpuz stress test, idles around 40c +- 5c,  my case has 4 fans and my room is 22-24c. I had a hard time fitting the stock fan on the motherboard, the pins would not go in easily so I had to remove it a few times I'm wondering if that affected the thermal paste so I might add some more and try again.", 'La verdad NO ten√≠a altas espectativas debido a que la frecuencia base me parec√≠a muy baja (@2.1 ghz), sin embargo haciendo algunos test de rendimiento, rapidamente los nucleos subian a 4.3 ghz sin mucho esfuerzo aparente. Los resultados de los benchmark fueron muy altos y la temperatura muy bien gestionada. Estoy contento con este i7 12700... Trabajo con Edici√≥n de video profesional.The truth is I did NOT have high expectations because the base frequency seemed very low (@2.1 ghz), however doing some performance tests, the cores quickly went up to 4.3 ghz without much apparent effort, the benchmark results were very high and temperature very well managed. I am happy with this i7 12700', 'A√∫n me falta por exprimirlo al 100%, pero todo apunta a ser un gran procesador para juegos.', "Fast and the graphics are serviceable. Only downside is you can't overclock it. I ended up getting a separate graphics card anyway so I should have gotten the 12700k or kf so I could overclock. Still very fast for anything I want to do.", 'This processor is a great deal for the money.', 'Parfait']

Product: Intel Core i9-12900KF Desktop Processor 16 (8P+8E) Cores up to 5.2 GHz Unlocked¬† LGA1700 600 Series Chipset 125W
Reviews: ['me gusta el procesador no se calienta tanto como otros de competencia y la calidad es superior los Intel siempre en la vanguardia', 'qualit√© prix', 'Upgrading from an i5-9400F which has seen a huge improvement. The days of seeing my CPU usage at 100% several times throughout the day are gone.I‚Äôm using an NZXT 360 Kraken AIO cooler and the temps are pretty solid, through normal use it‚Äôs at about 40 degrees Celsius, and through gaming it reaches about 48. My room is generally around 24 degrees ambient temperature in the summer.', 'If you buy a 12th or 13th gen Intel CPU, understand that you‚Äôre buying a chip that has a serious design flaw. The LGA 1700 contact pressure is nothing to overlook, and I wish I had of known about it before my purchase. It puts so much pressure on the chip that it flexes it to the point that you‚Äôll have serious thermal performance issues. I‚Äôm talking 100c+ temps under load. There is a fix though: uninstall the cpu bracket on your motherboard, purchase an aftermarket CPU contact frame and install it. No more temp issues. Buying a high end chip and having to alter my motherboard with an aftermarket product just doesn‚Äôt sit well with me. Stay away from 12th and 13th gen Intel CPUs, or buy a contact frame with it.', 'I got this over a 13th Gen since it is now fairly inexpensive and still plenty fast.  I am using the Asus ROG Strix z690-E mobo so I should be able to upgrade to 13th Gen when those come down in price.  This CPU needs a good cooler, I am using a ARCTIC Liquid Freezer II 360 with Thermal Grizzly Kryonaut.  I am dual booting Linux and Win10 though I am running games mostly on Steam under Linux.  Works surprisingly well.', 'It\'s a good CPU, able to game and do the productive stuff. I paired it with DDR5. People say it gets hot but I haven\'t found that even though I\'m only using a Noctua air cooler. Those little E cores actually do some work, and of course the P cores are fast. It\'s funny that the E cores are considered "efficiency cores" because they do use a lot of power.I think most consumers should get a 12700k or 12600k rather than this since they\'ll do just as well in games and since you can upgrade in less than a year. If you are running an app that uses all 16 cores, like a minecraft editor, then you may want to go for this 12900k, especially if you can find a sale.I\'ve been playing Flight Sim 2020, Cyberpunk, Dota and Minecraft Java quite a bit with this and the only place it\'s weak is flightsim. That\'s not really the CPU\'s fault though because Flightsim is a very poorly written game which bottlenecks on the main thread. It\'s actually an argument for the KS version of this CPU. But alas, even I have limits.', "i was a devoted AMD fan, until the X570 Ace started bothering me with the dreaded USB issue, after trying serval fixes, including Bios updates that came promising to fix the issue, also am a system builder since 2005, and as my part time business I build high end systems, and seeing how many stability issues AMD has from time to time I wanted to just give Intel a chance, and am glad i did, this is now in my main system, along with my trusty FTW3 3080, had to upgrade my motherboard and went with a Z690 Aero D, DDR5, am really happy with it, saw a noticeable improvement over the AMD with DDR5, at 1080p 1440p and 4k, but mainly I saw a great improvement in VR, i have to bring up that this isn't an advisable upgrade if you are running anything new gen, like AMD 5k or Intel 10th or 11th, as the differences will be negligible, but if you are in the market for the best right now, nothing that AMD offers at the moment competes as far as single core, or multi core for the most part, and ironically this time intel offers better value, good times indeed.", "I just did a build with a Z690 MB and this CPU (along with dual RTX 3090 cards).Easy build - everything worked great.  I also bought a Noctua NH-D15S chromax cooler, and I run Linux with conky showing all the cores and their temps.  It's pretty interesting to wathc all the p-cores and e-cores do their thing.I know that Windows knows what to do with these different types of cores, and as far as I can tell, running kernel 5.4.0-135, so does Linux.Great CPU.", 'While I was away on a deployment I wanted to come back home to a little PC project, but wanted to build something more high-end (my previous build being an i7-9700K and 2080 Super). Luckily I heard about this i9 getting on the market and I was looking at the Ryzen 5900X, but I had a good experience with my previous Intel CPU (Nothing bad with the couple Ryzen builds I‚Äôve had either).Anyways, long story short I built this heavy PC and the CPU has been an awesome choice! I paired it with my MSI Gaming X Trio 3080 Ti and an Samsung Odyssey G7 32‚Äù monitor and thing consistently gets to the 240 fps the monitor is capable of.Here are some pics of the build. I‚Äôve since moved the drain plug to the bottom rad since it was impractical to have it on the pump, but I saw a vid with it there so I sort of Lemming‚Äôd on that.üòÇ Enjoy!', 'FAST CPU, Great Value for the Power!!!']

Product: AMD Ryzen 3 3200G 4-Core Unlocked Desktop Processor with Radeon Graphics
Reviews:
["I have this CPU on an Asus A320I-K Mini-ITX motherboard and I am using it as a living room PC. Since it has a very capable integrated graphics, I need not put in a graphics card even though that still remains as an option if I want to upgrade in the future. This CPU handles 1080p video perfectly and even 4K UHD which is very impressive considering the price and efficiency of this CPU.I am also running it on Linux Mint 19 and it runs it perfectly and is very smooth and fast. However it took some troubleshooting as I wanted to get wake-on-lan (WOL) to work. Turns out that the hardware is all fine, and I just had to use a specific Linux kernel and after that, WOL worked perfectly fine. I can use an app on my smartphone to remotely wake up the computer.I've been using it for 2 months now and not a single problem has emerged thus far. A huge upgrade to the previous Intel Core 2 Quad that used to power our HTPC.", 'Powerful processor with excellent graphics capabilities for mild gaming.  Perfect for energy sipping family PC.', 'Es incre√≠ble me lleg√≥ en perfecto estado y funciona al 100 mi mejor elecci√≥n', 'O processador para uso dom√©stico n√£o tem melhor. Uma velocidade de processamento muito boa e a GPU atende para as tarefas cotidianas. J√° para jogos pesados fica devendo, mas d√° para se divertir em muito jogos com a resolu√ß√£o menor. Estou muito satisfeito, at√© porque o intuito n√£o √© jogar e sim trabalhar e estudar. Despois que passei a usar AMD, fiquei muito mais satisfeito por n√£o precisar trocar a placa m√£e toda vez que muda o processador.', 'The media could not be loaded.
                



\xa0I'm building several computers to use in my dental practice and I wanted something compact yet powerful for running dental imaging software, web browsing, YouTube and practice management software. My goal was not to build a high-end gaming rig. This computer is not for overclocking either. If you want a gaming rig go build one. If you need something that runs everyday work continue reading. Also, I'm AMD fan.BUILD SETUP:1. AMD Ryzen 3 3200G with Radeon Graphics APU (4 core CPU with Radeon Graphics). 65 W TDP and max temp 95 C. ($91.95).2. Gigabyte B450 I AORUS PRO WIFI (AMD Ryzen AM4/M.2 Thermal Guard with Onboard Wifi/HDMI/DP/USB 3.1 Gen 2/Mini ITX/Motherboard) ($141.12).3. Sabrent 256GB Rocket NVMe PCIe M.2 2280 Internal SSD High Performance Solid State Drive (SB-ROCKET-256)  ($46.99)4. Corsair Vengeance LPX 16GB (2x8GB) DDR4 DRAM 3200MHz C16 Desktop Memory Kit - Black (CMK16GX4M2B3200C16),Vengeance LPX Black ($73.99)5. Logitech MK270 Wireless Keyboard and Mouse Combo - Keyboard and Mouse Included, 2.4GHz Dropout-Free Connection, Long Battery Life (Frustration-Free Packaging) ($20.99)6. InWin Chopin SECC Mini-ITX Tower Case 150W Power Supply with 4 colors stickers inside, Black Aluminum  ($90.34)7. 24" DisplayPROS:1. The case has an amazing build quality. It feels premium with the black aluminum material. High quality finish and sturdy.2. Small form factor. Quite portable.3. AMD Ryzen 3 3200G is quite powerful for everything you throw at it. The nice part is that it has a built-in Radeon GPU so you can use the motherboard display out to power your displays. It supports 4K. It has 2 HDMI and 1 Display Port!4. Sabrent NVME is incredible. Windows 10 boots in 10-12 sec! Price is unbelievable.5. Built-in WiFi AC with antenna and Bluetooth 5.0. I love motherboards that have those!6. The case comes with 150 PSU. AMD with Radeon is max at 65 W so you wont be running the PSU at max. No noise from PSU and the CPU cooler fan is silent under normal operation.CONS:The case wont fit the AMD Wraith Silent cooler, without a slight modification.SOLUTION:It won't fit unless you remove the top bracket. Yes, it can fit!! It took me some time to figure it out and I wanted to share this with everyone. The stock AMD Wraith Silent cooler fits this case after you remove the top bracket from the fan. See pictures and video attached. The benefit is that you don't have to buy a separate cooler. I found that Noctua $39.90 is way too much to spend so that pushed me to figure out a solution.Plus the AMD cooler is bigger and since the fan is so close to the side panel. It will force air out of the case through the mesh.EXPERIENCE:Motherboard:The Gigabyte motherboard is incredible. The UEFI BIOS is graphics with mouse support. It came with latest BIOS revision 50 out of the box. Good job Gigabyte! (Hint: if you want to upgrade your BIOS do not do it from Windows. Always do it from the BIOS menu so no bricks). Windows 10 had no issues installing or running. All drivers installed without a problem. Radeon drivers worked out of the box. Also Miracast works on this APU with drivers 20.xx. I was able to wireless cast HDMI to a Anycast dongle and mirror my desktop.Boot time is 10-12 seconds! If your display is on standby and you push the power button by the time the monitor wakes up you're at Windows login screen. Unbelievable speed! WiFi and BT are great and coupled with 16 GB of RAM the GPU takes 2 GB and the rest is dedicated to Windows. Performance is great. It also supports Windows secure boot and other gems. Everything is so smooth.CPU Heat:Under idle conditions, the CPU temperature is around 28 C. With load you probably hit 40-50 C. I did not do extensive testing. Remember this is APU based on Zen+ architecture so it's not a 7nm APU. Hopefully, we get newer Zen 2 APUs from AMD. I love AMD !Overclocking:I do not do overclocking. My goal is usually to reduce power consumption if possible and have a quite system. The default AMD boost is way more than enough for my needs. I hate when people trash companies and motherboard because of VRM and such. If you want to overclock get a higher end and more expensive motherboard but let us enjoy those gems like the Gigabyte B450 I AORUS PRO WIFI.NOISE:Not so much. See the video. PSU does not make sound either. I tested it by unplugging the CPU fan to see. In fact that this case comes with PSU at this price is so cool. I wish more companies offer that.PERFORMANCE:If you need a computer that does everyday work you wont be disappointed. This setup is quite light and has AMD technologies. Thank you In Win Chopin for this wonderful case!', 'Processador excelente e boa rela√ß√£o custo/benef√≠cio. √â a terceira maquina que monto com esse processador e todos os clientes satisfeitos.E agrade√ßo a Amazon pela entrega a jato! Muito eficiente!', 'Bom custo e benef√≠cio. Modelo de processador que dispensa uma placa de v√≠deo, caso n√£o queira usar uma.', "Good cpu it won't burn ur pocket to buy one", '', 'En su momento cumpli√≥ su funci√≥n.']

Product: Intel Core i5-13400 Desktop Processor 10 cores (6 P-cores + 4 E-cores) 20MB Cache, up to 4.6 GHz (BX8071513400)
Reviews: ['Estaba un poco preocupado porque no hab√≠a actualizaci√≥n del producto desde Amazon, ten√≠a que ir directo con el servicio contratado y ah√≠ estaba. Pero dentro del pedido hay una nota que te informa al respecto.Tambi√©n hab√≠a un dulce de regalo.El empaque ven√≠a muy bien protegido, lleg√≥ el mismo d√≠a estimado. El producto en excelente condiciones. Estoy contento con la compra.', 'Works great with a dual fan 4070 in small SFF builds where you have limited cooler clearance height. Noctua L9i 47mm air cooler works great and keeps temps around 33C idle- 68C under synthetic load. 64-66C during extended gaming. No undervolting enabled, which could improve temps more if desired.', '„Ç≥„Çπ„ÉëÊäúÁæ§„ÅÆÊÄßËÉΩ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ', "This CPU is a superb, i build my system without any GPU and it performed very well on some new games.It's very fast for work, multimedia etc...Now i add a 6750 XT to my system and my PC is so very fast now (Ultra settings in all games without problems). CPU never overheat (and i leave in a hot country). Thanks Intel !", 'This CPU is great for an always-on machine. Low power draw, low fan speed idle, cool idle temps and not getting above 60C after 1h at full load. The power savings alone will pay for replacing a much older system, with the added benefit of all modern features, speed, virtualization etc.', 'value and efficiency are my priorities for cpus and this one does both.  not interested in any overclocking but do like the peace of mind of having the iGPU in case something goes wrong with main GPU.  as long as ur mostly sticking to gaming this one will be more than enough and wont need an expensive cooler to keep in from overheating.  stock one in the box kinda ugly tho so id still pick up a cheap 3rd party one with some rgb.', "This is a great processor for the price, I spent around $200 on it at the time of purchase. It's a good midrange option for building a pc and comes with a fan. The processor comes pre applied with a small bit of thermal paste but I'd wipe it off and re apply a new one.", "This was used in a mitx build with a 4070 ti and doesn't seem to have any issues with playing FFXIV (DX11) at 1400p @ 75 fps (monitor cap) with everything turned on. Went with DDR5 as the prices have dropped dramatically from when many of the reviews were written and it provides an additional performance gain over ddr4 (for longevity purposes as if say a stick goes bad in 2 years, it'll be cheaper and easier to find replacement ddr5 than ddr4). It's not my personal system so I can't provide additional details on its performance.", 'So i have installed on a new motherboard but havent gotten the build done yet will update once completed.', 'ÊôÆÈÄö']

Product: Thermal Grizzly Intel 12th Gen CPU Contact Frame
Reviews: ["Presque tout est dans le titre. C'est tout de m√™me un peu cher pour un produit aussi basique (quoi que fait avec une grande pr√©cision). Il est FORTEMENT conseill√© d'utiliser un tournevis dynamom√©trique (chez le roi des bo√Ætiers) pour la fixation √† la carte m√®re (entre 0.6 et 1 Nm) afin de garantir une pression strictement √©gale de tous les c√¥t√©s (la raison d'√™tre de ce produit).", 'I run a 13600K in an NZXT H1 (ver 2). That 140mm AIO does it‚Äôs darndest, but even under full power (undervolted and power limited to 105 watts for PL2) it can‚Äôt help but thermal throttle or erratically spike into the 90‚Äôs when I‚Äôm gaming. It‚Äôs honestly not too bad, but with this contact frame, I was seeing much better temps and regularity (less spikes and less dramatic spikes). I‚Äôve only done limited testing with one game, but I was much more comfortably hovering in the high 60‚Äôs to low 70‚Äôs rather than the high 70‚Äôs throughout a long gaming session. Very happy with this frame and with the instructions included.', 'Da ich meine K√ºhlleistung optimieren wollte habe ich mir dieses Produkt bestellt. Ich bin sehr zufrieden, da ich locker einige Grade meiner CPU senken konnte. Mit der Kombination einer Aio oder einer Custom Wasserk√ºhlung ein Top Produkt mit der man seine Temperatur gut in den Griff bekommen kann. Vor der Installation des CPU K√ºhlers, den PC kurz starten um zu schauen ob genug Druck auf der CPU vorhanden ist, da bei zu viel / zu wenig Druck zb. die RAM Riegel nicht erkannt werden k√∂nnen!', "I really didn't expect this thing to improve my OC that much but it blew me away.Installation is nice and simple and just re-uses the same screws as the Motherboad ILM but just needs you to take your time as precision is going to be far more helpful than anything else.I was running 6GHz single core able to push out ~275W when stress testing that ended up with some cores hitting 100C and others not even hitting 90C on a 13700K with a Arctic Liquid Freezer II 360 scoring 31550 in Cinebench R23After installing I'm now hitting 6.1GHz stable, my Cinebench score bumped up to 32180, spikes up over 300W and my core to core delta is under 10C and all core loads only hit 100C after lengthy stress testing like 30 minutes of Cinebench R23 or Prime 95.I hear that it can also help with RAM overclocking as evening out the pressure on the IHS eases off the memory controller but so maybe that's the next adventure.", 'This is fantastic and dropped my thermals by 5‚Å∞ under load, no real change on idle or light productivity use.One real issue is they even state to add reference marks on the screws but not everyone has a white chalk pencil or fine tip paint marker lying around. Maybe including mil lines on the screws or throwing in a little marking utensil. Torquing in nm is like trying to catch a greased pig unless you have a $200 Klein nm torque screwdriver', "Install wasn't as hard as people say, I recommend using the original ILM screws instead of the ones Thermal Grizzly includes however.", "I didn't realize how OCD I was with thermal paste, and liquid metal ... until I took the stock cpu mount off.This looks so much cleaner and is much more usable and practical to use.Intel Core i9-12900KF runs super cool, with Corsair H100x RGB Elite Liquid CPU Cooler.Stays cool, even with overclocking.Must buy", 'M¬πy pc was going above 100 C when tested using Prime95 for15 minutes with the original cpu  holder.  With the Grizzly the temps got no higher than 86 degrees C with the same Prime95 test. Make sure to follow the directions in the manufactures youtube video for best results.  Also use the new supplied screws because the old screws may be too short.', "Item did as described. Highly recommend watching Gamer Nexus or Der8auer EN on YouTube for a quick and easy tutorial.As the tutorial described, do not over tighten the screws. If you purchased Thermal Grizzley's Contact frame (cheaper knock offs do not have these laser etchings), it comes lazer-etched with incremental tightening markers.Highly recommend for a smooth thermal contact and protect your 12th, 13th and 14th Gen Intel CPUs.", 'I have an Intel 13700k paired with a 280mm Arctic Liquid Freezer II AIO cooler. I was regularly hitting 100c and throttling during benchmarks, and Cinebench stress testing. I added the contact frame, and after running cinebench r23  on a loop for around 35 mins my temps have maxed around 85C.So I‚Äôve been able to get a consistent -15c lower temp under these conditions, never over 30c while idle.Now I can finally get my 13700k to run with sustained boost clocks and get the full performance out of my CPU with even a little room for a slight overclock.If you‚Äôre running into thermal issues and thinking about getting this just do it.There‚Äôs cheaper options with similar performance, but I choose to support thermal grizzly and high quality German manufacturing over cheap Chinese bs every day of the week.']

Product: Intel Core i5-12600K 12. Generation Desktop Prozessor (Basistakt: 3.7GHz Turboboost: 4.9GHz, 6 Kerne, LGA1700, RAM DDR4 und DDR5 bis zu 128GB) BX8071512600K
Reviews: ['tudu ok100% original  e funcionando', "L'ho abbinato ad una scheda madre Asus Prime Z690-P Wifi, non ha mai dato problemi anche la scheda video integrata anche se ha un limite mi ha dato belle soddisfazioni nel periodo di attesa di una scheda video dedicata. Non ho fatto overclock per il momento.Come dissipatore ho istallato un noctua NH U12s Redux ad aria che senza overclock e su stress test su cinebench non ha mai superato i 60¬∞.Avevo pensato di mettere un correttore di flessione della Cpu ma alla fine ho pensato che la spesa non valesse i soldi spesi meglio forse investirli per un dissipatore migliore...Si tratta di un buon prodotto lo consiglierei ma dipende sempre a quale tipo di utilizzo devi sottoporre.", 'Dopo un piccolo diguido burocratico senza conseguenze, √® arrivato in anticipo. Installato su MSI PRO Z690-A DD4, essendo un processore K, non bloccato, si pu√≤ overcloccare. Di per s√® √® meglio di molti della serie  i7  che costano di pi√π. Slot LGA 1700. Buon prodotto.', 'expected more efficenct then ole i5 4440.  somewhat better but not alot that is noticable to average user.', 'Chegou r√°pido', 'Der "Intel Core i5-12600K 12. Generation Desktop Prozessor (Schwarz, Basistakt: 3.7GHz Turboboost: 4.9GHz, 6 Kerne, LGA1700, RAM DDR4 und DDR5 bis zu 128GB) BX8071512600K" wurde im letztem Jahr zu einem damaligem Spitzenpreis bei Amazon gekauft.Monate sp√§ter wurde die Hauptplatine, ASUS Prime Z690-P WiFi D4 f√ºr Verwendung mit DDR4 Arbeitsspeicher, gekauft und der Prozessor darauf eingebaut. Gekr√∂nt wurde das Ganze mit einem Akasa L√ºfter, der f√ºr die 125W TDP Spezifikation konstruiert wurde.Zus√§tzlich ist auf der Hauptplatine eine ASUS Thunderbolt 4 Einbaukarte vorhanden.Die automatische Steuerung der Leistungsverbesserung des Prozessors kann in dem BIOS der Hauptplatine noch beeinflusst werden oder abgeschaltet bleiben.Seit dem 26. November 2022 l√§uft das Rechnersystem hier ohne Beanstandungen, mit einem Betriebssystem basierend auf einem Linuxkernel.Ob t√§gliche Textverarbeitung, das Schneiden von Filmen im UHD Format oder das √úbersetzen von Programmen in Quelltext zu Maschinensprache, alles funktioniert tadellos.F√ºr den hier gedachten Einsatzzweck ist dieser Prozessor vollkommen ausreichend und kann f√ºr intensive Anwendungen empfohlen werden.', 'Veramente ottimo', 'bien recu, bien emball√©.', 'Tr√®s bon processeur avec ses multiples coeur de derni√®re g√©n√©ration excellent pour les jeux comme pour du montage ou autre il est tr√®s polyvalent et c est ce qui le diff√©rencie des autres i5', 'I benchmarked this using an industry standard tool. It performed well above expectations.I recommend.']

Product: Intel Core i3 (10th Gen) i3-10105 Quad-core (4 Core) 3.70 GHz Processor - Retail Pack
Reviews: ['From 4 cores to 8 threads. Pair with a good gpu and play any FHD and AAA game.', '„Ç≤Ôºç„É†„Åó„Å™„ÅÑ„ÅÆ„ÅßÊôÆÈÄö„Å´‰Ωø„Å£„Å¶„Åæ„Åô', 'Á¨¨ÔºëÔºê‰∏ñ‰ª£„ÅÆ„ÇØ„Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éâ„Ç≥„Ç¢\u3000Ôºî„Ç≥„Ç¢Ôºò„Çπ„É¨„ÉÉ„Éâ\u3000FF14„ÅÆ„Éô„É≥„ÉÅ„Éû„Éº„ÇØ\u3000„Çπ„Ç≥„Ç¢ÔºíÔºï√ó√ó„Åß„Åó„ÅüÔºàÂø´ÈÅ©„Å´„Éó„É¨„Ç§„Åô„Çã„Å´„ÅØ\u3000„Ç∞„É©„Éú„ÅåÂøÖË¶ÅÔºüÔºâ', 'Llego un d√≠a despu√©s pero no importa,  empaque completo y sellado de fabrica , trae su disipador original,  excelente compra lo recomiendo para todos los que iniciamos en el pc , ya q trae gr√°ficos integrados', "It is a good CPU for an office build or budget based build. It works well enough for the day to day casual use, media consumption, surfing, good with Office docs and such. The integrated graphics are sufficient for your typical static screen stuff. Video playback on full screen for movies can show its limitations and the graphics on this model just hit the last supported driver update, but that really shouldn't matter.Using this for an office build that I already had most of the parts from upgrading another PC. This is more powerful than the mobile CPU I was using in the laptop. It is cool, quiet*, and 'good enough' to drive daily for now without feeling like I am waiting around. Certainly not the fastest thing around but expected performance level to skew and pricing. This one is cheaper than its slower 10100 counterpart and ever so slightly faster.*The stock fan coming with is a plus, but stock Intel fans, and particularly before the refresh are pretty terrible for performance and noise generation. It is not that I would suggest doing so, but I had a leftover Noctua low profile 92mm (fan) cooler that I put on this and it works REALLY well for it. The cooler cost nearly half the price of this i3 CPU, so I am not recommending you do so, per se...but ANY half decent aftermarket cooler is going to work better and be quieter while doing so.", 'Good CPU for everyday tasks, runs Minecraft around 118 FPS 1080p.', 'KLEVV „Éá„Çπ„ÇØ„Éà„ÉÉ„ÉóPCÁî® „É°„É¢„É™ DDR4 2666 PC4-21300 8GB x 2ÊûöÔºãASUS PRIME H410M-AÔºã Core i3-10105 „ÅÆ3ÁÇπ„Çª„ÉÉ„Éà„ÅßË≥ºÂÖ•„ÄÇ‰ª•Ââç„ÅåASUS„ÅÆMB„Å®i5-4570+„É°„É¢„É™8G„Åßwin10„Åß‰Ωø„Å£„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åü„ÇÇ„ÅÆ„Çí„Ç±„Éº„Çπ„Å®ÈõªÊ∫êÔºã„Çπ„Éà„É¨„Éº„Ç∏Á≥ª„ÅØ„Åù„ÅÆ„Åæ„Åæ„ÅßÂÖ•„ÇåÊõø„Åàwin10„Åã„Çâwin11„Å´„Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éó„Éá„Éº„Éà„ÅßÂïèÈ°åÁÑ°„ÅèÂãï„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ‰∏ª„Å™Áî®ÈÄîÁöÑ„ÅØ„É©„Ç∏„Ç™Áï™ÁµÑ„ÇíCMÊäú„Åç„ÇÑÈÄöË≤©„Ç≥„Éº„Éä„ÉºÊäú„Åç„ÅÆÁ∑®ÈõÜ„Å®m4a„Åã„Çâmp3„Å´Â§âÊèõ„Åô„Çã„ÅÆ„Å´‰Ωø„Å£„Å¶„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇi5„ÅÆ4‰∏ñ‰ª£„Åß„ÇÇ„Åù„Çå„Å™„Çä„Å´‰Ωø„Åà„Åü„Åå‚Äù„É©„Ç∏„Åì„Çå‚Äù„Åß‰∏ÄÂ∫¶„Å´6Áï™ÁµÑ„Çím4a„Åã„Çâmp3„Å´Â§âÊèõ„Åô„ÇãÈöõ„Å´„ÅØÈÅï„ÅÑ„ÅØÂàÜ„Åã„Çä„Åæ„Åô„Å≠„ÄÇ„Ç≤„Éº„É†„Çí„Åó„Å™„ÅÑ„ÅÆ„Åß„Åó„Å∞„Çâ„Åè„ÅØ„Åì„Çå„ÅßÂçÅÂàÜ„Å†„Å®ÊÄù„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ', '„Ç≤„Éº„É†„ÇÇÂØæÂøúÂá∫Êù•„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´ÊúÄ‰ΩéÈôê„ÅÆ„ÇÇ„ÅÆ„Å´„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Åü„Åå„ÄÅ„Åï„Åô„Åå„ÅÆÂÆâÂÆö„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ„Ç∞„É©„Éú„Å™„Åó„Åß„Åô„Åå„ÄÅË∂ÖËªΩ„ÅÑ„Ç≤„Éº„É†„Å™„Çâ„Éó„É¨4Á®ãÂ∫¶„ÅÆ„É™„Éï„É¨„ÉÉ„Ç∑„É•„É¨„Éº„ÉàÂá∫„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ', 'it is a used cpu , even has old paste on top not clean', 'The purpose I bought this trustworthy CPU because I try to rebuild the RAID, but I then turn around using Windows soft RAID. As everyone know, good product, reliable company.']

Product: Intel Core i9-10900 Desktop Processor 10 Cores up to 5.2 GHz LGA 1200 (Intel 400 Series Chipset) 65W
Reviews:
['24 degrees when doing average office work but running one of my batch file processing programs kicks it up to around 48 degrees almost instantly... and it stays there till I am done.Stability is great but I may consider AMD a bit more on my next build.', 'Wanted to build a powerful mini PC to run Abaqus-CAE, and I paired this CPU with Asrock Deskmini H470W because this is the most powerful CPU this barebone system can support.The H470W runs on a 120W Adapter and this I9-10900 (TDP 65W) works just fine. This little beast has the raw computing power that cut the average Abaqus analysis time by 50% compared with my other laptop sports by I5 1035G7.Yet powerful, this is still a TDP 65W CPU and the heat is very manageable for a mini PC that has less than 2 liter interior volume. I paired it with Noctua NH-L9i and the temperature is about 86 degrees C under heavy load.Below is the component list.H470W Barebone system with 120W AC adapterI9-10900CPU with Noctua NH-L9iM.2 Hynix 1TB SSD32GB DDR4 SO-DIMMIt is amazing I can add such a powerful CPU into a tiny barebone system.Very happy with this CPU, highly recommended.', "This cpu is one of the best I have in my home. Currently there is an 8th gen i5, 10th gen i7, 10th gen i9, and a Ryzen 5 3600. During that time it was hard to buy CPU's and GPU's so I found a couple of products with integrated video. This i9 served its purpose and more. It is better now that I placed a small workstation card in it which works for me but is also a place holder until GPU's come back to reality. Fast CPU, makes light work of video editing and single core work like CAD. Does not see games, so cannot help there, but I am sure it would be more than enough for most users and prices are great for these.", "The media could not be loaded.
                



\xa0So, to be honest I only bought this i9 because I wanted the Asus ROG Maximus XII Formula Motherboard! I really didn't want an i9 because I had bought a Ryzen 9 3950x but after using this processor, motherboard and GPU along with my Samsung G7 Monitor my games are amazing. I did one overclocking bench mark test and was throughly impressed. I kinda like i9 now and I was never a fan before. I recommend it the chip is great!I stream here on Amazon Live at Amazon.com/shop/Atarabyte, I like to build/repair PCs, play games and talk about new tech!
