If you have any questions about building PCs, tech, high end PCs or building a decent cost efficient PC, come join my stream and chat with me. I love to give advice and help! There's also a list of my entire PC setup on my Amazon page.", 'Have absolutely nothing bad to say about this processor. People that are saying it‚Äôs not as good as the K version are looking at this wrong. This CPU uses literally half of the wattage that the K version does, while being at 5.1Ghz rather than 5.3. Do you really think you would notice a bigger difference between .2GHz vs using half of the wattage? I am still trying to find ways to utilize this processor to the max, but it destroys anything that goes at it. This processor will undoubtedly last a while for me and I would not think twice in your shoes either.', 'The 10 -generation CPU processor is still very strong now. It is suitable for my office use and mild game. The process of use is very smooth. It feels without stuttering. It is great and worthy of recommendation.', 'This 10 generation Intel package includes the fan so putting a system together is very easy.  I had the entire system working within 35 minutes of starting.  I added a 2TB solid state drive and 32 GB RAM so performance from power on to power off is fantastic.  With a good high speed internet connection, everything is faster and switching is instantaneous.  I spend very little time waiting for anything to load as well as significantly faster response on all applications, including gaming apps.  Even so, most of the time half of the cores are idle or under 10%.Great processor!', 'Bon', 'I bought this thinking I was getting a 10-900kthis is not the K versionthis processor is a dog compared to the 10 900know I have a 400 fishing sinkerupdateI turned off the power limitsflys good now at 4.8 Ghz all coresspikes to 5.1low heat  so I guess im happy with itUpdatebumped my memory to 3600 and now I can get up to 5.2 ghz', 'Amazing processing power. Now my pc takes around 6sec to boot up. And that‚Äôs freaking fast.You even get a fan out of the box.I will recommend not to go with intel custom build it will increase you bp better to go with ryzen.']

Product: AMD Athlon 3000G 2-Core, 4-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor with Radeon Graphics
Reviews: ['Paired this with an AsRock DeskMini A310; more than sufficient for my use case. Suggest to pair with 16GB of DDR4 memory to ensure sufficient RAM for the APU.', 'Cheap and no fuss processer. I use it for a cheap pfsense box and it worked great!', 'Bem embalado, novo, funcionando perfeitamente a mais de ano', 'TDP ÔºìÔºïW„Å™„Çì„ÅßÈõªÊ∞ó‰ª£Êéõ„Åã„Çâ„Å™„ÅÑÂãïÁîªË¶ñËÅ¥„Å®ËªΩ„ÅÑ„Ç≤„Éº„É†„Çí„Åô„Çã„Å†„Åë„ÅÆPC„ÇíÁµÑ„ÇÇ„ÅÜ„Å®ÊÄù„Å£„Å¶Ë≥ºÂÖ•„ÄÅOS„ÅØ„ÄÅ‰Ωø„Çè„Å™„Åè„Å™„Å£„ÅüWindows10„Éé„Éº„ÉàPC„Åã„ÇâÁßªÊ§ç„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ‰ªäÂõû„ÅÆCPU„ÅØ„ÄÅ‰∏≠Âè§„Åß„Åó„Åü„Åå„Å°„ÇÉ„Çì„Å®„ÇØ„Éº„É©„Éº„ÇÇ‰ªò„ÅÑ„Å¶„Å¶Áä∂ÊÖã„ÅØËâØÂ•Ω„Åß„Åó„Åü„ÄÇWin11„Å´„ÇÇÂØæÂøú„Åó„ÅüÂûãÁï™ÔºàYD3000C6FHBOXÔºâ„Å†„Å£„Åü„ÅÆ„Åß„Åô„Çì„Å™„Çä„Å®„Ç¢„ÉÉ„Éó„Éá„Éº„ÉàÂá∫Êù•„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ', 'Ottimo processore, reattivo e senza rallentamenti o impuntamenti nel lavoro quotidiano!Avevo per√≤ acquistato la versione con grafica Radeon integrata per poter utilizzare la grafica integrata senza acquistare una scheda video PCI Express ma...una volta collegata le porte VGA o HDMI della scheda madre, il segnale video √® inesistente.Verificati anche i parametri da BIOS ed √® tutto corretto ma...non funziona!Mio malgrado ho dovuto comunque acquistare una scheda video PCI Express separata...Ottimo prodotto ma privo di una componente importante o comunque non pienamente funzionante.Peccato', 'El procesador de entrada para PC ha superado mis expectativas. A pesar de su precio asequible, ofrece un rendimiento s√≥lido en tareas diarias y multitarea ligera. Mi PC se ejecuta sin problemas, y su eficiencia energ√©tica es impresionante. Es perfecto para aquellos con un presupuesto limitado que buscan un rendimiento confiable.', 'Demais', 'Ottimo prodotto fa il suo dovere egregiamente consiglio a tutti', 'Esta rese√±a est√° escrita por una persona que le entusiasma los PC en general y toda mi vida he jugado en computadoras armadas por mi mismo (con muy poco presupuesto siempre, cabe aclarar)Ahora si:Es un excelente procesador de entrada y el precio es absurdo (tomando en cuenta que a√±os atr√°s por este precio te vend√≠an basura); debo admitir que termin√© aqu√≠ por una recomendaci√≥n de un youtuber lowspecgamer, yo vengo de un procesador que en el a√±o 2016 me cost√≥ el doble, unos 2500$ pesos mexicanos, el A8-9600, que incluso dud√© en cambiar porque iba a reducir los 10 supuestos n√∫cleos que promociona AMD (4 f√≠sicos, 6 gpu?) pero confi√© en las recomendaciones y qued√© anonadado de lo que estos peque√±os dos monstruos pueden hacer.Prob√© durante un tiempo el procesador sin overclockear en una tarjeta A320 de asus con 16gb de ram a 3200mhz (que por la motherboard solo corr√≠an a 2400mhz), funciona de maravilla y el sistema operativo y los juegos se sent√≠an m√°s fluidos que con los otros supuestos 10 nucleos de mi procesador viejo.No me detuve ah√≠, hice mi tarea y al final termin√© comprando una tarjeta chipset B450 (escog√≠ este modelo porque pienso comprar un Ryzen 5000G en un futuro adem√°s del precio y overclock) de gigabyte para habilitar los 3200mhz de la RAM y probar que tanto m√°s me pod√≠a dar con un overclock, hay varias gu√≠as en google y al final encontr√© que la mayor√≠a coincide con 3.7ghz de reloj y 1700mhz de frecuencia en video.Ahora puedo correr cualquier juego en bajo (cabe recalcar que los m√°s pesados como el Marvel Avengers o Halo Infinite los tengo que jugar a 720p), pero si puedes dejar a un lado esos detalles gr√°ficos sigue impactando que toda esa potencia la puedas comprar por 1100$ pesos mexicanos que cuesta este procesador.', '„Çª„ÉÉ„Éà„ÅÆÁÇ∫„ÄÅ‰Ωú„Çä„ÇÑ„Åô„Åã„Å£„Åü„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ']

Product: Intel BX80684I59400F Core i5-9400F Desktop Processor 6 Cores 4.1 GHz Turbo Without Graphics, 2.9 GHz
Reviews: ['CPU is compatible with motherboard.', "Put it into a fresh MSI Z390-A Pro motherboard and it works like a charm. This is 2019, don't be put off by the lack of integrated graphics on this; if you're a gamer or an artist like me you'll certainly have a dedicated graphics card to support it anyway.Comes with a stock heatsink/fan with thermal paste already applied to it and is extremely friendly for those looking to build their own PC. In fact with how small a CPU is, most of the space in the box is dedicated to said heatsink.", 'No overclock but I don‚Äôt overclock so I am good with it. Work fine no damage when recieve', 'It works. Fast delivery', 'Eh cambiado de un i3 a a este I5 y vamos mi ordenador esta volando ! Estoy muy contento se nota mucho la diferencia y adem√°s me mandaron unas gominolas de agradecimiento ! Muchas Gracias excelente servicio y excelente producto estoy contento', 'Todo nuevo correctamente embalado y muy r√°pido el env√≠o', 'Buono', 'Ich habe schon ca. 5 PCs zusammengebaut seit 1997 und wollte mal wieder ein Upgrade vornehmen. Ich habe mir eine Kombination aus Intel 9400F und MSI Z370 Mainboard und 16 GB Crucial Ballistix bestellt. Dazu habe ich eine gebrauchte Nvidia RTX 2060 bei eBay gekauft mit 18 Monaten Restgarantie.Von Anfang an war irgendwie der Wurm im System und Spiele sind leider st√§ndig abgest√ºrzt. Ich hatte den Computer zur Analyse in einer Werkstatt abgegeben mit Vermutung auf defekt der Grafikkarte.Da der Computer dann sp√§ter anfing st√§ndig selbst√§ndig neuzustarten habe ich ein neues Mainboard bestellt bei Amazon. Ein ASRock Phantom Gaming SLI Z390. Das l√∂ste das Problem mit dem st√§ndigen Neustarten.Leider st√ºrzten Spiele und gelegentlich Programme immernoch ab. Ein Tausch der Grafikkarte gegen meine alte GTX 1070 l√∂ste das Problem leider auch nicht.Ich war aber auf den Computer angewiesen und nutze ihn erst einmal noch weiter.Ich entschied ich mich leider erst sp√§t die Teile zu reklamieren.Es waren schon 23 Monate vergangen aber es war noch vor Ende der Garantiezeit. Ich habe die CPU, Mainboard sowie Arbeitsspeicher zur√ºck geschickt an Amazon.Ich habe jedoch nur eine Gutschrift f√ºr Mainboard und CPU erhalten. Nach Anruf beim Support wurde mir dann das Geld f√ºr den Arbeitsspeicher √ºberwiesen. Dann bemerkte ich aber dass das Geld f√ºr die CPU wieder zur√ºckgebucht wurde und rief nochmal beim Support an. Ich sollte ein Formular mit 6 Fragen ausf√ºllen und per Mail an Amazon schicken.Die Gutschrift f√ºr die CPU wurde abgelehnt weil die Teile angeblich zu sp√§t zur√ºck kamen.Ich kann das absolut nicht verstehen!Werde nicht wieder bei Amazon etwas kaufen.So ein schlechter Service!Jetzt stehe ich ohne Computer da und habe nur teilweise mein Geld wieder zur√ºck.', "The seller communication is second to none, it was a fast delivery the only problem I had was the product didn't work but the seller was happy for me to send it back for a full refund.", 'Ho aspettato un po\' prima di recensire il prodotto, circa 2 mesi per l\'esattezza, in modo da avere il tempo di valutare effettivamente tutti gli aspetti operativi di questo processore.La mia valutazione √® positiva, ovviamente, in quanto si tratta di un buon prodotto potente ed affidabile. Cercher√≤ di mettere per punti gli aspetti che ho valutato.In generale: √® una normalissima CPU 6c/6t, con frequenze stock sufficienti per un utilizzo da normale desktop (fin troppo a dire il vero), in turbo boost arriva arriva ad un rispettabile 3.9ghz su tutti i core, che permette di giocare con frame rate superiori ai 60fps in qualunque gioco moderno anche al massimo dei settaggi (ovviamente per avere post, texture e AA al massimo dovete abbinarla almeno ad una 2060/5700); unica percca? stutter frequente in alcuni titoli per via della fluttuazione dei tempi di resa dei fotogrammi, determinati dalla mancanza di hyperthreading. Nulla di insopportabile, ma sicuramente fastidioso.Nella produttivit√† va benissimo, ma tra le offerte "new gen" sia di Intel che AMD √® sicuramente uno dei processori pi√π scarsi, anche a causa della mancanza di una igpu attiva. Scordatevi di giocare ai titoli AAA al massimo dei settaggi o senza limitare il framerate se volete fare streaming: abbinarla ad una RTX ed usare OBS aiuta ma non √® abbastanza.In conclusione direi che per il prezzo che ha (almeno al momento qui in Italia) rispetto alla nettamente superiore R5 3600 √® comunque un acquisto da valutare SE e solo SE si √® interessati esclusivamente al gaming.Un altro appunto che vorrei fare √® quello della compatibilit√† con futuri upgrade: non ci sono upgrade possibili se si compra Intel, mi spiego meglio: con le Intel 9th gen si ancora il socket LGA1151 che ormai √® a fine ciclo, infatti i processori Intel di 10 generazione useranno nuovi socket e nuovi chipset, motivo per il quale o si acquista una scheda madre z390 per fare l\'upgrade ad un i7 o i9 9th gen a distanza di 2 anni o si butta via tutto e si ricomincia da capo.AMD d\'altra parte non solo ha continuato ad usare il suo AM4 anche su Zen 2 ma lo user√† ancora sul prossimo refresh ovvero i Ryzen 4000, che presumibilmente spazzeranno via Intel dalla competizione.']

Product: Intel¬Æ Core‚Ñ¢ i7-11700KF Desktop Processor 8 Cores up to 5.0 GHz Unlocked LGA1200 (Intel¬Æ 500 Series & Select 400 Series Chipset) 125W
Reviews: ["It's works for my budget and usage so it's as great as it can go.", 'Es una belleza, el equipo reci√©n actualizado ahora es sumamente r√°pido y muy √∫til para multitareas.', 'Este micro es la bestiaaa lo recomiendo 100%', 'Working great so far, was a much needed upgrade from my i5-4670k..I jumped from 2012 to 2022 in one grand leap of upgrades, into "oh wow my CPU isn\'t at 100% when playing these games anymore?" (GTA V, Tarkov, FiveM, etc.)Running in this setup: MSI Z590 motherboard, 64gb Corsair Vengeance RAM (2x 32gb), Gigabyte RTX 3060 Gaming OC, Evga Supernova 750 G6 power supply, and the Noctua NH-U12S Redux as the CPU cooler keeps this going just fine. Everything air cooled since the last cooler was a liquid cooler that spontaneously screwed me over one day when the pumps failed while I was out of the house (somehow didn\'t fry anything besides my nerves). Watching the temperature on the CPU with this cooler, I have rarely seen the CPU hit 67c while running TWO instances of GTA V on max graphics.', 'I bought a KF in error, my bad.  I compared it to my i9-11900K and immediately realized that the compromises made in the i7-11700 was not tro my liking.  Tried to save a buck and wound up loosing.', 'Fue el primer componente de mi computadora en llegar, todo perfectamente bien empacado y en buen estado, lleg√≥ con sellos completamente cerrados del fabricante, ya estoy usando el procesador y es una maravilla, los recomiendo!!', 'Es justo el producto que ped√≠ por ello le pongo las 5 estrellas de momento ya que no he podido probarlas a√∫n pues no me ha llegado la motherboard pero se ve que el producto es nuevo y sellado', 'El cpu todo bien excelente esta trabajando n√≠tido', 'Best chip in town for a ROG  Z590-E!', 'This processor is amazing and fast. Best for the price too!']

Product: INTEL INTEL I3-10100T UP to 3.80GHZ 6M, Tray Computer COMPONEN
Reviews: ['Bei der Installation und der Inbetriebnahme gab es keine Probleme.Ich bin zufrieden', 'I was very happy to be able to get a "T" version of this processor. Low power consumption and cool operation is more important to me than processing power. I\'m obviously not a gamer.']

Product: Intel¬Æ Core‚Ñ¢ i9-10850K Desktop Processor 10 Cores up to 5.2 GHz Unlocked LGA1200 (Intel¬Æ 400 Series chipset) 125W
Reviews: ["Received well packaged and undamaged. Bought it for a new PC build after 7+ years using an I5 4690 due to  being CPU bound on too many games. Paired with a Dark Rock Pro 4, temperatures average out to around 52 degrees Celsius without air conditioning on low/idle loads. Have not attempted to overclock yet, but I'm curious to see what I can get since at stock I'm currently seeing 4.8 GHz.Six generations worth of architectural refinement, six more cores and sixteen more threads and I could not be any happier with the performance I am getting. No longer needing to close programs and background processes to free up CPU usage is liberating. I can throw emulators, multiple video streams and game at the same time and still have room for more. With this, I'll be good for a long long time.Note to those unfamiliar: Don't set your power plan to High Performance unless you're also buying this to use as a heater. I underestimated how hot it could get until I did that and changed back to Balanced not long after. It. Is. HOT!", 'The product is fantastic, I recommend the seller.', 'Seller was very helpful in resolving my concerns over what I received vs what I was buying. I would strongly recommend that the seller make it clear in the product description that what the customer will receive is not in retail packaging and why it is not in retail packaging. This was the only thing that prevented me from giving the vendor a 5-star review.', 'Processor arrived in a sealed anti-static bag within a brown box.Checking the serial with Intel reveals it‚Äôs a tray processor, not a retail CPU. So you don‚Äôt get the 3 year warranty from Intel.Maestro mentioned it has a 3 year warranty in response to message about this.Processor works, well packaged, just the listing on Amazon is not very accurate as to what you‚Äôre actually going to receive.', "I had an i7-7700k for 4-5 years, and when I got my 2080 Super I had to push that old i7 to a heavy overclock to get as much performance from it as I could. So I had been looking to upgrade my CPU for a while. Of course the debate came up if Ryzen was better or if Intel should even be considered. I'll admit, I still like Intel in my heart, but I wasn't getting 11th Gen, its expensive for basically no more performance. But the 10850k had come out just in the last year, for less than the 10900k but with the same performance. Mix that with it being cheaper with the 11th Gen announcements, and there being great looking and performing mobos for it (and 11th Gen) I bought this.Honestly, I gotta say, it does what it promises. It has 10 cores that can run like a beast. It has my 2080 Super performing at its best without the sweat and strain my 7700k had to. I had to push that 7700k to 5.2 Ghz, where I could feel it straining, to really see RTX gaming performance at its smoothest above 1080p. This 10850k boosted just from the base BIOS on my mobo to 4.8Ghz on all 10 cores and things are buttery smooth. I play Control at 1440p with maxed settings and get a fairly consistent 90 FPS and my temps and component usage are all nice and ideal levels. I was able to play Half-Life Alyx, and stream it while capturing my webcam footage without any temp issues and honestly hitting my VRAM cap on the GPU before any actual performance issues from bottlenecking.Honestly, I can't be happier with this purchase. I hate reviews without negatives, it feels fake. And I wish I had some, but seriously it is playing games I enjoyed before with far better performance at higher settings. It is handling my crazed multitasking and occasional streaming without a sweat. Ryzen 5000 series may be able to squeeze some better gaming performance overall than this. But at the price I got it, and the issues with availability of a 5800x (which is more expensive too) I couldn't say I'd be happier with that. Especially when the AMD motherboards don't look quite as nice either. My friend has a 5800x, I've played on his machine and heard from him in his own use that its good, but nothing there seemed to blow this 10850k out of the water.", 'Performed above expectations', 'I went from a 5820k to this beast... all I can say is WOW.The research I did indicated that this is basically Intel\'s flagship CPU, but a half of a small step down.One thing I didn\'t know about my 5820k was how much it was holding my entire system back.Passmark Benchmarks increased for EVERY component. My 5 year old RAM is now running in the 99th percentile. My 2070 Super isn\'t bottlenecked. Heck, even my crappy old SSD improved... but then was mercilessly replaced by an younger, sexier, far more modern NVME drive (hey, if you\'re going big, go BIG).Super happy with this. It\'s worth every penny. I\'m still scratching my head as to how I paid less for this than my 5820k, and I bought that when they weren\'t even second gen anymore... and this is first gen hardware... but I supposed I can thank AMD for that... it helps when a "little brother" competitor suddenly outclasses you for less than you are charging... but hey, that works for us Intel fanboys, so we can get our fix for cheaper!!Only con is that under load, it kicks all my fans/cooling into high gear... but still runs butter smooth in most applications. Most of what I do primarily uses the GPU, but having a proper CPU matched to it makes a huge difference in all 3D applications I use. For reference, I\'ve got it hooked up with a Corsair h100i radiator system, which seems to do the job well of cooling it. In this day and age, I can\'t imagine doing anything but liquid cooling on a high end processor.Now, when I can finally get my hands on that one 10GB super-amazing GPU that everyone has been wanting since September, and I\'ve had reserved since then... I\'ll be in VR/Gaming/3D rendering/3D modeling heaven.', 'Lost silicon lottery.Hard to OC over 4.9 on the best Noctua Air cooler. Reapplied thermal paste twice to make sure.  Might leave it back to default C states where a few cores bump too 5.2 for a minute.Damn thing is HOT. 250W was just a number until I owned this..  with all the noctua case fans and air cooler, I should have bought 360mm AIO kraken WATER cooler!Either was the Coy is a best though and I get above 69fos on every game with my ECGA GTX1080.  Can‚Äôt wait for rtx 3080 waiting list... in the summer lol.This cou paired with Asus z490-e strix.  16x2GB g.skill 6-9-9-39 I think and that worked without him hitch. No need to OC ram as this is intel not amd.I‚Äôll continue to try and tune but I‚Äôve experimented with different LL cals, VDDIO and VDDSA.Viceroy is set to 1.39 which is higher then I‚Äôd like it to be.  Asus defaults are dangerously high and name me uncomfortable, they push above 1.4 which I could do and hit that elusive 5.0 but I want this to run for 5 years.Overall coming from i7-6700k OC was not as big a perf jump as I‚Äôd hope but overall it‚Äôs fast and snappy.When in same I would recommend over the 10900 due to price for performance.Does not fit into meshify C with dh-15‚Äôs big ass 140mm fans and the location of ram sticks.  Only the crucial Ram has low profile enough to accommodate this.  I replaced that one fan with higher SP fan 120mm from noctua so now I can put my side glass case on.  PcpartPicker great but only 95% accurate overall so watch it.Overall happy but sad I lost the lottery of the ever was one on this Bin‚Äôed 10900 ;)', "I have built multiple PC boxes over the years and it has always been a fairly simple process. I source all my parts making sure that they are compatible and then assemble it. The i9 10850K processor was the last component I was waiting for and was pretty excited when it arrived. Fortunate I decided to film the open of the box due to other negative reviews I saw. I open the box and label says LGA 1200 and the correct model number was on the CPU. I figured all was good until I tried to actually put it in the socket. It was too big and the notches on the board were not in the correct location to lock into the socket. I ended damaging one pin in the socket. Went to BestBuy and purchased the exact same processor that drops perfectly into the socket. I have sent it back and requested a refund. I fail to see how something like this could happen accidentally. I'm not sure what they sent but it certainly isn't an i9 10850 for a LGA 1200 socket.Update: My brother did some research and found a picture online from a BestBuy customer who had the same problem. The notches were not in the correct place so it appears that this a a supplier problem and not an Amazon mistake.", "Excellent performance from this CPU - to say that it can cope with anything that's thrown at it is an understatement. More than suitable for a modern gaming PC. This CPU runs hot though compared to my previous build, and in my own opinion, the Noctua NH-U12A air/fan cooler is the perfect companion to keep the CPU as cool as possible. The i9-10850K is highly recommended to others - you will not be disappointed."]

Product: Intel¬Æ Pentium Gold G-6400 Desktop Processor 2 Cores 4.0 GHz LGA1200 (Intel¬Æ 400 Series chipset) 58W (BX80701G6400)
Reviews: ['The CPU price is incredibly cheap (especially if you buy 2nd hand) the performance is exactly half of the 13-10105F and pair well with any mid-high GPU (say GTX 1660 or RX-580) the performance is comparable to 6th gen i5 but with better memory latency, lower TDP and better PCI lanes.the 58w TDP means you can run the stock cooler for general use, but if used in gaming any cheap tower cooler will keep it nice and fresh regardless of the gaming session.', 'Muy buena pieza', 'excellent for basic home or office computer. fast shipping. excellent price. built in graphics...no need for expensive graphics card. very easy to install! cooling unit and paste included. well packaged.', 'If you know what you are doing this is great but know your LGA sockets first.', "J'ai choisi ce processeur pour l'assemblage d'un NAS DIY sachant qu'il pr√©sente √† mon avis un des meilleurs rapports performance / prix pour ce type de projet.En d√©finitive il s'av√®re efficace pour l'utilisation vis√©e, et -qui plus est- silencieux avec son ventirad d'origine sans m√™me chauffer v√©ritablement.Je recommande donc ;-)", 'A good beginner processor', 'I\'m not one that races out to type a CPU review. There is already plenty of information, benchmarks, etc. on the web detailing the performance of this chip and/or chips that are similar. Ultimately, I\'m hoping to present a little clarification regarding what one may expect to receive when purchasing this item.So, if the headline of this review has caught your attention it may have been because you noticed the product description states that it "doesn\'t" come with a thermal solution (AKA:  heat-sink/fan). However, like some other reviewers/commenters have stated, "it does"! (or at least mine did). The item I received was in retail form and included the stock heat-sink and fan (case badge and all). I\'ve come across similar dependencies on other retail sites claiming the same thing. Sad to state, purchasing this item felt like more of a gamble if anything.Does that guarantee the one you purchase will include one...Don\'t know! But it may minimize the reluctance to purchase it seeing that myself, including others, have had the same experience and can confirm that the item received was indeed a retail variant.All in all, if it comes down to it, it is a relativity inexpensive chip. Even though potentially receiving one without a thermal solution may not be all that desirable, many aftermarket solutions can be found on the web and are rather cost effective when dealing with a chip of this type. So, the $10 or less region may not be out of line for an adequate thermal solution. Just think of your possible usage scenarios and buy accordingly (if it would even come to that).I bought this knowing it may not have come with a cooler, so I can\'t state I would\'ve felt burned getting one without one.  "5 Stars" for exceeding my expectations!Best of luck!', "This processor isn't much to write home about. It is a 2 core/4 thread processor near the bottom of the 10th-Gen Intel product stack. I say that not to criticize it, but rather, to ensure I'm setting the proper expectation for someone reading a 5 star review for the cheapest latest-generation processor.As long as this processor is appropriate for what you're buying it for, it's a great choice and a pretty reasonable price. What is it appropriate for? In my case, I used it to build a pfSense router/firewall machine. It works great for this, with 3% to 5% CPU load under heavy usage. It would also be appropriate for a Windows machine that you intend to use for things like web browsing, Netflix or light productivity work (checking email, word processing, or similar). in fact, it's a great choice for those tasks.Where you'll be less happy would be something like gaming. If this is your entry point in to Windows gaming, I highly recommend spending a little more for something like a Core i3 10100. You could comfortably use the same motherboard as this processor, but it has double the cores and higher clock speeds.Additionally, if you're doing something that requires a little extra graphics power, the integrated GPU in this processor won't get you very fine. It's fine for the things I mentioned above.... For example, it will play 4K Netflix or YouTube with no problem... But even the most casual game would bring this to its knees. If you're dead set on a processor with integrated graphics, I'd recommend looking to team red (e.g. Athlon 3000G, Ryzen 3 3200G).One side note: I distinctly remember the product listing indicating this did not come with a heatsink/fan. That is incorrect. The product I received did include a standard Intel in-box cooler.", "To feel good about this purchase, you need to be an informed consumer. I would only buy this for very specific use cases. In my case, I put this in a low power home server more focused on storage and serving media (Plex) than virtualization. I think it would also be perfect for a basic home/office PC that's focused on browsing the internet and using Microsoft Office.This should not be purchased for gaming or other use cases that benefit from lots of CPU horsepower (i.e. Adobe Creative Cloud, etc).For me? The price was low. The power consumption was low. The feature set was right (it's great for transcoding video in hardware via Plex).If you're not sure, I would probably save yourself the potential disappointment and set my low bar at the Intel i3-10100.Recommended.", "I wanted to take this review to directly address those thinking of purchasing for gaming, as I haven't seen too many reviews about this.For the value, this CPU is insanely good, but you must know what kind of games you want to play before you pull the trigger. It is a 2-core, 4-thread CPU which is the equivalent of what older gen i3 CPU's were. It is very snappy for browsing & basic needs, but how does it handle in-game? Here's my experience. I have this paired up with a 4GB R9 380 GPU and 8GB of DDR4 at 2666. Windows 10. Some sample benchmarks:Apex Legends: AVG 65, Low 46 on mix of low/highWitcher III: AVG 71, dips to high 50's in Novigrad, all high with shadows on lowFortnite: AVG 123, Low 76, competitive settingsModern Warfare: 50-60 AVG on mix of settingsNow obviously these are rough samples, and  YMMV depending on your GPU and config. You can probably push higher frame-rates with even just a 10th gen i3. However, if you are on a budget, or you don't care much about having the most consistent frames in the world, this CPU is a killer value. I, for one, learned an important lesson with this CPU. Stop caring about the frames, and just enjoy the games. Even still, the performance this CPU can push on a healthy PC build is beyond acceptable. It is not a AAA game crushing chip, but it will play a lot of games from 2015 onwards perfectly fine."]

Product: Intel Core i9-10900KF Desktop Processor 10 Cores up to 5.3 GHz Unlocked Without Processor Graphics LGA1200 (Intel 400 Series chipset) 125W
Reviews: ['Despite still using an older 14nm architecture, this little beast handles everything you can throw at it with ease. Upgrading from an 8 core 8 thread i7-9700k, where I was seeing high 90% CPU utilisation in multilayer games, a 10 core 20 thread CPU will go a long way towards future titles.Perhaps what I was most presently surprised by was how cool it runs. Under load, the CPU can top out at 80C+ at stock with power limits removed and MCE disabled, but that is only when running AVX-heavy benchmarks like Cinebench R15, with a 30C ambient and an NZXT Kraken X63 280MM AIO inside my NZXT H510 case, which has notoriously poor airflow. When gaming, however, the temperature hardly, if ever, go above 70C, mostly hovering in the high-50s to low-60s range. This gives thermal headroom for some mild overclocking, which I have yet to do, because it already performs so well at stock speeds.', 'The best cpu until the 13th gen', 'Intel is picking up speed with these new cpu\'s after the X-series hit the market, soon enough they\'ll have cpus\'s as good as the X-series at a much better value. I like this CPU a lot it can run through new installations, updates, and any other cpu heavy tasks like no other. Although it uses a lot of power, the extra speed feels worth the extra wattage used. I used this cpu to run console emulation and it does very well, I think it could do ok to run ps4 emulation but I hadn\'t tried it. Most games seem to run a bit faster than usual though, this can be a concern if you play games where you need quick timing/reaction speed like in first person shooters. It may be better to use a standard eight core or six core cpu if game speed is a concern. Overall I"d give this item five stars, I can\'t wait to build a new Rocket Lake computer!', "Considering the shortages on the 5000 series Ryzen's, this is the next best thing that you can actually buy at retail! I managed to get one in the warehouse deals for a cheaper price than full blown retail on an unopened package, but it still works great! You also save a little on this because of the lack of APU in the KF model. Of course there's an issue if you're using this with integrated graphics in the first place so it's more of a non-issue for most people. Performance is spot on easily showing up almost all AMD at single threaded applications. The 10 core's are more than enough for almost anyone. I've got it on a 360mm AIO and temps never go above 70c for any reason, even extended gaming sessions.", 'Easy to overclock and has been super stable and grinds threw games and apps.  Really good deal!!', "To be fair, I upgraded from an i7-8700; this cpu is blazing fast and i've only ever gotten up to 80% usage running 3 intensive games at once. I do have one of those beefy Noctua dual fan coolers to keep temps low and stable ( 27¬∞C idle, in general staying around 60¬∞C), as this heats up fast. Make sure you get a proper cooler, as a standard heatsink single fan cooler was pushing 85¬∞C at 35% usage.", 'Great for upgrading my PC, but I had to buy a new motherboard to support this CPU.', 'Technically the CPU wrote this review so I guess it works.', "Such a powerful CPU. Good luck if you have poor or decent cooling system. My previous AIO wasn't able to cool this beast off, idle temp was 90¬∞c!! So I got the NZXT Kraken x63 and now the idle temp is at 28-30¬∞c. If you are thinking of getting this CPU I highly recommend investing in CPU cooling as well.", 'This chip is an absolute beast.Pro: Everything you do on your PC will be blazing fast when combined with an ssd. For gaming, this cpu has gotten me over 144 FPS in most 1440p games when combined with a 2080 super.Cons: gets very hot when overclocking even slightly, will require a really good watercooler. Dont expect to reach 5.3 without getting lucky.']

Product: AMD Ryzen‚Ñ¢ 9 7900X3D 12-Core, 24-Thread Desktop Processor
Reviews: ['I installed this in my Asus ProArt x670e motherboard. I use an Arctic Liquid Freezer II 280 RGB AIO water cooler. I like that it switches between two chiplets  one with higher frequency, the other with a higher cache. So you can have your cake and eat it too depending on if you are doing normal productivity type tasks or gaming. The switching between chiplets is done by Xbox game bar and is generally automatic. Nutshell is if Microsoft thinks you are running a game it switches to the X3D cache otherwise it uses the frequency optimized chiplet. You can check by bringing up the game bar with windows-g then looking at settings. The tdp is quite low at 120 watts, so it‚Äôs a very easy load for my water cooler, so my cooler is pretty quiet and it‚Äôs easy to keep the cpu well below its TJ Max. I also used the bottleneck calculator at the pc builds website, and per their estimation this CPU is well matched up to a Nvidia rtx 4070ti gpu. this was completely fine for my usage.', "I have to say I love this processor. I made the jump to a totally new platform. It is NOT without it's growing pains (which I can say now have settled at least for me).A lot of YouTubers say get the 7800x3d... if you do need core speed for programs or have games that use core speed this makes alot more sense. I think (my opinion) that once the bios and drivers are more optimized to use the necessary cores that have cache, vs higher clocked cores for performance this will be a amazing buy.Right now, it's a beast!I run it on a ASUS ROG STRIX X670E-E... the bios here was an issue... with all 7000 cpus it seems over volting cpu/mem controller could cause damage to the cpu or motherboard. I was lucky... my pc shut off randomly several times and I had to manually reset the psu. It seems my psu was saving my hardware. I was chasing down a possible PSU, RAM and motherboard or cpu issue. I spent weeks troubleshooting to no avail, all the answers I got from everyone was to RMA... I wanted to narrow it down so I didn't have to wait weeks for the turn around of each part.Finally I saw a new BIOs from ASUS.1410 is the newest I am using but both this version and 1303 claim to limit SOC voltage to 1.3 which should mitigate the shutdowns and possible damage.I really do love this chip and the X3D really is amazing in gaming. Really removes the lower .01 and 1% frame rates.I'm totally happy with the performance and am playing with per core curve optimizer. Now that I have more stability I can play with the chip more.Temps- from my observation the IO die temps at idle are in the 40C range... so that reads as the package temp... when actually the cores are in the 30s and 20s depending at idle. I also run a custom loop with dual 360 rads with the cpu and gpu in the loop. So I'm happy with the temps.All in all a great cpu, if just gaming or want to save some cash can do a 7800x3d, if you can use the higher core speeds of a 7900x3d this cpu is for you.", 'Io ormai sono affezionato alla serie 9 dei rayzen, sono passato dal 5900x a questo 7900x3d.Ho sempre scelto il 9 per la sua duttilit√† sia per il Gaming che per l ambito lavorativo e video editing.Anche questa volta amd ha fatto un ottimo lavoro.', 'Sono passato da un i9 10900f a questo processore e la differenza in gaming si sente tantissimo.Ho guadagnato parecchi frames sopratutto nei giochi cpu limit e rispetto all‚Äôi9 noto che l‚Äôutilizzo della mia 4090 √® decisamente superiore.Ottimi i consumi e le temperature, considerato che ho tutto questo chiuso in un case mini itx', '90+c for this CPU is fine, and it works as expected. If you want to lower that number, read about "curves" and undervolting.', 'Starting out, if you only play video games on your PC go with the Ryzen 7 7800x3d. It performs better and is cheaper.However, if you do a little bit of everything, this CPU is great.You could probably get away with a beefy air cooling system but it would be recommended to invest into a semi decent liquid cooling system.', "First AMD chip and GPU for my new build. So far everything is working great and very happy with my purchase. Really like AMD's apps and ease of fine tuning. Most importantly, this is my last review before Amazon will tell me a joke for submitting 6 reviews of my recent purchases.", 'Excellent performance for the price, for work and games, really good', "This CPU is great. It works flawlessly with my 4090 but I wish I had waited for the 7800x3d instead.While the CPU has 12 cores, the new 3D Vcache makes the CPU park 6 of those 12 cores since its stacked on one side. The performance is great if you use your PC for both gaming and productivity but if you only game, you are better off getting the cheaper 7800x3d. It only has 8 cores but since the 3D Vcache is on all 8 cores, none of the cores are parked and you get the full use of all 8 cores vs the use of only 6 cores with the 7900x3dI take this as a learning experience and while i have a little buyers remorse i can't say that the 7900x3d doesn't perform well. It's just that the 7800x3d makes the 7900x3d inferior for more money.", "Veloce, silenzioso e non riscalda troppo.Ho notato un grande incremento di frames in game passando dal 5950x.Prezzo che potrebbe essere un p√≤ piu' contenuto ma ottima risposta da parte di questo processore che non necessita di nient'altro che una buona scheda madre e delle ram all'altezza vicino. Consigliato se giochi."]

Product: Intel Core i3-13100 Desktop Processor 4 cores (4 P-cores + 0 E-cores) 12MB Cache, up to 4.5 GHz
Reviews: ['I build PCs for clients daily. The core i3-13100 is absolutely perfect.  6 core 12 thread, nothing can beat it for the money. And the client is very happy with its performance.  Can run many different programs at once.The core i3 has changed alot over the years. Used to be dual core, with HT, then quad core not HT, now 6 core 12 thread. Much better value.  Maybe for the 14th gen core i3 they could include 6 P-cores, 2 E-cores, being the same 12 thread CPU,', 'Pour le prix', "The 13100 isn't the powerhouse that the 13900k is, but it works well for day to day task where a more powerful processor isn't required.", 'El menor de su familia y se defiende muy bien, va perfecto con una RTX 3060 12GB y todo en ULTRA', "All I can say is that I'm very happy with my purchase!", 'If you need more processor, buy more processor.  However, most web surfer and video viewers will never notice this is a budget CPU.  Modern tech makes this little guys speedy as heck.  It runs games just fine as long as your expectations are super high end 4K gaming at a zillion FPS.  Check youtube for videos.  Great little chip.', 'Used it in a fresh build on MSI Mortar wifi and Thermalright assassin x. Temps 3x on idle and 5x on load. Has all needed performance and with integrated graphics is all needed. With Gigabyte Eagle RTX 3060 OC got Fortnite Epic run 130fps @1080p and ~90fps @1440p. Black Mesa ultra @1440p got 100-200fps. Single Con: Could be better priced around 130 though. I decided to have this configuration to have the possibilty to upgrade to 13600k sometime later if needed for Graphics render software.']

Product: AMD Ryzen‚Ñ¢ 9 7900 12-Core, 24-Thread Unlocked Desktop Processor
Reviews: ["I bought it for work, paired it with EXPO 64 GB 6000 CL30 memory that I found for 22k, not planning on overclocking as I don't need to, if gaming I would suggest 5800x3d as better value for money, but for productivity 12 cores are very good, no complaints yet, driver software is decent. Only use the iGPU at the moment, no graphics card", 'der L√ºfter ist extrem leise zumindest in der normalem Belastungsphase, noch habe ich nicht alles eingerichtet, um eine realistische Gaming-Aussage machen zu k√∂nnen', "First off, I enjoy building SFF (small form factor) type builds.The current generation of CPU's were more power hungry, which resulted in more heat to dissipate. Trying to cool a Ryzen 9 7900X on a CPU cooler rated for max 100W is quite difficult, so therefore you have to go towards cases like the NZXT H1 V2.This particular chip allows you to not only have near identical performance to the Ryzen 9 7900X with PBO, but also gives you SFF allowable performance at a lower wattage that still provides you power.So far today using this has been great, and I recommend this chip to anyone that wants a newer generation chip without the abismal power draws that have been required as of late.Edit 1/17:From normal use I have seen no difference between this model and the X model. I had both chips in my NZXT H1 V2, liquid metal as the thermal application, and by far the non X model does much better in this type of SFF build. It still will boost, however if you are like me, work from home, and use this all day long in most cases, you aren't going to want the CPU blasting at full power over the entire work day.Quick note: temps are much better, my fan curve was not changed and the temperature is a lot more tolerable compared to the X version, so my CPU radiator fan does not spool up as much as it did with the X. I let it hover between 50C-65C for daily use and the fans are quiet, with the X the fan was at half or more RPM constantly to keep it at around this temperature and would sometimes hover in the 70's. So, if you are temperature concious then the non-x version is great.With that said I am pleased with the product. I do feel though this model needed to be priced at $399, as we have seen the 7900X is selling at this time around $425 on sale.Again, I will reiterate, the allowances in this chip should have been more prevalent in the X version, as I feel like we were kind of ripped off slightly this generation on CPU's and GPU's.Edit 1/20:This will be my final edit. I am boosting to around 5.5 MHz with the wattage anywhere from 60-90W. My temperatures are sustaining on load no more than 68C on a single 140mm AIO in the NZXT H1 V2. This is great, I am maintaining the frequency, but with a much lower power draw.One item I would recommend is getting an aftermarket chip mounting plate for this chip, weirdly it did make a difference for this chip, around 1-2C lower than the stock MOBO chip mount. I'm using the following mount: Thermalright ASF-Black AM5 CPU Holder, Corrective Anti-Bending Fixing Frame, AM5 Full-fit Fixed Non-Marking Mounter, AM5 Anti-Bending Contact Frame, CPU Cooler Standard, I am also using the following paste: Thermal Grizzly Conductonaut Thermal Grease - 1 Gram Set + 3 Applicators + Pads - Liquid Metal Thermal Paste for Cooling The CPU, GPU Value Pack.So far so good, would recommend, and again this is what the first chip should have been - AMD is trying too much to be intel, sure make your server chips, but we buy AMD for efficiency, not brute power in most cases. Sure, there is threadripper, but most of us are casual users. Regardless, this is the chip we all wanted, it's powerful, efficient, and over-clockable.", 'I like the low TDP of these, only 65W and whopping 49k Passmark benchmark score with 12 cores and 24 threads! Great value for the money, will serve me well for a few years I imagine.', 'I am coming from a third generation i7, so this thing smokes!', "How it Perfoms?To be fair It's 90% of 13700K with PBO on and if youre lucky with Curve Optimizer + PBO will perform 95% of 13700K. Mine works -20 with PBO easliy and got score of 30k in Cinebench R23.You can try overclocking, but i strongly  woudln't suggest it.In comparizon to 7900X3D it's 20% slower in gaming but 10% faster in Productivity tasks and costs 30% less. In Comparizon to 7800X3D it's 20% slower in gaming but 35% faster in Productivity tasks and costs 5% less.So, if u just game then buy X3D chip and forget it.Why You should buy it. Whats it's USP?It's TDP, It will go max 180W to be precise, and will remain under 95'C  under worst of worst condition unlike 13700K which easily touches 100'C and consumes max of 253W.If you want to have a GPU with 450W+ TDP like 4090[Now] or say 5090 [in future :P] you can pair it with a >= 650W Gold PSU with this CPU. Use saved money into ssds or whatever.", "With AMD's Ryzen Master software this CPU can OC to 5500mhz out of the box. I have this installed on a 650M motherboard with 128gb of DDR5 and a RTX 4070 card and it runs nice and cool in a 'mesh' style mATX case. Compared to my  i7-10875H this CPU screams with half the heat produced. I am very impressed and glad I chose it over the 7900x or 7950x", "Very happy with performance.I have this paired with with Gigabyte x670 Aorus elite AX, Gigabyte 3060 geforce, 64Gb corsair 5200 DIMMs (2x32).For cooling used CORSAIR - iCUE H100i ELITE CAPELLIX XT, which works very well.Previously returned a Noctua NH-D15S, which didn't have correct backing plate.With this setup the 7900 idles in mid 30s.  With CPU at 100% (blender rendering, health check and performance tool apps) the max temp I've hit was 62¬∞, so the lower TDP of 65watts, combined with decent liquid cooler, removes overheating worries.I purposely went with qty (2) DIMMs, as this keeps the DIMM clock speeds optimal.  Populating all 4 DIMM slots will reduce DIMM clock speed (to like 3200 Mhz, I think).Thanks in part to 12GB 3060 geforce card, apps like blender, handbrake, do in seconds or minutes what used to take MANY hours on older athlon 8350 system.Compiling large FL studio projects that would take 30-40 minutes, run in just a few seconds now.", 'Using in a Gigabyte Aorus Elite AX motherboard and 64GB of G.Skill Flare X5 @6200 MHz.  Plenty of PBO setting in the BIOS for tweaking.  Runs CPU-Z consistently ~12500 and Cinebench 23 between 29507 and 30162.  Total system power at full load is 378 watts including (2) 27" IPS monitors.  Lots of bang for the buck from a CPU rated at 65 watts.  Included cooler is adequate for every day, but HD use calls for something heftier.  Use for CAD, rendering and Photoshop.', 'Great  !']

Product: Intel Core i7-12700K, 8C+4c/20T, 3.60-5.00GHz, boxed without K√ºhler
Reviews:
["J'ai r√©cemment fait l'acquisition de ce i7-12700K pour une mise √† niveau de mon PC gamer, en quelques points voici ce que j'en pense:----Performance en jeu :---------------Compar√© √† mon ancien processeur un i7-9eme g√©n√©ration, j'ai constat√© une nette am√©lioration des performances, notamment lors de l'utilisation de logiciels gourmands en ressources comme les logiciels de mod√©lisation 3D ou de montage vid√©o ou m√™me en streaming. En jeu il est largement suffisant pour tourner les jeux les plus r√©cents comme cyberpunk ou starfield !-------Polyvalence:----------Gr√¢ce √† la combinaison de c≈ìurs de performance (P) et d'efficacit√© (E) = (12 coeurs (dont 8 P-cores et 4 E-core), le processeur g√®re tr√®s bien √† la fois les t√¢ches quotidiennes et les applications plus exigeantes.------------Technologies embarqu√©es :---------------Le support de la DDR5, l'overclocking potentiel et d'autres technologies avanc√©es font du 12700K un proc de choix pour ceux qui recherchent un processeur pour le gaming-----------Points √† Am√©liorer :-----------Chauffe : M√™me si ce n'est pas excessif, j'ai remarqu√© que le processeur avait tendance √† chauffer un peu plus que mon ancien. Cela n√©cessite donc un syst√®me de refroidissement ad√©quat, j'utilise personnellement un water cooling NZXT qui le maintient √† une temp√©rature acceptable.---------Conclusion :-------------------------------Le Intel Core i7-12700K est un excellent processeur pour ceux qui cherchent √† combiner performances en jeu ou en multi tasks (streaming et jeu) et polyvalence. Cependant, assurez-vous d'avoir un bon syst√®me de refroidissement et √©valuez bien vos besoins avant d'investir, car le prix peut √™tre √©lev√© pour certains budgets.", "Comme √† son habitude, Intel fournit des produits de qualit√© et d'une stabilit√© √† toutes √©preuves. Tr√®s performant et merci Amazon pour les prix souvent excellents", 'Die Performance ist super! Die Kerne laufen bei Normalbetrieb auf ca. 20 - 30¬∞ C (Wasserk√ºhlung 1x Radiator) und unter Last auf ca. 50 - 60¬∞ C. Der Prozessor ist im Normalbetrieb (Windows 11 und ein paar Chrome Tabs ge√∂ffnet) immer unter 5% Auslastung. Stromverbrauch ungef√§hr zwischen 65 und 180 Watt je nach Auslastung. In bin absolut zufrieden!', 'Perfect upgrade from an i7 7700', 'The media could not be loaded.
                



\xa0Sem d√∫vida, um processador que resolve tudo. Fa√ßo live em games e n√£o trava nada. Estava em d√∫vida entre o i7 ou i9 12¬∞ gera√ß√£o, optei pelo i7 12700k e estou muito satisfeito.  Recomendo a todos.', 'i7 + 3060ti = 4.2% de bottleneck. Un parfait √©quilibre pour jouer en 1440p.', 'Cercavo un processore che mi consentisse un aggiornamento sul secondo PC che montava un i7 3700k. Aggiornamento eseguito e velocizzato il PC con programmi di grafica AI dell ultima generazione. Editing video, fotografia AI, il tutto  con elaboraxioni in tempi adeguati. Ho dovuto sostituire il raffreddatore a liquido, con un altro, per la sostituzione della scheda madre. Ottimo rapporto qualit√†/ prezzo. Credo rimarro un fan di Intel.... prestazioni nel tempo e mai un problema.. Consigliabile', 'No complaints here. It handles everything my gaming PC throws at it. I paired this with the Deepcool AK620.', 'Hij doet het prima en is niet slecht maar bij een nauwelijks identieke computer op de cpu na (ander merk) krijg ik betere performance met dezelfde prijs. Dit kan te maken hebben met dat ik de i7-12700k nog niet heb overclocked dus neem dit met een korrel zout.', 'Lieferzeit war leider etwas sehr lange (ca2.5 Wochen) aber jetzt wo ich habe passt alles er l√§uft ruhig mit der K√ºhlung gibt es bisher auch keine Probleme.  Hab ihn aber erst seit ca 1 Woche.Mal schauen ob das so bleibt']

Product: Intel¬Æ Core‚Ñ¢ i9-11900KF Desktop Processor 8 Cores up to 5.3 GHz Unlocked LGA1200 (Intel¬Æ 500 Series & Select 400 Series Chipset) 125W
Reviews: ["Even companies like Intel screw up sometimes.  That's what happened with the 12th and 13th generation Intel CPUs, the ones that followed this 11th generation i9-11900K.  There are detailed explanations for all that, which I won't go into.  The bottom line is, because of chip design, current CPU coolers, and power requirements, it's very difficult and very expensive to get better real world performance from the 12th and 13th generation chips.  This is why Intel is abandoning the LGA-1700 socket after just two years and starting over.  In the meantime, AMD has taken huge chunks of market share, particularly in applications that operate near 100% current load.  The i9-11900K or KF reached the optimal limit of the LGA-1200 socket.  It has an excellent CPU cooling interface and will run all day long at a TDP of 170 watts, completely stable and reliable with 8 cores at 4.8 GHz.  And that's not something the 12s and 13s are able to do.", 'Lo √∫nico que no me gusto fueron las fechas de entrega lo ped√≠ para M√©xico el 13 de abril y ten√≠a que llegar el 19 de abril y se atras√≥ la entrega por temas de aduana y me llegar√≠a hasta 2 de mayo y al final me lo entregaron el 24 de abril, pero fuera de eso el producto lleg√≥ bien y funciona al 100. OJO CABE RECORDARLES QUE NO PAGUE NING√öN EXTRA POR ADUANAS', 'fast speeds', 'Came on time and have had no problems.', 'Vino en una caja que no era la original y ya estaba usado ten√≠a restos de pasta t√©rmica por lo dem√°s s√≠ es el producto que dicen es lo que es un I9 11900kf lo tuve que devolver pantallazos azules sin parar cuando le hac√≠as una prueba de extres y reci√©n instalado el Windows 11', '', 'Do not get the Kf model if you are making a video editing workstation.  Programs can utilize the igpu as well as your gpu to work much more efficient.  But they can‚Äôt do that with a KF cpu.  Big mistake I learned from.', 'la caja del producto lleg√≥ un poco maltratado pero no afecto al producto, producto funcional y operativo', "At release, the reviews for this CPU were brutal.  From the 10-core i9 10900 to an 8-core i9 11900 that only matched and sometimes lagged behind the previous gen (mostly in productivity apps, not gaming) seemed a step backwards.  And at the original price, I agree completely.  But at these current, deeply discounted prices, and factoring in PCIe v4 and NVME 4.0, plus the ability to turbo beyond 5.3 GHz at safe Vcore values, this CPU begins to look like a viable upgrade path from 10th gen.  All-in-all, I'm very satisfied with the performance upgrade and the reasonable price to achieve it.  Still, it's hard to believe this CPU is already two generations behind.  Sigh....", 'After finding out this processor was not the best for the price I was a little bummed. However it was a gamechanger to get it on Amazon used. It overall was a great budget opition and I get good frames paired with a 3090. I recommend this processor when getting a good deal on a motherboard.']

Product: 50PCS Computer CPU Case Tray Packaging Clamshell for Intel LGA775 LGA1150/1151/1155 /1156 i3 i5 i7 CPU Protector Cover (50PCS Transparent)
Reviews: ["I've had issues with some processor clamshells staying shut.  These don't seem to have that issue, I have bought these multiple times and they work very well!", 'These are handy to have around the build area when swapping out cpus', 'Bue. Producto para procesadores intel']

Product: AMD Ryzen 3 3100 Desktop Processor
Reviews: ['It was one of the best budget CPUs at one point in time. The lack of availability made them overpriced. I was lucky enough to get one and was thoroughly impressed by its speed and energy efficiency compared to my R5 2600. There are probably newer better CPUs for the price now.', "AMD indubbiamente con l'uscita dell'architettura Zen 3 sta conquistando il mercato delle CPU guadagnando posizioni di vendita sul concorrente Intel. il processore √® prodotto su design AMD da TSMC con processo produttivo a 7nm.Ha un TDP di 65W che riduce non di poco i consumi ma eroga prestazioni notevoli per un processore di fascia bassa, pi√π che sufficienti per la quasi totalit√† di applicazioni, a parte i giochi pi√π evoluti)Ha di serie la ventola che √® pi√π che adatta per un utilizzo normale (no overclocking). Anche stressandolo per mezz'ora con tutti i core in funzione al 100% con Cinelerra (elaborazione video) la temperatura massima √® di 70¬∞ C stabile.La temperatura durante il normale lavoro di ufficio si attesta sui 34-40 ¬∞C anche perch√© i core vengono sfruttati  con basse percentuali (la maggior parte inferiore al 10%).Non ha un chip grafico integrato per cui richiede una scheda grafica a parte o integrata sulla scheda madre.L'ho montata su una Gigabyte B450M S2H con i soliti dovuti accorgimenti:- non toccare con le dita la pasta termica che √® gi√† piazzata sulla base del dissipatore;- non toccare con le dita la superficie della CPU (altrimenti il grasso presente sulle dita riduce la dissipazione. Se succede pulirla con un detergente a base di ammoniaca, ideale solo acqua distillata e ammoniaca, lasciando asciugare il tutto);- stare attenti a come posizionare la ventola: in alcune piastre madri la parte pi√π sporgente della ventola va a interagire nello spazio dove installare la ram, per cui √® da piazzare girandola di 180¬∞ ovvero tale sporgenza deve essere dalla parte opposta della Ram. inoltre nelle piastre madri, come riportato sulle istruzioni, prima del posizionamento della ventola sono da rimuovere i due supporti laterali per la vecchia serie di CPU AMD. Infine avvitare sempre incrociando, cio√® avvitando due viti opposte per alcuni giri e poi facendo lo stesso per le altre due fino a completo serraggio: in tal modo non si ha lo spostamento della pasta durante il serraggio dovuto alla leggera inclinazione del dissipatore causata dal serraggio delle viti prima da un lato e poi dall'altro andando ad inficiare poi le capacit√† di raffreddamento.", 'Ottimo processore per una build low budget.Associato ad una 1650 super, si gioca tranquillamente a warzone senza temperature elevate o qualsivoglia problema.Consigliato dopo parecchio tempo di utilizzo.', 'Ich betreibe den Ryzen 3 3100 in einem Asus TUF-Gaming B550M mit einem √§lteren Thermalright-K√ºhler und 24 GB RAM (DDR4-3000). Die CPU l√§sst sich problemlos auf 4400 MHz √ºbertakten, wof√ºr ich die Core-Spannung (VID) im Bios auf ca. 1,3 Volt anheben musste. Dabei wurde der Prozessor bei Stress-Tests allerdings mit 76 Grad etwas warm und verbrauchte auch ca. 75 Watt.Ich betreibe ihn daher mit nur 4300 MHz. Bei dieser Taktrate begn√ºgt er sich mit 1,2 Volt Core-Spannung (ich habe dazu die Offset-Spannung im Asus-Bios auf +0,75 V gestellt) und verbraucht unter Last nur ca. 55 Watt.Zum Tempo: Bereits bei 4300 MHz erreicht der Ryzen 3 3100 mit dem Testprogramm Cinebench 15 knapp √ºber 11.000 Punkte. Das ist kaum weniger als der auf 4,9 GHz √ºbertaktete Intel i5-9600KF in meinem Hauptrechner. Grund ist, dass der Ryzen 3 3100 acht Threads hat (4 reale Kerne und 4 simulierte SMT), w√§hrend die Intel-CPU nur 6 Threads hat (6 reale Kerne, kein Hyperthreading).Im Single-Thread-Modus hat der Ryzen 3 3100 bei 4300 MHz eine Rechenleistung, die rund 12 % unter der Single-Thread-Rechenleistung des Intel 9600KF liegt. Dies gleicht der Ryzen jedoch mit seinen 8 Threads wieder aus, wenn er mit Multithread-Programmen gefordert wird. Es ist daher keine √úbertreibung, dass sich der kleine Ryzen mit den rund doppelt so teuren Intel-Boliden aus 2019 messen kann.Ein Nachteil ist, dass der Ryzen 3 3100 bei √úbertaktung auf 4300 MHz (dazu hab ich im Bios des obigen Mainboards den Multiplikator auf 43 gestellt) IMMER bei diesem Tempo l√§uft, und auch die Corespannung wird nicht runtergeregelt. Sprich: "Cool and Quiet" funktioniert in dieser Konstellation nicht. Das f√ºhrt allerdings zu keinem nennenswerten Mehrverbrauch. Idle ziehen die Kerne zusammen ca. 5 Watt (√ºbertaktet). Un√ºbertaktet sind es ca. 3 Watt. Den meisten Strom verbraucht idle - in beiden F√§llen - die SOC-Einheit (ca. 16 Watt, gemessen mit HWInfo64).Fazit: Zum Preis von 95 Euro (Amazon-Preis): Volle Kaufempfehlung. Der "bessere" Ryzen 5 3600 war mir mit 170 Euro aufw√§rts zu teuer. Da warte ich lieber, bis Zen3 rauskommt und r√ºste das Mainboard dann n√§chstes Jahr ggfs. weiter auf. Vielleicht bleibt der Ryzen 3 3100 aber auch "f√ºr immer" drin. Er l√§uft schnell, rund und sparsam. Wer wie ich kein Gamer ist und auch keine Videos rendert, braucht definitiv nicht mehr.', "I bought this CPU for a budget 1080p gaming pc for my nephew. Originally I planned to use the 3300x in the build but they have been unavailable for months. Anyway I built the pc around this with 16gb (2x8gb) 3200mhz corsair vengeance lpx ram, an Asrock B550m Pro 4 mobo, RX 580 8gb Msi Armour gpu, 1TB WD nvme ssd, 2TB Toshiba 7200rpm HDD, 500w Be quiet system 9 psu, GameMax Phantom Gaming Case with tempered glass side panel, all new for ¬£600.I'm really happy with the performance of this rig, as is my nephew. Getting a 4 core 8 threaded cpu for this money is superb (I paid ¬£95), and it is an excellent performer. Even RDR2 chugs along nicely at 60fps with medium to high settings. My I7 7700k cost over ¬£300 3 years ago and the performance isn't far behind it.There are a couple of things to note when building a PC with this chip. It has no onboard gpu so you will need a discreet graphics card otherwise you will not get a display. Secondly I initially had issues getting the new build to post. I turned the power on and the fans powered up but that was it. Luckily have built a few pc's and thought this was a RAM issue. So I pulled out the sticks from slots 1and 3 and tried 2 and 4. Still no luck. I then put a single stick of ram in slot 2 and it posted. I then installed windows, shut the pc down and installed both sticks in their dual config and hey presto all worked fine. I did have a further problem as the I could not get the ram to work at it's designated 3200mhz, I had to settle for 3000mhz, though I'm sure a bios update would solve this.An included cpu cooler is also nice to see, and it works just fine, though if you like to overclock a beefier solution is recommended. It's certainly a lot better than the old intel stock coolers. Anyway a great value cpu, well done AMD.", 'A distanza di due anni tutto ok', 'J\'ai achet√© le Ryzen 3100 en tant que solution temporaire sur une carte-m√®re B550. J\'attendais Zen 3 √† la fin de l\'ann√©e, mais j\'ai √©t√© oblig√© de sauter le pas avant l\'heure.Je n\'ai pas utilis√© le ventirad fourni, j\'ai un Noctua NH-D15s dessus, ce qui est tr√®s disproportionn√©, mais il √©tait √† l\'origine destin√© √† un futur 4900x ! Cela dit la presse sp√©cialis√©e s\'accorde √† dire que le "Wraith Stealth" est tr√®s bon aussi.Bref, pour juste 115 ‚Ç¨, vous pouvez avoir l\'√©gal de l\'Intel Core i7 7700k, ce qui est franchement √©norme. Le processeur est aussi tr√®s facilement overclock√© jusqu\'a 4.3/4.4 GHz, m√™me sur le ventirad inclus, bien que je ne l\'ai pas encore fait moi-m√™me.Pour un PC construit soi-m√™me pas cher, je pense qu\'il est assez difficile de trouver mieux dans le segment qui se situe juste un peu en dessous du "milieu de gamme" actuel. CEPENDANT, si vous avez 20 euros en plus, essayez de trouver un 3300x, ou peut-√™tre m√™me de franchir le pas vers un 3600. Le 3300x est physiquement configur√© diff√©remment au niveau de ses puces, ce qui augmente sensiblement ses performances dans les applis type jeu vid√©o. Quand au 3600 (non-X), c\'est LE processeur le plus imbattable de toute la gamme Zen 2.', "Just got this Ryzen 3 3100 to temporarily use until the Ryzen 4000 CPUs release (paired it with my B550 motherboard and 16GB of 3200 DDR4). Upgraded from an FX-8350. Haven't really tested it much compared to the FX 8350, but I have played a few games on the new CPU and I have got quite a big improvement on some of them. (Still running my RX 480)Fallout 4 as an example, I was currently in another playthrough when I did the upgrade.  I went from getting like 20ish-30 FPS in the worst downtown areas (that's with a lot of settings down to lowest/medium/off) on the FX 8350 build.To getting 60FPS pretty much everywhere (With all max settings, except with Godrays OFF and shadow quality set to high and shadow distance set to 6000 in the .ini which is in-between Medium and High)The worst places for performance loss no longer sent my FPS into the 20s and with the new build the lowest I got was 49fps when it was raining, but it was mainly 55-60 for the worst areas or full 60 everywhere else.So the Ryzen 3 3100 running with 3200mhz DDR4 certainly improved FPS massively in Fallout 4 (happy about that as I mod the game a lot) this was at 1080p with my RX 480 4G.I got improvement in others also, but like I said I haven't really tested it much more.When the Ryzen 4000 CPUs come out I will update the bios when it's released then upgrade to a 8 core Ryzen 7.", 'Good product it‚Äôs faster', 'Surprenant...pour le prix...√©videment en 2023 il y a de meilleurs options mais...je tenais tout de m√™me √† en faire mention...ce cpu jumel√© √† une bonne vieille RX 580 et Halo infinite et warzone 2.0 sont toujours tr√®s jouables!']

Product: Intel Core i9-10900F Desktop Processor 10 Cores up to 5.2 GHz Without Processor Graphics LGA 1200 (Intel 400 Series chipset) 65W
Reviews: ['I build lots of computers for my clients, both AMD and Intel based.  AMD would have you believe that ryzen is some groundbreaking performance monster and if you believe the media ryzen left Intel in the dust years ago.  If you build as many PCs as I have, and work with both platforms on a daily basis you know that\'s not quite the case.  Ryzen is a great platform to be sure, the 3000 and 5000 series perform great typically, however they are often unstable (even without OC) and glitchy and seem to have way more issues than Intel cpus.  I won\'t go into specifics but I\'ll put it this way: I\'ve exchanged probably 1 in 3 AMD ryzen 5000 series cpus I\'ve purchased for builds and not a single Intel chip.  This chip in particular has always proven a stable and extremely well performing example of Intel maturity and stability.  It performs exactly as you\'d expect and the "silicon lottery" always tends to be in your favor with Intel and particularly with this cpu.  Don\'t get me wrong, ryzen is a huge leap forward for amd, and a great platform for high performance and or gaming, but i-series intel just always seems to have a slight advantage (maybe not in benchmarks, but I\'m real day to day usage anyways).  I\'m not an amd fan boy or an Intel purist, I just want a good product to provide my customers in their builds and this is a great cpu by all metrics.', 'Excelente procesador, cumple por mucho todas las expectativas, solo tener una buena gr√°fica y tienes pc para rato.', 'I didn‚Äôt want something I could overclock as I don‚Äôt really mess with that stuff anyways. I just wanted something I could drop in and go. I also didn‚Äôt need the onboard graphics as I had a GPU already lined up for this install.This was the perfect option for me to get a more modern intel processor without all the extras I wouldn‚Äôt use anyways. Coming from an i5-4690 this thing is light years ahead.I can‚Äôt speak for the stock cooler as I opted for a AIO cooler instead but even under some lengthy gaming sessions I don‚Äôt see temperatures get very high at all.', "Powerful CPU. (if you load it up to 100% good radiator required. box cooler is not enough). The 65W TDP figure is derived from the base frequency, also known as PL1 while the actual TDP (PL2) is much higher. In the case of the Core i9-10900F, the maximum PL1 Power limit is actually 170W and the PL2 power limit is 224W.Compare to 10900k it's super good deal if you buy it on some season sale. Even without sale... small performance difference compare to big price difference.", 'I purchased this I9 because of the AMD shortage  and I needed a boost in performance for my flight sim. Although the processor is considered locked you can still over clock it with BCLK (base clock).  It can also be locked on to keep all cores running at max. My chip clocks at 5.1 Ghz and is very stable. Max power consumption is 320 watts. Max junction temp is 70C with an aircooler.  For me it has been a very good deal.', "it's no 5800x but it's more stable so pros should use it", 'It‚Äôs awesome, works great!Make sure you have a good thermal paste!I recommend this. This is my first time doing a core upgrade. I recommend you look up your computer spec upgrade on your computer etc.Super fast and great for gaming!', 'I was worried as I have never bought form Amazon and this was for my first time and it was a big money order. I received my order much earlier than I expected and I am the happiest man on earth. Did I mention that I live in Namibian, Windhoek. Very Well Done Amazon!', "I've used AMD for 15 years and I never thought AMD's new launch would result in me getting an Intel. But here we are. For the first time in my life Intel became the more affordable option, and I'm glad I saved $100 instead of buying the more expensive R7 5800x and waiting several months to receive it.", "Works well.  Easily put together.I built a beast with this one.  I agree it's not as fast as the AMD, but the quality of the motherboards constructed for Intel makes all the difference."]

Product: Intel BX80684I79700F Core i7-9700F Desktop Processor 8 Core 3 GHz speed
Reviews: ['I upgraded from an i5-8400. Saw it was on sale (from an outrageous +$400 initial release last year to just $200 on Black Friday), so this was a no brainer. A lot of the feedback on this card online is negative since they‚Äôre referencing the $/efficiency when it first came out. At this price, it‚Äôs a bargain.I haven‚Äôt seen much of an increase in performance, but XMP now works. I don‚Äôt overclock, so the K version wasn‚Äôt necessarily on my list. The boost clock speeds are almost identical to the K version, and the base clock means cooler idle temps which are both wins for me.I did have to update bios on my Z370 mobo to get it to work. You HAVE to update your bios if you have a mobo older than the Z390 boards by using an 8th generation coffee lake chip, which in this case, I did have.Temps fluctuate. Apparently it‚Äôs from the speedshift technology. It reads changes in processes and temps adjust accordingly within 1/4th of a second, so benchmarks might be a bit alarming for novices. Otherwise, while gaming, the temps were around 53-60 temps. Using an aftermarket cooler. DO NOT USE THE INCLUDED STOCK COOLER. Noctua has amazing coolers.Also, for reference, I‚Äôm using a SFF case, so your cooling mileage will vary. These chips can have been told to run hot, so make sure you upgrade your cooler.Did I need this chip? Probably not. But this chip upgrade was the only sensible upgrade I can make before upgrading my mobo.I‚Äôm using a 1440p monitor and everything is stunning. I figure I‚Äôll upgrade my GTX1070 to something more recent to pair with the i7 9th gen. For these generation of boards, which are now obsolete, this is the best buy in this scenario.However, if you plan on buying a brand new setup, I would stay away from this chip and the coffee lake/refresh family. By buying this chip, you‚Äôll be trapping yourself, being unable to upgrade your chip in the future (since future chipsets are no longer compatible on these boards). These chips and boards have become obsolete and intel has moved onto more advanced chipsets. This chip is great for those within the Z370/390 family that got left behind or didn‚Äôt want to upgrade their motherboards. For those who know, join us.', 'I bought the i7-9700F in March 2022 - today June 13 2022, the processor has stopped working yesterday. I went to official Intel website to claim the 3 years warranty.  It is a valid number recognized by Intel; The processor has been replaced successfully.', "I downgraded from a Ryzen 3rd gen to save money in order to buy a faster GPU. This is a stopgap solution for me, I knew I was getting less performance. At least I saved a few bucks on the motherboard, purchased used. I woudn't recommend this CPU if you are starting from scratch, its clock is too low, overclocking is iffy and you will be using more power to make it work compared to more recent offerings from AMD.", "Installed in gaming machine and got the performance expected. Fully compatible with Windows 11. Together with a decent video card, RAM and SSD, it can be used to play any video game there is. There's always better, but for the price this is the best choice for gaming and software performance.", 'i7 9700F CPU arrived as ordered and was appearance wise in very good condition.  We installed the chip on an ASUS B365M-A Prime (Gaming) motherboard and ran benchmark tests. The CPU performed as expected.', "I upgraded my PC at the right time and I'm glad I did Lol my old gaming PC was so outdated lmfao but anyways I'm not having any issues", "Now that the 10th gen is out, this is an obsolete review.  Go for the 10XXX series.  However, at the time I bought this, it was a pretty good deal for a decent CPU.  Replaced my 9600K, and I have no regarts.  I can say that something was weird for a while after putting this in.  I'm not sure if it was the motherboard, or the network card on the motherboard, but I was getting weird errors in chrome, and random tabs just erroring out.  I updated the BIOS and put in a 10G NIC, and the problem went away.  Going by the errors, I would say the BIOS update fixed it, but as I changed both at the same time, I don't know.  But now I'm left with a nice PC that works well with my RTX 2080 in 4K.  I'm happy.", 'Really enjoyed the processor and have had no issues with it so far running games with ray tracing. Love the CPU and would recommend to a friend!', 'Re√ßu 3 jours apr√®s avoir commander ! Super', "I first purchased i5 9400 hd 6 CORE 2.9ghz at 4.1ghz overclocked. It was good. it was how do you say. A processor you know it processes thangs and such. I have asus z390 plus gaming wifi up to1gbs wifi its like 888gbs with 650w supply. 32gb ddr4 3600mhz silicon hyperx gaming GPU radeon rx 570. High tower musetex case wwwwwooooooo!!!! Beautiful. So When this i7 9400f dropped to $250 from $400 just before black Friday. Everyone everyone look at the pics.üëÜ‚òùI jumped gun u can see why. everything looks epic and it all by random is x.m.p compatible. 2020 HDR10+ 4K VIZIO 43inch tv. Yeah i will shoot my own eyes out. Old man. That's why I got it!!!üòçüò®üòçüò®üòçüíªüñ•üòÇüòÇüòÇüòÇüòéüòéüòéüòé"]
