Product: AMD Ryzen‚Ñ¢ 9 7950X3D 16-Core, 32-Thread Desktop Processor
Reviews: ["So, first off, I paid $690 for this CPU, replacing an older one so I could play Starfield and upgrade to Windows 11. It claimed to run overclocked at 5.7 ghz. I wanted the fastest best chip. All other CPUs I ever bought from AMD had the overclocking unlocked. This one was not and the software from AMD said it could NOT be unlocked due to the 3D feature. So, it's sold as running at 5.7 ghz, but the software they released says it can't, I couldn't get it to, and my computer shop wasn't able to. I put all that in just for anyone that will say I simply don't know what I'm doing. I called AMD. I wrote them. I read their website and articles. It runs at 4.2, which is barely a little faster than my previous AMD cpu from 2012. 4.2 is much slower than 5.7. They also promised a free Star Wars game with it, but AMD didn't honor the promotion. Within a couple of weeks of selling it to me at the insanely high price, they were discounting it as much as $130. So, I felt stupid for trusting them. I will say, it does run fine. I was able to upgrade to Windows 11 and I do run Starfield with it. Ironically, the only software I had any trouble running came from AMD itself. I'm using it fine with an expensive motherboard, 64GB RAM and an AMD 12GB graphics card. Other than overclocking or getting it to run any faster than 4.2 ghz, I have had no problems with this processor. But since 4.0 processors have been out well over a decade, this is way too much to pay for a 4.2 one. If anyone at AMD or anywhere else actually gets this processor running at 5.7 ghz, I still overpaid, but I'd at least be happier with the purchase. I've got lots of computers and you'd think they'd want happy customers. I've always chosen AMD because of their price, warranty and customer service, but this time it's not broken, so it's not a warranty replacement issue. According to their own software, it can't be unlocked which means it's not designed to EVER really run at 5.7. Too bad nearly every place that sells it still claims that it does, including AMD's website. Like I said, even my overpaid computer techs could not get it to run anywhere near the OC speed. On the other hand that meant it has never overheated, but this could also be because I overpaid for the best water cooling system. There's no game or app my previous cpu liked that isn't better on this one. I hope AMD reads this, gives me the free game, and makes their software and processor work as their website claims. If they do those things, well, it's still too expensive to get all the stars. I was too generous with my money as well as with the stars in this review. But it does run my computer and it does that well. It just doesn't run nearly as fast, isn't running the Star Wars game because they didn't keep their promise and cost way too much. Oh, I also thought the customer service person was rude at AMD, unlike Amazon who are usually super nice. I could give you all the technical details, but others have done that. I told you what matters to me, a nearly lifelong AMD fanboy.", "People bought the overpriced $450 7800X3D and thought it was a good deal, no. That thing has only 8 cores and can't run background task like video exporting, ... while you are video gaming. Also, that one is not great for working. How about spending $100 more for this beast and get both a gaming and working machine with a 16 core monster that are capable of multitasking? I bought this thing for $557 and it came with the Premium edition of Starfield that cost $100. What can I ask for more? The 7950X3D is the best. You can game and open multiple browser tabs, run video editing task in the background without worrying. Just run process lasso when playing video game to move the game to ccd cores. Be sure to equip 64GB memory for it. Why? It has 16 cores, 32 threads. Each thread should have 2GB on paper. Why equip 32GB for a 32 thread chip? Don't listen to people that say 32GB is enough.", 'AMD Ryzen 9 7950X3D √® una bestia da 32 core logici, raffreddato con un THERMALRIGHT PEERLESS ASSASSIN 120SE non va mai oltre i 75¬∞, nel bios ho settato comunque il limite a 80¬∞ per sicurezza (AI TWEAKER - PRECISION BOOST OVERDRIVE - ENHANCEMENT (THERMAL LIMIT - LEVEL 2 80¬∞C), pasta termica THERMAL GRIZZLY, nessun problema.', "Early on, people were having issues with this chip. Mostly through the motherboard and software since it is new tech. Since then, it has become stable enough. There seems to be a variance with the overclock or undervolt capability from chip to chip. I don't see a real advantage to this chip vs the next highest rated chip. You really just want it because its the newest.there is slighlty better multicore performance, but you really have to need it.The other nice thing about this chip is less power usage and lower max temps. It also has some room for undervolting on the power curve and still getting max speed out of it.I suggest you get a really good aftermarket cooler (AIO) to get the most out of this chip.", "Non mi dilungher√≤ sulle sue caratteristiche, stuoli di esperti lo hanno testato in tutti i modi e con i suoi avversari di sempre, i processori Intel. Al momento in cui l'ho acquistato, considerando che √® particolarmente votato al gaming, nei benchmark √® avanti di un buon 10% (e oltre in qualche caso), per contro √® costoso (sebbene, con un atto coraggioso, il suo prezzo di lancio era lo stesso del suo predecessore, il 5800x3D), consuma ben 100w (103 per l'esattezza, in TBD, anche se credo possa arrivare a 180w e oltre) e come dicevo √® l'ideale per il gaming, per altri usi credo siano soldi sprecati.", "The AMD Ryzen 9 7000 7950X3D is a testament to the relentless innovation from AMD. Leveraging the cutting-edge 3D V-cache technology, this processor offers performance levels previously unseen in the consumer CPU market.From a sheer computational perspective, it effortlessly handles intense multi-threaded applications and provides remarkable gaming performance. The added cache delivers a palpable improvement in latency-sensitive tasks, ensuring that users get a snappier and more responsive computing experience.The thermals and power efficiency, aided by the refined architecture, mean that not only is this chip fast, but it also runs cooler and more efficiently than its predecessors. This leads to quieter PC operations, even under load.In the realm of content creation, gaming, and general multitasking, the 7950X3D stands out as a behemoth. The seamless integration with the AM4 platform is a boon for those looking to upgrade without overhauling their entire system.To conclude, the AMD Ryzen 9 7000 7950X3D is a game-changer. It underscores AMD's commitment to pushing the boundaries of what's possible in consumer-grade processors. If you're in the market for uncompromised performance, this CPU is a stellar choice. Highly recommended!", 'Ottimo prodotto, venditore ottimo arrivato prima del previsto.', 'Runs a little on the hotter side while idle (80c), but overall a nice processor. Paired with the 4070ti, it‚Äôs fantastic.', 'Paired strix x670 e-e, 7950x3d, G.Skill Neo, h150i with strix 4070 oc... Graphics to the max on most games 95-125 fps. Able to install with ease! Load temps with corsair h150i elite say between 38-40c. These 16 cores can load up multiple +8 accounts of Eve online in under 2 mins! Top notch cpu! Previous cpu fx 9590 black edition. That was a fantastic processor.', "Running this chip with a DeepCool LT720 360mm rad with an ElecGear Carbon fiber contact frame with kingpin KPX thermal compound. In a lighter gaming workload, I didn't see temps get above 55C on the hottest sensor from hwinfo in the recommended config from AMD. I don't think high temperatures will be a problem for this particular chip, at least not outside what the rest of the 7000 series family can hit.I personally haven't had any stability concerns with this processor in the 3 weeks that I have ran it in place of my 7700x, even with EXPO enabled. In terms of average framerate, this chip feels like a 7700x subjectively, as I have no issues getting frames to a 4090 that I can tell. The 3d cache helps with 1%/.1% lows, to the point that the majority of the micro stutters I had gotten from my 7700x are largely gone in gameplay. There may be a small stutter when swapping from a game to a non game on another screen if using AMD's recommended config, but not enough to be a bother.Overall, if you want to mess around with extra cores later on (streaming, encode, etc.) but want the 3dcache for games now AND your budget allows for it, the 7950X3D is a pretty solid pick in my book for the enthusiast who wants the best without heading into server CPU territory.PC specs relevant to review:Asus ROG Crosshair x670E Extreme (with ElecGear contact frame, BIOS 1415)Gskill Trident Z5 Neo 32gb ddr5 6000 CL30 (EXPO)DeepCool Lt720 360mm radiatior (stock fans with unit, KPX compound)Gigabyte RTX 4090 gaming OC"]

Product: Intel Core i9-13900F Desktop Processor 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores) 36MB Cache, up to 5.6 GHz
Reviews: ['I bought this admittedly excessive CPU for a new build in a Shuttle barebones computer. I keep systems for a long time and they run 24X7 so reliability and future-proofing is important to me. This processor supports 24 threads via 4 performance cores and 16 efficiency cores. All of my computers run shared scientific jobs under the BOINC model so all machines are pushed pretty hard. I\'m glad to say that these CPU\'s cores run relatively coolly with 16 efficiency cores running at 100% saturation full time and the temperatures are in the 70-80C range which is fantastic given that the efficient Shuttle cooling system does it all via a little 3" fan, some fancy heat pipes and heat exchanger and does so quite quietly. I\'m not a gamer but I suspect that the CPU would handle almost anything thrown at it on the 4 performance cores and 8 threads although some heavier cooling might be called for if the performance cores were at 100% but I\'ll probably never know. Despite the eye-watering price I\'m quite satisfied with the purchase.', "Beware when upgrading, things get funny.  First, make sure to update the bios if you have a 600 series mobo.  Even then, there were issues with booting.  I had to use an old SSD on a USB to boot into safe mode, and only then was I able to reboot into safe mode with my NMVe OS drive.  Seems there's some sort of CPU encryption/associating that goes on and the new CPU will not recognize your old OS drive.  Anyway, I did get it to work and the chip performs as expected - amazing!  I can't give 5 stars because it was such a hassle to install.  Great CPU and price.  I highly recommend it for new builds.  32cores!", "Fast.Gets hot, but probably not as hot as the other 13900 models.280 FPS in Warzone 2's benchmark (w/ 4080 GPU and 7000 mhz DDR5))I upgraded from a 3950x with 3733 Mhz DDR 4 w/ the same GPU.Previously the max FPS I received in Warzone 2's benchmark was about 110.In CS GO I went from like 260 FPS in Dust 2, to 500 FPS."]

Reviews: ['El producto lleg√≥ antes de la fecha establecida, el embalaje ven√≠a muy bien logrado para protejer el producto, es la primera compra que hago a Dicotech pero he quedado completamente satisfecho.', '„Ç≤„Éº„É†„ÅØ„ÇÑ„Çâ„Å™„ÅÑ„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÅÊó•Â∏∏„ÅÆ‰ΩøÁî®„Å´„ÅØÂçÅÂàÜ„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ‰πÖ„Åó„Å∂„Çä„ÅÆËá™‰Ωú„Å†„Å£„Åü„ÅÆ„Åß„Åô„Åå„ÄÅ„Éî„É≥„ÅÆ„ÅåÂõ≥„ÅÆÂ§âÂåñ„Å´È©ö„Åã„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ', 'Excellent price and performance', 'Es un procesador interesante con 4 n√∫cleos y 8 hilos, tiene un rendimiento excepcional.', '', "When this thing is on sale I will buy a few. Product: Intel Core i9-13900 Desktop Processor 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores) 36MB Cache, up to 5.6 GHz
Reviews: ['Installed fine. My MSI motherboard wants to run it at the power levels it would for a K processor. And it actually works fine, just gets hot really fast. As seen under HWMonitor, it will hit the 100 degree thermal throttle limit when any significant benchmark program is run.  I worked around this by changing the cooler profile in the MSI bios from "liquid" to either "tower air" or "box".  "Box" profile  changes the automatic PL1 and PL2 settings to run as the i9-13900 non-K spec limits.  For a little overclocking performance, I set "tower air cooling" mode in the bios and experimented with slightly lower PL1 and PL2 settings as well as lowering the throttle limit from 100 to 95 degrees.  Works great now.', 'Got exactly what I ordered the intel i9 13900 no K model or 12900k. So for those who didn‚Äôt order due to the incorrect description I took the risk for you.', 'There seems to be some discrepancy between the Model # and the item itself. Rest assured, you will indeed get the i9-13900. See the attached for some rather impressive benchmarks. I did not think there would be that much difference between Normal and Turbo modes, but boy, was i wrong. Intel was quite helpful by providing link to their own diag tools:1. Intel¬Æ System Support Utility (Intel¬Æ SSU Report)2. Intel¬Æ Processor Diagnostic Tool3. Intel¬Æ Extreme Tuning Utility (Intel¬Æ XTU).4. Intel¬Æ Processor Identification Utility']

Reviews: ['i5-12400„ÅÆÊôÇ„Å´Âèç„Å£„Åü„Çà„ÅÜ„Å™Ê∞ó„Åå„Åó„Åü„ÅÆ„Åß13400„Å´ÊèõË£Ö„Åó„ÅüÊôÇ„Å´‰∫§Êèõ„Åó„Å¶„Åø„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÅåÂäπÊûú„ÅØ„Ç§„Éû„Ç§„ÉÅ„Çè„Åã„Çä„Åæ„Åõ„Çì„Åå„ÅÑ„ÅÑ„Çà„ÅÜ„Å™Ê∞ó„Åå„Åó„Åæ„ÅôÔºü', 'SHIMI-LAB„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜ„Åì„Å®„ÅßÂÆâÂÆö„ÅÆÂïÜÂìÅ„Å´„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇÂèñ„Çä‰ªò„Åë„ÇÇÂïèÈ°å„Å™„Åè„ÄÅ„Å§„Åë„Çå„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇÂ∞ë„Åó„Å†„Åë„Éô„É≥„ÉÅ„Éû„Éº„ÇØ„ÅÆ„Çπ„Ç≥„Ç¢„ÅåËâØ„Åè„Å™„Å£„ÅüÊ∞ó„Åå„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ']

Product: Intel Core i9-13900KS Desktop Processor 24 cores (8 P-cores + 16 E-cores) 36MB Cache, up to 6.0 GHz, (BX8071513900KS)
Reviews: ['Previously I had the AMD 7950x and it was pretty fast, don‚Äôt get me wrong. However, this 13900ks is a lot snappier even browsing around in windows 11. Programs launch faster and games are buttery smooth @ 4k ultra details, when paired with an Nvidia 4090. I also love the fact that the ks is a ‚Äúbinned‚Äù CPU, which overclocks more easily and typically handles faster DDR5 memory in the range of 7800-8400Mhz depending on how good the memory controller is in your 13900ks sample. Regardless, you will probably be able to hit 7800-8000 at the least. This purchase is actually my 2nd 13900ks and I ended up getting a better binned version this time. With an overal(Asus) SP of 113, P Cores 123, e cores 93, and memory controller was 83. Im currently running a G.Skill 32GB(2x16GB) 7800mhz DDR5 kit with XMP turned on in the BIOS. I have been able to bump it up to a stable 8000mhz by bumping up the Memory Controller voltage to 1.4v and the VDD/VDDQ voltage to 1.5v using the same timings that were on my 7800 XMP kit CL36. With the CPU and a Corsair h170i 420mm AIO with 6 fans in a push pull configuration, I was able to get a stable CPU overclock of 60/60/58/58/58/58/58/58 on the (8) P cores, but I‚Äôm pretty sure I can bump the 1-3 core workloads higher. It‚Äôs when using a workload that requires all 8 P cores that I run into some stability issues with my current cooling trying to push it past 5.8Ghz using all 8 p cores. I leave my E cores all synced at 4.3Ghz stock to help give me more P core Overclock headroom. Another overclock method that works really well, is easy and stable, is to turn on the Asus AiOverclock. Given that I have used both an MSI and Asus Z790 motherboard, I highly recommend the Asus ROG brand line for a Z790 compatible motherboard for this 13900ks. They update their BIOS version frequently and there quality is typically very good on there products that are produced in higher numbers. The absolute ideal motherboard for Overclocking and using the fastest DDR5 ram would be the Asus ROG Maximus Z790 APEX(2-DIMM) motherboard. If you just can‚Äôt get your hands on one maybe go with the (4-DIMM) Asus ROG Maximus Z790 Hero motherboard. You should be able to reach up to 7600mhz DDR5 on it. Whatever you do don‚Äôt settle on a motherboard, because it‚Äôs the center of the system and can be upgraded later. I started with an MSI Meg Z790 Ace and wish I had started with an Asus. The MSI ran a lot hotter with the same clock speeds and only supported up to 7200mhz DDR5 using 2x16GB sticks. The motherboard attached in the review photo is the Asus ROG Maximus Z790 APEX, a thermal Grizzly 12/13th gen contact frame to make the cpu more level for the heatsink cooler that goes on top and of course the 13900ks that‚Äôs a little dirty from previously applied thermal paste I just wiped off. Sorry for the long winded review, but this has been my favorite CPU that I‚Äôve owned.  It‚Äôs super fast and you can tinker with it for an easy overclock for fun.', 'Very fast for any application and gaming.With liquid 3 fan cooling system, never gets above 50 deg C in my setup.Get over 250 fps in WOT at 4k res with all graphics settings at max', 'At the time of this review, this is the top of the line for gaming CPU‚Äôs. The first ever chip to hit 6.0Ghz out of the box. It‚Äôs amazing. I have no trouble with anything running or processing on this. Paired with 128GB of ram and a 4090, you can conquer any game or task that the average person could ever need. If you can get one, do it! Just avoid the inflated prices though.', 'No regrets on picking this cpu - it ROCKS, go team blue !', "Works just fine, really fast, lots of cores.  With all the cores running, they will run up to 100 C and throttle back on clock speed with pretty much any standard CPU cooler.  The consensus seems to be that this is limited by the thermal connection inside the CPU case between the actual chip and the upper surface which contacts your cooling block.  In other words, the cores can overheat even if your cooling system can maintain the upper surface of the CPU at room temperature.  You don't want the cores running hot at 99 C for any length of time, and so you really need to tune the CPU clock speed and the voltages with a motherboard that permits overclock tuning.  With a good standard CPU cooler, I found it's possible to run continuously with a 4.7 GHz clock on all 24 cores and keep the core temperatures below 85 C.", "Even with a premium water cooling AIO utilizing 2 of the most powerful 140mm fans on the market (Noctua NF-A14 ippc 3000RPM PWM) cooling my radiator, this CPU hits 100C (thermal throttling) in about 2 seconds at full load on all 32 threads in Cinebench R23.  While my AIO does allow it to run at 5700MHz at 100C, the CPU is using over 330 Watts at that speed & delivering an impressive Cinebench score of 41697.  Basically it's too much CPU for any cooler on the market.  Even manually clocking the CPU at 4500MHz cap sees temps at 92C with fans on 100% speed.To get a decent daily use speed that doesn't drive the fans at freight train noise levels, I have to manually down-clock the CPU to 3500MHz which still gives great gaming performance, but keeps the fans down to about 60% fan speed.While the CPU is great for video editing, I don't think that it's worth the premium price over the 3GHz 13900K processor.  Wish I had saved some $$$ instead of going for the higher clock rate.....", 'I have this chip installed on an Asus z790 Hero. It runs like a dream and I am very pleased with the performance. Coming from an AMD 5950x system - the Intel z790 system and this chip just feel noticeably more snappy and run everything smooth as butter. I got lucky with a 113SP rating and the chip easily holds up to 6.3ghz on multiple cores at once. You pay to play for this one, but that is why its the KING of both gaming and professional workloads.', 'really awesome speeds i can get out of this. arctic II 420mm cools this really really nicely.', 'Expensive but powerful.', "But you're going to pay for it"]

Reviews: ["I initially was thinking between this and the 3700X but after assembling and testing the performance of this CPU, i think i made a good decision and saved that difference in terms of pricing for a better GPU. The CPU performed great even though it was comparable as a intel i5 CPU but i think it feels so fast and i couldn't even feel the difference between this CPU and my other laptop that was running on an i7 CPU. The price point is really unbeatable for team red. Only issue was the CPU temperature itself was hovering around 50 deg even when it was idling and i actually had a NZXT Kraken X62 AIO cooler attached to it but i think it should be fine because it was still way beyond its limit in terms of the temperature which i read online and lots of people say that it was normal. Other than that, really happy with the CPU's performance and price point and kudos to Amazon for delivering it so fast ahead of schedule all the way from US to Singapore, it was so fast and efficient.", 'Upgraded from Ryzan 3 1200 to this. Quite an improvement to games loading speed. My favorite part is able to put up the Zoom wallpaper which cannot be done on the Ryzen 3. Simple improvement to QoL.', 'All arounder CPU with great price over performance. Definately a real bang for the buck performnce beast.', 'This is seriously, I am not kidding, authentic! The reason why it is so much cheaper as US it does not charge taxes or jack up the prices as local shops do in Sim Lim Square or other online retailers in Singapore, hence the price you see here is what you legit get, the real deal. Warranty is definitely covered by AMD Singapore, so you do not need to worry about warranty issues.', "At this point in time, by far the best value and right on the sweet spot of price to performance, disregarding the 1600AF, but as that had its price go up the best value is definitely this 3600 now. Only mild complain I have is that it runs a little hot when idle, but it's not that big of a deal, since it doesn't get much hotter under load.", 'Overall, best budget processor to get. My rig mainly for light gaming and daily net browsing, great performance with this CPU, just that a little issue is this CPU getting hot easily. I am using NZXT H1 with AIO Pump, CPU temp at idle avg 55C, gaming could be 70+C.', 'Ordered 28 May, arrived 9 Jun. Initially, I thought I got a DOA but managed to get it to boot after several restarts. Idle around 45-60c in Ryzen Master with a Wraith Prism Cooler stock fan curve in a non air-con room', 'Working straight out of the box with Asus Prime B550M-A motherboard.', 'Value for money, great performance. Came without any problems at all. Also bought a B450m Mortar Max to go along with this processor. Works out of the box, started the first try. I am very very happy with this purchase.', 'Fast processor that comes with cooler. Drops in on motherboard and works perfectly. I did not see any overheating issues as many has claim and the temperature hovers around 55-65 deg C.']

Reviews: ['Un Ryzen valido, efficiente e di buona potenza in coppia con due ram da 8gb 3200mhz con profilo docp su una mobo Asus Prime b450m-k II. Il prodotto √® sicuramente valido e performante ma ho riscontrato due problemi (non so se sono legati a questo modello, oppure con i Ryzen in generale), le temperature sono risultate abbastanza alte anche per utilizzi semplici, questo mi ha costretto ad acquistare un dissipatore ad aria di buona qualit√† ed il risultato raggiunto √® ottimo, invece la sua parte grafica (Vega6) mi ha causato non pochi problemi come glitch grafici durante la navigazione web che ho risolto disabilitando la funzione di accelerazione hardware ma soprattutto in alcuni giochi la Vega ha mostrato il fianco a sporadici artefatti visivi, nulla di preoccupante ma ci tenevo a segnalare questo problema che potrebbe fare storcere il naso a molti. Per il resto... √® un prodotto valido e che consiglio per configurazioni economiche, vi porterete a casa processore e scheda video praticamente in un colpo solo.', 'Tr√®s bon processeur 4x 3.8Ghz avec prise en charge de la fr√©quence RAM 3200Mhz, Graphic Radeon prend en charge la 4K UltraHD 3840x2160p √† 60Hz.Livr√© avec ventirad WRAITH AMD qui est suffisant pour refroidir correctement le processeur.', 'It works very well.', 'Ha IGP quindi non √® necessaria una GPU dedicata', 'Prodotto eccezionale scelto la mio consulente informatico!!!', '5star', 'Wurde in einem Office-PC eingebaut wo keine Grafikkarte eingebaut wurde, reicht neben normalen Anwendungen f√ºr hochaufl√∂sende Musikvideos. Somit genau das was wir gebraucht haben!', 'Eine sehr effiziente CPU mit 4 Kernen und 8 Threads mit einer performanten Grafikeinheit!Es gibt in dieser Preisklasse (zum Kaufzeitpunkt unter 85‚Ç¨) absolut keine Konkurrenz g√ºr diese CPU, au√üer vielleicht ihr Vorg√§nger, den man teilweise auch schon f√ºr unter 80‚Ç¨ bekommt.Ich w√ºrde aber trotzdem zum 4300G greifen, da man hier einen h√∂heren Takt bei besserer Effizienz f√ºr nur ca. 5‚Ç¨ mehr bekommt.Sch√∂n ist auch, dass diese CPU problemlos und in meinem Falle sogar mit dem Stock Bios auf einem √§lteren Bilstar A320 Mainboard lief, welches unter 50‚Ç¨ gekostet hat.Insgesamt habe ich f√ºr einen neuen Office PC mit dieser CPU, Mainboard, 16gb DDR4 RAM, 256gb SSD, Geh√§use, Netzteil, neue Windows 11 Lizenz nicht mal ganz 230‚Ç¨ bezahlt.Und an die Leistung kommt kein Fertig-PC in dieser Preisklasse ran!', 'L√§uft prima. Bin begeistert von der Grafikleistung.Betreibe die CPU auf einem B550 Mainboard, habe der Grafikeinheit 16 meiner 32 GB Arbeitsspeicher zugewiesen.Gute Grafikleistung in FullHD und darunter. Sehr gut geeignet f√ºr Retro-Gaming. Auch okay f√ºr viele neuere Spiele, wenn man Abstriche bei Aufl√∂sung und Detailtiefe verschmerzen kann.Der mitgelieferte L√ºfter d√ºrfte gern etwas leiser sein, tut aber seinen Dienst.Sehr stromsparend!', '5 stelle perch√® presa a poco . Assemblato un pc da battaglia. Perfetto.']

Product: Thermal Grizzly AMD Ryzen 7000 CPU Guard
Reviews: ['simple solution but perfect function! nuff said...', 'Bon produit mais attention √† la prise de t√™te pour la pose.La nouvelle forme de ces processeurs est un myst√®re, un matin un ing√©nieur chez AMD a du faire un puzzle avec son enfant et il s\'est dit "Pourquoi pas une telle forme pour notre nouveau processeur".Le truc p√©nible s\'est le risque de bavure de p√¢te thermique.Oui aussi attention aux bricoleurs, ce n\'est pas la peine de serrer comme une brute le ventirad, AIO ou wartercooling custom, vous risquez de d√©former le processeur.Points positifs :- Tarif 9,99‚Ç¨ pour trois protections- Une fois bien pos√©, pas de risque de bavures pate thermique.Points n√©gatifs :- Usage unique.- Prendre son temps pour la pose, les gros doigts vous allez pleurer.- Notice pas clair.Je recommande pour les passionn√©s de mod√©lisme, de miniatures ou de peinture minutieuse.Le produit fonctionne, mais cette gal√®re a mettre en place.Pour les impatients, gros doigts, privil√©giez des solutions a double effets maintien sans d√©formation et protection contre le bavures de pate thermique Thermalright ASF-Black AM5 par exemple (quatre fois plus cher mais r√©utilisable)', 'Per il prezzo alla quale sono stati acquistati mi aspettavo veramente molto di pi√π, sia dal punto di vista qualitativo, sia dal punto di vista riguardante la cura nella realizzazione/misurazioni. L\'installazione non √® stata delle pi√π semplici a causa delle dimensioni delle varie dentature leggermente sballata. Ho preferito effettuare il procedimento di installazione del cuscinetto prima di "poggiare" la cpu all\'interno del soket, onde evitare che eventuali tentativi/errori durante la fase di incollaggio (tra l\'altro l\'adesivo √® veramente forte) potessero ripercuotersi, in qualsiasi modo, su parti delicate (pins).A parte tutto questo, questi i cuscinetti sembrano svolgere abbstanza bene la loro funzione (ossia prevenire l\'accumulo di pasta termica nelle caratteristiche dentatature presenti sugli heatspreader delle cpu ryzen 7000).', "I put one on my AM5 CPU.  I wanted to do it out of the CPU socket, but it instructs to do it while in there so I took my time with it.  Removed a little of the backing off a corner, then slowly worked my way around while holding the CPU in place so it didn't shift if I had to pull or push on areas that weren't where they needed to be.  It takes a bit of patience, and you can't expect perfection from things as flimsy as this.  But what it does offer seems a heck of a lot better than nothing, and risking thermal paste getting where it shouldn't be.My one gripe is one of the three you get, had the backing peel off in transport and it got stuck to the instructions.  So I lost one right off the bat.  Didn't realize it until I'd installed this one with a new liquid cooler.  It would be smart to ship these with something more rigid to keep them from getting ruined before the customer even receives it.  I've included a picture of what I mean.Overall this gets a general thumbs up.  Just take your time with applying it, and if you have something small, and plastic, that may help manipulate particularly stubborn areas into place.", "So, to be clear, once installed, its snug and does its job. Doesn't interfere with closing the clamp, fills the spaces nicely, and sits below the IHS.THAT SAIDThe instructions are completely stupid. Once the sticky tape is pulled on the bottom, it is very difficult to place on the CPU WITHOUT making a mistake and pulling the CPU out of the socket - which I did, and ALMOST dropped it. If it had landed on the PINS, game over. Basically, it sticks to the CPU and your fingers at the same time.Best advice - apply the guard to the CPU OUT of the socket, get it to fit properly and snug, make sure you carefully clean the CPU bottom thoroughly with 90% alcohol or above (as you likely will have man handled the CPU by then) and let dry. When it is dry, and the CPU now has the guard applied, you can safely place it in the socket.", "The real gem here is the peace of mind. If you're using liquid metal, this guard is a no-brainer. It lets you reap the benefits of liquid metal without worry. Thermal Grizzly has delivered a top-tier product and backed it up with stellar customer service. Can't recommend it enough. A solid five-star product!", 'Gute Idee Umsetzung aber etwas bl√∂d man muss die Kleber entfernen und dann etwas dran ziehen damit man es √ºber die CPU bekommt dadurch klebt die Teile an der CPU und lassen sich nicht ausrichten nach den 2 Versuch habe ich sie weg gelassen', 'Ich verstehe den Sinn hinter dem "CPU Guard", aber die Passform hat bei mir nicht so richtig hingehauen. H√§tte da f√ºr den Preis ein bisschen mehr erwartet.', 'Erf√ºllen ihren Zweck. Ist halt ein einweg Produkt. Gibt meiner Ansicht nach inzwischen bessere L√∂sungen.', 'The only thing to note is that the guard is really flexible. I used tweezers to apply and ensure a snug fit. The stretchy features helped a good seal surrounding the chip. Works great.']

Product: JEYI 13th Gen CPU Bending Corrector Frame, Socket LGA1700 Bending Corrector Buckle for Alder Lake CPUs - LGA1700-BCF
Reviews: ["I also didn't use the thermal paste that came with the frame. I just wanted to throw in my results in case it is of any use.CPU: i7-12700kMobo: Asus Strix z690-gCooler: NH-U12AThermal Paste: Arctic MX-4Case: Antec Dark CubeI had tested using Cinebench R23 before and after for both stock and oc and the results were within margin of error.Just for reference the stock temps were 76c to 80c with 20c ambient. My OC was the AI option. It was bouncing between 4.9-5.1ghz. Sometimes it did go up to 5.3. It did thermal throttle briefly. CPU fans were full speed. It mainly thermal throttle as it approached 230 watts. I'm sure I could dial it in a bit.I didn't do research before this. It was also cheap entertainment for a day off so I do not feel like I'm out anything. It does look nicer even if no one can see it. I do prefer it over the stock mount. Also I usually don't overclock.It seems upon further reading the contact frame improves water cooling. They have a flat contact plate. The contact frame helps it out because the IHS is concave/convex. On air coolers they tend to also have a matching  curve on the plate. When pressed together they already make good contact.I can confirm that this does nothing for my Noctua cooler. The SecuFirm mount was good at holding the bracket back plate in place during the swap. and it looks way better then the old bracket. No one can see it though under a cooler.", 'Perfect, will buy again!', 'There were no instructions- atleast not in English. The QR code on the paper insert opened a chinese website. It went on easily enough, just make sure the plate on the back of the board stays in place and avoid overtightening to avoid damaging the pcb - don\'t force it. I have no idea if it had any affect on Temps as it was a new build. The picture is not exactly what you get, it shows the cpu bracket, a tube of thermal paste, a spreader, a thermal pad, two finger "gloves" and a tool for removing/replacing the screws on the cpu bracket. I got the bracket, the tool, the thermal pad and a foil packet of paste - which once opened will go to waste if you don\'t use it all. No tube, no spreader, no gloves.If you want the recloseable tube of paste and the spreader to make it easier to properly apply the paste, go with a different brand.If you\'re using a different paste entirely or your cooler has pre-applied paste, then it probably doesn\'t matter and you can save a few bucks using this socket corrector instead of paying for a brand name that does the same thing.', "13900KFs rocketing to 100¬∞C, almost 3 seconds after initiation with cinebench r23 multicore stress test. Pull off the 420mm liquid cooler block and barely any thermal paste on the ends of the block's surface. You can see on the CPU's IHS that all of the thermal paste hasn't even been disturbed except for at both ends of the IHS. This is clearly an issue. I have used this product and it works. Won't get past 85¬∞C after 2 hours of heat saturation in the same cooler with the same test. 253W, All 24Cores Boosting To 5.8GHz w/No Thermal Throttling. üôÇ", 'Only dropped down like 4 degrees. Good price', "I ordered 2 of these for my kids' new computers. The installation wasn't too bad for someone who has built many computers. I used known good thermal paste, but the kit comes with a good amount. After watching videos about the increased thermals, I was sold on these brackets. I haven't done any testing with and without, but the core concept is there for any of the testing on videos about them.", "For $10-$15, this is a decent solution to Intel's awful Independent Loading Mechanism (ILM) for the LGA1700 socket. It does make contact with the board, the Thermal Grizzly option that does not. However the contact point is for this plate are insulated so it doesn't conduct electricity. So, the board won't get short circuited.There are no instructions included, so the way I did it is to gently turn the screws until you feel some mechanical resistance, then give it about another 45 degree turn and it should be good.I saw a 2-3 degree decrease in temps, but I mainly purchased this to prevent bending of the board. Your results may be different.", "Since I couldn't get the Thermal Grizzly version, I settled on this.  I ran Cinebench R23 on a loop prior to the install and was hitting 104C on my 12900K which is at 5.1Ghz all core.  This dropped my temps by over 15C, I sit at 90C on the hottest core and 73C on the coldest core. The install was easy, remove the old bracket and screw the new one on. I turned the screws until I felt a tiny bit of resistance and gave each screw not even a quarter turn after. I am a huge believer in these brackets and this one works perfectly! It comes with a bunch of stuff I didn't use but it's nice for people that don't have a million extra parts like I do.", 'Better temps overall - 15 C under load in my i7', "This is a nice contact frame that works well.  I use Handbrake regularly, and this contact frame dropped Handbrake temps by ~10 degrees C on my i5-12600K.  I'm now able to comfortably run the i5-12600K with an ID-Cooling air cooler, without throttling.The base contains non-conductive (phenolic?) strips that seem quite similar in material to the original Intel ILM.Installation is easy.  I used some Arctic MX-4 thermal paste instead of the supplied paste.  The JEYI has great thermal conductivity numbers, and it may work well, but I went with my tried-and-true paste.Highly recommended."]

A+', "-$6 for two plastic clamshells that must have cost a couple cents to make.-The molding tolerances are super sloppy - one of them wouldn't close right, and although the other does, I need to hold both closed with tape to prevent an accident.That said, I'm sure it will protect the part. Just disappointing for this to be the only option.", "Wouldn't fit Ryzen 7 cpu as described in ad.", 'Absolutely awful quality.']

Reviews: ["Ya le realice varios benchmark y en todos salio excelente, diferentes mobos y gpu's y ha salido con excelentes calificaciones", "Easy to install, speeds inline with online results once I replaced the cooler.  Stock cooler isn't very efficient.", 'lo combine con una rtx4070 y va de maravilla', "I got the i7-11700f, this model has no integrated graphics but im using it as the cpu for a proxmox server. I can say it works great, I can run the game servers I want, as well as host the website I want without so much as a hiccup.The cpu has intel's virtulaization technology in it so device pass-through is possible, and it having 8 cores (16 with hyoer threading) means I can have many instances of vms running at the same time.  It doesn't use a lot of power and that means it will stay cool and it will keep the fans quiet.All in all if I wanted to use this for gaming I see no reason why this couldn't be used in a sub1k gaming build the server I built cost me about 600$ total, and runs great.", 'Finally installed my cpu.Brand new in the box.Works excellent.Delivery 5 out of 5 ( Free expedited) All the way to Vancouver.Quality 5 out of 5I will buy from here again:)Thanks for the positive experience!', 'Buen producto', 'I purchased this and a new motherboard because my old setup was incapable of supporting Windows 11. Product: Intel Core i9-11900 Desktop Processor 8 Cores up to 5.2 GHz LGA1200 (Intel 500 Series & Select 400 Series Chipset) 65W
Reviews: ['OK', "Got my memory in the mail and was waiting for my processor to arrive so i would do one job.Processor came in DOA. had installed everything and went to start up and nothing no reaction at all.Swapped the processor and my system started up immediately. System bios was set ok and was seeing only one memory swapped the memory to test and one was working and one was defect. Bot packages came with a broken seal so i think they were returned because of these problems. I was insured so i got a new processor and new memory send to me. Now lets hope it's not the same issue with the new one.UPDATE: Got The new processor in and went to put it in my new AS ROCK 470 made by CUK and sold by Amazon. Again a faulty processor send by them. Spend hours mailing to CUK have about 28 mails the motherboard supprots the processor. Did everything we knew with a computertechniacian from school but nothing processor didn't work for the second time. Now it comes even if amazon knew the processor was faulty i explained to them i can't get the processors on time back because i'm all the way in the caribbean now and postal service(except DHL) is slow and it will take time to send back. Took me 4 chats to explain they understand. Still i'm waiting and waiting on my refund now about 6 weeks later they tell me Yes but there's a 73.95 dollars restocking fee so i was insured for 44.95 they got that money for the processor they send you that is faulty. You send it back they claim and again send you a faulty one. They claim restocking fee again. This is a good article for CNN about how it functions at amazon. I won't buy nothing like this again and didn't believe poeple complaining about Dead One Arrival till now. Good service AMAZON.", 'I love non k intel processor  as I hate heat', "Was not shipped from Canada, shipped from the US, didn't come in the original box (((WITH NO CPU FAN))). HOPFULY IT MAY WORK....FINE OUT OVER THE WEEKEND.", "It's great but the price is still high for being a previous generation of processor", 'Super rapido, recomiendo conseguir un cooler adicional para enfriar el cpu. El de fabrica que viene no lo aguanta y se apaga.', 'Ca fait cher pour un ventilateur']

Reviews: ['Niente da eccepire su una CPU Intel.Ha integrata al proprio interno la grafica video.', 'Processador atualizado e com excelente velocidade, vale a pena.', "Processeur pour un pc mont√©, cibl√© sur de la bureautique.Le processeur est pos√© sur une carte m√®re de chez MSI coupl√© √† 16go de RAM. Aucune carte graphique en suppl√©ment.L'√©cran est directement connect√© avec le chipset graphique du processeur.Aucune latence, de bugs sur une utilisation normale de bureautique.", "Ho preso questa versione e non la F solo per la possibilit√† di risparmiare sulla scheda video (essendo il mio secondo pc). Dicevano che senza scheda video il pc sarebbe andato bene solo per il campo minato, e ho voluto provare per vedere con i miei occhi. Caspita, ero pronto a ordinare una scheda video (come ho fatto per l'altro computer che √® pi√π prestazionale), ma ho visto che va molto bene. Senza eccellere ovviamente (chi √® esigente spenda pure 500-1000 euro in pi√π di scheda video dedicata). Ma ho notato che gioco benissimo anche a League of Legends senza rallentamenti o scatti. Sar√† anche merito della scheda madre, sar√† la RAM di 16GB, sar√† l'hard disk velocissimo M.2, sar√† il monitor non esageratamente grande (perch√© √® ovvio che se spingete il video su un 42 pollici o su un multischermo il sistema sar√† un po' sotto stress). Fatto sta che il nuovo pc neanche si sente quando √® acceso (quella ventola che gira in continuazione non c'√®!!! Che bello!). A questo punto vado avanti cos√¨ finch√© non mi d√† problemi, ma dubito che me ne dar√† perch√© non sono uno streamer o un gamer professionista.", 'werkt goed.fijne prijs.pas wel op de foto is misleidend, er word aangegeven dat dit een 11e generatie is, dit is niet zo het is een 10e generatie processor.verder is de processor goed, ik gebruik hem voor mijn gaming pc en games spelen vloeiend', 'Prezzo ottimo, processore fantastico per un utilizzo ottimale del pc , o volendo anche per un Gaming in full hd abbinato ad una scheda video economica', '√≥timo desempenho', 'Dados los precios actuales de los microprocesadores, este i3 es una buena adquisici√≥n para montar un pc econ√≥mico de uso general, tanto para ofim√°tica y navegar como incluso para jugar sin demasiadas pretensiones.Por poco mas de 100 euros, no se puede pedir m√°s. Cumple con su cometido de presupuesto ajustado y prestaciones aceptables. Un 4 n√∫cleos (8 con HT) es suficiente y llega hasta los 4,4 Ghz en modo turbo.Y si no necesitas jugar, no hace falta ni comprar una tarjeta gr√°fica, con lo que a√∫n sale mejor, dada la locura de precios de las gr√°ficas.Yo totalmente satisfecho por el precio.', '4 stars for the misleading title. Would have been 5 stars because product is good, delivery speed fantastic and brand new genuine item sealed in box.', 'INTELIntel I3 10105.Procesador b√°sico de Intel con gr√°ficos integrados.Procesador ideal para montar equipos b√°sicos y destinados a la ofim√°tica, es muy solvente para este tipo de tareas y se desempe√±a muy bien.Tambi√©n ideal para mirar contenido social, videos o plataformas de streaming.Se puede jugar con el a juegos, pero siempre que sean de gr√°ficos muy discretos.La verdad que es una opci√≥n excelente para gamas de entrada o ordenadores de presupuesto ajustado.Buen producto y compra 100% recomendada.']

En este sentido, el Intel Core i5-11400F es un procesador de alto rendimiento que recomiendo encarecidamente.Con una velocidad base de 2,6 GHz y 12 MB de cach√© inteligente, el i5-11400F ofrece un rendimiento excepcional en juegos y otras aplicaciones de alto rendimiento. Adem√°s, este procesador tambi√©n es compatible con la tecnolog√≠a Hyper-Threading, lo que significa que puede procesar hasta 12 hilos simult√°neamente, lo que lo hace ideal para aplicaciones que requieren un procesamiento de m√∫ltiples n√∫cleos.Tambi√©n es compatible con la tecnolog√≠a Intel Turbo Boost, lo que significa que puede aumentar su velocidad de reloj hasta 4,4 GHz en momentos de alta carga de trabajo. Esto es especialmente √∫til cuando se juega a juegos intensivos en gr√°ficos o al realizar tareas de edici√≥n de video.En t√©rminos de compatibilidad, este procesador es compatible con una amplia variedad de placas base, lo que significa que se puede usar en una amplia gama de sistemas de juegos. Tambi√©n es compatible con la memoria DDR4, lo que significa que puede usar la √∫ltima tecnolog√≠a de memoria para obtener un rendimiento √≥ptimo.En resumen, como gaming profesional, es una excelente opci√≥n para aquellos que buscan un procesador de alto rendimiento que ofrezca una experiencia de juego sin retrasos. Con su velocidad de reloj de hasta 4,4 GHz y su compatibilidad con una amplia gama de placas base, este procesador es una excelente opci√≥n para cualquier sistema de juegos de alto rendimiento.¬øRecomendable? Product: AMD Ryzen 9 5950X 100-100000059WOF Processor 16-Core 3.4GHz Socket AM4 CPU w/o Fan Retail
Reviews: ['Thought I would treat myself with an upgrade as I have always had a upper range motherboard, GPU ect when I built my system, but financial restraints meant it was the CPU which was the one item I had decided to shave down on at the time of the build. Not disappointed with the 5950x, motherboard accepted the new CPU and done the usual faff, a few restarts to reset all the settings, bios settings and re-login to windows ect, but after that it settled in well after a few minutes. I have to admit to having a smile when I seen the 16 core, 32 threads show up in the hardware manager. My assassin cooler thankfully kept this CPU cool enough at 69/70C when I ran a stress test (all cores and threads running full wack, stock settings), with a room temperature of 23C (summer time) I was a bit apprehensive about that and feared I might have to invest in a A.I.O cooling system to run the 5950x. I would say that an A.I.O might be required if I wanted to over clock though. Some may see the 5950x as over kill but sometimes it nice to have the high end hardware (have and not need, than to need and not have) and it has been a pleasant purchasing experience from both the product and the seller.', 'Yo me dedico al mundo audiovisual, lo utilizo para mover v√≠deos de gran peso , y definitivamente era lo que andaba buscando para trabajar c√≥modo y sin esperas.', 'Una potenza che vale il costo', 'De lo mejor y con calidad. No tiene problemas para funcionar y cargar cualquier tarea', 'This product works extremely well and have paired it with the noctua dh-15 and while it is suppost to run hot it stays at 40 easily when at standby and while playing it goes up to a max of 60 with the graphic settings at max.It also handles extremely well with unreal engine 4.2 when designing and I‚Äôve only managed to pull around 79% max out of it when using it at heavy workloads', 'Procesador perfecto para trabajar, y bueno para jugar, el problema es que es un poco perezoso en las latencias con las memorias, si quieres evitar eso hay que hacer overclock y si no tienes buena refrigeracion es como si no hicieras nada. He visto a mucha gente hablar maravillas, pero, o no me ha tocado un buen silicio o las review estaban compradas. A pesar de tener una fuente y placa base de bastante calidad, que es lo primero que te reprochan. No me convence, cambiare a Raptor Lake, ya que Alder Lake no tiene esa pereza. Ojo!!! no digo que sea mal procesador, en multinucleo es una bestia, pero muchos problemas con las memorias, que aunque dicen que lo han solucionado, no es asi, o no del todo.', "Commande bien arriv√© √† la maison, conforme √† la description, un peu d'appr√©hension suite √† certains commentaires n√©gatifs qui disait avoir re√ßu un colis vide ou abim√©. Autrement le Ryzen 5950X vaut son pesant d'or, mais les performances sont l√†.", "I ordered this to replace a 3950x chip that had gotten fried by a short in a bad component.  Yes, I payed a lot more than MSRP for it but I'm glad to find a copy I could purchase during this time when they are scarce.  The 5950x is a beast of a chip but it's also a better design.  I was able to get the same 64Gb of RAM running with the same settings except that I was able to back down the LLC for RAM setting and move from max setting to 3 on a scale of 5.  Despite this less intense LLC the L1 cache ran about 60% faster; L2 was a little faster and rate of exchange with L3 and RAM was about twice that of what I found for the 3950x testing with MEMTEST86.  This means it runs faster and cooler at the same time.  I attribute this to the fact that they've unified the L1 Cache to 2 areas instead of 4.  All of this while running the RAM seamlessly under +/- 18 hours of intense testing with no errors at 3600Mhz, instead of the default 2133Mhz.  (AsRock Creator x570 Mother board)  You can't get 4 sticks of this much RAM to run at this speed - well beyond base spec for the chip -- without research and tweaking.  However, it runs like a top once you find the design.", 'I upgraded to the 5950x from a 3900x & i think its a pretty sweet upgrade imo ! it is a Beast But I Dont Think a NZXT Kraken X73 is Enough Cooler for it (360mm AIO) Even with all 3 Fans running at 100% fan speed so just be aware is all i am saying ...Great CPU But Its hard to tame it when its at 100% full bore ! Maybe i should Explain a tad first Hot To me is 70-75c I Dont Want to run any thing above that !But amd says its fine to what 80-85c..Im just not going to do it but you can if ya want !', 'Ich benutze diesen Prozessor f√ºr Virtualisierungen und er macht was er soll und zwar richtig gut. Aber es ist dringend eine Wasserk√ºhlung erforderlich. Vor dem Einbau muss eine Biosaktualisierung durchgef√ºhrt werden.']

Product: AMD Ryzen 7 3800XT 8-core, 16-Threads Unlocked Desktop Processor
Reviews: ['Reicht aus um alle Spiele zu spielen üòâ Temperatur ist nicht so extrem wie bei den neuen CPU. Erledigt alles zuverl√§ssig üòä', 'I decided to go ahead and build a new PC for Christmas. I wanted the 5800X, but I have not been able to procure one, so I settled on the 3800XT. Coming from an i7-7700K, a whole heck of a lot has changed. AMD actually did a pretty good job extracting the most performance possible out of the silicon from TMSC\'s 7nm fab process. Pair this CPU with a quality motherboard and DDR4-3600 CL16 RAM (Crucial Ballistix is excellent for the money and over-clockable), set the infinity fabric and memory data rate to 1800-1900MHz in a 1:1 ratio, tighten the timings using the Ryzen memory timing calculator and pretty much leave everything else on auto. You will get excellent performance, see significant latency improvements, and you can also experiment with the PBO settings and under-volting to see what works best. This is actually much closer to Intel\'s offerings for gaming than pundits claim, especially with the newer AGESA BIOS firmware. And for productivity and power efficiency, AMDs Ryzen chips are the reigning champs.For single thread performance, I am scoring 569 in the CPU-Z bench and nearly 6,000 for the multi-threaded benchmark. For reference, my massively overclocked i7-7700K was only slightly lower for single thread, but considerably less than half of the 3800XT\'s multi-threaded score. I am very impressed. I am also not having any temperature issues, using the Be Quiet Dark Rock 4 heatsink and a -100 mV under-volt offset., which gives me about 32 degrees C idle temp and around 60-65 degrees C under 100% load. Be aware that under-volting may impact your CPU\'s performance. I noticed that my multi-threaded bench scores went down with an under-volt, but my single-thread scores went up with an under-volt, which is fine for me since I am mostly gaming, I will sacrifice a bit of multi-threaded performance for better single-thread performance. Also, I tried various PBO settings, none of which improved my particular chip\'s performance. I suspect the 3800XT on the latest silicon from TSMC is already optimized, hence PBO did not help me. Make sure to install the latest AMD chipset drivers and select an AMD Ryzen power plan for Windows. I am currently using the "AMD Ryzen Balanced Power Plan", but the performance plan is good for another 1-2% performance at the expense of power consumption.I have 2 cores that can hit 4.725 GHz (#0 and #3), with 4 cores routinely hitting a bit over 4.6 GHz and the other 2 typically around 4.55 GHz. During a long-running, multi-threaded load, I am seeing about 4.5 GHz on average across all cores, which I think is very good. Some have questioned the value proposition of the 3800XT since it is more expensive and does not come with a stock Wraith cooler, but it was worth it to me for the better boost clocks and massively improved single thread performance (~4-9% faster than the 3700X/3800X for light workloads thanks to the 4.7+ GHz boost, maybe 2-3% for heavy workloads.)I am very happy with this chip so far and definitely recommend it if you are switching over from Intel or a first gen Ryzen and you cannot get yours hands on the newer 5000 series Ryzen chips. This CPU works great for both gaming and productivity, and uses far less power than an i7-10700K or i9-10850K, which I had considered but I like AMD\'s PCIE4 support and upgrade path better than Intel\'s.CPU: AMD 3800XTMB: Asus Prime X570-ProRAM: 64 GB Crucial Ballistix DDR4-3600 @ 1900 MHz (DDR-3800) 16-18-18-38, 1:1 with infinity fabricVC: Gigabyte 5700XT OC (2nd gen)PS: Corsair RMX750Case: Corsair 750DDrives: Multiple Samsung 860/970 SSDs (2.5" and NVME M.2)OS: Windows 10 ProCPU-Z Score: https://valid.x86.fr/bench/mxru2m/1', 'Claramente es un procesador muy muy bueno para todo, y va a poder tirar de todas las gr√°ficas del momento y de las nuevas, pero tambi√©n tiene sus desventajas.Solo ponerla a funcionar ya te das cuenta al poner hwmonitor, hwinfo o el mismo ryzen master de que 1,45 y 1,48v en los test de estres (y en muchas situaciones de baja carga tambi√©n navegando por windows o internet) no es algo cercano a normal, claramente es un l√≠mite demasiado alto el que coge por defecto amd para este micro, por lo que queda descartado para alguien que no entienda de bios, oc, undervolt, etc.En mi caso al trastear, he conseguido buenas cifras dej√°ndolo a 4,4ghz a 1.2250V y baj√°ndole 10 grados (puedo llegar a 4,5ghz a 1.35V, pero no merece la pena por que sube mucho el calor y ganas poco), lo que lo deja actualmente en 72¬∫ en test de estres a tope, cosa que ser√° un horno en verano si lo dejo as√≠ (mi criorig h5 universal no da para mas, ya est√° viejo xD), as√≠ que tocar√° tirar de una refrigeraci√≥n de aire de las mas top ya que no me gustan las l√≠quidas, pero igualmente sab√≠a que tarde o temprano tendr√≠a que cambiar mi disipaci√≥n ya que tiene bastantes a√±os, por lo que para mi no es un problema.El problema de agesa y sus versiones me las podr√© evitar, ya que mi msi krait gaming x370 est√° muerta en actualizaciones hace ya bastante y tiene pinta que se va a quedar as√≠, por lo que un quebradero de cabeza menos mientras dure la placa, pero para el que tenga alguna mas top de las 450 en adelante y est√©n todav√≠a actualizando, como dicen los compa√±eros, se convertir√° en una ruleta de voltages y de cambios en la bios cada vez que se actualice, as√≠ que tenedlo en cuenta.Por lo dem√°s es un bicho y tira de todo, pero hay que dejarla fina y olvidarse de esos tan bien sonantes 4,7ghz en 1 n√∫cleo, ya que se sacrifica bastante y un voltage tan alto de stock no puede ser bueno para la vida del procesador.Dejo el tocho informativo y me despido, saludos a todos y espero que ayude a quien se lo plantee comprar.P.D. amazon si pensabas bajar 15‚Ç¨ despu√©s de 1 semana de haberlo comprado, avisa co** xD.', "Riscrivo la mia recensione dopo quasi 6 mesi di utilizzo:Che dire, ancora soddisfattissimo, soprattutto perch√® in questo tempo ho avuto modo di conoscere meglio le qualit√† di questo processore, e posso dire che il suo massimo potenziale lo raggiunge in Overclock, in particolare consiglio il programma CTR di 1usmus, dove viene applicato un OC ibrido su single e multi core, con voltaggi che si adattano al carico, il mio processore √® particolarmente buono e riesce a tenere stabilmente 4550 Mhz su tutti gli 8 core con 1.36V (ottimo per i giochi, chi impegano massimo un 50% della CPU), mentre con settaggi pi√π conservativi (che si attivano ad esempio durante un render pesante) tiene 4425 Mhz con 1.25V. Ovviamente rinnovo il consiglio di avere un impianto di raffredamento potente, perch√® comunque scalda.Il mio consiglio finale quindi √® di non comprare questo processore se intendete lasciarlo stock, perch√® i miglioramenti rispetto ad un 3700x sono trascurabili, e il boost stock AMD (ma anche dei vari tools delle schede madri tipo ASUS performanche enhancer, che ho provveduto a disattivare una volta capito che non serviva a nulla se non consumare di pi√π) utilizzano veramente voltaggi killer (con conseguenti consumi e temperature elevate) per ottenere delle frequenze ''basse'' (su cinebench raggiunge 4375 Mhz all core applicando un'insensato 1.389V, come ho detto prima con un OC manuale si raggiungono frequenza pi√π alte con voltaggi molto pi√π bassi).Discorso molto simile sul single core, i 4.7 Ghz vengono raggiunti (e anche leggermente superati) da stock, per√≤ con voltaggi mooolto vicini agli 1.5V, mentre con CTR per raggiungere 4.725 Ghz su carichi molto leggeri si usano 1.45V, volore decisamente pi√π sensato.Tirando le somme quindi:Se fate OC manuale o volete provare CTR di 1usmus cosigliatissimo, se non avete intenzione di metterci le mani andate di 3700x e rispiarmiate dei soldi. Perch√® un 3700x e non uno della serie 5000? Semplice, con i soldi risparimiati e una piccola aggiunta ci comprate un monitor 1440p, ed ecco che come per magia vi troverete un processore che va uguale (in game) ma avete 2 core in pi√π rispetto ad un 5600x con relativo margine di utilizzo per il futuro (e in produttivit√†)! Ragionate, non fermativi ai puri benchamrk fatti con una 3090 in 1080p e dettagli medi, nella realt√† le differenze fra i processori per chi non fa un utilizzo lavorativo sono moooolto minori", 'Mit dem 3800 XT habe ich mittlerweile die 3. CPU aus der 3000 er Serie nach 3800X, 3900X und nun 3800XT.Ich darf jetzt kurz erkl√§ren: mein 3800X liegt an der obersten Grenze der Leistungsstreuung, lockere 4500 Mhz Takt bei 1.35 V, 3800Mhz RAM mit 16 er Latenzen, mein 3900X ist eher eine durchschnittliche CPU mit max 4350 MHZ und max. 3600 Mhz RAM mit 14er Latenzen.Zum Vergleich mit dem 3800XT: Ich habe lange gewartet bis ich, eigentlich aus Neugier, eine XT Cpu gekauft habe, schlussendlich habe ich 15 ‚Ç¨ mehr bezahlt als f√ºr den X damals - was f√ºr mich OK ist.Out of the Box zum normalen X war in meinem System kein Unterschied festzustellen, kein einziger Test oder Benchmark hatte eine Abweichung die nicht unter Messtoleranz f√§llt.Die ersten Unterschiede werden mit AMD`s PBO erkennbar - der XT taktet dann n√§mlich auf einzelnen Kernen bis auf 4,9 GHZ ! Allerdings bringt das nur dem bewundernden Betrachter von HW Info etwas den die Leistungsspitzen liegen immer genau am Ende eines Benchmarks an - genau genommen in der ersten Sekunde wenn der Benchmark vorbei ist - bringt Leistungstechnisch also nichts ! Beim Manuellen Einstellen des Taktes funktioniert das gleiche was beim X auch funktioniert UND es lassen sich sogar noch 50 Mhz drauf legen - ich konnte also 4550 MhZ all Core stabil ( Prime 95) einstellen - beim Ram 3600 mit 14er Latenzen - es scheint somit eine eher durchschnittliche CPU zu sein denn man liest ja von teilweise 4,7 GhZ all Core Prozessoren.Wie auch immer: egal ob 4,5 beim X oder 4,55 GhZ beim XT die Testergebnisse sind nahezu ident, egal ob CB 15, CB 20, Prime 95, die 50 MHZ bringen KEINEN nennenswerten Zuwachs an Leistung.Mein Fazit: Wie schon beim Erscheinen der XT CPU`s habe ich vermutet, dass es sich um besonders gut selektierte CPU`s der letzten Fertigungs Generation der 3000er Serie handelt und genau so kann man es auch stehen lassen. Die XT`s sind sehr gut Taktende X Cpu`s wer Pech hat bekommt eben nicht zuf√§llig eine Spitzen CPU wie ich, bei den XT Modellen kann man sich aber die maximal m√∂gliche Leistung zu recht erhoffen und erwarten aber mehr als 15 - 30 ‚Ç¨ w√ºrde ich f√ºr 3% Mehrleitung nicht ausgeben, der 3800 mit X oder mit XT ist trotzdem mein Favorit bei der 3000er Serie.Update: mit etwas Zeit und Testen mit verschiedenen Spannung - Settings habe ich nun stabile 4,6 Ghz all Core, 3600 Mhz Ram mit 14 er Latenzen, CB 15, CB 20 stabil, Prime 95 instabil .Das entspricht fast genau einem + von 40 % gegen√ºber einem 2700x bei 20% weniger Stromverbrauch - wenn mich jemand nach der derzeit besten Allround CPU fragt: 3800 XT wenn der Preis bei dem des X liegt.', "Upgraded from a 2700X and machine is performing better.This CPU does perform extremely well for many applications I've tried such as gaming and CAD although is not a worthwhile significant upgrade from my old 2700X. Having been in a situation where I needed a new CPU the 3800XT was chosen as it offered, at least on paper, a marked clock speed improvement on the 2700X and the CPU was on sale. I must say the CPU is hitting 4.7GHz single core boost straight out of the box and 4.5GHz multi-core boost. Paired with an AIO cooler this performance is not marred with high temperatures either - on multi-core boost it merely touches 72C. This CPU is designed for higher end machines and therefor requires an excellent cooling solution.Overclocking? In my opinion you will yeald a performance boost in only particular specific applications. For gaming just set XMP on in BIOS and allow the single-core to boost to 4.7GHz. Manual overclocking disables the single core boost and therefor you will likely not get extra performance in gaming. Of course with next gen consoles utilising the same basic architecture as the CPU (8C/16T), in the future an overclocked multi-core setup may be beneficial.", "My build benchmarked in the 92nd percentile of current PC's in the world, with the stock AMD CPU cooler, (no liquid)!My Current PC build:‚Ä¢ AMD Ryzen 7 3800XT 8-core/16-Threads.‚Ä¢ AMD Wraith Prism CPU Cooler with Copper Base & 4 Heat Pipes.‚Ä¢ EVGA GeForce RTX-3060.‚Ä¢ ASUS ROG Strix B450 ATX Motherboard.‚Ä¢ 32GB (4x8GB) DDR4 3200MHz Corsair Vengeance RGB PRO Desktop Memory.‚Ä¢ 1TB Western Digital Blue M.2/NVMe Internal SSD, Gen3 PCIe up to 2,400 MB/s.‚Ä¢ Seasonic FOCUS GX-650, 650W 80+Gold Full-Modular PSU.‚Ä¢ 3x SilverStone AB120R 120mm PWM Addressable RGB Case Fans.‚Ä¢ EVGA PowerLink; PCI-e 12volt power adapter, part # 600-PL-2816-LR (EVERYONE should be using this on their GPU).‚Ä¢ Windows 10 Pro‚Ä¢ Adobe Creative Suite Master Collection 5‚Ä¢ Asphalt Legends 9Only the very wealthy (or foolish), feel a need to buy a 3080/3090 GPU, AMD 5950x, an intel i9-11900k. The real crazy folks purchase an AMD Threadripper or Intel Xeon.This CPU will crush most kids gaming or make great creative content!", "CPU seems to check out, my only gripe is I bought it new, but it did not come in the standard Ryzen box, but instead was shipped inside of a small plastic case, with the cooler and it's cardboard cutout inside of a plain shipping box. Not sure of the point in taking it out of the box, to ship it in a box that's exactly the same size, doesn't make me feel too secure in my purchase. Will update if anything changes, but like I said, the chip seems to be as advertised", 'Coming from a 2700x the performance difference is pretty noticeable, especially in single threaded tasks.  However, unlike the 2700x, this is of a chiplet design.  There is only 1 8 core chiplet on this CPU that is designed to run very fast and since it is manufactured at 7nm is EXTREMELY heat dense and runs hot.  I have this in a well ventilated case and have tried custom water cooling with the corsair cpu water block, a Noctua NH-U14S, and now a dual fan NHD15S.  Temps have honestly all been about the same.  After a few weeks I gave up trying to fight the CPU, now I just run it with PBO disabled in BIOS and set a fairly long fan curve for the CPU fans and just let it run as is with only XMP enabled.  Either the 3900X or 3700x run cooler for different reasons.  Overall, very satisfied with the purchase though.  Very fast CPU for gaming and streaming.  Very happy with the purchase and yes I was holding out for a 5900X but with garbage stock levels and pricing on most computer components right now I wanted to upgrade so here it is. :)', "Upgraded from a Ryzen 2600. CPU roughly 30-40% better for about $150 more.  If you can get it on sale, it's worth the money. Otherwise, go with 5000 series Ryzen or a 3700X if available (usually $100 cheaper and near identical performance).Happy with the chip overall - it was available at a lower price point compared to anything else that was worth investing in at the time. Works well in both gaming and hobbyist graphic design/music/video production. Pair with fast RAM for best results. Use an aftermarket cooler because it gets toasty if you overclock it.  You don't need anything special to run it at stock. I use a Scythe Mugen 5 Rev.B and it averages about 50-60 degrees under load. There are plenty of similar coolers (4-6 heat pipes) around $40-50 CAD that will work just as well."]

Product: Intel Core i5-10400 (base stroke: 2.90 GHz; socket: LGA1200; 65 watt) box
Reviews: ["Ho acquisato l'i5 10400 per installarlo su motherboard Asrock B460M STEEL LEGEND in un PC secondario che √® dedicato all'uso ufficio ed ha un cabinet ultraslim in cui non ci sta una scheda grafica dedicata.La scelta √® caduta sul 10400 perch√© √® un esacore con hyper treading (mentre i nuovi Intel serie 11 ne sono privi).Il processore √®, come atteso, assolutamente sovrabbondante per l'uso ufficio, con una riserva di potenza enorme.Per altri utilizzi pi√π impegnativi √® sempre molto valido.Ma se si vogliono ottenere le prestazioni massime √® necessario considerare un importantissimo accorgimento, che incrementa sensibilmente la potenza disponibile.Il processore in questione ha un TDP di 65 Watt nominale, il che si traduce in una frequenza di funzionamento standard di 2,9 GHz per ogni core. Solo occasionalmente, con l'attivazione del Turbo Boost si va ben oltre, arrivando anche a 4 GHZ, con conseguente aumento temporaneo della potenza. Dopo breve tempo, per√≤, il processore riprende ad operare entro i limiti di potenza di 65 W nominali. Questo non per problemi termici, ma unicamente per ragioni commerciali, ossia per diversificare il 10400 dai modelli superiori e renderlo a basso consumo.Molte motherboard di varie marche e, che io sappia, tutte le Asrock con chipset Intel 4XX e 5XX dispongono della possibilit√† di baypassare nel BIOS il limite di potenza, portandolo oltre.Ogni produttore ha la propria soluzione, con differente denominazione commerciale (Asus la chiama APE), ma personalmente preferisco la BFB di Asrock per due motivi:- la potenza attribuibile alla CPU √® sino a 125 Watt e quindi non supera mai le specifiche massime Intel, cos√¨ preservando il processore da eccessi;- l'impostazione √® attivata di default su Auto, che comunque sembra sfruttare tutta la potenza disponibile.Con motherboard di altre aziende va tenuto conto che non tutte prevedono questa opzione e che di dafult √® disattivata.Ad ogni modo, l'attivazione dell'opzione BFB (o con altro nome nel caso di altri produttori) l'i5 10400 non √® pi√π limitato dal TDP di 65 W, ma pu√≤ sprigionare tutta la sua potenza con TDP a 125 W.HWInfo mostra come tutti i 6 core lavorino contemporaneamente a ben 4,3 GHz di frequenza base costante, con conseguente notevole incremento della potenza di calcolo. In sostanza tutti i core possono funzionare in frequenza massima contemporaneamente e senza limiti.Le prestazioni divengono, quindi, non molto distanti da quelle di un i5 10600K che lavori a frequenza standard (ossia senza overclock); manca solo un ulteriore Turbo Boost per arrivare esattamente pari, ma l'incremento prestazionale dell'i5 10400 √® impressionante.Il rovescio della medaglia di tale incremento di frequenza e potenza √® l'aumento del consumo, ovviamente. Per quanto riguarda il calore prodotto, il dissipatore stock √® in grado di smaltirlo senza problemi.E' da tenere conto che questa opzione non danneggia la CPU perch√© la stessa continua ad operare entro le specifiche della serie i5, comportandosi in maniera simile, come detto, ad un i5 10600K senza overclock che operi sempre intorno alla frequenza base.E' peraltro sempre possibile variare il BFB, settandolo a piacere su altri valori, che spaziano da 70 a 125 Watt a passi di 5 W, cos√¨ da raggiungere un compromesso tra prestazioni e consumi, ove necessario.Considerando il prezzo del processore, poter disporre di fatto di un modello che √® qusi pari al modello di punta della serie i5 non √® poco.Posso dire che nei fatti il 10400 con BFB attivo surclassa l'i7 6700 K che ho nel computer principale, con un divario che diviene consistente soprattutto nelle applicazioni che fanno largo uso del multicore e del multitread.Riguardo alla grafica, l'Intel UHD630 non √® certo paragonabile ad una scheda grafica dedicata.Ma per l'uso ufficio ed in generale per impieghi non molto impegnativi va anche meglio del previsto, con una gestione fluida della applicazioni e buone prestazioni di decodifica video.Per 161 Euro ritengo sia stato un'ottimo acquisto. Sto valutando, infatti, di sostituire l'7 6700K con un i9 10900, che grazie alla tecnologia BFB riesce a confrontarsi con un i9 10900K o 10850K, pur costando sensibilmente meno.", 'Como n√£o √© modelo F vem com gr√°ficos integrados, da pra jogar praticamente todos os jogos com gr√°ficos no Low, mas se quiser gr√°ficos bonitos √© recomendado uma placa de video dedicada, produto muito bom e √≥timo custo beneficio.', 'We bought it to build a PC and it seems to be working great', 'Utilis√© en bureautique avec la partie graphique int√©gr√©e le proc rempli parfaitement son travail.', 'Entrega a tiempo y en buen estado', 'F√°cil instala√ß√£o, j√° vem com cooler e pasta t√©rmica. Como meu foco n√£o s√£o jogos, pra mim est√° √≥timo. Achei que demorou a chegar. Foram quase 10 dias. Sou de MG.', 'Bueno', 'Seg√∫n no da v√≠deo sin gr√°fica y a m√≠ s√≠ me di√≥ v√≠deo y me jalo al 100 sin gr√°fica, obviamente no jugu√© en PC sin gr√°fica m√°s que nada me sirvi√≥ para instaciones y entretenimiento normal pero ya con gr√°fica est√° m√°s mamalon 100% recomendado', 'Great Just Great', '√≥timo procesador.']

Product: Intel Core i3-10100 (Base Clock 3.60GHz; Socket LGA1200; 65 Watt) Box
Reviews: ['Comprado por 110 ‚Ç¨ el 3 de marzo de 2023. Vendido y gestionado por amazon.esEl primero me lleg√≥ desprecintado con marcas de uso y restos de pasta t√©rmica, me di√≥ muy mala impresi√≥n.Solicit√© un reemplazo y todo correcto.Muy buen procesador para un ordenador de uso dom√©stico; con 8 gb ddr4 y SSD va muy muy fluido. Tengo otro ordenador con un i7 8700 y en el tiempo de arranque, photoshop, internet, procesador de textos y juegos muy sencillos no puedo percibir ninguna diferencia.Con un pure rock de bequiet! muy buenas temperaturas con el ventilador a unas 400 rpm.Muy recomendado.', 'parfait', 'Non penso ci sia niente di pi√π economico e funzionante, su userbrenchmark va a un 80% di average bemchmark,installato da qualche mese e finora nessun problema', 'A winner from intel with integrated graphics. A thing to consider though is that you can get a 12th gen core i3 for pretty much  the same rate', 'Ideal para programas regulares o para trabajar en online. Bueno para trabajos 3D no profesionales o edici√≥n de v√≠deo. Si trabajas a alto nivel con programas anteriores, te recomiendo que te hagas con un procesador m√°s potente.Muy contento con el precio y la calidad de esta gama.', 'Tutto perfetto', "...un Articolo di Brand & di Qualita'... funziona perfettamente questa CPU, veloce Cuore della Scheda madre, per cui Prodotto consigliato.", "I have used several Core series CPUs and have got to say this has really impressed me for the price range you can't go wrong I got the version with Intel HD Graphics no (F) at end of model number. Super-fast runs under 150F with stock cooler at 95% CPU load per task manager, I put my good heatsink/fan and at 95% load it runs under 130F and idles at about 78F. Either way is really good if you don't have an aftermarket one. This is a Quad core not Duel like the older ones also hyperthreading. Just buy you will see.", 'Ottimo processore con grafica integrata cosi risparmio sulla scheda video che non mi serve, va bene per navigare in internet, vedere documenti foto e video in hd, velocissimo per me va bene cosi.', "Ho comprato questa Cpu per assemblare un computer prettamente destinato ad uso ufficio e quindi senza stare a prendere una scheda video dedicata, visto soprattutto il momento storico in cui siamo e i prezzi fuori dal comune. Questo I3 svolge egregiamente il suo lavoro: per un Pc volto ad un uso basic, quindi navigazione internet, applicazioni Office e visione di contenuti video in streaming va benissimo, forse √® anche troppo. La grafica integrata √® ottima per svolgere questo tipo di lavoro e non serve molto di pi√π alla fine; certo per giocare √® un altro paio di maniche, non l'ho testato in gaming ma gioco forza poi ci vuole una scheda video dedicata secondo me. Per il resto consuma poco, scalda poco ed √® stabile, preso a poco pi√π di 100 euro vale sicuramente la spesa!"]

Product: Intel¬Æ Celeron G-5900 Desktop Processor 2 Cores 3.4 GHz LGA1200 (Intel¬Æ 400 Series chipset) 58W, Model Number: BX80701G5900
Reviews: ['Good', "This is a fully compliant Socket 1200 Intel chip and is compatible with both Z490 and Z590 systems.Power wise it is the weakest of all the CPUs (2 cores), but what it lacks in power it makes up for in price and to be used as a diagnostic/place holder CPU.I plan to use it to diagnose and repair Z490/Z590 motherboards and at such a great price (~$25) it is the type of CPU you stick on the shelf and forget about it till you need it.It even comes with a stock Intel cooler making it very easy to swap in quickly to systems and even bin some CPUs just placing it on top of a CPU for a quick boot.Outside of that? Maybe some basic use for a very non gaming / CPU intensive system. For gaming or anything CPU intensive, you will definitely  want to look elsewhere.For anyone who is getting intermittent CPU error lights that tend to toggle between two colors in their diagnostic panel (Usually CPU and Memory error lights), it is most likely not the CPU but the fact this CPU only supports ~2666 memory. Your memory is most likely running at a faster speed either by default or has been set to its XMP profile. Make sure to completely reset your BIOS by removing your CMOS battery (or jumping the bios reset jumper) to clear all settings. Some G-5900 CPUs can support faster memory but it is not guaranteed as the rating is for 2666 only. Also make sure if it isn't booting to check your motherboard QVL list to make sure the memory is compatible with that motherboard and CPU.5/5", 'Me gustaria tener la informacion para garantia 1 de los procesadores no me funciono y quiero saber el procedimiento', 'I run a Minecraft 1.19.3 server on it. It runs it well a little slow to render chunks and you aren‚Äôt going to be able to max out viewing distance but It‚Äôs better than what I expected from a 20$ Cpu if you want a small scale server for like a NAS or MC server.', '„Éç„ÉÉ„Éà„Çµ„Éº„Éï„Ç£„É≥„Åó„Åü„Çä„ÄÅÂãïÁîª„Åø„Åü„Çä„ÄÅ„Ç≤„Éº„É†‰ª•Â§ñ„ÅÆÁî®ÈÄî„Åß„ÅÇ„Çå„Å∞„ÄÅ„Åì„ÅÆÁü≥„ÅßÂçÅ‰∫åÂàÜ„Å´ÂΩπÁõÆ„ÇíÊûú„Åü„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇCeleron„ÅØÂº∑„Åè„Å™„Å£„Åü„ÄÇ„Ç≥„Çπ„Éà„Éë„Éï„Ç©„Éº„Éû„É≥„ÇπÊäúÁæ§„ÇÑ„Çì„ÄÇ', '', "This cpu shouldn't be used in a gaming pc or work station. I would suggest using this in a budget server or a GPU mining rig only. This is the best cpu for $100", 'Esta bien para su precio trabajo medio excelente para la escuela y navegar', 'Consegui este procesador por la oferta, es muy bueno, tambien sirve para jugar algunos juegos basicos como League of legends o juegos indie de steam, busqueda y navegacion por internet es aceptable, recomendado si lo que buscas es algo basico para ofimatica, no lo recomiendo para gaming profesional por sus bajos nucleos, de resto es una maravilla', 'According to the experts in computing and engineers they recommend that you can buy used cpus b/c if they are not harmed by any means. I bout this one, and the shipping was super fast. I recommend it. if it is used most commonly is sent w/no heatsink so I had to buy one on my own that is compatible with this cpu.']

Product: Intel¬Æ Core‚Ñ¢ i3-10320 Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.6 GHz LGA1200 (Intel¬Æ 400 Series chipset) 65W, Model Number: BX8070110320

All cores have hit 4.5 GHz turbo boost but that is 1.0 GHz slower than intel says it can do. Also get a budget tower cooler as while gaming this CPU hit over 90C with the intel stock cooler. I gave it 4 stars due to this. If it would have boosted to 4.6 GHz I would have gave it 5 stars.', 'If you‚Äôre looking for a decent CPU (office and general stuff) this is your CPU', 'Basic desktop user that likes a responsive system, gone from a i3-6100 system built 5 years ago to this i3-10320. That likes to keep consumption as low as practical. 2 cores, 4 threads at 51w TDP. to 4 cores, 8 threads at 65w TDP. Together with a new motherboard and ram. Has provided quite an improvement.the quoted up to 4.6 turbo has only gone to 4.4 turbo. Using 48 watts at the cpu. Considering that a single core does the majority of the basic tasks. I am very happy with it.', 'Good price', 'This is a great CPU at this price point.', 'Used for a mining rig (basically runs windows and a few programs). Does a great job with no issues.', 'i like the speed of it i use it for my plex server', 'Â§öÂàÜ„ÄÅÈáëÈ°çÁöÑ„Å´i5ÁÑ°Âç∞‰ª•‰∏ã„ÅãÂêåÁ≠â„Åè„Çâ„ÅÑ„Å™„ÅÆ„Åã„ÇÇ„Åó„Çå„Å™„ÅÑ„Åå„ÄÅÊ≠£Áõ¥„Åù„Åù„Çã„ÄÇintel-X90„ÅÆ„Éû„Ç∂„Éú„ÅØCPU„ÇíOC„Åß„Åç„Çã„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÅÈÄöÂ∏∏ÊµÅÈÄö„Å®ÈÅï„ÅÜÂûãÁâà„ÅØÂêå„ÅòÂûãÁâà„ÅÆ„Äå‰∏äË≥™ËâØÂìÅ„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜ„ÅÆ„ÅØ„ÄÅÊú¨ÂΩì„Å™„ÅÆ„Åã„Äç„Å®„ÅÑ„ÅÜÂÆüÈ®ì‰Ωì„Å´„Åó„Å¶„ÅØÈù¢ÁôΩ„ÅÑ„ÅÆ„ÅßË≥ºÂÖ•„ÄÇ']

Quelle perte de temps. Lorsque je les ai appel√©, ils faisaient comme si c'√©tait moi qui s'√©tait tromp√© dans mes commandes, tr√®s insultant.", 'Love it. have built many gamer and video rigs with this CPU', 'Ordered Intel¬Æ Core‚Ñ¢ i9-10980XE but received Intel¬Æ Core‚Ñ¢ i9 10920X', 'Amazon keeps showing the wrong box and description. An i9-10920x 12 core comes in a black box with white letters and it says "x-series" A 10980xe comes in a black box with gold letters and it says"Extreme It\'s also not $1168 more like $729.
