Product: AMD Ryzen 5 1600 Processor with Wraith Spire Cooler (YD1600BBAEBOX) silver small
Reviews: ['Schnell. Gute Leistung.  Preis okay', 'Senza entrare troppo nelle specifiche tecniche che √® possible trovare banalmente nel giro di pochi istanti cercando sulla rete, posso dire che √® una CPU dal rapporto qualit√†/prezzo davvero molto elevato. Presenta 6 core fisici, per un totale di 12 thread utilizzabili. La massima frequenza single core √® pari a 3,6 GHz; quando, invece, vengono usati pi√π core, la massima frequenza raggiungibile risulta pari a 3,2 GHz. In alcuni casi possono esserci incrementi di 100 MHz se entra in funzione il sistema XFR: in altre parole, se le temperature sono accettabili, la CPU riesce, per alcuni periodi, a funzionare con un clock pi√π elevato di quello nominale.La CPU √® fornita con un dissipatore AMD Wraith Spire con pasta termica gi√† applicata; √® un sistema valido se si lascia la CPU a default o si fa leggero OC. La ventola, per√≤, √® un po\' rumorosa.Personalmente, senza voler in alcun modo essere di parte, credo che, nella fascia di prezzo a cui viene proposta questa CPU (sui 200-250 EUR), non ci siano molti motivi per preferirle un Intel i5 attuale (quindi Kaby Lake). I 1600/1600X (ma in generale tutti i Ryzen) sono overcloccabili, hanno 6 core nativi con SMT (quindi 12 thread), hanno un chip saldato (senza pasta termica come negli Intel) e quindi scaldano poco. Tranne che nel caso di 7600K (che, con tutti i 4 core attivi, arriva a 4 GHz e si pu√≤ overcloccare con relativa semplicit√†), hanno frequenze di lavoro simili agli i5 proposti da Intel. Le prestazioni con i giochi sono praticamente sovrapponibili, mentre nei software che scalano bene con i core non c\'√® proprio storia: gli R5 vincono a mani basse. Inoltre, la piattaforma Ryzen adotta il socket AM4, che, a quanto sembra, verr√† usato diversi anni (quindi sar√† possibile continuare ad usare le stesse schede madri); invece, il socket 1151 usato attualmente dai Kaby Lake sembra, quanto meno ad oggi, destinato a "morire" con questa architettura di CPU e sostituito per ospitare i futuri Cannon Lake e Coffee Lake. Credo che l\'unico vero vantaggio degli i5 sia rappresentato dalla GPU integrata che possiedono (i Ryzen ne sono sprovvisti): se non giocate o comunque non usate una GPU dedicata, allora, ad oggi, dovete necessariamente rivolgervi alle CPU Intel se volete prestazioni di un certo livello. Se voleste AMD, dovrete aspettare le future APU Raven Ridge. Concludo dicendo che, oggi come oggi, non investirei 200 EUR o pi√π in una CPU con soli 4 core fisici. Se proprio si volesse Intel, andrei almeno di i7, dato che in ottica futura le applicazioni tenderanno sicuramente ad usare pi√π core/thread. Ma a quel punto perch√© non prendere un Ryzen 7? Ognuno faccia le sue valutazioni.Per concludere:a) Rispetto al 1600, il 1600X, invece che lavorare nel range 3,2-3,6 GHz, lavora nel range 3,6-4,0 GHz; inoltre non √® fornito di dissipatore e il TDP √® di 95 W invece che 65 W come nel 1600. Costa pi√π del 1600, ma se non volete fare OC, √® una scelta migliore. Se non vi cambia niente, allora valutate i prezzi.b) Se volete una CPU principalmente per giocare, meglio rivolgersi agli R5 piuttosto che agli R7. Si risparmiano indicativamente 100 EUR (che si possono investire in una GPU di fascia superiore) e, ad oggi, le prestazioni a parit√† di frequenza sono di fatto identiche (i giochi non arrivano a sfruttare 8 core, e probabilmente non lo faranno per parecchio tempo).c) Prendete delle RAM veloci: l\'interconnessione Infinity Fabric su cui si basano le CPU Ryzen dipende dalla frequenza delle RAM, quindi, ad oggi, potrebbe essere una buona idea prendere almeno delle 3200 16 (che hanno ancora prezzi "accettabili"; nel caso, affrettatevi, perch√© pare che i prezzi siano destinati ad aumentare nei prossimi mesi). Personalmente, posso dire che con scheda madre Asus Prime X370 Pro e RAM Corsair Vengeance LPX CMK16GX4M2B3200C16 non riesco ad andare come da specifica XMP (ovvero 3200MHz 16-18-18-36 1.35V), ma tramite D.O.C.P. a 2933MHz 16-18-18-36-69-1T 1.35V. Tuttavia sono tranquillo, in quanto AMD ha annunciato che a maggio il supporto alle RAM verr√† esteso e migliorato con gli aggiornamenti dei BIOS delle schede madri.Se vi servono altre informazioni, chiedete pure, nel caso aggiorner√≤ questa recensione nel futuro.---------------------------------Aggiornamento 27/04/2017Dopo alcuni test posso spiegare meglio il funzionamento del XFR con questa CPU (tenuta ad impostazioni di fabbrica). Quando √® caricato al massimo un singolo thread, il core relativo al thread in questione si porta a 3,7 GHz. Non l\'ho mai visto andare a 3,6 GHz come da specifica. Quando invece si caricano tutti i thread, tutti i moltiplicatori si impostano a 34x, e quindi la frequenza di ogni core √® circa 3,4 GHz (dico "circa" perch√© il bus clock non √® esattamente 100 MHz ma 99,8 MHz). Se la temperatura del core supera i 65 ¬∞C, i moltiplicatori iniziano a scendere a step di 25 MHz portandosi, fino a 70 ¬∞C, intorno a 33,75-33,50x. Questi sono i risultati da me ottenuti con la ventola fornita nella confezione (con profilo di velocit√† alto ma non massimo) e Prime95. Si pu√≤ concludere, quindi, che a default: 1) la CPU non lavora praticamente mai a 3,2-3,6 GHz come dichiarato, ma a 3,4-3,7 GHz; 2) se si vogliono avere le frequenze pi√π alte possibile, √® opportuno non superare 65 ¬∞C nel core.Usando un dissipatore Noctua D9H e pasta termoconduttiva Noctua, quando tutti i core sono sotto carico con Prime95 il core difficilmente supera i 60 ¬∞C (anche in questo caso la ventola non √® al massimo e funziona a regimi ben pi√π bassi della Wraith Spire). La silenziosit√† √® completamente a vantaggio del dissipatore Noctua.', 'Tiene el mejor costo para los equipo de alto desempe√±oBUENO (comparaci√≥n realizado en el 5 de octubre del 2017):- Sin Overclock (3.20GHz): est√° entre los 4% CPU m√°s r√°pidos del mundo (Percentil 96, con CPU mark de 12643)- Con Overclock1 (3.77GHz, 3.0V): est√° entre los 2% CPU m√°s r√°pidos del mundo (Percentil 98, con CPU mark de 13941)- Con Overclock2 (3.85GHz, 3.5V): est√° entre los 2% CPU m√°s r√°pidos del mundo (Percentil 98, con CPU mark de 14200)- Trabaja con 12 procesos simult√°neos (6 procesadores con 2 nucleos cada)- Bajo consumo de energ√≠a: Sin overclock (11W minimo; 73W m√°ximo); Con overclock1 (17W m√≠nimo; 105W m√°ximo); Con Overclock2 (21W m√≠nimo, 130W M√°ximo)BONITO, est√° dise√±ado con todas las tecnolog√≠as m√°s modernas:- Soporta memoria DDR4: trae canales especializados para optimizar el acceso a las memorias DDR4- Soporta almacenamiento SSD NVMe nativo: trae canales especializados en PCIe para lograr m√°xima velocidad sin afectar el ancho de banda PCIe- Soporta optimizaci√≥n del consumo de energ√≠a por cada n√∫cleo- Soporta realizaci√≥n de Overclock (incremeto de velocidad) en todos los modelos de la categor√≠a RyzenBARATO, comparado con las opciones de la competencia (INTEL):- Por el mismo precio de lo que cuesta un procesador Intel generaci√≥n 7, tienes un desempe√±o aproximadamente 40% mejor- Este procesador debe soportar varios a√±os antes de tener que cambiarlo, esto es debido a que su desempe√±o est√° entre los 4% m√°s r√°pidos del mundo (Percentil 94)- Puedes hacer Overclock sin tener que pagar m√°s por una versi√≥n "liberada para Overclock"- No necesita comprar disipador para hacer Overclock. Consiglio di risparmiare sulla cpu (1600 liscio) e sulla mobo (b350), ma non sulla ram: 2x8gb cl16 3600mhz, ma anche cl 14/15 3200mhz sarebbero l'ideale.. peccato per i prezzi che sono saliti alle stelle da qualche mese e non scenderanno sino a fine anno secondo le attese.Insomma se si deve acquistare un pc oggi, non ha pi√π senso investire su un quattro core sovraprezzato e una piattaforma morente; meglio puntare su ryzen5 1600 che √® il miglior processore in circolazione nel rapporto prezzo/performance, e su una piattaforma che sar√† in grado anche di ospitare le future generazioni di cpu ryzen.", 'Myth 1  ‚ÄòYou cannot install Windows 7 on Ryzen or an m.2 SSD.‚ÄôMyth 2  ‚ÄòYou cannot run the Windows USB Installation Tool from another win7 machine, use 8 or 10.‚ÄôMy win7 install was to be on the gigabyte GA-AB350 gaming 3, ryzen 5 1600, and samsung 960 evo 500gb. The Windows USB installation tool would not run for what I now know was several reasons.As someone who struggled with this as well in several stages, but appear to have siphoned the best practices from the interwebs as a couple of additions, it\'s all I can do to help others save their time. I plan on posting this on the 3 related items since I was unable to post on the blog that helped me along the way.Before we begin, 2 important items for those pulling their hair out or unsure if they can succeed with what they have available.Ensure you have updated your BIOS to the latest version. In my case, it was F22. It shipped with F7!Also, ensure your new SSD is the only storage device attached to the board.1. Obtain your .iso of windows 7 from MS\'s download page if you have not already.2. Format your flash drive as FAT32 and mount the iso image to the drive using the Windows USB/DVD Download Tool, also a MS download. The drive is now bootable but needs to be tweaked with the new USB drivers.3. Obtain the Windows USB Installation Tool from gigabyte or potentially other mfrs. Do NOT unzip it yet.4.**IMPORTANT** While the .zip file is still an un-extracted .zip file, right-click it, properties, and unblock it. This will prevent you from spending a long time unblocking individual files later.5. **IMPORTANT** Extract the .zip file to a very short directory name such as the root of a drive as many have suggested (thank you).6. Run the Windows USB Installation Tool and it will take 8-12 minutes if everything is going well. If any issues, run the tool as an administrator.7. After completion, add any other storage drivers to the flash drive you might need during installation, i.e. NVMe below. No particular path or steps, you can browse to them.8. Safely remove your flash drive and use it in one of the USB 2.0 ports at the top of your new board.9. Power on, F12 for boot menu, install windows 7, hopefully :) And be quite pleased you can use your OS you own outright and is still "supported".A note from step 7: google \'Howto Install Windows 7 on a Samsung SSD 960 Pro (M2)\' for assistance extracting the newest driver from the Samsung executable (that requires the drive to already be installed to run). I did not attempt installation using the NVMe driver that was included in the Windows USB Installation Tool, as it was an earlier version and I was not certain of 960 evo compatibility. Once the files were extracted to c:/program files/samsung, I just added them to the flash drive and pointed to them during windows installation.', 'Easy to install, and worked without error for day one.', 'Ho acquistato questa cpu Ryzen per il nuovo Pc che ho assemblato, l\'utilizzo del pc √® per gaming ed editing e sicuramente questo processore mi sta dando delle soddisfazioniPartiamo dall\'imballaggio: √® arrivato insieme ad altre parti per il pc in un ampio scatolone riempito con pezzi di carta per evitare che i vari prodotti urtassero, sono quindi soddisfatto della protezione.Il processore √® inscatolato in una bella confezione di forma cubica la quale all\'interno contiene: la CPU, il dissipatore wraith spire SENZA LED, un foglietto infromativo e un adesivo da attaccare al computer di bella fattura. When this came out at full RRP (¬£200+), it was worth every penny and I have absolutely no doubt this will be the "go-to" processor for making ultra-budget builds in the future for office workstations, now that the price is less than half it\'s original asking... or maybe it\'s U-series variants, who really knows? They\'re all honestly brilliant.It\'s compatible with the extremely basic A-series motherboards, all B-series boards and some X-series boards without needing updates, for a full list always check the specification from the website itself as new BIOS will be released over time increasing compatibility. It\'s also very easy to mount on the motherboard itself, almost impossible to get wrong - just make sure you line up the right corner while has a symbol on both the processor and the AM4 socket.The Wraith Spire cooler is just phenomenal, AMD\'s competitors would never include a cooler at the price range the Ryzen series started out with. I did run into a little issue but I found out when installing the cooler, it\'s best to do so in a "cross" shape, to apply even pressure across all 4 screws at once. The cooler itself isn\'t RGB but does a great job of keeping it cool under very heavy loads. I would recommend buying third party thermal paste as standard - it will give you a few more FPS under max temps for minimal cost.Performance is phenomenal for the time this chip was released - video editing with this outclasses laptops over 10x its current asking price. It\'s getting a little outdated now (2019) and I would recommend waiting out the new socket AMD will probably bring to the market in 1/2 years if you can wait that long but if you need a simple workhorse PC now for anything that isn\'t intensive gaming, this is a fantastic budget choice.Five stars. This literally changed the market.AMD Ryzen 5 1600 Desktop CPU - AM4 / Hex Core / 3.2 GHz /19MB / 65W']

Product: AMD YD170XBCAEWOF Ryzen 7 1700X Processor
Reviews: ['Excellent piece of engineering! 8 cores 16 Threads CPU at very affordable price, especially when computer parts are in shortage.Easily overclockable to 4.1GHz at 1.35V. This thing is gonna overtake the Zen 2, 3700 at stock speed for half the price!Highly recommended, especially when it has entered the price point below 120USD, new from Amazon.A direct installation on MSI X470 Carbon.', 'Bonjour, bonsoir !Le titre de mon avis fait assez provocateur mais √ßa refl√®te bien ma pens√©e (pav√© en perspective mais complet au moins!). On peut trouver du i7 7700k pour √† peu pr√®s le m√™me prix sur des sites comme LDLC ou materiel.net sauf que le Ryzen 7 1700x a le double de coeur et est bien plus polyvalent et "futureproof" comme on dit que son concurrent en termes de prix. Alors oui, il est un peu en retrait en gaming par rapport √† ce dernier mais honn√™tement √ßa ne sert √† rien de les comparer √† ce niveau sauf si vous √™tes dans le gaming comp√©titif et que vous avez besoin de 140 fps et au-del√†. Et encore, le R7 1700x y arrivera tr√®s bien dans des jeux comme Overwatch ou CS:GO avec de tr√®s bons graphismes si le GPU suit donc c\'est un peu un faux argument en faveur du Intel. N\'oublions pas non plus qu\'en jeu, quand le 7700k est utilis√© √† 100%, on a le 1700x qui est utilis√© vers 30-45% maximum. Il en a donc bien plus sous le capot, ce qui peut servir si vous faites beaucoup de multit√¢che en arri√®re plan en plus de jouer.Avec le R7 1700x vous aurez la possibilit√©, contrairement au i7 7700k de faire bien plus de choses en m√™me temps sans que votre PC ne rame, notamment si vous faites de l\'encodage vid√©o en m√™me temps que de jouer. Sur son concurrent de chez Intel ce sera quasi impraticable car il est encore limit√© √† 4 coeurs et 8 threads alors qu\'avec le 1700x vous pourrez faire √ßa tranquillement, et pas avoir √† laisser votre encodage tourner et devoir vous occuper sans votre PC.Aussi, au niveau du stream, vous pouvez partir si vous n\'avez pas le budget vers un Ryzen 5 avec 6 coeurs mais pour avoir test√© le 1700x sur twitch, je peux vous dire qu\'il est excellent: aucun drop de fps avec une gtx 1080. Si vous streamez et que vous avez le budget vous pouvez foncer dessus. Il ne faut pas oublier en g√©n√©ral qu\'en termes applicatifs il est en concurrence avec un i7 5960x voire du i7 6900k qui sont des processeurs √† plus de 1000‚Ç¨ avec le m√™me nombre de coeurs.Aussi, pour avoir vu et fait des tests √† la m√™me fr√©quence (j\'appuie sur le fait que ce soit √† fr√©quence identique) entre les Ryzen 7 et les derniers i7 Kabylake et Broadwell-E, les IPC (instructions per clock) de Ryzen sont l√©g√®rement sup√©rieures √† celles d\'Intel contrairement √† ce qu\'on pourrait penser. Vous √™tes donc plus malins de prendre ce processeur plut√¥t qu\'un intel au m√™me prix voire plus cher, surtout qu\'Intel change tr√®s souvent de plateforme ce qui oblige √† changer de carte-m√®re en plus du processeur. AMD a dit que la plateforme AM4 devrait rester aux alentours de 2020, vous avez donc le temps !Pour les joueurs qui h√©sitent entre ce processeur et le i7 7700k n\'oubliez pas non plus qu\'Intel sort la g√©n√©ration Coffe Lake d\'ici quelques mois, avec en flagship un 6 coeurs 12 threads... pour le mainstream. √áa veut donc dire que les jeux vont avoir encore plus tendances √† √™tre optimis√©s pour des CPU avec plus de 4 coeurs (on a aussi les consoles qui ont des APU avec bien plus de 4c). On a d√©j√† des pr√©mices avec des jeux comme Battlefield 1. Vous ferez donc mieux d\'acheter un 8c/16t au m√™me prix qu\'un 4c/8t maintenant.Le d√©faut de tous les Ryzen: l\'overclockingAvec une fr√©quence de base de 3.4GHz et un turbo sur tous les coeurs de 3.5GHz, on n\'a malheureusement pas beaucoup de possibilit√© d\'aller bien plus haut avec le 1700X tout comme avec tous les processeurs Ryzen. C\'est sans doute un de leurs plus grands d√©fauts. En effet, on peut en g√©n√©ral pas les faire monter √† plus de 4.1GHz avec du tr√®s bon air-cooling comme avec de l\'AIO (all-in-one) ou du watercooling custom sauf en y mettant un voltage bien √©lev√© du style 1,45 volts et plus. Pour celui que j\'ai achet√© pour mon ami (j\'ai personnellement un 1800x et j\'ai pu tester tous les R7), on a pu atteindre 4GHz sur les 8 coeurs avec un corsair H60 et avec 1,35 volts, ce qui est plut√¥t pas trop mal. Aller au-dessus demande un meilleur refroidissement car plus de volts et on a pas pu aller plus loin.PS: Pour les inquiets de la RAM avec les Ryzen, v√©rifiez bien sur le site constructeur de votre carte m√®re si vous avez une mise √† jour vers l\'AGESA 1.0.0.6 qui r√®gle la tr√®s grande majorit√© des instabilit√©s et incompatibilit√©s RAM. Vous trouverez sur reddit, les sites des constructeurs et youtube plein d\'infos √† ce niveauEN R√âSUM√â: Si vous voulez UNIQUEMENT jouer √† des fr√©quences tr√®s √©lev√©es du genre 140-240 fps (et que vous avez l\'√©cran qui va avec √©videmment) vous pouvez aller sur du i7 7700k au m√™me prix mais il vous faudra le changer plus rapidement compte tenu des optimisations de jeux √† venir. Pour tous les autres qui ont le budget pour se faire plaisir, en ont l\'utilit√© ou qui veulent simplement bien investir leur argent tout en jouant "raisonnablement" (en 60-75 fps quoi) prenez plut√¥t le R7 1700x, il vieillira bien mieux ! C\'est la fin de l\'√®re des 4 coeurs pour le grand public !', 'Este procesador es ideal para aquellos que quieran renderizar o utilizar programas de dise√±o. No hay ning√∫n procesador que le pueda dar batalla por este rango de precio. A nivel de juegos, tampoco tiene ning√∫n problema. No teng√°is miedo por la gente que diga que tal o cual Intel va mejor porque mueve casi todos (o todos) los videojuegos sin ning√∫n problema. Lo que te podr√≠a limitar el poder jugar a el videojuego 1 o al videojuego 2 es la tarjeta gr√°fica que compres, que es donde estar√≠a la diferencia en poder jugar o no, ya que este procesador es demasiado potente para cualquier videojuego y lo ser√° por lo menos unos a√±os m√°s.', "First, system specs:ASRock X370 Taichi board16 GB (2X8) Team T Force Nighthawk DDR4 3200 RAMSapphire R9 280X (1080p)Kingston Hyper X 3K 120 GB SSD for OSWindows 10 Home 64 BitThis was an upgrade from an FX 8320 OC to 4.2 Ghz and 990FX board. Most components were carried over to the Ryzen system. I must say, this is a very noticeable increase in performance! This CPU takes anything I throw at it and doesn't even break a sweat. Handbrake encode times on my custom settings are less than 1/4 the time it took the FX to complete, Blender renders much faster, games are smoother with higher frame rates, and the list goes on. It was well worth the upgrade. Even with the dated and aging GPU I have seen average frame rate gains as high as 50% over the 8320. The AGESA 1006a BIOS update (V3.0 for this board) seems to have solved the early memory problems and stability issues. My board has no issue using the XMP profile for 3200 RAM with the correct timings and the system is fully stable. Shop around and be very selective on your RAM choice. DDR4 3200 is the fastest supported so far, but this will likely change in time. Get the fastest you can, Ryzen performance gains are pretty much linear up to DDR4 3600.The Ryzen platform still has some rough edges that need smoothing out, but it is at the point now where it will run fine in most any circumstance. For such a new platform, I'm surprised at how well it works. I've not had any stability issues at all. Overall, I'm very satisfied with this CPU and platform. I'm not even going to bother overclocking it yet, it's plenty fast enough for me.This CPU runs very, very cool. Temp monitoring software reports the 1700X and 1800X at 20 degrees Celsius higher than it actually is. Subtracting the 20 degrees, the highest I've seen is 52 degrees running handbrake, and 54 degrees under heavy gaming load. It hovers around 35 degrees when browsing the net. I'm using a Corair H 60 AIO cooler. It is also extremely efficient. I have seen ~96 watts or so under heavy load, and 20-35 during internet browsing.XFR boosting is an absolutely awesome thing! This CPU with the H 60 regularly runs at 3.5 GHz on all cores, and boosts as high as 3.9 GHz when using less cores.Things to consider:I actually was going to get the Ryzen 5 1600X, but the sale price for the 1700X made me go after it instead. The 1600X is roughly equal to or faster compared to the 1700X at stock clocks in games. So if all you're doing is gaming, that's the top choice. If you (Like me) do other things as well such as rendering, video encoding, photo shopping, or CAD work, the 1700X makes more sense. It is also likely a bit more future proof than the hex core Ryzens are as well.Get a good cooler if getting one of the X models! They do not come with a cooler (As of the date I bought mine). The non X CPU's have a very nice stock cooler. The Corsair H 60 is more than enough for this beast at stock clocks and is dead silent. There are many great air coolers out there, too. Just look for one that comes with the AM4 bracket. Most companies will send one separately if the cooler doesn't come with it.TLDR; This CPU is more than enough to handle anything you want to do. It is a massive upgrade from anything older (2008-2014), especially any FX CPU and quad cores. Ryzen is about 76% faster than Piledriver (FX) clock for clock! I am very happy with it and recommend it to anyone looking to build a new system.", "Bonjour,J'ai achet√© ce processeur, car cela faisait longtemps que je souhaitais changer mon vieux 2600K, seulement il fallait une bonne raison, et les 10% de plus par g√©n√©ration offert pas Intel ne me paraissaient pas du tout justifier les hausses de prix.Pour l'aspect esth√©tique, rapidement, la boite et tr√®s classe et le processeur estampill√© Ryzen tr√®s beau. Mais cela n'est pas le plus important puis qu'on ne le verra pas.Voici mon avis :- L'installation se fait sur un socket AM4 d'AMD, les pins √©tant sur le processeur et non plus sur la carte m√®re je n'ai plus peur d'abimer celle-ci, et je ne me demande plus si le probl√®me viendrait pas d'un pin tordu de la carte m√®re quand celle-ci √† un comportement √©trange. Premier bon point.- Les performances qui sont vraiment au top pour tout les logiciels professionnels que j'utilise. Je n'ai pour l'instant, jamais eu le moindre soucis de latence avec ce processeur. La seule chose que je lui reproche sont ses performances sur Winrar, qui g√®re tr√®s mal ce processeur, les performances restent bonnes, mais bien en de√ß√† de ce qu'on peut attendre d'un 8 c≈ìurs.Ce processeur montre r√©ellement toutes ses capacit√©s dans le multit√¢ches, pour un streamer par exemple, c'est la perfection : Jouez, Filmez, Uploadez, sans que cela n'impacte jamais les performances en jeu.- L'overclocking est facile et pouvant facilement faire gagner 25% de performance pour ceux qui ont en besoin, je n'ai jamais vu un mod√®le 1700X ne pas atteindre les 4,0Ghz. Cependant, c'est r√©guli√®rement une fr√©quence plancher pour beaucoup de mod√®le, et de ce point de vue l√†, le 1700 est pr√©f√©rable au 1700X. D√©j√† il n'a pas d'offset de 20 degr√© sur la temp√©rature, et il est plus ou moins capable d'atteindre les m√™mes fr√©quences. le 1700X et 1800X sont √† privil√©gi√©s pour ceux qui ne comptent pas overclocker.- Les temp√©ratures si non overclock√©, le processeur a un tr√®s bon comportement sous watercooling AIO, ne chauffant pas de trop et ne mettant pas √† mal la dur√©e de vie des autres composants.- Le coup de pied dans la fourmilli√®re : Alors qu'Intel nous fait croire qu'il a rien de mieux que des 4 cores, on voit depuis la sorti des processeurs d'AMD qu'Intel nous cachait beaucoup de chose et faisait de la veille technologique sur le dos des consommateurs, tout en ne baissant jamais ses tarifs, AMD a mit fin √† √ßa avec ses nouveau processeur et c'est une bonne chose pour les consommateurs.", "Comprato subito appena uscito, dopo numerose ricerche.Ero indeciso tra due modelli, il 1600x oppure questo e alla fine mi sono lasciato tentare dai 2 core in piu'  ;) anche se la spesa e' salita abbastanza...Per ora il processore si dimostra davvero ottimo, credo che quest anno sara' Amd ha dominare nuovamente il mercato dei processori!Ho scelto le versioni ''X'' per via del fatto che le loro frequenze sono gia' piu' elevate di fabbrica rispetto alle versioni ''normali'' che invece andrebbero overclockate manualmente.IL processore e' fenomenale .. ha raddoppiato il punteggio nel single core rispetto al mio vecchio Amd fx6350  6core..  (cpu-z bench di 440 punti)mentre nel multithread (dove primeggia) risulta essere circa 5 volte piu' veloce nei benchmark (cpu-z bench di 4300 punti)Attenzione pero' ad una cosa..  se anche voi come me ne arrivate da una piattaforma gia' abbastanza performante,(amd fx 6350 , 16gb ddr3 1600, nvia gtx 1070 oc , e  SSD 512GB samsung pro, )  .....  subito non capirete se e' stata una buona scelta passare al ryzen, perche' le prestazioni durante l'utilizzo normale del pc (internet, office, ecc)  sono pressapoco molto simili ..La reale differenza la apprezzerete solo durante l'utilizzo di programmi piu' specifici, tipo photoshop, lightroom, autocad, e videoEditing..  dove questa nuova configurazione vi fara' davvero vedere la differenza di prestazioni rispetto a qualsiasi altra piattaforma.Anche a livello Gaming ho avuto un aumento significativo delle prestazioni.. con quasi il doppio dei frame nel gioco Ghost Recon Wildlands ..utilizzando la stessa cheda video in entrambe le configurazioni (nvidia GtX 1070 OC )E' un processore di nuova generazione, che ha un ottimo potenziale in tutti gli utilizzi .. peccato solo che essendo ancora cosi' tanto ''giovane'', purtroppo non e' ben implementato dai software , e dallo stesso Hardware su cui viene montato.. (schede madri che richiedono un continuo aggiornamento del bios per lo scarso supporto alle ram ddr4 ... e peccato per il  ''solo'' supporto dual channel ..Aprire il Task manager e trovare 16 processori che lavorano e' davvero bello :DIo consiglio il 1700x per chi vuole il top delle prestazioni a 8/16 core,(quindi lavorative)  senza spendere  circa 120 euro di piu' per la versione 1800x che e' uguale in tutto tranne per una leggera frequenza in piu' (che non fa la differenza)Oppure punterei al 1600x dove risulta una frequenza in single core ancora superiore al 1700x (ideale per il Gaming)  ma avendo due core in meno perde molto nel multithread (suvvia... 12 core sono sempre ottimi)  :D", 'I got this on sale, and only been using it a week or so.  I must say its impressive how far AMD has come since its last generation.  There was nothing from Intel that could beat this in price and performance.  The motherboard i bought with it was the "GIGABYTE GA-AB350-Gaming 3" which was on sale for just over 100 dollars.  Just amazing value here.  Similar Intel motherboard and cpu would have set me back almost double the cost and had no noticeable gains for me.I got this to replace an old 2600k cpu.  So far its literally twice as fast in benchmarks i\'ve run on it compared to my 2600k that was overclocked to 4.6ghz.... and its 3 times faster than my 8 core bulldozer cpu i had.  But its single threaded performance is just slightly better over the 2600k, but still good enough that you could easily game on this unless you are a 144/200hz gamer.  Someone running 60 to 75hz will easily hit those framerates with this.  Likely over 100fps in most games if they use the threads.  Unless a game is horribly optimized and a complete cpu hog that only runs on 1-2 threads, this cpu should run games good.  But i\'m actually using this cpu for mainly heavily threaded applications and won\'t be gaming on it much.Comparing it with the 2600k i7, i did a power test on it, and it uses about 25-30 watts less power at idle than my 4.6ghz overclocked 2600k.  I assume it uses over 60-80 watts less power than my bulldozer cpu but i didnt test it directly to it.Since it was the 1700x I got, it didn\'t come with a cooler, so i bought a Noctua NH-U12S SE-AM4 to cool it.  It works well, the temps keep the 1700x at 31-32c at idle, and 42c at 30% cpu usage, and 63-64c at 100% usage (older version of prime95 was used to max cpu, 20 min test).I think one thing to look out for is VRM temps on these ryzen motherboards, they get really hot.  At 100% cpu usage i noticed my vrm temp hit a max of around 112c.  But when i put a small 80mm fan above the heatsink of the VRM, dropped the temps to 65c under the same load.  But under mild load the vrm won\'t hit 112c, so this all depends on how long your cpu will be hitting 100% load and how long you want your capacitors on your motherboard to survive.  A simple fan above the heatsink gives you a lot of cooling on it and makes you feel safer by cutting those temps in half.  Fortunately the motherboard i got let me monitor those temps and fix the problem easily with some airflow.So i\'m happy with this cpu, if you can get it on sale its a steal.  This cpu can do everything i need, and am looking forward to what AMD can do with other ryzen cpus in the future.  I haven\'t tried to overclock this at all and probably won\'t since i\'m getting enough performance from it.  From what i heard you can only overclock them up to 4ghz or so, and its hard to know if its worth the extra power usage for small gains, i\'d have to look into it further.', 'Bonjour,Ce processeur est absolument exceptionnel pour le travail. Coupl√© √† une carte m√®re X370 et de la RAM 3000mhz ce Processeur √©crase tout la comp√©tition en terme de puissance.Non seulement Intel n\'a rien √† proposer d\'√©quivalent √† moins du double du prix, mais en plus les CPU sont beaucoup plus chauds et tirent beaucoup plus de Watts. Donc non seulement chez Intel vous payez plus cher aujourd\'hui, mais en plus vous payez plus cher sur le long terme, sans compter que la temp√©rature √©lev√©e du lineup actuel d\'Intel rend la dur√©e de vie de leur processeur plus courte.Comptez √©galement les cartes m√®re Intel sont beaucoup plus ch√®re (sans rien offrir de plus vu qu\'Intel a invent√© un syst√®me honteux qui est de faire vendre des cartes m√®res plein prix avec toutes les fonctionnalit√©s (RAID, Lanes PCIe disponibles) MAIS les fonctionnalit√©s r√©ellement utilis√©es d√©pendent du Processeur que vous achetez... Donc en gros chez Intel c\'est "achetez-vous des cartes m√®re √† plus de 250EUR avec plein de trucs sympa, mais si vous voulez les utilisez, achetez vous les processeurs √† 1000EUR".Pour moi le choix est tr√®s simple aujourd\'hui:- vous cherchez un processeur de jeu: achetez-vous un 7700K chez Intel ou un R5 1600 chez AMD si vous √™tes un peu plus court au niveau du budget.- vous cherchez un processeur de calcul / rendering: achetez vous un R7 chez AMD, Intel n\'a rien √† proposer d\'√©quivalent si ce n\'est au double du prix.- vous cherchez un processeur HEDT: achetez vous un Threadripper (1920X - 1950X) d\'AMD. Pour le m√™me prix qu\'Intel (1950X d\'AMD vs 7900X d\'Intel) ils sont 30% plus puissants, plus froids et consomment moins d\'√©lectricit√©. Pour la m√™me puissance que chez Intel, ils sont 25% moins chers (1920X), sans comptez les lanes PCIe qui sont non seulement plus nombreuses chez AMD, mais √©galement TOUTES d√©bloqu√©es, contrairement √† Intel.Concernant mon exp√©rience du processeur il tourne √† 3.6ghz sur tous les coeurs, 50C. Cel√† est fait avec l\'outil "Sapphire Power Boost" int√©gr√©e au BIOS d\'AsRock, donc aucun probl√®me de garantie.J\'esp√®re vous avoir aid√©.', 'Ich m√∂chte hier gleich mal mit den zu erwartenden Problemen dieses Prozessors anfangen, damit sich K√§ufer darauf vorbereiten k√∂nnen.1. Stabilit√§tsprobleme unter √§lteren Versionen von Windows 10 (pr√§ Millenium-Update): Als ich den Prozessor zum ersten mal genutzt habe, habe ich Windows 10 komplett neu installiert mit einer Boot-CD, die ich irgendwann Ende 2015/Anfang 2016 erstellt habe. Meine G√ºte war das nervig den Fehler zu finden, wenn alle 5 Minuten der PC abst√ºrzt. Ich hatte erst gedacht es w√§re meine SSD, weil am Stromanschluss beim Umbau ein St√ºck abgebrochen ist und da ein Wackler entstanden ist. Nach einem schnellen Besuch im Saturn und einer neuen SSD blieb das Problem und ich habe erst mal 140‚Ç¨ zus√§tzlich ausgegeben. Es stellte sich dann heraus, dass der Ryzen Prozessor unter √§lteren Versionen von Windows 10 massive Stabilit√§tsprobleme hat. Es empfiehlt sich also f√ºr eine Neuinstallation schnell noch eine neue Windows 10 ISO runterzuladen (geht ja eh alles gratis). Seitdem allerdings (bis auf ein paar missgl√ºckte √úbertaktungsversuche) keine Abst√ºrze mehr.2. Die Sache mit der CPU Temperatur:Wie von vielen Quellen angegeben (und mittlerweile von AMD auch best√§tigt) waren die von BIOS und von Software abgelesenen Temperaturen der CPU deutlich h√∂her (ca. 10-20 Grad) als er wirklich hatte. Angeblich war das daf√ºr gedacht, dass der Prozessor garantiert richtige K√ºhlleistung bekommt, allerdings er√ºbrigt sich das ein bisschen f√ºr Nutzer mit Wasserk√ºhlung, die sich dann fragen, warum der Prozessor im Ruhezustand 60-65 Grad warm wird. Nach dem letzten BIOS update von meinem ASUS Prime X370-Pro wurde dieser Wert angepasst, allerdings wird in der AMD Ryzen Master Software immer noch der erh√∂hte wert angezeigt (siehe Foto), also nicht erschreckt sein und panisch die W√§rmeleitpaste wechseln, wenn euch am Anfang 70 Grad + angezeigt werden.Von diesen Anfangsproblemen mal abgesehen (was mich einen ganzen Tag gekostet hat) l√§uft der Prozessor wirklich gut.√úbertakten: Mit der Ryzen Master Software leicht, auch wenn es viele lieber √ºber BIOS machen werden. Das 1700X Modell, dessen Takt bis 3,8GHz angegeben wurde, kann auch noch gut dar√ºber hinaus gebracht werden. Einige seiten geben an, dass √úbertaktungen bis 4GHz gut m√∂glich sind, bei wurden zwar 4GHz in der Software angezeigt, Realistisch waren es aber (im Task-Manager) ca. 3,9-3,97 GHz, was immer noch gut ist und man sich die Frage stellt, ob man die 100‚Ç¨ f√ºr den 1800X nicht sparen sollte. Ich muss aber sagen das bei Vollast und der √úbertaktung die Temperatur trotz Corsair h60 Wasserk√ºhlung nicht gering waren (ca. 70-80 Grad angepasst nach Temperatur Update), also eine Doppelradiator-K√ºhlung wird in dem bereich doch schon √ºberlegenswertPerformance: Die Performance kann sich wirklich sehen lassen. Ich werde noch ein paar Fotos f√ºr Cinebench score und 3Dmark Firestrike Extreme Physics Test hinzuf√ºgen, aber Ryzen √ºberzeugt deutlich bei CPU lastigen Arbeiten und kommt nah genug an Intels 6900k 8 core Prozessor ran, dass der deutlich geringere Preis (1159‚Ç¨!!) mehr als gerechtfertigt ist. Auch f√ºr Spiele liefert der Prozessor gute Leistungen ab. Er kann zwar generell nicht mit dem Intel i7 7700k mithalten, wenn aber Spiele multithreading besser unterst√ºtzen, √§ndert sich das Bild und der Ryzen 7 wird zu einer gleichwertigen Alternative. Da ich aber in Zukunft mit besseren 8 Core Support f√ºr Spiele rechne, w√§re dieser Prozessor eine lohnende Investition f√ºr zuk√ºnftige Technologie.Alles in Allem bin ich nach einem etwas gestressten Installationstag doch sehr zufrieden mit AMDs neuen Produkt, besonders, weil Intel mal gezeigt wurde, dass gute Qualit√§t nicht extrem teuer sein muss, nur weil man es teuer machen kann.', 'Der Prozessor selbst ist super und das Preisleistungsverh√§ltnis sowieso. Er ist ausreichend in den Rezensionen beschrieben und bewertet.Was sich AMD mit der Core-Temperatur hat einfallen lassen, geht nach meiner Ansicht etwas nach hinten los.Der Plan war eine Wasserk√ºhlung, ausgestattet mit gro√üz√ºgigen Radiatoren, gekoppelt √ºber einen PWM Splitter mit dem CPU-Fan. Nun hat AMD den X-Prozessoren etwas Tolles mitgegeben: sie manipulieren an der CPU Temperatur herum. Sie verpassen ihr ein offset, damit die L√ºftung nicht zu sp√§t einsetzt. In meinem Fall sieht das so aus, dass die CPU im Idle alle paar Sekunden spontan 10¬∞ zulegt ... 36 36 34 42 41, nicht jedoch unter Last, da bleibt sie sch√∂n ruhig konstant.Zun√§chst dachte ich der Temp-sensor ist defekt und habe einen zweiten 1700x ausprobiert - identisch. Dann habe ich auch im Netz das Statement von AMD dazu gefunden, dass die X-Prozessoren einen Offset erhalten, um bei √úbertaktungen rechtzeitig die K√ºhlung anzuregen.So weit so halbwegs gut gemeint, schade nur, dass die L√ºftersteuerung meines MSI X370 Gaming Carbon ziemlich sensibel auf die Spr√ºnge reagiert. Die Folge sind wilde Hochsteuerungen der L√ºfter. Das eingestellte Profil wird ignoriert. Die Wasserk√ºhlung ist gro√ü mit vielen L√ºftern. Sie sollte bei 10% laufen. Die n√§chste Steigung der Drehzahlsteuerung muss hinter 60¬∞C liegen, damit sich die Steuerung im Alltag bei 40¬∞C an das Profil anlehnt. Ansonsten springt sie st√§ndig um 40 bis 60% der L√ºfterleistung hin und  her.Dachte ich, biste clever, legst Du die L√ºfter auf ein Geh√§useanschluss um und w√§hlst die ungest√∂rte Bordtemperatur als Indikator. Denkste, die Steuerung des MSI f√ºr Geh√§usel√ºfter greift ebenfalls auf die CPU  Temp zu. Im BIOS-L√ºfterprofilsteuerung kann man so sch√∂n einen Haken bei CPU/System machen, aber das steuert nur das Diagramm! Also wer meint, er k√∂nne sein Geh√§use beim MSI X370 anhand der Systemtemperatur k√ºhlen lassen, leider falsch. Aber das ist nat√ºrlich Mainboard-spezifisch.Virtualisierung AMD-V wird im Bios unter OC unter CPU Features eingestellt. Brauchte ich ein Forumhinweis, um das zu finden.Kleines Update: Ich meine verstanden zu haben, wie AMD die Temperatur bewertet. Wenn CPU-Last eintrifft, d.h. ein steiler Gradient der CPU-Last entsteht, dann schickt AMD vorsorglich ein Offset an Core Temp, bevor sich die Arbeitslast tats√§chlich in realer W√§rme auswirkt. Das soll bewirken, dass die K√ºhlleistung dann bereits zur Verf√ºgung steht. Reagiert eine gut ausgearbeitete L√ºftersteuerung aber ebenfalls auf Gradienten in CPU-Last und/oder Temperaturverlauf, dann kommt es zu Verst√§rkung des Effekts. Denn anders l√§sst sich nicht erkl√§ren, dass das MSI-Board schon hochdreht, obwohl die Absolutwerte selbst noch bei 40¬∞C liegen und die Grenze zur Drehzahlsteigerung jenseits der 50¬∞C liegen. Wenn die CPU Arbeit hat, z.B. rendern, bleibt die Temperatur konstant.Noch eine andere, vorl√§ufige Anmerkung: bei der Verwendung von Linux Mint 18.2 KDE erhalte ich derzeit noch "unknown hardware". Andere Editionen habe ich noch nicht weiter versucht. Wird vermutlich irgendwie gehen, aber noch keine Zeit zur Nachforschung gehabt.']

Product: Intel Core i3-7100 7th Gen Core Desktop Processor 3M Cache,3.90 GHz (BX80677I37100)
Reviews: ['Den Intel Core i3-7100 (Kabylake-Serie) betreibe ich in einem "Asus B250M-C"-Mainboard (siehe meine separate Amazon-Rezension dazu) mit 2 x 4 GB Crucial Ballistic Sport DDR4-Arbeitsspeicher. Hauptanwendung ist Office/Medienwiedergabe. Als Betriebssystem verwende ich Windows 10 pro 64.Die Rechenleistung des i3-7100 liegt rund 5 % √ºber der des Vorg√§ngers Core i3-6100 (Skylake), was vor allem auf die h√∂here Taktrate von 3,9 GHz zur√ºckzuf√ºhren ist. Wer den Vorg√§nger hat, f√ºr den lohnt sich ein Upgrade daher in der Regel kaum.Im CPU-Test von Cinebench R15 erreicht der i3-7100 420 Punkte. Im Grafiktest von Cinebench R15 kommt er auf 53 Punkte. Gestiegen ist gegen√ºber Skylake die Effizienz. Die Core-Spannung des i3-7100 liegt "idle" bei 0,7 Volt und steigt unter Last auf nur noch 1,09 Volt (beim i3-6100 stieg sie auf 1,18 Volt).Laut HW-Monitor verbraucht der i3-7100 unter Last nur 35 Watt - in etwa so viel wie ein Notebook-Prozessor, aber bei einem Vielfachen der Rechenleistung. Ein (f√ºr mich inzwischen verschmerzbarer) Nachteil der Kabylake-Serie ist, dass sie nicht mehr zu Windows 7 oder 8/8.1 kompatibel ist, weil Microsoft nur noch f√ºr Windows 10 Grafiktreiber bereitstellt.-------------------------------Warum ein Core i3-7100 statt des "hochgelobten" Intel Pentium G4560?Um Intels Pentium G4560, den sogenannten "Preis-Leistungs-Sieger" und "Geheimtipp" unter den Kabylake-Prozessoren, ist nach mehreren positiven Testberichten ein wahrer "Hype" entbrannt. Tats√§chlich bietet auch der G4560 zwei Kerne mit Hyperthreading (fr√ºhere Pentium-CPUs von Intel hatten nur 2 Threads, also KEIN Hyperthreading). Er taktet allerdings nur mit 3,5 GHz. Der Tempounterschied zum i3-7100, der mit 3,9 GHz l√§uft, ist deutlich sp√ºrbar.Der gr√∂√üte Unterschied aber liegt in der Grafik. W√§hrend die 610-Grafik des Pentium G4560 unter Cinebench R15 nur 23 Punkte erreicht, kommt die 630-Grafik der i3-7100 auf 53 Punkte. Grund ist, dass die 630-Grafik doppelt so viele Shader hat. Die Leistung der G630-Grafik entspricht der einer aktuellen Grafikkarte im Preisbereich von 70 bis 100 Euro. Wer nur Gelegenheitsspieler ist, f√ºr den reicht die G630-Grafik vollkommen aus. Bei der 610-Grafik k√∂nnte es eher "eng" werden.Der Pentium G4560 bestach anfangs durch einen sehr g√ºnstigen Preis von 55 Euro. Inzwischen werden aber, offenbar infolge obigen "Hypes", teils 80 Euro und mehr f√ºr ihn verlangt.  Das sind nur 20 Euro weniger als der aktuelle Preis f√ºr den i3-7100. In Anbetracht der Mehrleistung - speziell in der Grafik - ist der i3-7100 meiner Meinung nach inzwischen attraktiver. Vor allem, wenn man die 20 Euro Aufpreis in Relation setzt zu dem Gesamtpreis eines Eigenbau-PCs, der in der Regel bei √ºber 300 Euro liegt.-------------------------------Warum ein Core i3-7100 statt einer neuen AMD Ryzen-CPU?AMD hat mit der Ryzen-Serie den PC-Markt "aufgemischt" und Intel unter Druck gesetzt. So gibt es z. B. seit einigen Wochen Ryzen R3-CPUs, die wie der i3-7100 nur rund 100 Euro kosten, daf√ºr aber vier echte Kerne haben, frei √ºbertaktbar sind und bis auf 3800 MHz oder gar 4000 MHz gebracht werden k√∂nnen. Sind die nicht attraktiver als ein i3-7100? Meine Anwort: Nein. Begr√ºndung:1. Die Rechenleistung des kleinsten Ryzen R3 1200 entspricht laut Tests nur knapp der des Intel Pentium G4560 (siehe oben). Er ist damit leistungsschw√§cher als der i3-7100. Ob das auch (noch) bei √úbertaktung gilt, kann ich mangels Erfahrung nicht beantworten.2. Ryzen-CPUs haben keine eingebaute Grafik. Ich h√§tte zus√§tzlich eine Grafikkarte kaufen m√ºssen. Wenn ich eine wollte, die der Grafikleistung des i3-7100 entspricht, h√§tte ich mindestens weitere 70 Euro ausgeben m√ºssen.3. Ryzen-CPUs haben noch immer eine schlechtere Energieeffizienz als Intel-CPUs. Ryzen ist zwar ein deutlicher Schritt nach vorn (gegen√ºber Steamroller und Co.) Doch gleichauf liegt AMD noch immer nicht. Aktuelle Ryzen-Rechner konsumieren schon im "Leerlauf" laut Tests rund 45 Watt, w√§hrend der i3-7100 mit meinem B250M-C-Mainboard "idle" lediglich 25 Watt verbraucht. Bei H√∂chstlast zieht der i3-7100 inkl. Board/Speicher/SSD nur 62 Watt.-------------------------------Warum jetzt noch eine Kabylake-CPU, wo doch gerade Intels neue Coffeelake-Serie rausgekommen ist? (UPDATE 8.10.17)Mit dem Core i3-8100 (Coffeelake) bietet Intel seit Anfang Oktober - erstmals innerhalb der i3-Serie - einen echten Vierkerner (ohne Hyperthreading) an. Bislang waren die Core i3-CPUs stets Zweikerner mit Hyperthreading. Das ergibt zwar in beiden F√§llen vier Threads, aber mit vier echten Kernen entsteht "mehr Dampf". Auch erfordern immer mehr Spiele das Vorhandensein von vier physischen Kernen. Der Core i3-8100 wird allerdings nur mit 3,6 GHz getaktet.Mitte September, als ich den i3-7100 kaufte, hie√ü es noch, dass der i3-8100 erst Anfang 2018 rauskommen soll. Intel hat den Launch jedoch vorgezogen - offenbar in Reaktion auf die Verkaufserfolge von AMD Ryzen. D.h. der i3-8100 ist bereits jetzt (8.10.17) im Handel mit Lieferzeit bestellbar. Der Preis liegt rund 20 Euro √ºber dem des i3-7100. Speziell f√ºr Gamer d√ºrfte sich dieser Aufpreis lohnen, weil der i3-8100 nach aktuellen Tests (Anandtech) √§hnlich schnell sein soll wie die Einstiegsversionen der Core i5-CPUs der Kabylake-Serie. Wenn ich von dem vorgezogenen Launch gewusst h√§tte, dann h√§tte ich wohl noch gewartet.Ein Nachteil von Coffeelake ist, dass man auch ein neues Mainboard der 300-Serie ben√∂tigt (zurzeit nur als Z370 erh√§ltlich und relativ teurer). Grund: Die Coffeelake-Prozessoren verwenden zwar den gleichen Sockel 1151, haben aber eine andere Pin-Belegung. Au√üerdem sind sie nicht kompatibel zu Intels bisherigen 200- und 100-Chips√§tzen. Der "neue" Sockel hei√üt wegen der unterschiedlichen Pin-Belegung auch 1151-v2. (Dass Coffeelake-CPUs trotzdem auch physisch in √§ltere 1151-Sockel passen - inkl. Aussparungen ["notches"] -, h√§lt Anandtech-Rezensent Ian Cutress als fahrl√§ssig, da elektrische Besch√§digungen von CPU und/oder Mainboard drohen. Um schnell auf AMD reagieren zu k√∂nnen, scheint Intel etwas √ºberhastet vorzugehen.)Ein Grund mehr, sich von dieser Hast nicht anstecken zu lassen. Kabylake-CPUs sind jedenfalls voll abw√§rtskompatibel zu den 100-Chips√§tzen und k√∂nnen daher nach BIOS-Update auch in √§lteren Skylake-Mainboards verwendet werden. Vorteil: Die bestehende Windows-10-Registrierung f√ºr das Skylake-Mainboard bleibt erhalten.Wenn Sie diese Rezension hilfreich fanden, freue ich mich √ºber eine entsprechende Bewertung.', 'CPU i3-7100 @ 3.9GHz mont√© sur une ASUS H110I-PlusPositifs:Performances excellentes pour des usages de bureautique et navigation Internet. (en tache unitaire/simple, il est env. 20% plus lent qu\'un i7-7820X mais 6 fois moins cher).N√©gatifs:* Les variations des tarifs √† 6 mois de la part du fondeur (Intel) sont l√©gitimes; les variations quasi quotidiennes et infond√©es de Amazon comme des vendeurs tiers est ill√©gitime.* Certains CPU 7i√®me g√©n√©ration indiquent "10 Windows requis"; √©videmment cela n\'a pas de sens pour le CPU qui se moque bien de l\'OS utilis√©; par contre les fournisseurs de drivers peuvent (du fait d\'un accord avec Microsoft ou par "commodit√©" (flemme)) ne pas fournir de drivers pour le chipset/le composant graphique int√©gr√© au CPU; c\'est le cas ici de Intel qui ne fournit un driver pour le GPU HD630 que pour W10; si le 1280x1024 convient vous pouvez installer *tous* OS Windows; pour les r√©solutions sup. avec le GPU int√©gr√©, il faudra W10 ou gal√©rer avec un install manuel.Produit achet√© au vendeur CPU-WORLD-UK LTD, livraison rapide en 2 jours, √©changes mail excellent.Ajout au commentaire:Le GPU interne (HD630) est cens√© supporter la r√©solution 2560x1440 (sur des forums Intel, j\'ai lu des experts Intel expliquer que c\'est le cas et d\'autres dire le contraire (!)).Apr√®s diff√©rents tests: le 2560x1440 est support√© pour un √©cran connect√© en HDMI mais pas en DVI-Dual Link (on n\'a alors que 2048x1152). Pas de test fait en DisplayPort, ce connecteur est rare sur le carte avec connecteurs vid√©os.La limitaton de r√©solution est bien du au circuit HD630 de ce CPU, et non √† la carte-m√®re sur lequel il est mont√©.', 'Buscava n√£o gastar muito, acabei escolhendo uma configura√ß√£o boa por√©m ultrapassada e de dif√≠cil upgrade. O processador em si cumpre o que se disp√µe.', "Such a good bang for your buck. I built a super slim mini ITX build in a Silverstone Raven small form factor case. It is about the size of the old Dell desktops my company used to use. The case is a lot less bulky than typical PC builds, but for a minimal build with this processor it was perfect. According to benchmarks on UserBenchmark this processor performs nearly exactly the same as my laptop processor. My laptop processor is a quad core i7-6700hq. This dual core processor performs just as well as my laptop quad core. I put in a GTX 1050 TI graphics card which also near exactly matches the performance of my laptop's GTX 970m. With this processor I build a desktop that can do everything my laptop can do, but for a third of the cost. Pretty awesome low end processor!One thing I forgot to mention is that it comes with its own stock fan/heatsink. Had I known this I wouldn't have bought the $40 noctua low profile fan. Since you can't overclock this processor you really don't need a better cooler than the stock one. I bought an i7-6700K last year and that didn't come with a fan or heatsink, so I didn't think this one would. If you have an i5 or i7 processor I'd buy an aftermarket cooler. For an i3 like this one just use the stock. You really aren't going to see any performance benefits.", 'A Natale mi hanno chiesto di assemblare un PC "economico" da usare a casa. Purtroppo gli I3 di 4a generazione che usavo con schede madri H81M (un\'accoppiata eccezionale) erano introvabili per cui ho dovuto cercare altre soluzioni e mi sono  orientato verso il socket 1151.Scheda madre Asus H110M-D e i3-7100.Con Win10 non ci sono (o almeno non dovrebbero esserci) problemi.Invece per Win7 (e anche 8) Intel rende disponibili i driver video solo per Win Server 2008 ma non per Win7 (sono gli stessi driver). In questo caso occorre smanettare un po\'.Ecco una scaletta di operazioni da fare per installare Win7 sull\'accoppiata Asus H110M-D / i3-7100:1) Attivare sul BIOS l\'opzione "simulazione mouse e tastiera" che troviamo tra le opzioni USB.Nota Bene: Questa opzione non √® detto che ci sia su altri modelli di schede madri...2) installare Win73) Se l\'installazione non comprende il SP1 installare il service pack.4) Installare i driver della scheda madrePer i passi successivi cercando su internet si riesce a trovare anche una versione di driver gi√† pronta per l\'installazione.Oppure potete seguire questa guida su YouTube: "Fix for Windows 7 drivers for Intel 7th gen HD graphics 620 610 615 630 Iris 640 650"5) Prelevare l\'ultima versione disponibile dei driver video per Win Server 2008.6) Eseguire le modifiche indicate nella guida7) installare i driver grafici.Alla fine avrete una macchina di 7ima generazione perfettamente funzionante con Win7 :)', 'El procesador est√° bien, tiene dos n√∫cleos y es r√°pido, parece que en el futuro todo ir√° hacia m√°s n√∫cleos pero en un lustro este aguantar√° bien, pero es caro comparado al g4560. Yo queria el pentium para hacer un gaming barato y amazon me manda todos los componentes menos el procesador (que consegu√≠ a menos de 60 ‚Ç¨) y me cambia dos veces el dia de entrega del envio y lo sube de precio (se v√© que intel no suministra los suficientes o hay mucha demanda) total que por no esperar un mes me gasto el doble por un procesador parecido(algo mejor). Ahora, montado bien, todo funciona.Cuando te gastas tanto dinero en piezas y necesitas tenerlo todo para montarlo y probarlo esperas m√°s fiabilidad.  Amazon me ha hecho ir mal esta vez. Hasta ahora siempre habia tenido experiencias buenas, pero esta vez me he preocupado. Bueno ahora ya tengo el ordenador y en fin no hay mal que por bien no venga, todo sea eso.El procesador es dual core, 4 hilos, frequencia alta, gama media baja pero suficient.Edito: Es un buen procesador, me sobra para gaming y uso de ofimatica y navegar por internet. El nuevo Ryzen 3 parece mejor pero no lleva gr√°fica as√≠ que este te har√° el trabajo por un buen precio. (Que mal lo que hicieron conbel pentium 4560 que lo subieron de precio siendo un chollo, en fin...) La pega son 2 n√∫cleos pero bueno 3 o 4 a√±os aguantar√° bien, luego un i5 o 7 segunda mano estar√°n mucho m√°s asequibles o directamente te cambias de plataforma.', "Built my first comp a few weeks ago on a budget, was a little skeptical on getting an i3 over i5 (i7 was definitely not in the budget). But i was impressed by it's out of the box specs and has good reviews so i saved the $100 and put it towards better graphics card and more RAM. I am impressed so far, does everything i've asked out of it just fine. Only complaint is it will get a little bogged down (and i do mean only a little) when you have a ton of screens open and doing a lot of stuff at the same time (Steam, LoL, CSGO, RL, Google, Settings), but that was only after i first turned it on and was trying to update/dl everything and play games all at the same time. But its only a dual core and i knew that going in, and its not typical that i run a ton of stuff at the same time. If you can afford the i5-7600k i would tell you to go for it, but if you are on a budget this is a great CPU.", "I wanted a low wattage CPU that would work well for gaming. For those that don't know many games even today really only use 1 core at a time. This puppy is extremely low wattage to begin with (lower wattage= less heat generated) and hopefully longer system life. This i3's single core performance is up there with $350+ xeons and i7's. So for the price it's very impressive as long as your games can only use 1 or 2 cores at a time. For a bit of education if you do ctrl+alt+delete and it looks like a game or process is using all cores equally it is usually a lie. It is in reality one core getting hammered at 100% then jumping to the next one in the series. You have to actually research to figure out how many cores your game actually uses at one time. If you aren't a gamer and for some reason are building a desktop for casual internet use like watching youtube videos and browsing the internet an i3 like this is probably the best thing for you to buy. Especially since it will actually save you money over a beefier processor that you will never actually fully utilize anyway.", "Pour am√©liorer la performance de mon ordinateur, j'ai command√© ce processeur. Les caract√©ristiques fournies par le site m'ont convaincue et le prix √©galement. Aussit√¥t re√ßu, j'ai fait appel √† un r√©parateur pour l'installer. Aussit√¥t fait, on a test√© sa performance et les changements sont tout de suite visibles. Mon PC est devenu plus rapide √† l'allumage et surtout quand on lance un logiciel tr√®s lourd. Il est devenu plus r√©actif aussi. Je vais bient√¥t installer une carte graphique plus puissante que j'ai actuellement pour plus de puissance et de performance. Je recommande.", 'Used this CPU for a build I did for my uncle. He will mostly use it for general day to day browsing, but the kids will use it for moderate gaming. Mostly less demanding esports games. For this purpose it is perfect and being priced at sub ¬£100 means it is right up there on the price/performance ratio.If you are looking to build a PC just for moderate gaming and day to day use, I would highly recommend buying this instead of splashing out on a more expensive CPU.Do not let the fact that this only has 2 cores make you overlook this CPU. The fact is the unless you are a heavy gamer, developer, or render videos and pictures on a daily basis, you most likely will not even be utalising more than two cores anyway. So you are going to be much better off saving that money that you would spend on buying a more expensive i5 and putting it towards an SSD, which will give you much more noticeable performance increase.If you found this review helpful (or not), let me know by clicking the "yes" or "no" buttons bellow, Happy shopping!.']

Product: Intel Celeron Processor G3900TE 2M Cache 2.30 GHz 35W Tray
Reviews: ["J'ai achet√© ce processeur pour √©quiper mon RIG et je dois dire que je ne suis vraiment pas d√©√ßu.Le processeur fonctionne nickel et est tr√®s tr√®s peu √©nergivore.Il ne consomme que 35W, ce qui est vraiment int√©rressant dans un RIG.Et question emploie de tous les jours, il g√®re bien la bureautique, le surf sur internet et m√™me les vid√©os.Et en plus, je l'ai re√ßu tr√®s rapidement et bien emball√©.Que demander de plus?Franchement, il est √† conseiller, surtout vu son prix :-)Pour infos : socket 1151 et compatible avec ASRock Pro BTC H110"]

Don't be like me.", 'I bought this unit from Amazon Warehouse and it came like a real genuine Intel Processor. However when I install the chip and booted into the bios, it showed the model is 1603v4. I ran CPUZ and it said the same thing. Someone probably bought the real chip and returned the fake one back on Amazon.Don‚Äôt let the marking on the CPU surface fool you. Make sure you go to bios or window to check if the chip is not fake.']

Product: Intel Bx80662I56600 6Th Generation Core I5-6600 Processor
Reviews: ['Buon processore molto versatile, peccato che bloccato per l‚Äôoverclock. Affidabile e una garanzia', "Ho acquistato questo processore I5-6600 boxato a ottobre 2015, dopo 4 mesi mi sento di poter dare un giudizio completo.Troverete migliaia di recensioni su internet a riguardo, vorrei sottolineare 2 aspetti che per√≤ spesso vengono trascurati da recensori professionisti: dissipatore stock ed efficienza energetica in idle. Legati l'uno all'altro.Il nuovo processo produttivo a 14 nm consente nuovi traguardi di efficienza energetica, questo processore ed ovviamente tutta la famiglia skylake in idle consuma 2 o al massimo 3 watt. Sotto un utilizzo leggero (navigazione web, film, download) il carico rimane a non pi√π di  5-7 watt.Un carico energetico cos√¨ basso pu√≤ essere gestito dal dissipatore stock senza alcun problema, 2 watt possono essere dissipati con successo anche a ventola completamente ferma se ci pensate (quello che avviene in un tablet o smartphone ad esempio).Il dissipatore stock ha una ventola PWM che con adeguata scheda madre (asus con Fan Xpert 3) pu√≤ essere comandata da 400 rpm a 3000 rpm.Fino a 7-800 rpm la ventola √® inudibile, a 1200 rpm incomincia a farsi sentire appena, sopra i 1600 rpm il rumore diventa fastidioso.In pratica fino a 15-20w (30% di carico CPU) di consumo si pu√≤ far lavorare la ventola stock a livelli non udibili sotto i 1200 rpm.Per superare i 15 watt con questa CPU bisogna giocare o fare editing video o calcolo pesante.Se si gioca con le cuffie vedrete che il rumore del dissipatore stock non si sente nemmeno a 2000 rpm.Il consiglio che vorrei dare a tutti quelli che compreranno questa CPU √® valutare l'utilizzo che se ne fa e di tenere il dissipatore stock almeno i primi tempi.Se non si lavora costantemente con la CPU a pi√π del 30% del carico potrebbe non servire un dissipatore aftermarket.In questo momento sto navigando, riproducendo un film HD sul secondo monitor e ho avviato una sessione di download pesante.Siamo a 6-7 watt di consumo, CPU a 35 gradi con dissipatore stock a 700 rpm e ventole del case completamente ferme.Abbinate un alimentatore con ventola ferma a basso carico e un ssd e avrete un pc non udibile.Due parole sul video integrato, √® abbastanza potente da far girare i giochi pi√π recenti in full hd con dettagli base, a risoluzioni pi√π basse si arriva a dettagli  medio bassi.", "Inizio la recensione col dire che stavolta la spedizione √® stata pi√π lunga del previsto, perch√® amazon aveva il prodotto in francia ed ha dovuto viaggiare...trovato il processore al secondo giorno dalla pubblicazione su amazon a 217 euro con spedizione gratuita (il 4690 costava 230) e l' ho comprato inmediatamente...Il montaggio del processore nel suo socket 1151 √® veramente facile e veloce, non dovreste avere problemi (ero al mio primo pc da montare), l' unico grattacapi ve lo da il dissipatore.Che dire delle prestazioni, se comprate un processore professionale, potete pagarlo anche 2000 di euro, ma la velocit√† del sistema rimane pi√π o meno quella (dipende dall hdd, o ss ((quasi obbligatorio se si monta un pc di questo livello).Per√≤ posso fare un grandissimo plauso alla sua hd 530 che monta, ha davvero prestazioni sbalorditive per essere una integrata.In questo momento aspetto l arrivo della r9 390,E a mia grandissima sorpresa, riesco a fare 35 fps su rust experimental in hd con dettagli alti/massimi.... e mantengo temperature veramente basse abbinato al rajintek themis,Usando la sua pasta termica, che di solito fanno schifo (compratene una a parte cbe guadagnate qualcosa in termini di temperature) e ho in idle 20 gradi su tutti i core, cio√® era pi√π calda la mobo e il case che la cpu...Il carico della cpu non arriva mai al 100%, nemmeno se ci provate...tranquilli che giocando vi dura almeno 5 anni senza colli di bottiglia.Tenete conto che dovete prendere una mobo e delle ram ddr4 apposite, quindi se partite col farvi un nuovo pc ne vale la pena, altrimenti se venite dalla scorsa generazione di cpu lasciate stare...Spero di esservi stato utile pcI5 6600H170 asrock pro4sR9 390 8gbCorsair vengeance lpx", "L'acquisto di questa CPU √® stato dettato dall'esigenza di costruire un PC da gaming per un mio parente senza sforare cifre esagerate. Sebbene esistessero i5 dalle frequenze anche pi√π basse la scelta √® stata orientata su questo perch√© aveva prestazioni non troppo dissimili dagli i7 base della stessa famiglia.PRO:- Elevate prestazioni e frequenze adeguate a sessioni di gioco intense- Framerate elevati con CPU affiancata da scheda grafica Geforce 1060 e 8GB DDR4 di ram per il sistema, anche con i giochi di ultima generazione. Nessun calo di framerate e giocabilit√† al massimo. Quasi inutile spendere di pi√π per schede video pi√π potenti e prestanti. Il guadagno si aggirerebbe intorno ai 20fps quando con questa cpu e scheda video siamo ben oltre la giocabilit√† e la fluidit√†- Pochissimo calore nonostante le elevate prestazioni, √® difficile sentire la ventola al massimo anche nelle sessioni di gioco pi√π intense.CONTRO:- Non √® economico ma di certo il prezzo √® allineato alle prestazioni offerte- Non ha il moltiplicatore sbloccato verso l'alto per l'overclock, tuttavia con alcune schede madri √® possibile comunque elevarne le frequenze.- La ventola non √® grandissima e la pasta termica non era adeguatamente protetta ma anzi esposta alla polvere. Questo mi fa pensare che fra un anno andr√† cambiata perch√© sar√† gi√† secca e forse l'uso di un dissipatore pi√π grande consentirebbe di avere maggior margine di temperature andando a evitare qualsiasi danno. Consiglio di cambiarla al momento  del montaggio.", 'Bei der Bestellung dieser CPU ist mit etwas sehr merkw√ºrdiges passiert. Als ich den Karton der CPU in der Hand gehalten habe, dachte ich, da stimmt was nicht. Es hatte weniger Gewicht als erwartet, und die √ñffnung, wo normalerweise die CPU gesch√ºtzt durch Kunststoff durch das Geh√§use scheint, war zugeklebt. Nach dem entfernen der Folie und √∂ffnen des Kartons der Schock:Es war eine defekte, bewusst durchgebrochene Grafikkarte im Karton, ummantelt von zwei St√ºcken Styropor. Das war und ist nat√ºrlich mehr als merkw√ºrdig. Gekauft habe ich dir CPU direkt bei Amazon. Ich wei√ü bis heute nicht, wie sowas passieren kann, aber es ist passiert.Nat√ºrlich hatte ich erstmal Angst, dass sich der Umtausch problematisch gestaltet. Die Angst war aber unbegr√ºndet. Amazon hat sofort reagiert und eine neue CPU verschickt und mit Zeit gegeben, die alte "CPU" zur√ºck zu senden. Alle Achtung, das h√§tte ich bei derart teurer Hardware nicht gedacht. Hier ein fettes Lob an Amazon!Zur CPU, der Einbau gestaltet sich einfach. Das aufbringen des Boxed K√ºhlers kann einen schonmal etwas w√ºtend und ungeduldig machen, allerdings muss man hier nat√ºrlich aufpassen. Einbau des K√ºhlers IMMER bei ausgebautem Mainboard, um keine unn√∂tige Spannung auf das Mainboard zu bringen und dadurch zu besch√§digen.Die CPU ist angenehm Flott, zum zocken einem gehobenen Mittelklasse PC\'s absolut ausreichend. In Kombination mit einer GTX 1060 ist hier sehr viel Potential. Leider kann ich keine genauen Angaben zu den FPS machen, da ich den PC f√ºr meinen Bruder zusammengestellt habe.Sie stellt aber durchaus eine Konkurrenz zu meiner nicht-√ºbertakteten 3570k dar und ist dabei noch energieeffizienter. Alltagsaufgaben werden rasch abgearbeitet. Wer kein Highend will, kann hier zuschlagen!', 'Der Einbau eines nicht ganz preiswerten Prozessor ist mit vielen √úberlegungen verbunden. Muss das Mainboard ausgebaut sein, ist W√§rmeleitpaste dabei, wie tr√§gt man sie auf, reicht der CPU- K√ºhler, WIN10 neu freischalten usw. ???Da ein altes Mainboard und dessen AMD Prozessor einfach nicht mehr mithalten konnten, sollte es ein neues Mainboard mit modernem Prozessor sein. Auf der SSD war im alten System schon WIN 10 upgegradet.Das Mainboard und der Einbau der CPU war wirklich einfach- ein Video im Vorfeld f√ºr den Neuling ist aber hilfreich. Der Einbau des beigelegten CPU K√ºhlers- nur einklicken und fertig. Hier war schon W√§rmeleitpaste aufgetragen (meine gr√∂√üte Besorgnis da etwas falsch zu machen). Das Mainboard muss f√ºr den Einbau der CPU und des K√ºhlers nicht ausgebaut werden. Der restliche Einbau auf einem Asus Board war eher "Komplizierter"- Ursache aber Mainboard Hersteller! SSD angeschlossen und Computer gestartet. Zum Gl√ºck funktionierte WIN10 ohne Neuanmeldung bei Microsoft. WIN 10 bietet die M√∂glichkeit das System neu aufzusetzen- ein Programmpunkt unter Einstellungen-->Wiederherstellen und dann PC Zur√ºcksetzen. Empfehle ich trotzdem- auch wenn alle Komponenten ohne Probleme erkannt wurden.Die Entscheidung f√ºr den 6600 hatte finanzielle √úberlegungen. Ein Asus Mainbaord- H110Plus und ein 8GB DDR4 2400 MHz RAM.Dem Gegen√ºber steht nat√ºrlich der 6600k (der hier auch im Haushalt taktet)- hier ben√∂tigt man zus√§tzlich zum √ºbertaktf√§higem Mainboard noch ein CPU L√ºfter. Preisunterschied der Komponenten ca.100‚Ç¨  Wer einen neuen K√ºhler und ein besseres Mainboard einsetzt, der sollte auch gleich zum 6600k greifen. Hier sind 4,2 GHz ohne Probleme m√∂glich.Das System l√§uft stabil (aktuell ist der Prozessor nicht √ºber 35¬∞C gestiegen) und ist f√ºr die meisten Anwendungen vollkommen ausreichend.', "Acquistato per una configurazione medio alta, insieme ad una Gtx 970, si comporta bene, scalda poco e garantisce delle buone prestazioni, provato con tutti i giochi Blizzard, si comporta benissimo.Ci tengo a raccontare per√≤ ci√≤ che mi √® accaduto a distanza di 4 mesi. Spero che non si ripresenti un problema del genere, ho letto e sentito dire che succede veramente di raro, ma dopo 4 mesi dall'acquisto un giorno il processore ha deciso di smettere di funzionare, il pc partiva, ma non arrivavano segnali alle periferiche in output, ho contattato Amazon via numero verde, e hanno subito provveduto (nonostante fossero passati pi√π di 30 giorni) a mandare a casa un corriere a ritirare la CPU difettosa, e nel giro di 2 giorni a spedirne una nuova, che funziona. Sono rimasto davvero esterrefatto dalla qualit√† del servizio, dubito che un qualsiasi altro venditore avrebbe potuto garantire una tale rapidit√† di risoluzione del problema.A parte lo spiacevole evento, per ora lascio 4 stelle perch√® il processore soddisfa a pieno le mie esigenze.", "Un gammer ha bisogno di un processore all'altezza;ma tutto sommato l'annoso dilemma tra 7 e 5 risulta essere veramente insignificate se si ha a disposizione una scheda video adeguata e ram quanto basta.Non voglio  dilungarmi in discorsi tecnologici o grafici,scrivo questa recensione a distanza di mesi dal suo acquisto e se dovessi ricomprarlo lo rifarei.Non √® owerloccabile ma sicuramente stabile,sicuro e affidabile. Lo si vede nel tempo nelle risposte non del gioco ma nell'uso quotidiano,non tradisce,abbinato ad una scheda Asus z170 o anche h170 diventa un matrimonio perfetto.Temperature basse esercizio di alimentazione minimo e resa ottimale, sempre al meglio.Ho letto molte recensioni tecniche o meno,ma nell'uso si vede almeno come utenza finale,se un prodotto √® valido e questo √® un processore che pu√≤ competere tranquillamente anche con con la stessa famigli I7 o AMD.Sockett 1151 almeno nel mio caso a meno che non si faccia grafica vettoriale professionale ritengo il giusto compromesso tra potenza e affidabilit√†.", "Subito i pro e i cons.Pro:Buona potenzaBasso consumoNon scaldaQualit√† IntelContro:Mi aspettavo qualcosa in pi√πHo comprato questo processore in sostituzione ad un i5 3570k che aveva un overclock a 4.8ghz (dopo anni ha ceduto) non mi aspettavo di avere la stessa potenza essendo non K ma rispetto alle frequenze stock non ci √® stato questo salto prestazionale. Tornassi indietro spendere qualcosa in pi√π per l' i7 6700 versione non K.Perch√© prendere la versione non K?Se volete un processore potente, (per giocare o per lavoro) ma soprattutto molto affidabile. A frequenze standard probabilmente lo cambierete quando il processore sar√† troppo vecchio per le prestazioni.Ho abbinato questo processore con il dissipatore che mi trovavo dal vecchio processore versione overclock.Temperatura idle 28¬∞ (in estate) max 48¬∞ Full(Con queste temperature non si romper√† mai)Per il gioco consiglio lo stesso un dissipatore leggermente pi√π grande. Se non giocate va benissimo quello di serie che raffredda molto bene.", "I have been using this for 2 days only. It is not a very high end but it is perfect for moderate use and i hope it will fulfill my needs- android studio and gaming. But I have one issue that the motherboard's hdmi output is lost sometimes and recovered after long shutdowns. I found the below article helpful. It's rather of intel hd graphics 530 driver problem i think. If you encounter the same problem, see this-https://communities.intel.com/thread/28044?tstart=0The price should be around 15k but it is a lot more expensive, maybe because of VAT. That's why I minus 1 star.This is a 6th gen processor with ddr4 memory support. Although ddr4 technology is not fully matured now, the 6th gen processor will be future proof than the 5th gen. That's why I spent a bit more and gone for this.I will update this review in the future."]

Product: Intel Core i5 6500 3.20 GHz Quad Core Skylake Desktop Processor, Socket LGA 1151, 6MB Cache
Reviews: ['If you want to build a "budget" gaming PC.... DO NOT! WITHOUT DOING SERIOUS RESEARCHMy review is directed towards gamers since you can run MS Word on a potato and if you do video production, the Core i-7 is the sweet spot.Now breathe, relax your mind, and manage the excitement you have garnered from the prospect of not having to pay to play online with friends (ahem! plus-live-gold), SAVE UP an extra $100 - 150 and buy this processor. I bought the AMD X4 860k, then bought the Core i-3, and finally this i-5 in a 2 week period (returned the others).Why? Because this is a much more superior CPU. It is faster, has 4 cores and a frequency of 3.20 GHZ. Also, it has integrated graphics (which is a plus weather gamers acknowledge it or not). If you want an unlocked sucker, get the \'K\' version for an extra $20. I bought this because I exceeded my budget by about 30% (tee-hee). You are getting every dollar out of it. Not saying you are not getting a bang for your buck from the other processors mentioned, but after hours and hours of research, it only made sense to "Eat the extra cost" since I\'ll be doing content creation (I know, but the Core i-7 bleh-bleh-bleh). If you are in doubt, I recommend these YouTube reviewers to give detailed explanations of the or-15 6500A special thanks to the YouTube Channels, Science Review, Digital Foundry, Hardware Unboxed, Austin Evans, JayZsTwoCents.These Tech reviewers are professional and carry out extensive research and benchmarks for a wide variety of games. In fact, \'Hardware Unboxed\' is my favorite because they run benchmarks for at least 12 - 20 different games! Crazy huh?My thoughts:The year 2016 is winding down and newer titles will eventually show up: you do not want to regret not utilizing every aspect of your PC to enjoy the experience. A good example is the Division which is about to bring its player base up and release content all the way into 2017. even though you can use a NOT-Core-i5 processor to run it, the game\'s minimum requirement is a Core i-5 2400, which is also a very good CPU as well. Its even cheaper than this (you will save about $50 or more if you don\'t want to spend on this)Here\'s my build for you to weigh the cost (PS I wasn\'t going for Shinny PC, but a powerhouse):Rosewell Micro-ATX Case with 400W Power Supply: Initially $38 from Amazon;s warehouse deals. Got an extra 15% discount because it didn\'t come with screws, hence $33 Also 400W can power most GPU\'s but my GPU required 500W, so i bought another PSU :(CPU:  Core i5 6500 3.2 ghz: $203 - Ouch! To the wallet, but worth every single dollar. (If it goes on sale at a lower price, I still won\'t be mad)RAM:  Ballistix Sport LT 8GB Single DDR4  - $42.99MOBO: Gigabyte LGA1151 Intel H110 Micro ATX DDR4 Motherboard GA-H110M-A - $49.99GPU:  MSI GAMING RX 480 GDDR5  4GB (it was the same price as an RX 470, so why not) - $199.99PSU:  EVGA 500 W1, 80+ WHITE 500W, - $35.99Time:  At lest 4-6 HoursMiscallaneous:  $45All part prices are from Amazon.com at the time of this review.My Hard Drive\'s were from my old computers and my monitor was also from an old PC as well. You have to understand, this is still under $700 if you add the cost of a monitor mouse and keyboard. It\'s twice the price of a recent console, but it will perform better. Plus, it is open ended (or "future proof" - don\'t lie the term). I can upgrade my GPU when the next Gen of consoles are released. And if I become a millionaire before then, I can upgrade to the Skylake\'s Core i-7 Even then, PC ports will be optimized for the masses!CONCLUSIONYou, as the potential buyer have to weigh the cost, but from my research, this is one of the better gaming PCs you can rig up right now. In fact, a pre-built PC with these components was selling for about $800 a few months ago.So, if you are looking for a budget gaming Rig, ensure you have a strong CPU and GPU. Prices fluctuate, so keep an eye out to get the best value for your money.', 'IMBALLAGGIOCome potrete ben vedere dalle immagini il prodotto arriva in una scatola piccola e nel complesso leggera. Nella parte frontale troveremo il logo Intel in alto a destra, il nome del prodotto, ovvero "Intel core i5" grande al centro, e sotto il nome specifico del modello, e qui parliamo di un i5-6500 con una sigla sotto (LGA1151) a cui dovrete stare molto attenti perch√© da quella sigla capirete la sua compatibilit√† con la scheda madre ed altri componenti: occhi aperti se vi state facendo la vostra configurazione come nel mio caso (io ho comprato una scheda madre Asus H170-PRO). All\' interno invece troverete la vostra cpu con le classiche coperture del socket!DESCRIZIONE GENERALELa cpu si presenta con il suo classico colore grigio, facile da inserire nella scheda madre, non mi ha dato nessun problema. Purtroppo, dato il fatto che non ho montato io il mio computer non vi so dare consigli sulla pasta termica. Sopra ci ho montato un dissipatore cooler master abbastanza economico, invece del classico dissipatore Intel che offre il prodotto (andrebbe comunque bene per chi non ha bisogno di dissipare tanta aria e quindi chi non richiede molto sforzo da parte del pc ma queste non sono le mie caratteristiche), e va tutto alla grande! Sono passati ormai due anni da quando ho acquistato il prodotto e posso dire che va ancora tutto come se fosse il suo primo giorno!CONCLUSIONIQuesto prodotto lo consiglio veramente a chiunque, anche se col tempo probabilmente usciranno prodotti che non avranno nulla a che vedere con questo prodotto in confronto a qualit√†/prezzo... ma data la facile manovrabilit√†, la sua affidabilita e il suo prezzo molto accessibile, lo ritengo davvero un prodotto eccellente.P.S. Se avete domande un esitate a chiedere, risponder√≤ il prima possibile! (Ho messo una sola foto perche ormai √® stato inserito nel pc perci√≤ l\'unica cosa che vi posso far vedere √® la scatola smantellata dopo l\'injserimento! Le foto di Amazon vi saranno comunque d\'aiuto!)', "E' un ottimo processore se non avete necessit√† di fare overclock.  Alla fine ho preso il 6600K che lo permette per dare pi√π longevit√† al sistema con una spesa poco maggiore.", "As someone upgrading from a Core 2 Duo E7200, this chip is amazing. I'll let the thousand other reviews go into the technical details of the processor, but I want to specifically mention the cooling.I bought this for a brand new build, and with it I also purchased an aftermarket Cooler Master Geminii to ensure that temps stayed low. I'd heard from other reviews that some didn't even receive the stock cooler (which is ridiculous, it's 98% of whats taking up space in the box) or a few that said the stock thermal compound (pre-applied on the heatsink) was pathetic and worth the Arctic Silver upgrade. However, when I purchased this though Amazon (NOT a reseller) I got a factory sealed box with the stock cooler, and it actually works AMAZINGLY.After some stress testing, installing, and heavy game playing, I am happy to report that the highest temps I've seen so far are about 47c. At idle, I get about 25c. And mind you, I monitored this during a 2 hr game installation and a 1080p game workload. I am honestly blown away by the effectiveness of the stock cooler. Of course it wouldn't work for any decent overclocking, but for the 6500, there's no need at all for an aftermarket cooler.UPDATE - 6/6/2017Been using the CPU for mostly gaming, some AutoCad and other editing here and there, and the whole stock air setup is still working magnificently. A little note on my setup: i5 6500, Gtx 1060 6gb, 1TB Samsung EVO SSD, 16gb Ballistix RAM, and 6 Corsair AF120 fans. This CPU has not let me down once. Even under full load during stress testing for almost 20 minutes, the highest temperate recorded was 56 degrees. With a stock cooler. Wow. Knowing this though, I kind of want a K edition card now that I see the enormous overclocking headroom. So maybe I should've spend the extra $40... But no complaints, this particular unit will continue working like a beast for years to come.", "The title says most of it. It's a good chip if you're not running anything super demanding like content development. It will do it reliably, but it's a bit slow. Probably good for teaching kids patience. It's getting outdated though, because it doesn't run AVX instructions... in lamens if you try to play Cyberpunk 2077 with it, it will crash your video drivers. It's likely AVX instructions will be used in software more and more so this chip might be useless in a few years.... assuming loads of programmers have shifty coding practices like CD Project Red. Many programs have workarounds, so there is hope for this chip yet.Badly optimized games aside, it will play most games flawlesy. I played portal without a GPU and it was brilliant. Paired with the good old NVidia GTX1080 I play Mortal Kombat 10/11 with the graphics maxed out no problem.
