Provided the game is optimized well it will play nicely... might need to lower the graphics though.", "Good processor, hasn't let me down yet, easy enough to install, but there's a reason it's not 5 stars. If you can fork out an extra few pounds, have a look at this one instead: https://www.amazon.co.uk/Intel-Cache-Processor-i5-6600-Turbo/dp/B010T6D39O/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&qid=1484335188&sr=8-3&keywords=intel+i5+6600 because you're getting a little more for a little more, and it balances out well- may be that extra potential 2 or 3 fps, is that worth seven quid to you? (I'm going off prices at time of writing, I got the 6500 on sale, so the price difference was higher, and I'm justifying my buyer's regret).As for the missing star, this is because owing to certain couriers delivering on days later than they were meant to (why is ebuyer still using yodel?), all of the parts for my current build arrived over four days when it should have been half that time. Amazon however have always been good for me, and their parcel arrived when it was meant to, along with another company who delivered my motherboard. Long story short, I had everything apart from a power supply, graphics card and OS, and was left to put this in with no idea of whether or not I'd done it correctly, and the horrible sound it makes as you clamp it down feels worse than watching someone burn ¬£189.99, because you have to deal with the failure as well. Folks, remove the black plastic cover from the cpu cover on the motherboard, and keep your blood pressure low.", "Was soll man dazu sagen zu den Prozessor.Absolut Top in dem PreissegementBin umgestiegen von einen AMD T1090 auf den I5 6500 und es liegen Welten dazwischen.Die Effizienz ist beeindruckend. bei 50% Auslastung eine Temp von max 40 Grad ist schon beachtlich.mit meinen alten AMD T1090 Prozessor bin ich nicht an die Temp Werte ran gekommen. Gek√ºhlt wird der Intel von einen be quiet! Dark Rock Advanced C1 der passt mit den Montagehalterungen perfekt auf Sockel 1151.#Update#so nach einem guten halben Jahr kann ich sagen das der Kauf sich absolut bezahlt gemacht hat.Aktuell f√§llt mir jedoch auf das ich in GTA5 und Tom Clancy's The Division bei 80%-90% Auslastung rein vom game her . Auf 100% Auslastung komm ich wenn die beiden Games mit den ganzen Prozessen im Hintergrund laufen laste ich die CPU zu 100% aus .In Verbund mit einer MSI RX480 in Ultra Einstellungen.Die anderen Games die ich zocke, bin ich bei 40%-50% CPU Auslastung (WoW Fallout4 HdRO)#Update2 12.6.17#So nach nun gut einen halben Jahr kann ich sagen das der Prozessor sich immer noch gut schl√§gt.Aktuell spiele ich Ark und liege dabei mit einer Auslastung bei 50-70% was ein guter Wert ist und dazu eine Temperatur habe von knapp 50 Grad Celsius in Verbindung mit einem BeQiuet Dark Rock AdvanceC1Jedoch wenn ich dazu mit OBS aufnehmen komme ich konstant auf 98% Auslastung der CPU.", 'I bought this CPU for my first PC build I am very thrilled. I bought this CPU for its capabilities. Moving on, CPU is well- protected and the fan is protected and tightly packed in the small Intel box.The CPU has a triangle on it that you match up with the array on the motherboard which is nice for a first timer like myself. Moreover, than cooler has seemingly flimsy or odd clips that hold it to the motherboard, but they are solidly planted once it snaps and rotates into the holes of the motherboard. Again, a nice stock cooler in my opinion (of limited knowledge) even though almost all featured PC builds cram buying an after market cooler down your throat. The cooler is fine for what it is,  a stock cooler that comes with thermal paste and is designed by Intel for Intel.Lastly, at idle the temperature is a consistent 29 degrees Celsius. This CPU easily handles 3D builder, Auto CAD, other modeling programs, and gaming titles such as Skyrim, Dishonored, Fallout, CS GO, GTA IV are all getting very high frame rates in highest settings in coordination with my MSI GTX 960 4GB OC.', "I'm assuming it's great. The inexpensive motherboard failed, but I've got a better one on the way now. I foolishly ordered the motherboard before the CPU, so wasn't able to test it within the 30 day period after ordering. The problem was that the CPU is so expensive I could only purchase it by itself. I should have assumed that the CPU was solid and waited on the purchase of the motherboard for a more timely handling of the computer build and testing. Having to buy computer parts a little at a time, doesn't always work out so well and I didn't want to have to break it up into three separate orders, but of course that's exactly the way it's working out anyway. I pay as I go, which doesn't do much for my credit rating and high interest credit cards are not a viable choice either. I just need to rebuild my old desktop from 2007 and gradually get it into another case as possible. The motherboard that's coming, will handle an upgrade to an i7 6700k, down the road, so that's encouraging at least. Mean time this i5 6500 will do just fine I'm sure.", 'For anyone looking to build or upgrade their processor in a gaming/productivity PC, look no further. The intel i5 6500 is one of my favorite processors in its performance range. When I first installed this processor into my PC it was a breeze. I was pretty astounded at the speed, swiftness, and reliability of this processor. This processor can prove to be more than enough for most of your needs. You need it for gaming? It gets the job done right. Productivity? You got it. This i5 can handle most of any tasks you can throw at it. The price also isn‚Äôt bad at all for the performance you‚Äôre gonna get. It‚Äôs a great all around processor.After a couple years of using pretty heavily it has shown some age, however, nothing major. It sometimes will display a little lag and get slow, however, nothing to hinder performance in gaming or nothing to slow your work day down.']

Product: AMD AMD A6-7400K Dual-Core 3.5 GHz Socket FM2+ Desktop Processor Radeon R5 Series (AD740KYBJABOX)
Reviews: ['Received on time. Processor speed is Good. Integrated Radeon graphics, works well with Photoshop and Coreldraw application.', 'Ho acquistato questo Processore ( CPU con Scheda Grafica Radeon integrata...) nello stesso ordine in cui ho comprato anche la Motherboard ASRock FM2A68M-DG3+ ( di cui ho fatto una credo ‚ÄúINTERESSANTE‚Äù recensione che ti invito a leggere e che non √® difficilissima da trovare poich√® basta cercarla tra quelle pi√π lunghe...) che doveva servire a installarlo ( lo so che √® quasi una banalit√† ma se sei interessato a sapere altro continua a a leggere‚Ä¶) e praticamente nulla di altro poich√® avevo gi√† tutto il resto per completare un PC che ovviamente √® ancora nel pieno della sua funzionalit√† e che spero lo rimanga ancora molto a lungo‚Ä¶Premetto che √® stato acquistato come nuovo e che quindi mi sono un poco ( e non positivamente‚Ä¶) meravigliato quando mi √® arrivato con la scatola ammaccata sugli angoli e con il sigillo che dovrebbe chiudere la scatola gi√† tagliato‚Ä¶Non sono una persona che facilmente grida ‚ÄúAL LUPO, AL LUPO‚Äù e/o si perde d‚Äô animo e quindi dicendo a me stesso che in fondo non √® certo la scatola che mi interessa ma bens√¨ che il Processore faccia il compito per il quale √® stato acquistato felice che a prima vista la CPU sembra che non avere difetti monto l‚Äô intero PC, tutto sommato godendo di un interessante pomeriggio per farlo‚Ä¶Sorpresa il Computer non si accende nel senso che non parte neanche il BIOS e addirittura non si sente alcun BIP, premetto che anche se non √® oggi ne √® stato mai il mio lavoro primario comunque √® da molto che sono appassionato di informatica ( qualcuno ci definisce ‚ÄúSMANETTONI‚Äù termine che personalmente mi piace e mi si addice visto che √® da prima del 2000 che smonto pezzi anche di una certa importanza nei miei PC Desktop‚Ä¶) e malgrado sia ‚ÄúQUASI‚Äù sicuro di aver fatto tutto bene ricontrollo che ogni cosa sia stata fatta nel modo migliore‚Ä¶Provo l‚Äô alimentatore in un altro mio PC e funziona perfettamente, provo a mettere sulla Motherboard FM2+ una scheda video su slot PCIE ( perfettamente funzionante in un altro Computer ) e il BIOS ancora non parte‚Ä¶Inizio a sentirmi un poco frustrato e mi viene quindi il dubbio ( ho mani molto grandi e non pi√π la ‚ÄúVista di Falco‚Äù di un tempo...) di aver collegato male i ‚ÄúMALEDETTI‚Äù cavettini ( tanto per capirci quei micro fili che servono per dare il comando di alimentazione e reset alla Motherboard e che servono per  il funzionamento e controllo degli HDD‚Ä¶) li ricontrollo con esterma cura e infine mi convinco che non √® quello il problema‚Ä¶A questo punto mi rimangono le due peggiori delle ipotesi, la Motherboard e/o il Processore non funzionano‚Ä¶In ogni caso dovendo eventualmente restituire l‚Äô una e/o l‚Äô altro, comprati da me come nuovi qui su Amazon, comincio con la stessa estrema cura messa nell‚Äô installarla innanzitutto a smontare la CPU‚Ä¶Controllo la piedinatura del Processore e noto che anche se a prima vista sembra tutto perfetto ( come normalmente ci si aspetta che sia‚Ä¶) in effetti alcuni piedini sono un pochino piegati e addirittura uno manca‚Ä¶Non nego che mi sarebbe piaciuto provare a rialzarli ma essendomi successa la stessa cosa nel corso degli anni con un altra CPU sempre della Pregiata Ditta AMD e non essendoci riuscito non ci ho nemmeno provato‚Ä¶Ho quindi richiesto la sostituzione con lo stesso oggetto al Servizio Di Restituzione di Amazon che in tempi molto brevi e senza darmi troppe complicazioni, e anche merito di questo servizio di Amazon ( nella speranza di non doverlo utilizzare troppo spesso...) che questo articolo ha 4 stelle, mi ha inviato un altro Processore che mi ha dato la soddisfazione di far partire immediatamente questo mio PC‚Ä¶Leonardo', 'I didn\'t expect this type of performance in an affordable CPU like this.This is my first APU ever. I repaired some laptops with the AMD C series processor, but that is far away from this. Even when I compare the graphics perfomance from my (unaffortunally gifted) Lenovo laptop with Intel HD Graphics 3000... WOOOOAAA!! This APU is a beast!Ok, this can\'t be compared with any Quad-Core processor from Intel or even AMD. Any Quad-Core with a great graphics card can destroy this little bunny. But what about the dual cores?... Well, personally I can\'t test it side-by-side with the Pentium G3258 yet (the "Anniversary" edition CPU from Intel) but for graphics the AMD can be more powerful (maybe not a lot). Both are overclockable so, you can add "more fun" to both, but I\'m still thinking the APU can be better, just for graphics. Both can cost the same (Aprox. 60-70$) so both can be a bang for the buck for their respective platforms, but maybe in the Intel side you can get more benefits if you plan to get an i7 like the 4790K later on... Spending 300$ but building a powerful Z97 machine... Perfect! (That was my second option, but I just have 300$ to spend in the whole year... I can\'t upgrade for that i7 until the next year thanks to the Exchange control in my country Venezuela).But for a 300$ upgrade (or build, read my GA-F2A88X-UP4 review for details), this APU is just playing it so well. I didn\'t expect that kind of performance in games I never hope to run in this.Assassin\'s Creed Brotherhood in med-high at 1080p. GRID 2 and F1 2013 at 1080p in medium details. Low details at 720p in NFS Rivals (still playable, over 25FPS). Maxed out The Sims 4 at 1080p without antialising with variable 35 to 60fps. WOOOOOW!! I an happy (noob) gamer today. Thanks for this APU, AMD... But if I just could afford any quad core APU like the 7850K :\'(.Let\'s talk about bad things from this little bunny. This APU is the worst (ok, the less featured) from the Kaveri architecture. It just have two cores running at 3.5GHz, with a little boost to 3.9GHz. That boost can do weird things in the temperature, I have this APU with the included cooler for about two months and today I had to change the thermal compound because my temps are taking above 70¬∫C; I do not recommend get this APU above 70¬∫, this its thermal limit, and can short the lifespan.Hold on a second. Why are this APU taking the temps too far? Are you doing some overclocking?My answer YES... And no.Because if you motherboard have the "Turbo" feature for the APU clock already activated, you APU is doing some overclocking secretly... Until you check with some software like AIDA64 in the Overclock section: 13% of "secretly" overclocking. Not a huge deal if you don\'t play recent games like NFS Rivals. In my experience, the processor does it quite well running the gaming until my case sensors alert when the temps go to high (70-75¬∫C). Maybe I look like a maniac with the temps, but is a serious business: If you get some thermal throttling, you can notice it looking the performance; in my case, NFS goes with some lag when the temps gets above 70¬∫ at 720p resolution. That\'s not good and must to be solved.You can\'t do great thing with the supplied CPU cooler. Maybe some thermal compound change, helps. But the great secret if you want to continue with the stock cooler is deactivate the "Turbo" feature in the motherboard UEFI. The games right now runs solid, and not to far from 50¬∫C. Nice.If you want to get this issue completely rid off (Ok, my english isn\'t perfect, but you can get the point), buy an aftermarket CPU cooler like a Cooler Master Hyper 212 Evo or whatever you like. Those coolers can provide you some improvements in the temps "problems", like 5 to 15¬∫C less, in some cases. Consider the airflow in your case and your, that helps too.Well, this is a good performer. Not a CPU destroyer, but this can run flawlessly in you FM2+ system (remember, this one can\'t run in a FM2 motherboard, just in FM2+ boards). I recommend get this thing feed with some fast RAM like 1866, 2133 or even 2400MHz DDR3 RAM; that can help you to get some improvements in graphical tasks because the GPU cores in the APU need system memory to get a boost in performance. Its a nice upgrade or a very good plan if you are taking options for a new build. For me, is a great experience.', 'Very nippy little processor, especially in the light of my old Intel E6300 Core Duo, but perhaps that is not really a fair comparison!Onboard GPU also a nice bonus, no extra cards getting in the way, or noisy graphics fans.Frankly, the performance is quite remarkable at this price point.I set this up on an Asus A88X-PRO motherboard with 8GB of Hyper X Beast memory rated at 2400MHz, but dropped down to 1866MHz to match the processor. (See reviews elsewhere)Apart from the memory speed alteration, the motherboard was set to "Auto" with no deliberate overclocking, and despite the processor rating of 3.5GHZ standard, 3.9GHz Turbo, it ran at 4.1GHz "out of the box" (still does), and has never exceeded a temperature of 41C on the standard fan, with no evidence of stress or instability.Like some others, I bought this as a budget processor, with thoughts of perhaps upgrading it later (hence the motherboard and memory choice), but on the basis of this performance I shall probably be keeping it for a while yet and have a play with some of the motherboard overclocking settings.Unless you are into some seriously heavy gaming, number crunching, CAD or video editing, you will not be disappointed.Buy one! Almost forgot-(doing this a lot lately-must be an age thing). In my case the GPU initially showed as a "Standard VGA Adapter" and some programmes reported "Hardware Acceleration not Enabled". To overcome this I went on to the AMD site and downloaded the latest graphics drivers(Catalyst suite).It will ask you whether you have a GPU or APU and ask you to put in the model number-it\'s all very straightforward. It will then direct you to the appropriate version to download.This solved my problems, and the screen image certainly also seems a little crisper.', "This processor was bought with the intent of it being replaced with an upgrade fairly soon. I paired it with an MSI A88xm motherboard and 8GB Adata  1866mhz ram.  It runs so well  that anupgrade will probably wait.  The stock cooling fan is very quiet and keeps the chip very cool to the point that only a few times has a case fan been called upon for additional cooling by the motherboard. When I have monitored the APU it has usually been in the low 50s celsius (way below any danger zone). It plays all the games my son and I are interested in at very playable frame rates which I owe to using the max speed ram the apu recommends.  It plays Minecraft , Skyrim , Just Cause2, Portal2, Arma2 and many others very well. Is it a gaming screamer? No, but like I say it plays all these games at decent resolutions very well.  It is only a dual core, but most games in particular at the moment use only 1 or 2 cores anyway, If you always have large numbers of windows open with active content on all of them then a 4 or more core processor would probably run more smoothly, but we don't run anything in the background that might detract from performance. This was why I used this as an entry level APU as the 2 processing core it contains are more than adequate to replace an aging system and perform what we currently ask of it. I have not attempted overclocking it as of yet, but might  at some point. It hasn't been necessary to play with that at the moment.  My only bit of advice is upon system set-up  make sure to go to AMD and update the drivers (we went from potentially disappointed performance to overwhelmingly happy).  All in all we are very please with this.", "Ho lavorato 40 anni nell'informatica, ora assemblo/riparo assiduamente pc da circa quattro anni... qualcosina ne capisco! Scusate il preambolo.Ho sempre assemblato/riparato per altri ma ho sempre posseduto vecchie carrette, la mia filosofia √®: finche funziona bene... si continua cos√¨! Arrivando da dual core di oltre 10 anni fa... √® un bel passo avanti per me. Che dire di questo processore preso per caso a 52‚Ç¨: rapporto qualit√†/prezzo molto buono. Considerando che uso ancora vecchi HD meccanici devo riconoscere che il pc va veramente bene. Per una spesa inferiore a 150‚Ç¨, sostituendo solo il cuore del computer (mobo, ram cpu), si ha un pc validissimo per il 95% degli scopi.Video in full HD fluidi, accesso alle cartelle rapido, reattivo in browsing/office e non ho voluto fare overclock. Ora, pubblicando su Youtube, provo un po' di video editing e aggiorner√≤ la recensione. Un difetto lo vogliamo trovare? La ventolina, piccola ma rumorosa,  avrebbe pi√π senso se messa in un frullatore... almeno verrebbe coperto il rumore della ventolina!Giudizio finale (tagliamo corto) 85 su 100.", "Runs right out of the box with my A68HM Grenade motherboard and 8GB of RAM. I bought this CPU intended for office use, so I think this A6 chip might even be overkill for such job. This APU also comes with integrated R5 graphics, so no extra discrete graphic card is needed.For gaming though, steer away and go for other CPU, such as Intel Core or AMD's new Ryzen series.However, the stock cooler is awful. The temperature runs very high at 70C even at idle. I do have an extra older stock cooler from the old Phenom chips, and the heatsink is way better, dropping the temperature at 40C idle. Do consider on buying a cheap cooler and good thermal paste to replace the stock cooler to keep running this CPU cool.Overall, I recommend this product for building a computer for general use and office, as it has integrated graphics and parts that are cheaper than some of Intel's variants.", 'El procesador se usa para tareas b√°sicas como navegar por internet y funciona sin problemas incluso se pueden jugar juegos como LoL o algo similar, el √∫nico problema es la temperatura,  con el disipador de stock funcionaba a 75+ llegando a los 85 o m√°s con el turbo, para mantenerlo debajo de los 72¬∞ que especifica la compa√±√≠a que no deber√≠a de pasar compre un cooler m√°s grande de amd ya que un un 212evo no cabe el el gabinete de la pc donde esta instalado ya que es slim, aun y con ese cooler no es suficiente y tengo que desactivar el boost para que no pase los 70¬∞, fuera de la temperatura funciona sin problemas.', "All in all a cheap cpu and graphics solutin for budget builds, I'd seen some claims of people playing things like GTA V on these and I've got to say I doubt them after trying this APU for myself, I used this for a budget build for my sister who doesn't play anything too demanding, but even basic multitasking maxes out the processor.I tested it quite thoroughly, done a few stress tests to make sure everything was stable and it simply seems the processor isn't up to doing much but run very low end 3D graphics and only using one program at a time other it slows right down.I've tested Bioshock, Portal 2 and The Sims 3 and they run atleast at 30fps, Life is Strange has some very low FPS I'd consider it unplayable (i'd imagine it'd be down to poor optimisation).All in all the build was incredibly cheap under ¬£170 in total so I wasn't expecting much from it.", "Good CPU for use on your second computer. It is not that powerful, and is OK for routine computing. Very competitively priced. IMPORTANT NOTE: It is NOT an AM3 processor but an FM2/FM2+ processor and has a built in GPU; so no need for a separate GPU card, which increases 'VFM factor'."]

Product: Intel Core i5-4690 Processor (6M Cache, 3.5 GHz upto 3.90 GHz) BX80646I54690
Reviews: ['If you had a Pentium (not i3, i5 or anything like that) in your 1150 socket motherboard, this will make a big difference. I can see my desktop lasting several more years now. Mine came with cpu fan and it works just fine.', "I bought this for an older computer.  It was easy to install and I've had no issues with it.  It was a fairly inexpensive way to add some life to my old desktop PC.", "This processor is worth every penny. I do a lot of Video Converting, and it was a pain having to wait 30 mins to convert a 25 minute video. Now with this processor, I can convert a 25 minute video in 3 Minutes! if that gives you any idea as to how fast it is. That turbo boost kicks in and she just starts flying! Every other task has been surprisingly fast as well. This thing just blows right through everything I throw at it. I mainly bought it for gaming but, I do also convert videos A LOT so this processor is good for everything I needed it for. I haven't actually gotten to play any games using it yet, but I can tell just by how much of an improvement it is over my last CPU, that games wont be an issue for this processor.Here's some of what I have on my PC right now.- OS - Windows 8.1- CPU - Intel i5 4690 3.5 Ghz- RAM - 8 GB DDR3 1600 Mhz- Motherboard - MSI Z87-G45 Gaming- PSU - 620 Watt- GPU - Integrated Graphics Motherboard/CPU (No Graphics Card yet) Picture looks GREAT!---------PROS---------Incredibly FastRuns through everything I throw at it with easeSuper quietVery solid 3.5 Ghz with 3.9 Ghz Turbo that automatically kicks in when needed.If you're not looking to overclock, this is the one you want.--------CONS---------None.", 'I\'m using it in a PC running Windows 2012 Server R2 with 16GB (soon to add 16GB more) RAM and 4 HDs.  I\'m hosting 4 Win 8.1 Hyper-V VMs on it while using it also as a front end of a HTPC and notice no performance issues whatsoever related to the processor.VM1 is a PLEX video server (for Rokus and Chromecasts) and "NAS" (just a Windows 8.1 share) to deliver videos to XBMC front end running on the server host OS itself.VM2 is my son\'s PC, accessed at his desk via a Wyse thin client.VM3 is my PC that I use for all my personal stuff, accessed via anything I have my hands on at the moment (Chromebook/Windows laptops, android tablets/phones, etc.).VM4 is used as a downloader and hosts any other types of server software I need to run.I also installed another NIC for better network performance.  The only performance hit I noticed was because the VMs were all hosted on one HD and my HDs are normal speed.  I moved 2 of the VMs\' VHDX files to a different HD and BAM!  All VMs are now super fast.  I\'m barely teasing the power of this processor and probably could have got away with an i3.  But I always like to leave some elbow-room so I\'m very happy.', 'good budget for starters should upgrade tho', "Fantastic processor all around that runs very cool for the performance it puts out. It can do everything I throw at it and if all you are doing is gaming do yourself a favor and DO NOT get the i7 or Xeon. Many games only utilize at max 4 cores, but usually just 2 if that. Games benefit from higher clock speeds and not more cores. If you want a processor for only multimedia/production/video editing this processor will work, but you will see much bigger performance gains with a quad core Xeon or i7 with hyper threading and at least 8 or more virtual cores. AMD is a decent choice at the sub $100 level or so, but after that, even if you have to pay a little more upfront you will earn it back on your energy bill. Especially with haswell your computer will run so quickly reliably was well. All around you can't go wrong with this processor for gaming.", 'With the demise of Windows 7, I thought it would be good to get acquainted with Windows 10 and build a system for it.I chose this processor for the reason it was not a "K" model so there would not be a large heat factor, it cannot be overclocked, but who needs it with 3.5 GHz. forward. It runs cool and runs hard. Temps are in the middle 20c. Put it on a Asus Z97 board which has expired already.This CPU supports 1333 and 1600MHz memory natively. The taller speeds you have to monkey with the BIOS.Also supports many office type applications.  Contains Intel 4600 graphics which are fine for every day use. The price tag was very good.Fast and a lot of fun while it lasted. Ordered another board, I be up again shortly.Delivered on time, packed well.', "This processor has been working like a champ for around a year. It is able to handle all of today's games including Overwatch, Battlefield 1, Infinite Warefare, Doom, etc. Who is this processor for? I believe it is just for gamers. Now, if you're a streamer, or a video editor, or anything that uses a lot of cpu power than i recommend a little stronger cpu but this one works great! It also runs fairly cool. When idle it sits at around high 20s or low 30s. When on full load, it runs at around 67-73 degrees. That's with stock fan and my room being a bit on the warm side. Totally in love with this processor and recommend it a lot if you just need one for running games.", "This Haswell processor shines! It is low energy consumption, yet one of the quickest on the market. Because it's Haswell, it handles video better than previous generations of Intel. I put this on an ASUS H97 and I have the perfect, yet relatively inexpensive and energy efficient, home theater PC. Anime fans: this processor handles 10-bit AKA Hi10P with no problems. Also should work fine for 3D. It should also be fine for media editing and even gaming, though the most hardcore gamers may be looking for something that overlocks.ONE NOTE: I have a small room and found the included fan made a sort of wailing sound that was annoying. I replaced with a Noctua Silent Cooler.", "Great Chip for a great price when I got it.  Works well with my HTPC setup.  Performance wise its still marked higher than most AMD chips.  Reasons I went with AMD for 10+ years was the cost.  I see that AMD chips are no where in the top 5 spots for performance in gaming or video editing.  When I originally switch over from Intel to AMD besides price AMD's ran cooler compared to the Pentium 4 chips and what not.  Now Intel has the performance and lower wattage compared to anything AMD.  I have only seen AMD chips with more cores and higher wattage and sometimes in the top 5 in benchmarking spots from my research.  http://www.tomshardware.com/reviews/gaming-cpu-review-overclock,3106-5.html I still like AMD but rather pay for performance and lower wattage."]

Product: Intel Core i3-4360 Processor (4M Cache, 3.70 GHz) BX80646I34360
Reviews: ["J'avais besoin de remplacer un processeur et une carte m√®re HS. Ce processeur est tr√®s suffisant pour la plupart des besoins bureautique et jeu l√©ger (avec une petite carte graphique √† moins de 100‚Ç¨) pour la plupart des utilisateurs (adultes et enfants), m√™me en 2022. Arr√™tons d'acheter du neuf quand l'ancien bien entretenu suffit largement. Je l'ai toutefois vite chang√© pour un 4690k beaucoup plus performant et eu √† tr√®s bon prix", 'La CPU √® un dual core con 4 thread e gira a frequenza standard di 3,7 GHz. E\' un buon prodotto anche se di generazione precedente (socket 1150). Come tutti i processori Intel di questa generazione (Haswell) scalda pochissimo; 54w di massimo assorbimento. Nella versione boxed qui venduta ha il solito dissipatore Intel a basso profilo, un po\' rumoroso ma pi√π che sopportabile. Io l\'ho sostituito con un silenziosissimo Thermaltake ad heatpipe. Il video integrato HD4600 ha prestazioni pi√π che valide, tranquillamente paragonabile ad una scheda video discreta di fascia medio/bassa, di quelle vendute tra i 50 e i 70 euro. Ottima la riproduzione video e l\'utilizzo "casual" in videogiochi non troppo impegnativi. Adattissima all\'utilizzo HTPC grazie all\'integrazione delle tecnologie Intel Quick Sync Video, Clear Video HD e Wireless Display.4 Stelle solo perch√© costa un po\' troppo e le nuove CPU 1151 costano meno: Un I3-6100, che ha prestazioni paragonabili a questo, costa una trentina di euro in meno. Quindi, se dovete assemblare un PC da zero, meglio rivolgersi a prodotti di ultima generazione, con schede madri socket 1151 e RAM DDR4. Nel mio caso, avendo gi√† RAM e dissipatore adatti al 1150, ho preferisto restare una generazione indietro e pagare qualcosa di pi√π il processore, risparmiando su scheda madre e memoria. Sono comunque assolutamente soddisfatto dell\'acquisto.', "I ordered an i3 4360 3.7 ghz processor and received an i3 4330 3.5 ghz processor. Considering I don't upgrade my PC very often, I was very dissapointed to say the least. However the 3.5 ghz chip is a decent chip for a mid range office PC. The graphics chip on the CPU is very impressive when streaming youtube videos. I streamed 5 videos simultaneously, ran several applications in the background and the CPU didn't use anymore than 40%.An impressive little chip and well worth ¬£100. If I had ordered a 4330 I would rate it 5/5 however as I ordered a 4360, I'm rating it 4/5 purely because of the botch up by Amazon.", 'Superb little Processor. Specially for a single core I3. works a charm for anything. With it being a 3.7 it worked like a treat for gamign. Bought this for a for mid end gaming rig on a strict budget. price to performance ratio is great and allowed me to play some games on medium to high settings depending on how intense the game was , performance was held back by stock cooler which limited prolong gaming like most CPUs. came well packaged and fast delivery, All in all a good product that I would recommend to anyone putting together a cheap and affordable p.c for people on a medium budget', 'Excellent Value for money.', 'Love it...Impressive performance so far (6 months). I am using it for my HTPC and run great for a low profile video card and sound card.', 'ho ricevuto questo prodotto nei tempi previsti da amazon l unico problema e stato un difetto nella grafica integrata che mi mandava in crash il pc. ho chiesto il rimborso che e avvenuto in meno di 3 giorni. non sono in grado di descriverre il prodotto ma sicuramente e un valido processore.', "Should have bought (4) when the were $122 from Amazon. I am comparing this against both the stock and clocked pentium K g3258, and i5-4760k, across Gigabytes z87x-ud5h, h81, h85, z97 gaming 5, and h97 gaming 3. For the price, the pentium K works for what it is, but it fails at multitasking, the high base clock, GPU, + cache + hyperthreading truely makes this chip greater than 1/2 a quad core, in running multiple programs and tasking. It seems to do as good of a job for the most part as the i5-4670k, with exception, e.g. data intensive tasks, encrypting files video editing, raring files extracting compressing etc., however, I have that processor in another machine for those tasks I don't need it sitting idle running most of the day twiddling it's thumbs, at replacement cost of nearly double. Plus when doing extensive quad-core tasking as mentioned functional use of your PC can be hindered or may cause crashing, potentially losing other work, I would rather have a PC for each purpose, in which each integral component serves it's specific task without over or under working itself or other parts.", "Perfetto e di facile configurazione per i Kext (anche grafici della HD4600) su El Capitan.L'ho montato nel case Antec Slim Mini-ITX, che possiede un alimentatore esterno da 90 W.Ero inizialmente dubbioso, pensavo non reggesse, invece si √® dimostrato davvero veloce, anche per quanto riguarda la parte video, riuscendo anche a far girare alcuni videogiochi con un framerate stabile (cs:go, ets2).", "Great processor with a great performance to price ratio. This is not used for gaming, just  light office and home computing. I built two identical systems with this, one for parents and one for my sister. One of them is working great, the other seems to have overheated and is returning video errors, resulting in blank screen and driver recoveries. I discovered that it was because the computer was placed in area with very little airflow, and must have been damaged by overheating. I installed a better heat sink (originally just used the stock heat sink) and it seems to have improved significantly, though it looks like the processor is now permanently damaged. It isn't returning many driver errors anymore, and isn't overheating anymore. Just a word of caution from someone who should have known better than to trust a stock heat sink and fan. Buy an aftermarket fan and heat sink for peace of mind, especially if you plan to put the computer in an area with restricted airflow around the case."]

Product: Intel Xeon E5-2620 v2 Six-Core Processor 2.1GHz 7.2GT/s 15MB LGA 2011 CPU BX80635E52620V2
Reviews: ['good product but a little bit expensive', 'This product does not include the plastic carriage that comes in a new box.  The plastic carriage is important because the manufacturer requires it in their specifications.  Without it, the system could be damaged beyond practical repair.', 'I just received this processor and tried to install it in a AsRock socket 2011 x99 and it does not seam to fit', "Wasn't sure if I would be happy settling for a lower version due to budget but this processor does the trick.Package was new factory sealed tray. All cores worked and no excessive heat issues.Single Idle @ 10-18w 22CDual Idle @ 15-23w 22C", 'item as described, slow shipping though.', 'Energy efficient, quite fast when turbo kicks in, certainly enough for a web server, workstation or database server on a development or small scale infrastructure project.', "I am running dual Processors on my motherboard and for the price, I chose these. no problems to report installing was a snap, matched with Intel's coolers.", 'Great for VMware host dual processor setup.']

Product: Intel Core i3-3245 3.40GHz 2 LGA 1155 Processor BX80637I33245
Reviews: ["built the machine as an htpc back in 2013. i use a low level graphics card with it, but there is no need for that if you don't need a dual monitor set-up like mine. the integrated graphics that this unit offers works just fine. i'm leaving this review just in case someone comes along with an old 1155 socket that they want to fill with an efficient cpu....it uses very little power and performs better than expected.", "I had purchased 2 of these (from another retailer) and am very happy with them.  So, when building another system, I purchased this CPU from Amazon.I only gave it 4 stars because given that it is only an i3, the price seems high.  But, to be fair, Amazon's price is as good as other retailers.", "I don't know what the big thing is about bagging on i3's. Sure, it's a dual core processor, but it's got hyperthreading on so you get 4 theoretical cores for good multitasking. Yeah, it's not as awesome as an i5 or a beefy i7. But for the price, this processor is more than enough for the typical user. The i3-3xx5 processors have newer HD 4000 graphics, which are plenty for most Steam games. If you want to build a budget PC for student or business use, and would like to do light gaming, this processor will serve you just fine. I dropped this in an mITX build and just used the integrated graphics for my little brother, who needed a computer for school, but likes to play games. He absolutely loves it. And to be honest, I kind of didn't want to give it to him after I finished building it.I chose this one over the 3225 for the clock speed boost, but if you're trying to keep things on a budget that's a great processor too.Tl;dr Solid processor, decent graphics, good price. Plenty of horsepower for most people.", 'There was a problem with the fan', "There wasn't any reviews so I decided to post one. The processor has a tdp of 55watts which surprised me of suck raw power this thing has. I played some games like battlefield 3 online and it never went below 39 fps! I've had an AMD fx 6300 and it did have a better rendering power, but don't forget this i3 core has 2 physical cores and 4 logical cores....a total of 6 cores just like the 6300, but even better. So to sum it all up it is just the best cpu i have ever bought with a lot of power. Maybe could compare with the amd fx 6300 quite closely, but not overclocked 6300 was tested!!!!", "This is a low power consumption CPU that is great for HPTC builds.  Even though it's rated at 55 watt TDP, the CPU idles at about half that amount.  My HTPC re-build uses this CPU, 8 GB DDR3, 5(five) 3TB Harddrives, 80GB SSD Bootdrive and Asrock H77 Pro4-M.  The system pulls a total of 60-65 watts with all drives spun up.  And the system boots to the Windows desktop and into XBMC in a fraction of time it took to using the old E350 cpu/mobo combo and draws slightly less power to boot!", "I used this to build my new computer. I am an IT guy. I use my computer for technical work, some video/audio editing, entertainment, and light gaming. I am using the integrated graphics and this works great for said purposes on a 1080p HDTV via HDMI. Haven't tested many games. I would add a dedicated GPU if gaming was my primary reason for purchasing this CPU.", 'Really good', "DOA. Can't say anything else. First 3Letters said it all", 'Easy to install, motherboard capacity attained by the upgrade. Processor runs much cooler than the previous one. Price was right.']

Product: Intel Core i5-4570 3.2GHz LGA 1150 84W Quad-Core Desktop Processor Intel HD Graphics BX80646I54570
Reviews: ['sehr gut gerne wieder', 'tutto ok', 'I selected this CPU for a gaming rig. I needed something future proof to make sure it doesn\'t bottleneck any GPU I place in there. tested it with a GTX 770 which is equivalent to the GTX 680. ran benchmarks on 1080p and got almost the same results I got from i5 4670k (no overclocking in both tests). no need to OC nor try to exceed the capabilities of this CPU. I was planning to get an i5 4670k + after market cooler + Z87 mobo. then I researched some benchmarks and realised there is no need to go for an expensive CPU while the graphics are all in the GPU. so I skipped the cooler, downgraded to this CPU and downgraded the mobo choise to B85. this saved my $ 80 which was invested in upgrading the GPU and thus achiving an excellent performance.if you plan to play games on a single monitor at 1080 res or even at 1440 res then you\'re looking for a GPU of the GTX 760 tier or HD 7870 XT or even the higher tier such as GTX 770 or HD 7970 then this CPU is the right choice for you. however, if you plan to go even higher or to SLI, then I guess you\'d be better off with an i5 4670k (or i7 depending on your target res+FPS and required GPU setup for the job) + Z87 board + after market cooler in that case. hence that overclocking will require you to buy a higher watt PSU which might add up more bucks to the budget. I\'m using 550W for this build which is considered overkill considering I\'m not overclocking or using GPU in SLI/CF.The only con that cost the last star is the price point. although this cpu is great, I find it more feasible to buy an ivy bridge higher end cpu from microcenter at the same/lower price. idk what intel is thinking with their price ranges. you\'ll also save up on mobo as the Z77 prices are decreasing in the presence of the newer Z87 generation. it\'s true that you\'ll lose the 10% performance advantage of haswell but you\'ll have overcloking capabilities which is even more future proof for gaming rigs.The setup:CPU: Intel Core i5-4570Motherboard: MSI B85-G41 PC Mate ATX LGA1150Memory: Corsair Vengeance 8GB (2 x 4GB) DDR3-1600 CL9 1.5vSSD: Samsung 840 120GB SATA 6b/sHDD: Western Digital Caviar Black 750GB 3.5" 7200RPM SATA 6b/sGPU: EVGA GTX 760 2GB ACX Cooler SupercloskedCase: NZXT Tempest 410PSU: SeaSonic G 550W 80 PLUS Gold ATX12V / EPS12V Semi-ModularOD: LG GH24NS95 DVD/CD WriterOS: Microsoft Windows 8 Professional (64-bit)', "I bought the new Haswell i5-4570 so that I can play the latest games at either high or medium settings @ 1920x1080 resolution. Runs CS:GO and BF3 like a champ (200fps and 102 fps respectively).However, I ran into couple problem (really one, the other one is more of an annoyance) down the road.After a week, I noticed that the game was stuttering for a bit. My fps in CS:GO would start out from 200 fps and go down to 20 fps at times. I decided to investigate and found out that the CPU was idling around 80C and 100C under load through BIOS (MSI H87M-G43 REV 1.2) I thought the BIOS temp reader was off and used CPU Temp reader which said the same thing. I found this really strange as ambient temperature was around 20C (Hey I like to live cold - its also good for the computer :] ). Took a closer look and found out that the CPU fan was not running. It seemed like it was caught on a cpu fan wire but the actual problem was the CPU fan was not able to rotate at all. I always do CPU fan test before doing stress test so this caught me off guard. Replaced stock cooler with Cooler Master Hyper 101i and the problem went away.*On a side note, I really really really (can't emphasize this enough) dislike the intel's method of securing the CPU. Mine was really hard to secure (had to at put serious force onto the lever) and left a small indent on the sides. The cpu fan secure system on the sockets LGA 1156, 1155, and 1150 isn't the greatest either as I found the rotating mechanism really irritating when you have to work with small space.Otherwise, really happy with Intel's new Haswell.**On a second note, I read somewhere on Tomshardware about the design of the Haswell and its likelihood to run little hotter than her sisters' cores (Ivy Bridge and Sandy Bridge). Make sure you get an adequate cooling. The stock cooling is mediocre at best and the paste that comes with it is even worse. It doesn't space out evenly.", 'Llego en buenas condiciones tal cual se ofrece', "I go to upgrade memory (had 16Gb, upgrading to 32Gb), and I get the bug.So, I've been investigating other CPUs for my LGA-1150 socketed motherboard.  I thought about the i7-series, and had to come over to this CPU, which is the one I bought way back in 2014 and is presently in my system.It's been a workhorse.  I do semi-pro photography processing on my machine, and it's held up well and I've had no complaints about performance .. now I am looking at processing 4k video and thought maybe it's time to upgrade my CPU.  I wanted to stick to the motherboard I have, so I'd need to buy an i7 that fits an LGA-1150 socket, and there are some out there .. I think the money would be better spent on an upgraded GPU, though, since most video processing software makes use of a GPU.I wanted to just comment and say that my CPU, this trusty old i5, has been busy for six years now, faithfully enabling me to process whatever it is I need it for .. great processor.", "This CPU is very good, providing very smooth and fast PC usage. Even though it's a tad slower than the 4670, I think it's worth going with this one instead if your budget really requires you to save that $20. Hasn't had issues running any games and it scores a CPUmark of around 7500 on Passmark, with single threaded hitting around 2200. I was initially going to get an FX-6300 with a good motherboard and overclock, but found out that even then it still wouldn't match a lower end Intel CPU in terms of single core performance. Which with that FX processor and a good board it would've cost as much as a micro ATX board and this CPU, so it wasn't worth it. I play Arma 3 and single core performance is key as the engine only utilizes two cores then scales. The single core performance of this CPU matches a stock clocked i7-3970X, which I find impressive.The bottom line, it's a superb mid-range CPU even with the lack of overclocking, and the stock cooler indeed works fine. I was a bit worried about the heat problems with Haswell, but the stock cooler is not having any issues. Pair this with a decent micro ATX board and you'll have yourself a powerful machine for a low price.Also, a tip for anyone having issues installing the CPU cooler, you turn the knobs counter-clockwise to pull the pins out of the spreaders, then you fit the cooler over the holes and then push down on them on opposite sides so that the pins fit in the spreaders securely. After this is done the cooler shouldn't move at all.", '„Åä„Åã„Åí„Åï„Åæ„Åß„ÄÅ„Çµ„ÇØ„Çµ„ÇØ„Å®„ÄÅÂø´ÈÅ©„Åß„Åô„ÄÇ', "I was in a quandary with regard to a CPU when I decided to replace a dead motherboard.  I looked at Intel Core i7 CPUs but decided that was more speed and performance I really needed.  I'm not a gamer and not a power user; so the Core i5 looked like a better investment.  But the Core i5 4670 cost almost as much as the Core i7 processors.  So, I went with this CPU (a little cheaper without a huge hit on performance), hoping it would be good enough for my modest computer use.  It was!  I installed it on my new ASRock motherboard and it performed plenty fast enough to do what I want.  It was excellent up until I greedily put another 8Gb of DDR3 memory in my motherboard and the motherboard died.  I've RMA'ed the motherboard to ASRock and am waiting for a replacement board.  I look forward to getting another motherboard and putting my system back together.  I hope my computing needs don't grow a lot over the next 4-6 years; so I can continue to get good usage out of the i5-4570 CPU!", "Before I bought this intel cpu, I was using a fx6100, good as it was, the fx6100 failed at newer end games, towards the middle of 2017.I bought this in january of 2018, I used a gigabyte mobo h81ms.Even though this has low clock speed, it'll reach 3.4ghz or 3.6ghz with the right settings on some board brands.I wouldn't use this directly for main streaming and gaming 24/7, desktop productivity is pretty good.However having multiple apps and what not going on, it'll hiccup and choke from time to time.Over all its done a wonderful job for a whole year straight with no issues.If you're on a tight budget and want to get past amd am3+ line up and partially their am4 line up.This would be the way to go for the time being until you can afford to pay for more newer expensive components."]

Product: AMD Athlon 64 X2 6000+ Dual Core 3.1 GHz ADV6000IAA5DO 89W Socket AM2 AM2+ Quiet
Reviews: ['Above Expectations. My Hard Drive finally bit the dust after six years so I thought this may be a good time for a little make-over. I originally had the AMD Athlon 64 2.6 ghz. processor and decided to see if there was something hotter available. I knew according to my Motherboard specs. that I should be able to use the "Phenom" 3.1ghz CPU if I could find one. I put in a search and couldn\'t believe my eyes when I seen one on Amazon! is there nothing you can\'t purchase on Amazon? $23.00!! you got to be kidding! How could I go wrong? I would never believe this would make so much difference. I am completely happy with this purchase. It gave my old computer NEW LIFE! It runs faster rand smoother. In every way it could be better it is.', 'What a difference, I added life to my very old desktop with less than $100 bucks including this CPU, video card with HDMI output and some ram. The PC feels younger and faster much faster. I  no longer need to spend $2k for a new one "its nonsense".', 'Although my former CPU was the same TDP, this CPU hammers my CPU cooler fan where the prior CPU rarely activated CPU cooling fan to the same RPM. Just the differences of actual power dissipation between CPUs.Runs good, no errors known so far.', "I used this product (AMD Athlon 64 x2 6000+) to upgrade my Dell Inspiron 531 which had an AMD Athlon 64 x2 3800+.  It was very easy to remove the old processor, drop in the new 6000+, apply some thermal paste, and reattach the heatsink / fan. The BIOS recognized the new processor on first boot.  I couldn't be happier!  I can definitely tell the difference!", "Like a few other reviewers, I bought this for my Dell Inspiron 531 desktop PC. It originally had a 2.1 ghz one: Now it's 3.1 :) Much better. Very noticeable! I also upped the RAM to 4 GB while I was at it.", 'Love it... My old Dell is usable again. Streaming is all I needed but It does a lot more.', 'Great upgrade for my Dell Inspiron 531, which was running on a single core 1.6GHz. I do recommend replacing the stock heat sink for an aftermarket one to prevent overheating. The new CPU did come with thermal compound which was nice.', 'I wanted to squeeze that last little bit of performance from my Hewlett Packard a6000n that came configured with ther AMD Athlon 64 X2 5200+ processor.  This used processor arrived from the vendor securely packaged and it works perfectly.', "Great product, great seller!!!  Really made my mom's computer blazing fast.  Swapped out a 64 3500+ in an Acer AST-180", "Exactly as advertised, works fine. It's an out of date processor by todays standards but it's exactly what I needed. Descent price to boot."]

Product: Dynatron I2 Socket G PGA988 Intel Core i3/i5/i7 Mobile CPU Cooler
Reviews: No Reviews

['L√§uft wunderbar war auch gut vepackt danke gerne wieder üëç', 'Mein etwas √§lterer Dell Optiplex 790 mit einer i5-2400 brauchte mal ein Upgrade, der kleine i5 wurde mir bei manchen Aufgaben (zum Beispiel beim Alt-Taben aus Spielen auf Discord/Whatsapp) etwas zu lahm, darum habe ich mich entschieden, auf den (in Benchmarks) um ca. 30% schnelleren i7-2600 (das ist gleichzeitig auch die beste CPU, die keine Xeon ist und vom Mainboard unterst√ºtzt ist).Die Unterschiede bemerkt man schon beim Hochfahren von Windows 10 von der SSD - hier spart man paar Sekunden. Au√üerdem starten Programme etwas schneller, in Heroes of the Storm mit Discord im Hintergrund schafft die neue CPU gepaart mit einer GeForce GT 1030 auf den h√∂chsten Einstellungen zwischen 50 und 60 FPS (vorhin zwischen 30 in Teamfights und 50). Andere Spiele die ich probiert habe sind Starcraft 2 und Team Fortress 2, auch hier hat man entspannte 60 FPS bei den h√∂chsten Einstellungen. Interessant w√§ren auch Tests bei Bild- und Videobearbeitung, dazu bin ich leider nicht gekommen.Dabei wird die CPU mit dem Stock-Cooler von Dell nicht hei√üer als die i5, der Stromverbrauch ist auch derselbe.F√ºr unter 70‚Ç¨ hat sich das Upgrade gelohnt, ich kann den Chip nur empfehlen.', 'Der Prozessor funktioniert einwandfrei. Bis jetzt keine Probleme. Gute Preis f√ºr benutztes Produkt.', 'Das ist mein neues System:Mainboard: ASUS P867 Rev. 3.0CPU: Intel Core I7 2600CPU K√ºhler: Arctic Cooling Freezer 7.0 Pro Rev. 2.0RAM: Corsair Vengeance 16 GBGrafikkarte: Gigabyte NVIDIA GTX-460HD: Intel SSD 80 GB SystemfestplatteHD2: Western Digital 320 GB SATA IIHD3: Western Digital 500 GB SATA IILG Blue Ray BrennerSony DVD BrennerAuch wenn viele geschrieben haben, da√ü es Probleme mit der Erkennung des RAMs gegeben hat, kann ich dem nicht zustimmen.Der Speicher und die CPU wurden sofort erkannt und automatisch richtig getaktet. Alles l√§uft reibungslos und suuuuper schnell.Der CPU K√ºhler von Arctic Cooling verrichtet seine Arbeit gut und leise. Temperatur im Normalbetrieb liegt zwischen 38 - 42 Grad.Im Stresstest (ASUS Diagnostic Tool) geht die Temperatur nicht √ºber 60 Grad hinaus und der L√ºfter ist nur leicht zu h√∂ren.Jetzt habe ich wieder ein paar Jahre ruhe :-)Bin sehr zufrieden.', 'macht was er soll was soll ich sagen', 'Ich habe den [Intel Core 17-2600 (Quad-Core) @ 3,40 GHz] in ein ASUS P8P67-M Motherboard eingebaut, um meinem alten Rechner neues Leben einzuhauchen. Dieser Prozessor, in Kombination mit 32GB DDR3 Arbeitsspeicher, einem Crucial 500GB SSD Medium und einer (zugegebenerma√üen) starken [ASUS [PCIe 3.0] NVIDIA GeForce GT1660 PH-OC 6GB DDR5] Grafikkarte lassen dieses Motherboard der 2ten Generation, das leider nur mit einem PCIe 2.0 Slot ausgestattet ist, wieder sehr dynamisch wirken.  - Mit anderen Worten: Der Rechner hat eine unglaubliche Performance-Steigerung erfahren.', 'Alles ok', '50 % mehr Leistung vom i5 auf i7', 'Sehr guter gebrauchter Zustand. Intel 7 2600 l√§uft ohne Probleme.', 'It works on my HP Elite. Board: Hewlett-Packard 1495 (SOCKET 0).']

Product: Intel Core i3-550 Processor 3.2 GHz 4 MB Cache Socket LGA1156
Reviews: ["I recently built my first pc for gaming and wanted a good mix of value and performance for each component.  The intel core i3 550 seemed like a good value, having the combination dual core + hyper threading and an onboard graphics processing unit.  The onboard gpu is nice because my motherboard does not have onboard graphics and if my PCI-e graphics card did not work for some reason I would still have a functional computer.Since this was my first computer build, I assembled it somewhat haphazardly and made some mistakes.  In the case of the processor, I did a really bad job applying thermal compound to the chip.  The stock heatsink comes with some kind of thermal pad stuck to the bottom and rather than use it alone or scrape it off and use my own compound (arctic silver), i left it on AND used the arctic silver.  Bad choice--idling was at about 40C and running prime95 for about 30 seconds got the cpu up to 80C.  These are not stable temperatures for a gaming computer (which can apply a load similar to prime95) so I checked the arctic silver website and found some good directions on how to apply thermal compound.Tips for applying thermal compound:-both cpu and heatsink surface need to be extremely clean (no dust/oil/hair/etc).  Rubbing alcohol is recommended.-you only use a very small amount of thermal compound--just to fill microscopic gaps between the heatsink and fan (ie the metal should do most of the heat conduction, not the compound).  In my case, i should have removed the thermal pad on the stock heatsink.-apply a small amount of thermal compound to both surfaces and work it in with the edge of a credit card, passing over repeatedly to spread the compound over the entire surface (DONT use your finger to spread it around).  This is to fill in the microscopic pores.  Remove excess with dry cloth or paper towel.-Now you need to find your respective model on the arctic silver (or whatever your compound is) website and read how to put the final application.  For the intel i3 550, you apply a line of thermal compound parallel to the long axis of the actual chip.End result:  idling at 29C and maxes out at 74C after an hour in prime95.  For a stock fan on a mini itx board in a small case (lian li pc-q11), i think that is pretty damn good. Gaming performance has been fine and i have had no stability issues at all.  Games I've played with it:  Batman arkham asylum, Red Alert 3, Warhammer 40k Dawn of War 2, Dead Space, Left 4 dead, and HL2 dm.", 'I bought this i3 processer to assemble a non gaming PC, and have been impressed with the speed that it works.I thought about the i5 or i7 but the cost of this i3 is well worth the money.', 'After hours trying to work out what cpu would meet my needs I went on the intel site and realised I basically just needed to decide whether to go for an i3, i5 or i7. All the variants of each are basically irrelevent for non-experts, just a question of deciding how much you want to spend, a bit like choosing between the 1.3 litre or 1.6 litre engine for your new car. Bottom line was that building a new pc bsed on i3 was way cheaper thn i5 or i7, and is absolutely fine for my casual gaming, office apps etc. Personally I think the speed of my computer is now dictated by the operating system (windows 7 64 bit); the i3 is obviously able to open and run apps as quickly as they are ready but still has to wait for windows to get itself together to begin with.', '‰∏≠Âè§„ÅÆÁâ©„Å†„Å£„Åü„Åë„Å©‰æ°Ê†º„ÅÆÂÆâ„Åï„ÅßË≥ºÂÖ•„ÄÅÂïèÈ°å„Å™„ÅèÂãï„ÅÑ„Å¶„Åè„Çå„Åü„ÅÆ„ÅßÂÄã‰∫∫ÁöÑ„Å´„ÅØÊ∫ÄË∂≥„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Çã', 'F√ºr 3‚Ç¨ Als mining rig CPU gut', 'El envio lo he recibido en perfectas condiciones, pero la idea es que lo enviaran todo junto y no por separado. Tal vez me falta experiencia en aprender a comprar por Amazon, pero no me gust√≥ el hecho de que no me enviaron junta toda la compra hecha en la presente fecha.', 'POR SER EL MEJOR PRECIO QUE ENCONTR√â EN EL MERCADO Y TENER LA POSIBILIDAD DE SER ENTREGADO EN MI PUERTA', 'I recently made the switch from Mac to PC and decided on a custom built computer. I did not trust purchasing a "name brand" system and wanted to choose my own parts, etc. I opted for the Core i3 550 and couldn\'t be happier. It runs fairly cool and is very quick! I\'m not a gamer and don\'t plan to OC the chip so I don\'t have any comment on that end, but it has handled Windows 7 very well in many aspects.If you are looking for a fast chip that won\'t break the bank, look no further than the Core i3 550.', "Pour un Core i3, c'est vraiment une bonne surprise ! Tr√®s performant, sans que √ßa n'y paraisse.Malgr√© un prix un peu cher, et un socket pas courant...", "I have had this Intel Core i3-550 Processor 3.2 GHz 4 MB Cache Socket LGA1156 since 2011. About 3 months ago, I overclocked it up to 3.7 with Cooler Master V8, but it didn't run stable. So last week, I ordered my first water cooling kit and I installed to my case and everything was good. Guess what? I jumped the clock speed from 3.7 to 4.51 with no problem @ the temp. of 32 C & MB temp. @ 27Not bad huh? Now I run it @ 4.17 because I don't wanna burn my CPU. Anyway, thanks for reading."]

Product: Leviton 47611-C6B Category 6 Voice and Data Module
Reviews: ['Used Leviton LAN products on three different houses over the years. The quality is great and no faults or failures on any of the products.', 'I ordered 4 of these Cat-6 modules to fit into a structured media cabinet.  When I went to punch down the Cat-6 cable, I found that Leviton did not allow enough space for the cables to lie next to the IDC connectors.  Cat-6 cable has a greater diameter than Cat-5 cable and these boards obviously were designed for smaller cable.  If you plan to use Cat-6 cable, DO NOT buy these because your cable will not fit.', 'Excellent product.  Works great for me.']

Product: Intel Xeon X3430 Quad Core 2.40GHz 8M Socket LGA1156
Reviews: ['ÊÅØÂ≠ê„ÅÆYoutubeÂ∞ÇÁî®„Éû„Ç∑„É≥„ÇíÁµÑ„ÅøÁ´ã„Å¶„Çã„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÅ‰Ωô„Å£„Åü„Éû„Ç∂„Éº„Å´Á™Å„Å£Ëæº„Çì„Åß„Åø„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇÂè§„ÅÑCPU„Åß„Åô„Åå„ÄÅ„Åï„Åô„ÅåXeonÔºÅÁúüÂ§è„ÅÆÊöë„Åï„Å´„ÇÇË≤†„Åë„Åö„ÄÅYoutube„ÇíÂÜçÁîü„ÅóÁ∂ö„Åë„Å¶„Åè„Çå„Åæ„Åó„ÅüÔºÅCPU„ÇØ„Éº„É©„Éº„Åå„ÅÇ„Åæ„Çä„Å´„ÇÇ„ÅÜ„Çã„Åï„ÅÑ„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÅ„Åì„ÅÆCPU„ÇÇ„ÅÇ„Çè„Åõ„Å¶„ÅÑ„Å£„Åü„ÇìÂºïÈÄÄ„Å´„Å™„Çä„Åæ„Åó„Åü„Åå„ÄÅ„Åæ„Å†„Åæ„Å†„ÅÑ„Åë„Çã„Å®ÊÄù„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ„Åù„ÅÆ„ÅÜ„Å°Âà•„ÅÆÊñπÊ≥ï„ÅßÂæ©Ê¥ª„Åï„Åõ„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇË™∞„ÇÇ„ÅåÊÜß„Çå„Çã(?)XeonÔºÅÂÄ§Â¥©„Çå„ÅåÂçäÁ´Ø„Å™„ÅÑ„ÅÆ„Åß„ÄÅ‰Ωô„Å£„Åü„Éë„Éº„ÉÑ„Åß‰∏ÄÂè∞ÁµÑ„Çì„Åß„Åø„Å¶„ÅØÔºü', 'ÁèæÂú®„ÅÆWIN10„ÅÆÂ†¥Âêài3„Å†„Å®ÊôÇ„ÄÖÂãï‰Ωú„ÅåÊ≠¢„Åæ„Å£„Å¶„Åó„Åæ„ÅÜ‰∫ã„Åå„ÅÇ„Çã„Åå„Åì„ÅÆCPU„Å†„Å®‰Ωï„Å®„Åã‰Ωø„Åà„Çã„ÄÇ']

Product: Vertical Universal CPU Holder
Reviews: ['I got this to mount my re-furbed G5 Dual Core Tower on my cubby-hole music-studio wall. The assembly guide sheets are very confusing at first, second, and third glance, until you realize you\'ll have to take your time to look at it very carefully, to figure out the exact mounting setup you need to go by. While I can see that they were created in a way to live up to the "Universal" status, more detailed instructions would have helped, whether by words, or by diagrams.With this being mounted right over the end of my studio\'s twin bed, I took advantage of every, single screw-hole available on the mounting plate, though I had to buy the extra screws and anchors for this purpose. Even extending the mounting plates as far as they go, I barely had enough room to squeeze-in my 55 lb tower, which being a re-furb already had quite a few dents and scratches; but this was actually quite the workout to do, and NOT something I would even TRY doing with a brand new CPU, that was the same size.So though I made it work to suit my purpose, with 2 extra purchased shelf-brackets supporting it for my own sense of security, it was no easy task, and this CPU holder was clearly NOT made for older, or customized CPU\'s that would be wider by design.So I\'m giving this product 3 stars, since they stand for "it\'s okay", which is my exact opinion, though I should add that I would make it 2 and a half stars, IF that option was available, here.', 'The wife needed a holder for her computer in the kitchen office.  I looked far and wide and this is the best by far.  We use it for a small form factor but it can expand and fit a larger one.  Keeps the computer off the floor and helps to make it look real nice.  I found this one as at work the IT dept uses them also.  Amazon had the best price!  even beats ebay!  plus easy shopping as you know.  Highly recommend.  You need to hold to wall or cabinet or desk with screws..  make sure your desk can support.  one more thing..  it is a little pricey but i felt worth the cost.  I considered making one out of wood but that would be  a massive undertaking and probably look kinda cheesy.', 'Qualit√© ergotron irreprochable, r√©glable en largeur, multiples possibilit√©s de fixation : rail ergotron, sur un tasseau de bois, dans un mur', "I am STILL reading the instructions.  I'm thinking of taking out other languages in the hopes maybe I just forgot how to read English and that is the problem.It is heavy.  Very heavy.  It comes with two intimidating looking screws and some other bits.  Apparently you should have a full range of tools because nothing is included.  You need a stud finder, what looks like an Allan wrench.  Just baffled.  I am good at putting stuff together but this has me stumped.  If you like simplicity in installation, avoid this bugger like the plague", 'Pros: Looks nice, worksCons: Doesn\'t fit cases wider than 7.5" that\'s most of my PC cases  Tiny design flaw with the sliding bracket. It is attached only by two screws so it will tilt farther you go. It\'s a problem for wider cases.Bottom line: I would buy this only for narrow cases.', "A quality, and nice looking product.Was easy to install on wall.  Just needed to find the studs, then rest is easy.Gets the CPU up off the floor where any spills can't get to it.Sturdy and well made.I bought four.  Planning on getting a couple more for other computers.", 'over priced, parts missing or wrong sometimes, be sure to check it when you get it to confirm it will work.', 'Hoffe Es h√§lt noch lange. Am Anfang war Ich noch sehr skeptisch das es meinen neuen 3000‚Ç¨ High-End PC tr√§gt, aber bis jetzt h√§lt er.', 'Was easy to attach to a solid desk end to keep our small CPU, router and WiFi off the desk and off the floor and out of the way.', 'Easy to install, adjust to any size, build strong']

Product: AMD Athlon 64 Processor 3200+ Socket 939 (ADA3200BPBOX)
Reviews: ["This is a decent processor, and the price was decent, used. It worked.However, if I had it to do over, I would have bought the dual core 3800+ that is currently in themachine. The dual core effectively doubles the speed of the computer, and, the price differencewasn't much.The single 3200+ is at a point where with anti-virus software, you are getting 100% processoruse too much.To keep an old rig running, if you can't find the dual core processors for a decent price,This is a great deal.", 'I BOUGHT THIS ITEM TO USED IN MY EMACHINE COMPUTER WITH WINXP .', 'Hard to find item.  This is brand new and comes with the proper heat sink', "My treasured AMD 4800+ fried and it, my computer and I was forced to seek a substitute. In the days of when I bought it, it was embarrassing Intel with being the first computer technology that bypassed the front side buss. Wonderful. Transfers that took 3 or 4 minutes on an Intel clocked in at only 40 or 50 seconds.Today of course, every omputer has this direct connection so it's no big deal yet I had trouble parting with it. My transferring of my A8V mobo to a new case and not seeing a stud that shorted out one of the 4800s core made the decision to seek out a substitute. My budget prevented my replacing it with the same, $500 CPU as well as it simply is no longer worth it as a $100 CPU or even less now has the same virtue, no FSB.So I sought out the 3200. A poor choice. It reminds me of the days of phone modems. Not that being online suffers this fate, ALL activity takes forever. My advice: trash your old PC & get something new.This is no reflection on the seller. He was fast, professional and his prices are terrific. The item was exactly as he said and it arrived promptly so buy from him with confidence. But do more research than I did when trying to get an old horse running again. 8^(", 'After What seemed a struggle the issue was resolved.  The Advertising of a Boxed 939 processor and getting a OEM processor was not what i was expecting but after a few E-Mails my Money was refunded and the processor was shipped back.  GOOD customer service!! Thank you very much.', 'The customer says fix it and you replace the bad fan.  When it will not boot you sweat about the cost of a new processor until you check Amazon and locate the replacement you need at the price you need.  I am happy and customer is happy.', 'Built her own computer', 'What can I say. This review is after years and its still going strong. 24/7 on now for the last 4 months. There isnt to much to say about AMD or Intel Chips. They just work well but I switched to Intel again.', 'It worked as expected, MADE an exchange  with, OR should I say for a xp laptop and might I say upgraded it to linux', 'Great!  I upgraded the computer I built for my step mother.  I works  great and is an excellent buy.']
